title: Leesa Original Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Springs/CertiPUR-US Certified /100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous out of the Box!', 'author': 'Mollie MaKay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all it’s beautiful! Came right out of the box fluffed up!! It’s the perfect firmness and softness! I had ordered a nectar that was awful. I was falling off the mattress but this is a dream! I can’t believe how wonderful this is!! Exactly what I was hoping for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars DANGEROUSLY COMFORTABLE', 'author': 'anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If I could get paid to just lay in this bed all day...... I probably would.... It's SO COMFORTABLE, I worry sometimes I'm sleeping too much! Didn't have this problem with any mattress in the past... Also it is amazing at absorbing shock! Like if i set a glass of wine on it and lay down near the glass, it doesn't tip over! I love this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every cent', 'author': 'Major_Chunks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my 2nd Leesa and once again im really pleased with the whole process and product. Medium firm and conforming. Super comfortable and a great nights sleep', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Cured my jaw, neck pain!', 'author': 'Lydia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I didn’t buy this mattress with the intention of resolving my TMJ, but by the second night it was gone! Must be the head and neck support that was missing with my old mattress!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars This mattress causes significant back pain', 'author': 'Justin Sorensen', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I was hoping for a supportive mattress that offers a comfortable nights' sleep. However after a month of sleeping on this mattress, I was in significant pain. The mattress offers little to no lumbar support. With two people on the mattress the mattress caves in on itself. If you need back support please do not buy this mattress", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced a firm mattress', 'author': 'Mark Schilling', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got one for my teenage son to replace a firm mattress. He says that he sleeps so much better now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This mattress is not 60" wide', 'author': 'Apple', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'So disappointed with this mattress. I had read all the great reviews and the recommendation from wirecutter.1) The mattress is not 60" wide as indicated, the mattress is out of square and it less than 59" at the ends. This leaves a gap on the bed frame, also queen size sheets are too big for it it slips and slides.2) You can feel the springs protruding on the side of mattress (on all 4 sides).3) The edges are super soft and the mattress cover is too big for the mattress so it slips when you try to stand up. If you any disability sitting up you won\'t have any thing to help stabilize you.I bought this mattress from Amazon and not from Leesa directly. That\'s my mistake for trusting that Amazon will honor the same return options. Returning through amazon was to complicated so now I\'m stuck with it. What a waste of money as I will have to get a new mattress soon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and good level of firmness', 'author': 'Nish', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good edge support, firm, and comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not great', 'author': 'Rhiannon Marshall', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'We had to return an extremely uncomfortable a firm bed from another company before trying this Leesa. I was nervous because the last one was so awful. Initially, it seemed this was better, and it is a bit. Unfortunately it’s not comfortable as all the reviews have raved. I can’t see going a month of being in extra pain and unable to sleep to see if it adjusts to you. You can feel the coils on the sides of the mattress. It is a bit bouncy but not in any way that provides comfort. It’s too firm, after just a few days coils squeak, no cooling or softness. Even with an additional pad it’s just too hard.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'Pamela J. Trinch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had my Leesa original hybrid for 3 years and it is as comfortable now as it was brand new. I love it. Great value for a great product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Leesa Sapira Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen Size, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Spring / CertiPUR-US Certified / 100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional mattress', 'author': 'Innovator', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Yes, it\'s a tad firmer than I was used to, but the back and edge support this hybrid mattress offers are exceptional, eliminating the back pain I had with my previous memory foam-only mattress. The build quality and luxurious materials used are high grade. Overall, the Sapira is a class act.Day 1: The mattress arrives in a tall square-box, about 2x2x4. I attached a photo of what the mattress looks like compressed inside the box. Upon placing the mattress on my boxspring, I cut the plastic off and the bed immediately sprung to life, literally, as the coils decompressed. Yes, there is a noticeable off-gassing smell, but it\'s not offensive. I left my window open at night, and 90% of the smell was gone by the next morning.Day 2: At first, the mattress was a bit firm, but after about 24-36 hours the mattress had fully decompressed and was much more comfortable. It\'s probably a 6.5/7 out of 10 on the firmness scale, the way most online professional mattress websites suggest. The top Avena foam layer sleeps cool, so I don\'t overheat. The bounce the Avena foam + the pocketed coils provide makes moving around, and getting out of bed effortless. The off-gassing smell is just about gone now.Day 3: Decided to get rid of my old mattress and keep the Sapira. I sleep mostly on my back, but sometimes on my side and stomach throughout the night. The only sleep position I thought wasn\'t going to work out was the side position, because of the firmness, but the 3 inches of Avena + memory foam actually provide just enough sinkage, while keeping my spine aligned. The off-gassing smell is completely gone now. I bought a mattress protector, and then my bed sheet goes over that to complete the package.When I bought this mattress last Sunday, there were 20 left in stock with Amazon. As of this morning, only 9 Queen-size beds were left in stock, while some sizes other than Queen were already out of stock. So clearly word is getting out about this mattress. At $1,325, it\'s also a lot less expensive than every other hybrid mattress on the market, most of which will cost at least $2,000 more than this one, and will require you going to a showroom, and taking time off work to be home for delivery.In conclusion, I highly recommend this mattress. Please feel free to ask me any direct questions on here. Also, if you have time, I recommend reading the review on Sleepopolis, as it\'s the most comprehensive professional review that matches my own experience.Update: although I bought a Claritin mattress protector, and although when I called Sapira customer service they recommended having one too, I removed it on Day 4. It added a "plastic" feel to the surface of the bed that became unbearable. Once I removed it, that initial softness I experienced on Day 1 came back again. I only intend to use just my bedsheet from here on out. I recommend you do the same.((On a side note, I suggest ignoring the only other two reviews on here, both two stars. Unlike myself, neither one is a confirmed buyer of this product. The first review is too short to be real for a legitimate mattress evaluation by an actual customer. The fact that this mattress has the firmness rating it does shows the Sapira is designed for superior back support, so the reviewer\'s complaint is illogical. The second review is also partially off topic, as they discuss the manufacturers\'s website, which has nothing to do with how the mattress feels. Yes, they are correct the mattress is a little firm, but every other online review already confirms this. So to slam the product with only two stars for performing how it was designed is unfair.))', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good quality and definitely med firm', 'author': 'KC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slept on this mattress now for a week and am very pleased with its level of firmness. I prefer firm (side and stomach sleeper) and this is definitely medium firm and I feel supported when side sleeping. I'm using an adjustable base (Lucid - highly recommend) and have it in up position frequently and it retains its shape . The only downside is that the edges are soft which makes it hard to sit on the edge, but I knew that when I bought it. So far I have no regrets with the Leesa Sapira.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress!', 'author': 'Donna S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this mattress. Needed a replacement for my 15-year old Therapedic. Took a chance on this highly rated product and have not been disappointed. It feels as good as my Therapedic. Soft and firm. Relieves my back and hip pain (I’m a side sleeper.) And it was HALF THE PRICE of a new Therapedic. I would recommend this mattress to all former Therapedic owners.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Feels comfortable but produces me back pain. Reimbursed by Amazon', 'author': 'Juan Diego Barco', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'When I lay in this mattress is soft and feels good. However, I always get up with back pain and I never suffered from back pain in my life.I have been trying to return the mattress for more than 2 months without sucess. As the mattress is unboxed, UPS will not allow pick it up.I have talked with several Amazon representatives but they have only forwared my petition and at the end they have not solved it.Update:After several calls and weeks trying to return the mattress, finally Amazon decided to reimburse me the full amount I payed. At the end they were cooperative,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Needed to try - not THE BEST but good', 'author': 'KayDawg', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Heard rave reviews and was inundated with social media ads after looking Leesa up online while mattress shopping, so the Hybrid won out for, well, being a hybrid and because Leesa is a B Corp.Queen mattress on a slatted platform frame without a box spring.It's really soft - softer than I expected it to be for a hybrid, and you can feel the springs on the edges and right through the side of the mattress. But good for stomach/side sleepers and can be good for back sleepers if you don't already have a lumbar spine issue, IMO.My friend had one that I spent just one night on and I don't remember hers being this soft. Will the softness dissipate over time?I'm afraid I overpaid for something that won't last up to the standard 8-10 years since it's already soft and I can feel the springs. We'll know more when we get to the 100 days of trial (it's only been 30)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’m a new person.', 'author': 'Chelsea Breza-Berndt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, I’m not a product reviewer. I generally ignore any and all opportunities to write product reviews. But I felt the Leesa Hybrid was deserving of my time to write a review.We had been searching for a mattress for a couple years, mainly paralyzed by the fear of not liking whatever we decided to buy. Our old pillow top was about 9 years old and at 28 years old I was starting to understand how boomers feel when they wake up in the morning.We tried the Leesa in person at a local store and were sold, but Amazon had by far the best deal we could find.My boyfriend likes firm mattresses, but I’m 5’ 2” and 130 lbs so we needed to find a balance between firm and too firm. The nice part about the Leesa is the memory foam top, so you get a softer feel while still enjoying a medium firm mattress. It’s even perfect for my lighter body weight and the boyfriend thinks the firmness is satisfactory too. We are both happy.The one thing that has taken some getting used to is it sleeping cooler. We’ve had to play with the thermostat in the house a bit since our previous mattress slept so hot.However the most striking thing is the GREAT SLEEP AND TOTAL AND COMPLETE LACK OF BACK PAIN!!!! I would recommend this mattress to anyone!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Was nervous ordering online!', 'author': 'R. Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so nervous ordering a mattress online. I had been able to try the mattress at a local store that carries the brand. Their delivery time was out 4 weeks. Amazon offered a discount and delivery was a few days out from the order date.I purchased a platform bed and it was recommended that I get a 9-11 inch high mattress. I like pillow top mattress especially. Not really available in the 9-11 inch range.I love this mattress! So comfortable and just soft enough for my liking. Very supportive yet comfortable. I am so happy that I picked this brand. Lessa is not as advertised as others, but well worth a look when thinking of spending a couple thousand dollars on a new mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really excellent', 'author': 'Jenna.Leann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have had this mattress since July of 2018 and still love it. My husband prefers a slightly softer mattress, I prefer firm, and neither of us have any complaints. I am generally a side sleeper, no issues there.We have a king and I really wanted a mattress with good edge support and this one definitely does. It makes the mattress feel larger to us. Right now there’s three of us sharing this bed (us plus our 18 month old) and I love that the mattress is firm enough for us to feel safe having our son sleep with us. We all have our own space and never wake up sore.My husband has had two of his buddies buy this mattress and they were also happy with it (plus their wives). I also love that it’s a hybrid, full memory foam isn’t my thing and this just seems durable. Negative reviews on this mattress genuinely surprised me. Maybe we aren’t picky because neither of us have any back issues, but we sleep so much better than we did before!Mattresses are such a personal preference and I know it’s risky to order online, but this one is a pretty safe choice in my opinion (unless you prefer soft mattresses).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Painful Sleeping Experience But Amazon Honored Their Refund Policy', 'author': 'New Homeowner', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I really hoped this mattress would work for me, given all the positive reviews and ratings it\'s gotten from reputable (?) national media outlets, but it turned out awful for me. Maybe because my body is just too used to the firmness and bounce of inner spring mattresses, this memory foam hybrid caused pain in my back and hips so bad that I never slept through the night during the trial period. Some reviews say this mattress is too firm, but I found it too soft. Lying on my back, I could feel my butt sink down into the foam a good 3 inches; lying on my side, my hips would also sink down that far, pulling my spine out of alignment. Yes, the memory foam "bounced" back to normal once I got up, but that didn\'t help while I was lying down! Also, as someone used to moving around easily on an inner spring, moving around on this mattress also created pain in my back and sides since the memory foam basically "immobilizes" you.To Amazon\'s credit, they issued a full refund when I requested it, efficiently and quickly without making me go through a lot of paperwork or red tape.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Arrived mishappen.', 'author': 'Kathleen M. Sheehan', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'As shown in the attached photo, the mattress was narrower on the bottom than on the top at one end. This was the case on both sides of the mattress at that end. Thus, the mattress does not come to the edge of the foundation at this end. This defect may have been due to the mattress being compressed for shipping causing a permanent distortion in its shape. This was my first time purchasing a mattress that is shipped this way, so I do not know whether this is a common problem. I plan to replace with a mattress that is not compressed for shipping. Other than this defect, the mattress seems to be as advertised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: King Mattress, 10 Inch Memory Foam Mattress King Size, Innerspring Hybrid Mattress in a Box with Motion Isolation, Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bed', 'author': 'Corrie Mitchell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Super comfortable. It is firm but you can move around without waking your partner or child. It was fully expanded before the time frame. Corners are just a tad under supportive. But it doesn't bother me. It's a great price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars amazing quality for an amazing price', 'author': 'Peyton M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Finding a comfortable mattress for my husband & I is difficult because our preferences are so different! His lower back pain prevents us from getting the sink right in kind of mattress, my favorite. BUT this mattress checks all the boxes. We got it within 2 days, delivered in a box, placed it in our room, and slept on it that night. No back pain complaints from my husband and I get to sink in and sleep comfortably. He woke up before me and I didn’t even feel him exit the bed. For the price, I would recommend to anyone on a budget!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfortable Mattress', 'author': 'Amazon Shopper', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mattress is a very comfortable mattress to sleep on. In fact, my first night\'s sleep on this mattress was one of the most relaxing experiences of any mattress that I have slept on. The only reasons why I give it 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because: (1) My mattress only expanded to 10" thickness instead of 12" thickness when I took it out of the plastic sheeting (but it was still very comfortable to sleep on). (2) When you sit on the mattress or apply weight to one specific area of the mattress it feels soft and the mattress does cave in a bit. However, when you lay down on it and distribute your body weight over the entire mattress then it is very firm and comfortable. I would strongly recommend this mattress if you want a firm and comfortable mattress to sleep on. I would give it 4.5 stars but I can\'t so I gave it 4 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fast and easy', 'author': 'deelauren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was very easy to purchase and delivery. Set was was super easy, just take out of the package and the mattress put on bed. The comfort is good. Great price for quality mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Comfy!', 'author': 'S. Zamenski', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was a little nervous ordering a mattress without trying it first, but it is SO comfortable. It's just firm enough to support my joints, but it's cozy and soft right where I need it. I can lay in any position and feel supported and comfortable.It's pretty heavy, so you might need help if you're a smaller build. The little slicer they provide is a joke, so I just used a box cutter (slowly and carefully so I didn't cut the mattress). Make sure you open it at the end so the air rushes out and lets the mattress expand while you remove the rest of the plastic.It says to let it sit for 24-72 hours. Mine was almost fully expanded after several hours, but I let it sit for 48 hours. I slept on it that night, and it was fine. I didn't notice any off-gassing, even though it's winter here and my windows are shut. There wasn't any odor at all, which was nice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Angel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is super comfortable and good for the price! It’s high quality for sure. Also super thick which is nice. Just be careful when you take it out the plastic because I got slapped…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly comfortable', 'author': 'Arie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was nervous about getting a mattress in a box because I couldn't try it out first but wow. I knew I wanted a plush mattress and didn't have a l9t to spend. After researching for a few weeks I decided on this one. It inflated back to its usual shape quickly and was totally reinflated in a few hours. I slept on it that same night and so far there's no dips or sagging which was something I worried about. If you want a plush mattress this one is a good choice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not 10 inches', 'author': 'Auntyrob', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The mattress arrived in excellent condition and I unboxed it the next day. I got the full size and it's kinda heavy, about 50 pounds I think, but it wasn't that hard to get out of the box or get on the bed frame. The little letter opener type tool is a joke. I used my scissors, just be careful not to cut your mattress. There's 2 layers of plastic, one keeps it rolled and the other keeps it sealed. Once on the frame and the plastic removed it started to expand right away but it only got to 8 inches. I let it sit for the recommended 3 days but it never got to 10 as in their description, the reason for the 4 stars. As with any new mattress it may take first few nights to get used to, my back hurt a little at first. The mattress is bouncy so no motion isolation like the ad says, and the edges are a little flimsey, it almost feels like I'm sliding off when I go to get up, but it's comfy and I sleep well. They offer a 100 night trial and I would send it back and get a true memory foam but how the heck would I get it back in the box. If you don't like bouncy, don't get this mattress but it IS soft and comfy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars DANG GINA! This is one comfortable mattress!', 'author': 'Daney B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this mattress (in a queen) for my 13 year old son as he broke his bed frame (that was a full) and I decided to get him a sturdier frame and also get him a bigger sized bed overall as he is a tall fella and likes to sprawl.Every morning when I go in to say good morning and annoy him, I lie in his bed and I think "my lawd this mattress is very comfortable for the price!"I would think that a mattress at this price point would be the worst (I know that makes me sound like a terrible mom for getting this for my kid when I thought it would not be great but whatever I am not made of money ok?!), but it is legit COMFORTABLE.If I didn\'t already have the best mattress/bed in the world, I would not hesitate to order one of these for myself. Easy to open, easy to move, puffed up to its expected size very quickly, didn\'t smell, and was ready to go in no time at all.I highly recommend this mattress if you are on a budget but don\'t want to sacrifice comfort.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best sleep I've had in years", 'author': 'john H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First and foremost when it comes in the Box you receive this long sort of heavy box that's about a foot square and about 6 6 and 1/2 ft long once you unbox the actual mattress you see this tightly wound mattress wrapped in it shipping container you take the cutting tool that comes with the mattress, carefully poke a hole in the plastic and zip right along the scene where it tells you to stand back and be amazed. Once you cut the last bit of the plastic it Springs away from you like one of the old snakes in a can and start rise up, if it's like mine it'll be upside down and you'll have to flip it over. Give it the 24 to 48 hours and a good warm room to fully air out and inflate to reach its maximum potential and then start enjoying some of the best sleep that you've ever had.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 8 inch Twin Mattress Gel Memory Foam Mattress for Cool Sleep & Pressure Relief, Medium Firm Mattresses CertiPUR-US Certified/Bed-in-a-Box/Pressure Relieving (8 in, Twin)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Let’s get into it', 'author': 'Kelsey Vaughan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Okay I’m going to try to be as detailed as possible. So we decided to upgrade our bed after 5 years. I searched everywhere on Amazon & all the other brands were either $300+ or we’re going to take almost a month to get to us. But then I found this, I read all the reviews & we decided to try it. We had never ordered a mattress online before but decided to give it a try. It shipped pretty fast but then somehow was lost in transit (which is still don’t know how they misplaced a package this big) but it wasn’t the seller’s or amazons fault, that’s on ups who it was shipped through. I contacted Amazon & they immediately ordered a replacement. That was on February 15th. Amazon said it wouldn’t be here until February 22nd & we were okay with that. Well it ended up showing up on February 17th! We were so excited. The box is heavy so it’s easier for 2 people or someone super strong to carry. My husband got it upstairs & unpackaged which was super easy to do. It almost immediately inflated but we gave it about 12 hours to sit. Last night we slept on it for the first time & omgggg love it. It’s definitely firm which is what my husband wanted but still soft. The memory foam is great & makes you feel cradled as you sleep. It pops right back up pretty fast too! One of the most comfortable beds we’ve ever bought. We will be buying a full size for our daughter since she needs a new bed too! Amazing quality at an amazing price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good mattress, good price', 'author': 'melauree', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got 2 of the 6 inch for my daughters' bunk beds. They arrived quickly in a vaccuumed sealed packages. It was a little tricky to get the mattress out of all of the plastic but once opened they fluffed up pretty quickly. We opened them 48 hours before the kids were going to sleep on them to let them fully fluff up and to air out. They had a pretty strong chemical smell (similar to the smell of a permanent marker) and it took a few weeks for that to go away. My kids report the mattresses are comfortable. I have not slept on them myself but have layed on them a few times and found them pretty comfortable. For an adult/teenager I would recommend a thicker mattress than the 6 inch but it is perfect for my young kids to be safe in their bunk beds. The cloth cover zipped off easily to wash and went back on pretty easily as well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made memory foam mattress', 'author': 'kitty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I only give four stars due to having found that I personally prefer the spring mattress over memory foam. I hadn’t slept on a memory foam mattress before and thought I would try one so this one was purchased. For me, personally with a bad back, there is little give which causes pain, and isn’t comfortable …for me. For you? In regards to this mattress for one looking for a memory foam mattress…it is incredibly well made, firmness is great, and the comfort is there if you like memory foam.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good for your back', 'author': 'MadG', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So I’ve forever been terrified of buying a foam mattress. So I thought I’d order this to try out foam because my spring mattress was over 10years. This one is a good price to test and had good reviews. So I got the mattress. I was very skeptical and worried the whole time I let it opened to decompress. It had no problems forming into its shape in about 6 hours or so. I allowed it to air out standing instead of flat. It really had no smell. I put my nose to it and thought my eyes got itchy after but maybe it was from something else. So no odors and no problems with its shape. So finally I slept on it. And I guess since I’m not use to foam it felt really weird. It feels like you’re stuck in every position you move into. But I guess that’s how it is. It has a sinking feeling but I guess that is also how it is. I woke up actually feeling really good and like my back was straighter. And I ordered 8 inch and it indeed shaped into 8 inches because I measured it. It seems smaller but it’s not compared to my old mattress that is also 8 inches. Ok so my reason tho for 4 star is because the material is polyester which you can’t find in the description. Polyester is really bad for your hormones but it seems they make everything out of plastic nowadays. I researched organic brands and basically anything labeled organic vegan etc is just greenwashing. All foam mattress are processed with tons of chemicals. They have to. It’s a science in order to turn fibers into all the crazy things they make. They will then add some essential oils at the end to call it organic. Overall this is a wonderful buy for toxic mattress because they all are. It’s a lesser evil. It’s very comfortable in a stiff odd sinking way. I bought some cotton sheets to help balance things out. I recommend you buy this mattress for testing the foam waters and your budget.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable omgahhh', 'author': 'lyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the 6inch queen mattress! It’s now been a whole week since I had it and I’m super satisfied and so is my 3 yr old!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE IT!', 'author': 'Tenika Wascom', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this mattress - we got the full size. I am amazed how I was able to see this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far so good', 'author': 'Ggnam', 'rating': 4, 'content': "When it first arrived it was about 2.5 inches high and was slanted to one side.After 6 hours the mattress started to take shape and is now up to 7 inches.I am not sure this will expand to 8 inches and I will update this after giving it two more days.One downside is that the corners do not expand totally as in the picture.Other than that it seems like a very good mattress. I will update again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I am satisfied with this', 'author': "Kat's Korner", 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I had high hopes for this mattress to be the best option for me. title: 6 Inch Green Tea Memory Foam Mattress, Fiberglass Free, Patented Custom Contour Support, Sturdy Base Foam, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-box, Twin, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6 months in.. one of the best purchases ever!!', 'author': 'Brett', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me start by saying that I haven\'t ever had the luxury of buying a new bed since I was born before this one right here, the 12" Zinus Green Tea Mattress of the Queen sized variant. I had a spring bed with a pillow topper for 15 years. I was used to it, it did the job. I knew my bed was nothing special but I knew I could do better. When I finally ready to move out, I knew it was time to get a new bed. I\'m fresh out of college so I knew I wouldn\'t be spending $800 on a mattress. And everyone says "you spend half your life on a bed, make an investment!!" Well that was true 10 years ago. Now, we can buy vacuum sealed beds on Amazon for 10th of the price of a Tempurpedic bed. There\'s so many these days, I needed to do my researchWhy Zinus?Through my deliberations on WHICH bed in a box I would purchase, it was between this, Casper, Purple and I think some other $500+ one. I wasn\'t considering the Amazonbasics one because it seemed very very generic and bare for my taste. Casper and Purple have great marketing and I see the ads all the time on the subway and on the internet. Reading some reviews, I saw that they might be a bit too firm. That lead me to Amazon where I found Zinus. The bset reviews say...well, its the best. The worst reviews are people who opened them up and got covered in fiberglass. Figuring that I wasn\'t going to open it up, I chose this one. It looks nice, the material of the case seems comfy and the alleged "green tea" will help me sleep better. Also, the bedframe I bought was also a Zinus so I figured that they would pair up better (spoiler: not really lol). Finally, it was only $279!!The first 2 daysThe box comes in the mail. It\'s pretty damn small for how big a queen mattress is. I\'m not tall by anymeans and I was able to bear hug it up the stairs to my apartment. Out of the bag, I placed it on the bed frame. I let it breathe for a day with the windows in my bedroom cracked open before sleeping on it. (Yes, it smelled for the first day. The next day, a bit less. I believe within a week, there was NO smell left. I understood this would happen before I made my purchase and I will NOT be factoring it into the review because we\'re all adults and we will get over the smell without calling the bed trash.) 24hrs later, the bed had blossomed to around 12" in most parts and 10" around the corners. My girlfriend always says "10" is fine" so I lay on the bed for the first time and woah... this is the comfiest bed I\'ve ever layed on. My back didn\'t hurt, I was in bliss. The first sleep, I woke up so refreshed. I had NO complaints. Even my cat was on it all night and he usually gets up and goes on the move.Day 3 and beyond (6 months in total)Since day 2, not much has changed. The bed has retained it\'s shape. It wasn\'t broken in on 1 side and virgin on the other. The corners never really took shape but I\'m not sure if this is due to the sheet I have over it. There is an element of body heat absorption which will have you wake up a bit sweaty. I recommend getting a lighter blanket or bamboo sheets to help with this. I did both and I don\'t sweat anymore. It\'s been 6 months of great sleep for me. Oh yeah, that green tea extract line is BS. I don\'t smell it, never did and I don\'t think it\'s what causes me to feel calm in bed. I think that the comfort is what makes me happyOverallOverall, this bed is absolutely worth it, every single penny. You can\'t beat the price for the quality of the product and the quality of your sleep. I love getting into bed and I HATE getting out because of how warm and comfy I am when I wake up. I 110% recommend this bed. Good luck!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress. Comfortable for 2 fat people and 3 dogs.', 'author': 'Zooper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'EDIT: 3 month update.....I\'m still leaving it at 5 stars. We have now had this mattress for just over 3 months and still love it. I am falling asleep faster, staying asleep and waking up feeling more rested. I have slept on both sides and even in the middle of the mattress and have equal comfort anywhere. I normally have 3 dogs hogging the bed and what\'s really nice is I barely notice if they get up and move to a new spot, even if it\'s right next to me. I no longer feel like my husband is doing backflips if he turns over in the middle of the night either. Even the one night the mattress pad didn\'t make it into the dryer in time for bed I did notice the difference the mattress pad makes in not making this mattress feel as firm, but it was still quite comfortable, just not as comfortable. I have no complaints. There were no smells with ours to start with so that never was a problem and it\'s still at a full 12" evenly across.I\'m in the camp of those who were really skeptical of buying a mattress online. Especially a foam one since I\'ve had a regular pillow top one for the past 10 years. Yes it was time for a new mattress! I had been shopping around for a new mattress for a few months trying out different ones, getting pricing and trying to make a decision which is kind of a big deal when you\'re more than likely looking at spending a lot of money. A friend suggested we consider the foam mattresses and that Amazon had some good prices on them. I headed to a local store to give their version of these mattresses a try and I was surprised how comfortable they were. After testing them out I decided to see what Amazon reviews had to say about the ones they offered. I read through the good and the not so good and the flat out bad reviews and decided to take a chance and see what arrived. I am super happy I did! Granted it\'s only been 2 weeks but so far we love this mattress! I had read the multiple reviews saying theirs didn\'t inflate correctly, had a foul odor, was lumpy, etc....thankfully none of that was true of what we received.To break it down.....cons...It is a firm mattress no doubt. I am someone who likes to pretty much sleep in a cloud and am a side sleeper so it\'s taken some getting used to. Since the cost of this mattress was so good I went ahead and ordered a high quality mattress cover/pad and for me it\'s really helped make adjusting going from a plush pillow top to a firm bed a lot easier.Going from a spring mattress to a foam ones takes some adjustment on the support on the sides. Obviously the spring ones tend to have more of a frame around the edges so sitting on the side of the bed is different. I wouldn\'t say it\'s bad but it\'s not as supportive.We will probably need to get a new bed frame here sometime soon. While the box springs we had from our old king are still in great shape the lighter weight mattress tends to slide and needs to be shoved back into place every night before going to bed. Not really any fault of the mattress it\'s just a con that I\'ll need to replace the bed itself in order to stop this from happening.Another con that\'s not the fault of the mattress it\'s just my bad luck....I missed where this was on sale just after Thanksgiving because I was still pondering what kind of mattress to get. So I paid the higher, yet still on sale, price. 4 days later it went back on sale again and has remained $40 cheaper for over a week now. Bummer for me, but still a good deal, just not as good of a deal as if I\'d waited 4 more days to decide.On to the good stuffPros.....Per my experience I say buy this mattress. Don\'t wait, grab it at the price it is now. I did not notice any sort of foul odor but I did open the windows and had the ceiling fan going while it inflated.It inflated to the full 12" and did so within an hour. We were sleeping on the mattress withing 4 hours of setting it up. It fit where our old king size was perfectly with no overhang or shortages size wise. It\'s around 2" taller than our old mattress so that took a little getting used to but it measured 12" with a regular school ruler.It was well packaged and fully deflated ready to go when it arrived.I\'m a big girl and my husband is a fairly big guy and we both sleep comfortably on this mattress with our 3 large breed bed hogging dogs. When my husband moves at night he does so like a fish out of water and I have noticed he doesn\'t wake me up turning over because it\'s not bouncing me around like our old mattress did. I don\'t even really notice a dog moving around to a different spot.I\'m a side sleeper who would love to sleep in a cloud so this did take some getting used to but it\'s never been uncomfortable. The first night getting to sleep and finding a comfortable position took a little bit but I could instantly feel I was better supported and my hip and shoulder didn\'t have the pressure it normally would. When I turned onto my back I felt almost like I was sleeping in a hammock. Not totally of course but the extra support was there where it hadn\'t been before. With what I saved on the mattress I went ahead and bought a nice mattress pad/cover to put on top to make it a little more soft. I had always been told you can make a firm mattress more soft but you can\'t make a soft mattress more firm so if it\'s too firm invest in a good pad and it can make a lot of difference if you prefer a softer bed.What I noticed right away is when I woke up I wasn\'t as sore. I feel a lot more rested in the morning and I\'m not waking up to turn over or move around near as much as I was. Granted our old mattress was 10 years old and that had a lot to do with it, but still this mattress is obviously better and keeps me in a deep sleep for longer periods throughout the night.My husband also says he\'s sleeping better and isn\'t flopping around like he had been doing with the old mattress. He\'s the one of us always complaining about being hot while sleeping and he said he hasn\'t noticed this mattress makes that any worse, and if anything since he\'s not moving around so much it\'s better.We like it so much we plan to order the 8" version for our kid\'s bunk bed here soon.As we get more use of out this I will try to update this review for how it\'s holding up. I don\'t expect to get 10 years out of it, granted i probably shouldn\'t have tried to get 10 years out of the older one but it held up for at least 8-9 of those years. For this price I\'d be happy if it lasts a couple of years. If it lasts longer even better. I highly suggest if this is too firm for you to buy a nice mattress pad and to buy it while it\'s at the price it is now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Packaging, Soft Yet Supportive, and Top Value for the Price', 'author': 'Ming W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I tend to be very critical when reviewing a product but this 12" memory foam mattress deserved a good rating. The reasons are for 1. Packaging (definitely matters when it comes to something as big as a mattress that you have to handle on your own), 2. Level of comfort, and 3. Val0ue. I want to also include the fact that I have 4 bulging discs from a bad accident and bought this for the level of support and comfort one gets from a memory foam mattress.1. The Packaging: I\'m not the strongest or tallest person and had no one to help with getting this on my platform bedframe. Oh yes and I live on the second floor of an apartment building with no elevator and slightly uneven stairs. But I was a able to get it done without hurting or straining anything. The packaging was solid and convenient enough to allow for some sliding and scraping of the package prior to getting it into my apartment and still not damaging or dirtying the mattress. I had to pickup this approximately 5\'8" package at the local UPS pickup center because my apartment building has a front gate that has to be manually opened and if they had left it in front of my door, it would block the walkway and would most likely have been taken anyways. I also had to rent a Home Depot pickup truck to pick this up, it would not have fit into my 2 door coupe. This would fit into a large SUV with the seats folded down but the box that it came in is approximately 5\'8" x 18" x 18" (check the product details for exact measurements) and will definitely not fit into the trunk of your typical sedan. I was able to lift (maybe 40-50lbs?) this and get it into the pickup. Getting this up my stairway was the challenge and to do this I had to flip it from end to end on the stairs. The packaging was a hard cardboard box and withstood the tumbling. Once the box was removed, I found that the mattress was compressed, rolled-up, vacuum sealed in heavy plastic, and inserted into a solid plastic/polyester protective bag (kind of like the carrying bags of sleeping bags). This protective bag kept the mattress protected and was removed by tearing the perforation. It required a little bit of effort, but was doable without scissors. I then had to unroll it with the zipper fabric cover side down, carefully cut the plastic vacuum wrap and that was it. The mattress did have to be flipped so that the proprer side was on the bottom but it was easy enough. The mattress rose to its intended thickness within 24 hours, and most of it within 30min. All in all, the packaging was well done and I was able to set it up by myself without damaging the contents. The mattress itself had a fabric zippered cover that I kept on and I also put the entire mattress into a vinyl zippered cover.2. The Feel of the Mattress: Comfortable due to the softness yet supportive aspect of memory foam but I could slightly feel the foundation frame underneath. I opted for the 12" mattress because obviously the thicker the mattress, the higher amount of memory foam material as well as the support foam underneath. I read a review for an 8" mattress and the writer mentioned that she would have gone for at least a 10". I put this on a metal platform foundation and I believe that if I had gone for anything less than 12", I would not be giving it a 5 star for comfort. This mattress was definitely supportive and took pressure off of my back and joints. It had enough memory foam material that I sank in some but was supported by the base layer of support foam. For a little around $270 with taxes, I doubt that I would have found a comparable mattress with this level of comfort. Yes, it memory foam is known to trap a bit of heat and I did feel more heat than a spring mattress but I do sleep with the AC on so it wasn\'t an issue. If you are one that is very averse to heat or sweat easily as I do, you may want to consider a gel infused top. I didn\'t feel like I was in the clouds but it was comfortable enough with enough actual memory foam for the feel.3. Value: Definitely well priced. I had visited a Tempurpedic both at the OC County Fair and the price was nearly $2K. This mattress didn\'t feel as good as that model but for $270, I doubt that I would have found another mattress with memory foam. I had looked at a lot of options on Amazon and for a 12" thick option with Certi-Pure certification, along with infused carbon material to keep it from smelling, this mattress was the best priced out there. Plus, you technically don\'t need a boxspring and a platform frame could be purchased for as low as $60-$70 increasing the value. So all in all, if you are considering a memory foam option, this one is the one to go with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, Supportive and Affordable', 'author': 'The Third Man', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I know you are skeptical of the low price - as I was - but this mattress keeps appearing on best-of lists for good reason. I find it surprisingly firm, yet giving to conform for my side-sleeping needs. I purchased the 12" thick mattress. The build quality is very good, and it was ready to use within a few hours of opening. It is foam, so there is an initial foam scent that I did not find to be unpleasant. I am pleased to say that after a month I like this mattress and consider it an excellent buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oprah of beds.', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "THIS 👏🏻 BED 👏🏻 IS 👏🏻 THE 👏🏻 JAM. First off, I'm a flight attendant. I sleep in a lot of hotel beds. I know what a good and bad bad feels like. THIS BED IS AMAZING. Feeling impartial about the non conforming bed of the future? Think you'll miss the springs? No way. I promise. I felt the same. I sat there for 36 hours straight watching this bed rise in my kitchen festering the idea that I made a mistake. What is this? Why does it have to rise? Who even am I right now? The instructions were like one sentence and I probably messed it up. Omg what if I messed up?! 2017 is weird, I hate this. I hate New things. JK NOPE. I HAVE NO REGRETS! This bed cured my boyfriend's back pain. This bed cured my sleepless nights. MY PHAT @zz can sleep on my side without my spine feeling broken in half. I can sleep on my back or stomach no problem. I can't remember the last time I slept through the night... Now I can't wake up. We spent three days sleeping til 2pm. Today I missed my alarm for work by 2 hours. I legitimately slept through 2 hours of backup alarms that go off every 10 minutes. THIS BED IS THE DEVIL. But like a good devil that greets you with puppies and all things great in this world. This bed is the Oprah of beds. This bed is like getting a whole row to yourself on an airplane. This bed is like seeing your ex and they look like a potato and your eyeliner is so fleek it pierces their heart. This bed is freshly signed divorced papers. THIS BED IS ALL YOU NEED IN THIS LIFE. Its dirt cheap, soft yet firm, and will make you laugh pretty hard the first time you're trying to get rowdy on it. I've had this bed a few weeks now and I am pretty convinced that this is the best decision I've ever made in my life besides losing my virginity and buying a motorcycle. TOP THREE for sure. So stop debating and order this bed. Just do it. (Shia lebeouff voice) (I probably spelt that wrong)Oh and it doesn't smell bad. I read that it did. It smelled like it was compressed in a bag and shipped across the country which was expected, but it went away. Also the box makes a rad cat house.Xoxo", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I have had this mattress for 8 years', 'author': 'Orbenth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this mattress when I purchased my house 8 years ago. I had been sleeping on a 20 year old spring king size mattress.I have the 12” Green Tea version. King. I am a 36 year old side sleeper who weighs 140 lbs.My wife is a 27 year old side and back sleeper who weighs around 250 lbs.I have the pleasure of being able to tell you how this mattress compares with a Zinus 8” cooling gel mattress and a 10” Green Tea mattress.In the 8 years I have owned this 12” mattress not a lot has changed. It has broken in but not down. It is noticeably less firm than the other mattresses without being considered not firm.There are no lumps, dips, divets or sunken in spots. I would buy it again in a heartbeat. In fact I know 6 other people who have purchased this mattress solely because they house sat my dogs for me while on vacation and slept in my bed.So let’s break it down:I purchased the mattress and it came tightly rolled and compressed in a bag that was in a box. I dragged the box to my spare bedroom and dumped it out. I rolled the plastic with the bed in it out and carefully pulled the plastic away from the mattress before carefully cutting along the seam in a quick motion with a box cutter. It immediately began to inflate. I pulled the plastic complete off and left it on the guest room floor. At the time I had just purchased the house. The carpet was clean and the only other item in the room were 3 moving boxes. I opened the 2 windows in the room. It was spring in SC so about 80 degrees. I left the room and continued to clean and unpack. I checked on the mattress about 6 hours later and it looked fully inflated. The room had a smell. It was very light and smelled like new foam as to be expected. I went along and plucked at the corners which were all still not fully up. Left the room and cleaned. I checked in it again before going to bed that night. The bed looked fully inflated, including the corners. I did not touch it. I went to bed and left it alone until that next night giving it almost a full 48 hours. I dragged my old mattress out of my room that night and leaned it against a wall in the spare room and then with the help of my then girlfriend, took the new mattress and placed it on my bed frame. (Which is an adjustable bed frame. More on that later.) there was no longer a smell. I grabbed my old sheets which fit on it perfectly even though this mattress is 12” and my old one was 6”. Grabbed my comforter and pillows and me, my girlfriend and 35 lb Australian cattle dog Beaux and 6 lb chihuahua Wiggles lay down. Heaven.I was 28 and weighed 115 lbs at that time. I had hurt my back at work tripping over a cord while carrying a heavy load when I was 23. My back had never been the same. For the first time in 5 years I lay on that mattress and no longer felt the pressure in my back. Or the constant searing pain. I do not sink into it. It’s by no means cloud like or marshmallow plush. On a scale of 1-10 with 1 being most firm and wooden plank like and 10 being marshmallow soft where you sink and get trapped this is a 3-4. It relieves pressure points but isn’t hard. I don’t bend when I lay on it but can feel my hip and shoulder go in. I don’t get very hot on it and I’m a very hot, very light restless sleeper. Any movement, light, sound, breathing will wake me up. Basically I’m just really bad at sleeping. It’s very good at not transferring movement so my girlfriend could roll or move and I wouldn’t wake up. When I bought the mattress I also got a waterproof cover because Wiggles was 14 and had seizures. Sometimes he would wet himself during the seizures so the protector could protect the mattress. It doesn’t crinkle and you can’t feel it, but even 8 years later the mattress looks like the day I drug it onto the bed.It bends on an adjustable base but is thick enough that it doesn’t bend all the way. The base also vibrates to massage your back. I can feel it through the mattress as well though it is very dampened.Sexy time is no different on this than with a spring mattress. You don’t sink in, there is less bounce and no squeaky springs.Fast forward to 2020. The pandemic. I am now 34 and weigh 155 lbs. mattress still feels and looks the same even with weight gain. No bumps or lumps and not hot, unless it’s summer but no matter what mattress you have you’re gonna be hot when it’s 106 degrees outside and the ac on your 102 barely insulated house is struggling.My spare room is no longer empty with just 3 boxes. It’s now a whole guest room. And it also has a Zinus bed frame and 10” green tea mattress. 10” compared to 12” is a little bit on the firmer side. Now a 2-3 on that scale from earlier. Still pressure relieving but motion transfers a little more. Beaux was testing it out with me and rolled and I could feel the bed jump. Guests still absolutely love it and talk about buying one. I always take them to my room so they can lay on mine and tell me if they feel a difference. They always end up choosing the 12” and buy it for their home.I have slept on the cooling foam Zinus mattress at 8” at my mother in laws house. It is not noticeably cooler but IS noticeably firmer. A 1.5 on that scale from earlier. Just shy of being a wooden plank. I was stiff the next day and my shoulders and torn back muscle aches. My advice is to go thicker on the mattress no matter your weight. Gives more pressure relief without giving you the sink. My mattress at 12” is by no means not firm but it’s also pressure relieving and not rock like.It’s now October 29th 2022.I’m 36 and weigh 140. Wiggles is no longer with us but the mattress cover and Beaux remain. Stryker the 50 lb Australian cattle dog has joined us. I write this review at 8:09 am, laying on the mattress. I slept for 7.5 hours and have no pains, stiffness or aches. I feel well rested. My wife is slightly snoring and just rolled a little and I barely felt it and only because I was awake to notice. I highly recommend this mattress and will replace it with another one exactly like it at the 10 year mark if it feels like it needs to be replaced. It doesn’t feel any different than the day I bought it now though. Maybe the 12-15 year mark if that’s the case.Sweet dreams and have a good night, y’all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars SECOND PURCHASE IN -- FULL REVIEWS OF BOTH!', 'author': 'Buckeye Baby', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'SECOND PURCHASE REVIEW - 12-02-2021 - Big fat BUMMER! I am incredibly disappointed in my second purchase - exact same mattress - exact same thickness yet a completely different mattress and experience!? I feel more rested and relaxed waking than I have in at least 5 years.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stunning how good this is for the money', 'author': 'Mark', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I worked at Sleep’s for 7 years and took great pride in my craft. Knowing my products, the sleep certifications and how to match a customer to the right sleep system to improve their quality of life was something I took very seriously and truly enjoyed. That said - One of the difficult things to do was sell against this ‘new breed of online mattress companies’ like Casper etc offering quality queen sets to compete with brands like Tempurpedic for around $1000. The issue wasn’t the quality per say, but rather if a sleeper TRULY understood what they specifically needed (considering proper alignment, WITH PRESSURE RELIEF) vs simply assuming ‘firm is best… it is NOT’, that person COULD buy online and save money. That said I did have a healthy amount of people who got burned by making ill informed choices online who came in and bought from me. My mrs and I WERE on a Sleep to Live 400 (middle of their quality line) queen set where we had scientifically designed sides tailored to our body. Think a customized Simmons Beautyrest pocketed coil style mattress with cooling material in the surface bc we sleep hot. In 2009 when we bought it, it retailed for $2200. It was fantastic. It has a 20 yr warranty (if no stains or damage), where if it sags more than 1 1/2”, we get a replacement. While still comfortable today, *WE’VE changed*. Different needs with pressure relief, different support needs.. dare I say we weigh more 😳👀😂… I am a student of the Tempurpedic and various other memory foam products. TP launched an ENTIRELY NEW category in bedding with quality memory foam. Although that came at a hefty price. We own one original TP cloud twin my 16yo sleeps well on, i was allowed 1 ‘friends and family priced’ TP product per year at about 40-50% of retail. The caviat to that was I was not allowed a comfort exchange on it, the one I thought we wanted was $2500 at f&f, and to ME, that was too expensive a gamble, ESPECIALLY when we liked our STL 400. So I could never pull the trigger. We decided to go king size for Christmas. Along with size, comes bed frame, mattress protectors, sheets, comforters, etc… going up in size I bought this mattress based on a few REALLY key points:- it was Certi-pur certified- no fiberglass- reviews said no smell upon opening- 150k+ reviews at 4.5 stars??- in memory foam (specifically lower price) thicker typically = good pressure relief- price was absurd at $400 on black Friday My final thoughts - if this WORKS, transitioning to memory foam, we’ll be set up otherwise to buy a better mattress as needed. It has worked since day.. 1 It’s very normal to take 1-4 weeks to ‘get acclamated to’ a new mattress. We made it clear in the business to give it time.. at LEAST 7 days, up to 30. If your body doesn’t like it at that point, come in to exchange it. This thing came out of the box with *ZERO*…. Smell. We brought it in from the cold and opened it at 3:30, and despite knowing it takes up to 72 hours to fully expand from shrink shipping, slept on it that night.- back pain - none- shoulder pain - MUCH better (id been having issues sleeping due to shoulder pain)- mattress rebound - perfectly acceptable (doesn’t feel like your stuck in a hole)- tossing and turning - drastically reduced All in all, we are SUPREMELY happy with this mattress. Longevity - Im truly not as concerned bc its already served its purpose and gotten us through the transition from coil to foam, and queen to king. If it only lasted a year, id chalk it up to being cheap, and with next to no concern upgrade to a brand with more history in higher quality. Fantastic product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 8 Inch Memory Foam and Spring Hybrid Mattress - Medium Firm Feel - Bed in a Box - Quality Comfort and Adaptive Support - Breathable - Cooling - Guest and Kids Bedroom - Twin Size
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I loved it so much, I bought a 2nd one (I think you have to pay xtra for bugs)', 'author': 'Wolfshanze', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I now have two of these in my home for my two children... I bought my first in September of 2018 to replace an old mattress for my daughter... it was great, and my daughter loved the mattress... no issues at all with the mattress... my son needed a new mattress too, so I was about to order a 2nd one in February 2019 when I noticed numerous reviews (many recent) citing reports of bedbugs.Now let me clarify my experience here... I work in the hospitality business and maintain dormitories for military training students that are on a constant rotation, much like a hotel. We are all trained to spot, look for and deal with bed bugs should ever the problem arise... bed bugs have nothing to do with personal hygene or cleanliness, they can infest anything from the sleaziest no-tell motel to the fanciest 5-star Hyatt Regency. Also, bed bugs don't limit themselves to beds, they will travel and hide on/in anything... clothes, shoes, carpets, suitcases, curtains, laptops, alarm clocks, a book... bed bugs aren't picky. For those reviewers that say they got bedbugs... if you think it came from the mattress and you just tossed it out, problem solved... YOU STILL HAVE BEDBUGS because your house is now infested (or previously was and you just now noticed).Now back to these Linenspa mattresses... I LOVE THESE THINGS... they're very comfortable and affordable... both my kids love them. I had already purchased one back in 2018 and never had any issues, and as someone who can spot those little devils, our house is free of them. When I ordered my 2nd mattress (after reading the negative bug reviews) I went ahead and took the added precaution... and you should too... if you're ever worried about something like this...INSPECT AND OPEN THE MATTRESS OUTSIDE YOUR HOUSE!I just laid a bedsheet in the driveway, opened the box, inspected the vacuum-sealed wrap... saw nothing... opened it up on the sheet on my driveway (to keep it clean of course) and fully inspected this sucker everywhere... nope... no bugs, no smells... just a nice clean beautiful mattress. Carried it inside, no issues, son happy... If you actually do have one that is infested like some people claim, and you opened it inside and slept on it... ya... your whole house is now infested (and possibly was before you bought a new mattress).I just want to make it clear that as someone who works in the hospitality business and is trained in spotting and dealing with those little devils long before it becomes a problem... I've bought two of these mattresses from this company and never had an issue with bugs or smells... and if I need a third or fourth mattress, i would buy another... but if you ever suspect or worry about something like this from this company, or ANY company... just open it outside on a clean sheet and inspect thoroughly before you bring it in.... that way if there is a problem, you don't risk letting them into your home.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the price and has lasted a long time and still comfortable', 'author': 'Charlotte Martina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We purchased this mattress for my daughter when we upgraded her bed frame. The mattress was immediately placed on the frame and waited a few days to try it out. This is a good value and is very comfortable for a guest bedroom. I’m please with the purchase although I don’t have to sleep on it. I think it’s going to work wonderfully.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No bed bugs (darnet), but is a nice mattress', 'author': 'Maurice Garlet', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Mine didn\'t come with any bedbugs, so naturally, I complained and I learned that these people are getting smart. What they did was very simple yet efficient. At night when no one was around, they quietly replaced the sign \'Mattress Factory\' in front of the building with one that reads \'Rug Factory". At first, the bed bugs were perplexed, they like to be snug but they are bed bugs, not rug bugs, so after much discussion, they decided to move on and infest the factory down the street. That said if you want your mattress with bed bugs you have to order them separately, they do not come with the mattress anymore.Now if you really believed that a brand new mattress could come with bed bugs, I guess you also believed my story, so be at peace no bed bugs.On the serious side of things, the mattress is to my taste medium-soft more than medium-firm. Of course, that will vary a lot depending on whom you ask. I am male, 5\'9 and 175lbs and I guess your weight also has a lot to do with if it feels firm or soft. The mattress is very flexible (it comes in a box) so what you have under the mattress may also affect how it feels.I only had this mattress for a little over a week now and so far I am very pleased. It looks nice, yet it doesn\'t look like a $1,000 mattress which is normal and I really don\'t see the point in buying a very fancy mattress that no one will ever see except you when you change the sheets. That said I haven\'t encountered any major defects on the seems or anything of the sort. I found one tiny imperfection in one seem, yet it doesn\'t look like it may rip apart, just not super nice. So far no noise from the springs nor any other problems.I did a lot of research before buying this mattress, I was one click away from buying another one for around $600. Reading all the reviews I realized that people complain of mattresses losing the form or having other kinds of defects after a relatively short time despite being much more expensive $600-$1,000).I also realize that no matter what; there are only two basic kinds of mattresses. The memory foam ones, which I don\'t trust because like people they lose the memory with age. Let say that some of them may even suffer from Alzheimer\'s. The other ones are the Hybrids which are basically spring structures covered with a layer of memory foam. In this case, even if the memory foam goes South, you still have the springs, so it seems like they must last longer.Of course, they all claim to have a proprietary and unique technology that will allow you to sleep like a baby. Nevertheless, they will still be in one of the two mentioned categories, the rest could be true, or just sales speech.Long story short, if this one goes bad after a year or two, I wasted $120. If I buy one of those $1,000 ones and they go bad after a year or two I will be extremely disappointed, angry, and sleeping on an uncomfortable mattress. I don\'t know you but it doesn\'t sound to me like a good sleeping formula.Of course, I could go with one of those $7,000 ones they tried to sell me at the Home & Garden show (yes I am still laughing at the salesman). I guess they are really comfortable, but then the credit card payment will take away my sleep so no thank you.The pain relief low rate is because it didn\'t help with my lower back pain, but I don\'t think it is the mattress\'s fault, apparently, I need a firm mattress for that and that may not be the solution for everyone\'s pain.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Changed my review', 'author': 'Patricia Evans', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Updated review:Although I wasn\'t going to order the same mattress, I couldn\'t decided what I wanted, and I didn\'t want to pay a lot of money for a mattress that wouldn\'t be used often. It is far from the worst.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a toddler bed', 'author': 'Sara', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. Definitely low cost material', 'author': 'John Ang', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Update: I’m updating my review due to having too high of expectations.
