If you are going to buy a LinenSpa mattress, I\'d stay away from the 8" and hope the 10" or 12" hybrid is better (however I wouldn\'t be surprised if they use the same springs)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Quality', 'author': 'Yessenia Campos', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This feels like an expensive mattress I can’t believe how comfortable it is.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Nope, no bedbugs (and here's why there wouldn't be)", 'author': 'S. Johnson', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'If you’ve been reading reviews of this mattress, no doubt you’ve seen all the reviews claiming that someone found bedbugs in their mattress, and no doubt you’re starting to wonder whether buying this mattress is worth the risk. However, unlike many of the previous reviewers, I actually have firsthand experience with bedbugs. Thanks to the people who once lived in the apartment below mine, I know far more about bedbugs than I ever wanted to know. So, to set your mind at ease, here are a few important facts about bedbugs and why you’re highly unlikely to find them in a brand-new factory-sealed mattress.1. Contrary to popular belief, bedbugs are not tiny little unidentifiable specks. An adult bedbug is reddish brown, about the size and shape of an apple seed, and easily identifiable as a bug. Bedbug eggs and nymphs (babies) are tiny little specks, but they’re whitish or yellowish. So if you see tiny dark spots on your new mattress, they are NOT bedbugs or bedbug eggs. Even if they appear to be moving, it’s probably due to static electricity or air currents, not because they’re alive. Any tiny specks on a new mattress are probably exactly what the manufacturer says they are, which is flecks of burned plastic left over from the packaging process.2. Bedbugs won’t crawl into a mattress just because it’s a mattress. Bedbugs don’t know what mattresses are. Bedbugs are small, slow-moving critters that can’t jump or fly, so their preferred prey is something that’s lying still and oblivious to its surroundings, i.e., sleeping humans. They\'re attracted to sleeping humans by the carbon dioxide that humans exhale, and then they hide in or near the bed because they’ve found a food source in the bed, not because they’re somehow intelligent enough to recognize a mattress and seek out mattresses that aren’t currently occupied by humans.3. Bedbugs would have trouble getting established in a factory. Certainly they could hitchhike into a factory on a worker’s clothes or belongings, but once there, they wouldn’t thrive. They prefer to hide during the day and feed at night. They don’t like bright lights or prey that’s awake, moving around, and alert enough to smack any bugs they feel crawling on them. Any bedbug that made its way into a mattress factory would probably just get stepped on, not start a colony in the equipment and infest all the mattresses. (See above: no way is a bedbug intelligent enough to think to itself, "Hey, that thing over there is a mattress. If I hide in it, I\'ll eventually get delivered somewhere that I can find a sleeping person to bite.")4. Bedbugs aren’t indestructible. It’s true that they’re highly resistant to pesticides, and according to some sources, they can live a year without food and 18 months without oxygen. But one thing that does reliably kill bedbugs is heat, and furthermore, bedbugs can be squashed. In the unlikely event that a bedbug crawled onto a mattress in a factory, it probably wouldn’t survive as the mattress is compressed with giant rollers, wrapped in multiple layers of shrink wrap (which requires heat to shrink the shrink wrap), stored in a non-climate-controlled warehouse, shipped in the non-climate-controlled hold of a cargo ship, etc.5. Bedbug nymphs require a blood meal to progress from one stage of development to the next. Even if a bedbug got onto a mattress in the factory (unlikely, because they don’t know what a mattress is), survived the packaging process (unlikely), and laid eggs inside the packaging (only possible if this specific bedbug is a pregnant female), you wouldn’t end up with a mattress crawling with bedbugs. Without anything to eat, the nymphs would not develop. (And no, these hypothetical bedbugs inside the packaging couldn\'t survive by eating each other. The only thing bedbugs eat is mammalian blood.)6. A bug on your bed isn\'t automatically a bedbug. Bedbugs are a specific species of insect. Walking across a bed doesn\'t make any other kind of bug a bedbug, any more than walking across a cow pasture would make you a cow. (I bring this point up because I\'ve looked at a number of photos of supposed bedbugs posted by other reviewers. Only one photo clearly showed a bug, and that bug was the wrong shape to be a bedbug.) It\'s possible for a bug to get into a warehouse or delivery truck and hide in a crevice of your package. It\'s also possible for a bug to get in through your open door while you\'re bringing your package inside, or for a bug that was already in your house to come out while you\'re unpackaging your mattress, and end up on your new mattress just because it\'s there. But none of these scenarios necessarily means that you have bedbugs. Granted, you probably don\'t want any bug of any species in your bed. However, bedbugs are particularly bad news because they will bite you and they\'re very hard to get rid of. But odds are that any other bug on your bed is something harmless that you can just vacuum up and forget about.7. If you buy a new factory-sealed mattress and later notice bedbugs in your home, that doesn’t prove that the bedbugs came from the mattress. Bedbugs can get into a home in any number of ways. Live in an apartment building? The bedbugs may have crawled through the walls from a neighboring apartment. Slept in a hotel or at someone else\'s house lately? You may have brought bedbugs home from there. Had overnight guests? They may have brought the bedbugs with them. Bought any used furniture, even if it wasn\'t bedroom furniture? It may have had bedbugs hiding in the cracks. Used public transportation? You may have picked up a bedbug that was hiding in the seat upholstery. And so on. Furthermore, a bedbug infestation in a home can start with just one pregnant female bedbug, but bedbugs reproduce slowly by insect standards, so it could take weeks or months for the infestation to get big enough to notice. So by the time you realize you have bedbugs, they\'ve probably been there for quite a while and it\'s likely impossible to trace where they came from. But a brand-new sealed mattress is about the least likely source. (And by the way, bedbugs don\'t come from bad hygiene or unsanitary living conditions. Bedbugs aren\'t attracted by dirt or garbage or smells; they\'re attracted by people who breathe, which is, last time I checked, everybody. So the cleanest person in the most spotlessly neat home can get bedbugs just as fast as the smelliest slob who never washes his sheets, because both the clean person and the smelly slob breathe.)8. If, in spite of everything I just said, you’re still feeling paranoid about bedbugs, there’s a simple precaution you can take. Buy a zippered mattress cover that’s labeled “dust mite proof,” and as soon as you’ve unpackaged the mattress, zip it up in the cover and just keep it in the cover. (Bedbugs are bigger than dust mites, so anything that\'s impervious to dust mites is also impervious to bedbugs. And no, bedbugs can’t chew through a mattress cover. Their mouth parts are designed only for sucking blood, not chewing.) Also, if you have enough floor space, you can quarantine your new mattress for a few days. Lay it out on the floor where it’s not touching any walls or furniture and stick strips of double-sided tape to the floor all the way around it. In the almost impossible event that a bedbug comes crawling out of the mattress, it will get stuck in the tape and eventually die.In short, if you buy this mattress, you\'re not going to get any unwanted guests with it. (Well, let me rephrase that statement: you won\'t get any unwanted guests in the form of bedbugs. I can\'t make any guarantees about annoying relatives who invite themselves over.) So let\'s move on to a review of the mattress itself. Short version: It\'s okay, but I\'m not hugely impressed. Longer version:COMFORT/SUPPORT: I don\'t find this mattress supportive enough. Especially if I sleep on my stomach, I can feel my hips sagging into the mattress, which leads to a backache. Admittedly, I\'m a full-size adult who weighs, well, let\'s just say more than 150 pounds, so I may just be too heavy for an eight-inch twin mattress. (Still, the equally thin, cheapo inner-spring mattress I had before this one worked fine for years, so I suspect the problem is this mattress, not me.) If you\'re a heavier adult and/or prone to backaches, this may not be the mattress for you, especially not the eight-inch version. Also, the sides of the mattress are not reinforced, so if you sit on the edge of the bed, you\'ll sink down all the way to the box springs. You essentially have to hoist yourself out of a hole to get out of bed, so if you have difficulty standing up from a sitting position, this is not the ideal mattress for you.APPEARANCE: My mattress never fully expanded after it was unpackaged. The center reached a full eight inches, but the corners did not. The smashed-down corners don\'t really affect the usability of the mattress, but they do make it look oddly saggy and lumpy.SMELL: I didn\'t notice any bothersome smell. I could detect a faint scent when the mattress was brand new and I laid face-down on it without a sheet, but once I put sheets on, I no longer noticed it.NOISE: The springs squawk loudly when I\'m getting into or out of bed. However, they\'re loudest when my weight is concentrated in one spot. When I\'m lying down with my weight more widely distributed, the springs make very little noise when I roll over.DURABILITY: I\'ve only had this mattress a few months, so I don\'t know about long-term durability. However, the fabric top of the mattress is already starting to pill. As already noted, the sides of the mattress aren\'t reinforced. Also, the top is a cotton-like fabric that\'s not waterproof or water-resistant, which means that it will stain. If your child spills a juice box on the bed (to say nothing of more gross scenarios), you may be able to wipe away some of the stain with a wet washcloth, but the ghost of the stain will be there approximately forever. I don\'t think this mattress will hold up to long-term use.So, should you buy this mattress? If you need a cheap mattress delivered to your door in a small box in a hurry, then this is probably an acceptable option. And no, you\'re not going to get any bedbugs as a free bonus. But don\'t expect top-quality comfort or durability, because you\'re likely not going to get them either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bought it for my elderly mother', 'author': 'jennifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'She needed something with a decent firmness and extra support on the sides so she wouldn’t slip off like she would with her last full memory foam mattress. I would say out of all the mattresses I’ve had this Green gel memory foam 12” Queen size Mattress is thee best one hands down. And I will definitely be purchasing for my family members.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Most comfortable mattress I've ever owned", 'author': 'Joe Fangohr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the Zinus 8 Inch Gel-Infused Green Tea Memory Foam Mattress / Cooling Gel Foam / Pressure Relieving / CertiPUR-US Certified / Bed-in-a-Box, Queen size. It has three different layers of foam and is not a hybrid model. First is the 4.5" high-density base support foam, next is the 1.5" comfort foam, and on top is the 2" gel-infused memory foam. This is the first foam mattress I\'ve ever owned, and I\'ll never go back to using the old box spring mattresses I\'ve had all my life. The first night I slept on it with only a single sheet covering over the mattress and I was stunned by how nice and comfortable it feels compared to everything I\'ve ever slept on before. The second day I installed the SafeRest Queen Size Premium Hypoallergenic Waterproof Mattress Protector, which is quite thin as it\'s a mattress protector and not a mattress "pad." I noticed no difference in how it feels in any way with this addition after using the bed all day and sleeping for 8 hours the second night. I believe it\'s so comfortable because of how your body sinks down into the foam slightly which supports your mass more uniformly than other surfaces \u200bcan. Don\'t get me wrong about this, it\'s still a quite firm mattress so it\'s not like you sink way down into it. I wish there was some way I could better express just how much I love my new Zinus mattress!!! This is like sleeping on a cloud! I\'ve read some negative reviews about people who\'ve removed the cover that comes on the mattress to wash it or for whatever reason and then went nuts complaining about loose fiberglass fragments they encountered afterward. I believe the tiny amount of fiberglass material built into the cover is part of the fire-retardant material that makes up the cover. I also believe the warning the manufacturer gives about not removing the cover is their way of being over-cautious about the possibility of customers coming into contact with fiberglass fibers if they do so, and anyone who has removed the cover has NO ONE TO BLAME BUT THEMSELVES for any problems they encounter for failing to follow the manufacturers instructions. I haven\'t removed the cover on mine but I did open the zipper about 12" so that I could stick my bare forearm inside and rub it around to see for myself if there really was loose fiberglass fiber but I didn\'t notice any indication of this at all. My recommendation if you ever feel the need to remove the cover to wash it or whatever is remove the cover, deflate the air out of it and then CLOSE the zipper (without turning it inside out) and then arrange it around the center post of your washing machine. This will ensure the inside and outside of the cover won\'t come into contact with each other. Wash on a delicate setting, no bleach, then after removing it from the washing machine don\'t put it in the dryer, just lay it out on the floor to dry before putting it back on. The first picture was taken just 5 minutes after removing the mattress from the box and it\'s a full 7". 36 hours later it had expanded to the full 8" as can be seen in the second picture. After about 36 hours it was fully expanded and was very smooth and flat with square edges, and it looks almost perfect in every way. I have no idea how long this mattress might last, but after paying only $200 plus $18 in sales tax with free shipping it\'s easy and cheap enough to replace. I\'m still using my old bottom box frame but since the distance between the support slats is a full 6" on my old base, I show in the third picture how I installed (with a few screws) some pieces of 1/4" plywood to the top of it for better support for the foam mattress. I simply bought and installed 3 pieces of 1/4" plywood at 24" x 48". I needed to cut the width of one piece for the foot end of the bed down 4" so that the plywood would break over the supports slat of the old box base. If you choose to follow my example you may need to modify this to some extent depending on the spacing of the support slats of your base.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Measurements', 'author': 'Sharon R', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'For starters, it has been over 2 days now and it\'s still not "fully" expanded. The one that isn\'t is still curving down, and it\'s of course missing some inches to it.I already wrestled it and bent it the opposite way (it helped) so the corners can straightened. title: King Size Mattress - Upgrade Strengthen - 12 Inch Hybrid King Mattress in a Box, Mattress King Size with High density Memory Foam and Independent Pocket Springs, Strong Edge Support,Firm
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm and soft at the same time', 'author': 'Tessa N. Denham', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this because my husband and I have been sleeping on a hand-me-down mattress for nearly 10 years and it was really bad on his back. He has some disc compression and his doctor recommended a medium firm to firm innerspring mattress with a memory foam top or mattress topper if we needed it to keep from getting sore on pressure points while we slept. This mattress just fit the bill (in more ways than one because of the great price). My husband is nearly 6\'5" and weighs around 270. I have noticed him moving around so much less when he sleeps than he did on our old bed. When he does move around or just gets in or out of bed, I don\'t get bounced around like in our old bed because the springs are individual. The springs also keep him from creating a deep depression in the mattress that makes me have to fight all night against sliding into the hole. The memory foam layer is soft enough and thick enough to relieve pressure but thin enough to not negate the support of the more firm innerspring foundation. We had been using a 4 inch thick firm memory foam mattress topper on our old innerspring for the last 3 or 4 years. It was much better than without it, but created problems this one doesn\'t. The thicker foam compresses more and more as the night goes on and can leave us feeling like we\'re sleeping in a hole. It\'s actually alot harder to move around on that thick foam and I found myself waking up to change positions because it took a little too much effort to sleep through. And since there was no edge support, I\'d just slide off if I sat on the mattress close to the edge, or I\'d just feel like I was fighting sliding off when laying down close to the edge because of the slant created by my own weight. (I\'m smaller than the average female btw, but that was still a problem). None of those problems occur with the mattress. It seems to be the ideal thickness and firmness for us, and the edges are nicely supported while still being soft enough to not be uncomfortable while sitting on the edge of the bed. We\'ve been sleeping on it for almost a week, and he\'s still so much more comfortable while sleeping and when he wakes up in the morning. In the past, when we\'ve stayed in hotels or been guests in someone else\'s home, even if the bed seemed more comfortable at first, new problems would start to reveal themselves by about night 3, and he\'d start feeling discomfort somewhere else in his back or neck. Even if a mattress was better on the area that our home mattress irritated, it would end up causing discomfort in some other way. So far, this new mattress has remained comfortable for him longer than any other. I\'ll update if that changes. The mattress can be rotates head to foot, but not flipped be a the top is different than the bottom. We will rotate it regularly because of our size difference to try to keep the wear as even as possible. If it doesn\'t wear well or we become less happy with it, I\'ll update my review. So far I would recommend this mattress to anyone needing or wanting this type of support, especially if they have a smaller budget.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect mattress for the price!', 'author': 'Caity', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the Queen size 12inch and it is a great bang for your buck! Burns', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I let mine set up for about 60 hours before I slept on it. It’s really comfortable! I was surprised. It’s firm but the top layer is soft. Best nights sleep I’ve had in a while! For the price, you can’t go wrong.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not a Hybrid Mattress.', 'author': 'Gen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is absolutely not a hybrid mattress. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for our sleep needs in 2017 Riverside Retro trailer.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great support and comfort in a 5 inch mattress. Even without articulated corners this Lucid queen short works well in our Riverside Retro 177SE. Bed is easier to make and accessing the hinged-lid storage compartment underneath is easier.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress for guest bed or toddler!', 'author': 'Kristin Lynn Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this as my 2.5year olds first big boy bed. Is perfect size, stiffness, and comfort for a toddler. Would recommend and purchase again.It is thin, but it’s the size it shows when purchasing. If you’re in need of a thin but comfortable and reasonably priced bed... this is it.Not sure on what the mattress is made of, or if it is made of what the description says, but it’s still a great mattress.UPDATE: 4/27/2021 - this mattress is amazing. Fits perfectly in the bed frame I had made for my son. He slept amazing on it last night! Absolutely love! See last 2 images!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for my bad back', 'author': 'Kaleem Z. Khwaja', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Like many of my fellow bipedal hominids of a certain age, I\'ve developed a degenerated lumbar disc and, being a side sleeper, have found I need a very firm mattress to keep my spine from bending and pinching through the night. I\'m taking the time to write this up in hopes it\'s of use to others with bad backs struggling to find a good night sleep and eliminate the source of their pain.My lower back pain was getting progressively worse for several years until I realized the problem might be the "firm" $2K mattress I was sleeping on. I went camping for a week, sleeping on just a 2" memory foam topper on the ground; pain started to subside immediately. I\'ve since tried out a couple other "firm" mattresses in the $2-3K range and have come to the opinion that there\'s no such thing as a mattress that is both thick and also firm. The more material you add, the more sag you\'re going to get. Period. Companies would obviously rather sell you a thicker, more expensive mattress, but if you want a truly firm mattress it must be thin.This LUCID mattress is unusually firm; firmer than I had expected and firmer than I had even hoped for. It\'s definitely not as plush as thicker options. But it is GREAT for my back, and starting the day pain-free is the most important thing. It was a little too firm for my partner, so we added a 1" latex topper which is nearly as supportive and quite a bit more comfortable. I would recommend this combo.The only setup I\'ve found that is better for my back is the aforementioned firm 2" memory foam mattress topper right on the floor. That\'s the setup I use for car camping and I never sleep better than on one of those. It\'s perfect in terms of both support and comfort, at least for me @ 5\'8", 150lb. The downside is I\'ve found those toppers only last a couple years of daily use before softening to the point your hips start to feel the ground beneath. If you try the topper-only strategy, make sure it\'s high-density as they\'re not all the same. I got mine at Costco.The reason I gave this item 4 stars instead of 5 is that they obnoxiously list it as 60x80" (true queen) but both the box and tag list its true size, which is 59"x79". So the description is misleading (perhaps even deliberately so, as getting those numbers right would have been a trivial task). I\'d rather pay 3% more for a mattress that fits both my bed frame and my sheets. 1" matters when you\'re sharing a queen. I ended up returning the mattress for this reason alone despite it otherwise being a keeper.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Finally, A Full Night's Sleep", 'author': 'P. Thompson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this during Prime Day to replace a couple of foam toppers I have been using on a hand-me-down traditional full mattress and box springs set that is still too hard for my taste despite being broken down. The two toppers were about 5 inches total of just "memory foam" and weren\'t really getting the job done. I am 62, overweight, and have arthritis in many joints, including my hips. I sleep mainly on my left side but at times, my left hip would hurt and I would end up on my back during the night. This caused my back to hurt and my legs to go numb. Not to mention apnea episodes with multiple wakings during the night.To be honest, I really didn\'t pay much attention to the inches and just saw the good price - got mine for a lot less than what it\'s going for now. When I got it and saw that it was only 5 inches, I worried. Especially when I read on the company website that it was designed to transition kids from the crib to a full size bed. I was afraid it wouldn\'t be firm enough to give the support I needed. Happy to say that assessment was very, very wrong.I got it out of the box at around 11:00 am and it was fully decompressed by the time I was ready for bed 12 hours later. There was no strong smell that I could detect and I am very sensitive to smells. It\'s firm enough to keep my hip from hitting bottom yet cushy enough to keep me pain free. I woke up on my side, exactly as I had gone to sleep. Basically, I slept like a rock and woke up feeling a lot better than I usually do.I would definitely recommend this mattress if you are looking for a replacement. However, considering how the full mattress is suddenly going for more than twice what I paid for mine during Prime Day, you might want to check around for a better price if you\'re looking for a full.By the way, this mattress works just fine atop a traditional mattress and box springs. I even have another foam topper between the older mattress and this new one but only because it would have been a royal pain to have gotten rid of the topper first.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for the camper, comfortable', 'author': 'Tallie365', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was skeptical because I always thought memory foam was hot and squishy. This mattress is wonderful. It fits the short queen camper bed perfectly. No sags or dips! Firm enough to get in and out of an awkward space. Very comfortable at just 5 inches! I wish we would have bought it sooner. Came in a nice cover. Expanded into shape in just a few hours. We bought 2 for two queen beds in the camper, one is a rear slide out. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great “thin” mattress', 'author': 'Stephanie Joyce', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We got our kiddo a loft bed and realized our current mattress was too thick/tall for the guard rails to be effective, this mattress is a great price and my kiddo says is comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Right amount of firmness but did not get to 5”', 'author': 'Joanne K', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I needed to add height to another foam mattress (instead of using a box spring) and was looking for something that was very firm and no-frills. I read all the other reviews, positive and negative and selected this mattress based on how firm it was. When I took it out of the box and cut through the plastic to let it expand, I could tell right away that it wasn’t going to expand as fast as other foam mattresses from other brands that I have purchased. I let the mattress sit flat on a bed I wasn’t using for a full 72 hours and the mattress never got past 4” deep. This is disappointing because I was looking for the advertised for 5” of height.That said, 4” is close enough for me to use and not deal with the hassle of returning it. I would only recommend this for purchase if you can live with less than 5” and prefer a firm mattress.Pro:It is very firmNot made with fiberglassNo strong odorCon:Did not reach 5” as advertised and labeled on the ad, box and mattress cover', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for bunk beds', 'author': 'Ashley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We use this for our daughter’s bunk bed, she like and it is comfy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Firm mattress', 'author': 'Kyle', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This firmness is perfect 👌. I have been apprehensive to get a gel memory foam bed because I have lots of pillows with this description and they all lose the firmness. We will see how this holds up. I'm impressed. It is strange that the mattress is 5 inches wide. Not sure I like that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Thin Mattress for Platform Frame.', 'author': 'john', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It Suits My Needs. title: Queen Mattress, 10-inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress, Medium-Firm Queen Mattress in a Box for Pressure Relief & Support, Breathable Cooling Queen Size Mattress with Zippered Cover
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress at a great price', 'author': 'Jennifer B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently updated a spare bedroom and decided to finish it off with a new bed frame and a new mattress. This mattress is firm and forms to your body and is still supportive. I am not sure how well it would do if you are a "Firm" mattress-only person, but if you like a padded feel and are a side sleeper, I fully recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A MUST-HAVE for side sleepers!!!', 'author': 'Laura Ann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress topper is insanely comfortable!! I had purchased one of those bed-in-a-box mattresses about 2 years ago and never really loved it. I sleep on my right side all of the time, and I was getting very bad muscle spasms on my left side. I was actually sleeping with a heating pad draped over my side to try and at least limit the spasms as best I could. I assumed it was from sleeping in the same position night after night. Then I researched it and found that side sleepers like me need a mattress that isn\'t too firm. So rather than buying a whole new mattress I purchased this topper. I unfurled it mid-morning and by bedtime it was ready to go. WOW!! Talk about an amazing night\'s sleep! Not just that but when I woke up my body wasn\'t sore at all, which was so welcome since I also suffer from very chronic back pain. It didn\'t solve my back pain since it\'s aggravated by other activities and by being tall, but when I lay on my bed now I just feel completely enveloped with comfort and relief. As for the pain in my side, that\'s almost completely gone already. I simply can\'t believe what a difference this 3" topper has made to my well being.As for the odor, my bed is made using a bamboo mattress pad, then a fitted sheet over that. After 5 days of sleeping on this I can still smell a very slight odor from the topper. I am hyper-sensitive to odors because I am a chronic migraine sufferer, so when I lay down my ears start to ring which is usually a sign a migraine is coming. But it hasn\'t yet caused a headache so to me the odor isn\'t enough to put me over the edge in that way. And I\'m assuming that over time even this slight odor will dissipate. Perhaps since I didn\'t air the topper out for the recommended 48 hours after opening it and I then encased it in both the mattress pad and fitted sheet that it may take a little more time for the off-gassing to cease.One thing I\'m thinking might happen is the topper may eventually bow in where I sleep but I can always turn it 180 degrees around, and then after it bows in again turn it over and continue to rotate it.I recommend you take a chance on this! I\'m not being paid for my review with any perks, it\'s my genuine opinion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very Good Mattress for the Price - And the Vendor Solved a Shipping Error Immediately', 'author': 'Chronic Buyer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "After reviewing dozens of foam mattress I decided to buy the Marsail Queen Mattress, 10-inch Gel Memory Foam product. In my mind the $189.99 product offered what I needed at a good price point. Their $159.99 product looked good also, but I decided to buy the more expensive one. As a bonus, the shipping was free. When the mattress arrived, I put it on the bed and checked it out. Upon close examination I found out it was the cheaper 2 foam layer version and not the more expensive 3 foam layer version that I had ordered. I found the packing list item number and checked it against the model number on the Amazon product pages. The item number shipped to me was in fact the less expensive mattress - not the more expensive mattress I paid for. The fulfillment center had shipped the wrong product.Now here is the interesting part and the quick solution by the vendor. I decided to to see if sending the wrong mattress back or just keeping the cheaper mattress made the most sense. I made a simple lay down test on the mattress to see if it would adjust to my size and weight and if I was comfortable enough and to my surprise the incorrect mattress seemed to be just fine for what I needed. After some exchanges with the vendor - with submitting pictures of the incorrect product number on the box - I asked the vendor to credit my account for the price difference for the cheaper mattress that was sent. The vendor immediately sent a refund back to my account. So don't be afraid to buy from the vendor of the Marsail Foam Queen Mattress product. I believe they will fix any issues that might pop up.In conclusion, the mattress that I kept is of good quality, is in fact medium firm, but has enough give in the top foam layer of foam to be comfortable for my size and weight and hopefully lasts a good long time. At this price point, I consider it a bargain. Add the very good customer support and It's all good for me. I rated this four stars based on the quality vs price of the product and vendor solution for the shipping error. The vendor response and quick refund for the shipping error is actually five stars, but there is no way for me to list that separately. I believe the more expensive mattress would have been a five star mattress for me, but the four star less expensive version is just fine for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for a bunk bed', 'author': 'Stephanie Santucci', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased two of these mattresses for my grandchildren\'s bunk bed. I may need to add additional slats, but I don\'t think it\'s necessary. It is soft. When I lay on it (145 lbs., 5\'7" tall), it initially sinks but it feels wonderful. It\'s soft but supportive. I haven\'t slept on it (again for my grandbabies) but I will when the time is right. Very much worth the money!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable mattress but…', 'author': 'Rebekah', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'We’ve had the mattress for almost 2 months now. title: King Mattress, 12 Inch King Size Mattress in a Box, Medium Firm, (Upgrade Strengthen) Hybrid Mattress King Size, Ultimate Motion Isolation with Memory Foam and Pocket Spring, Strong Support
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced a $6,000 mattress', 'author': 'R. A. Maynard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So, about 3 years ago my wife and I were suckered into buying a $6,000 mattress at a retail mattress store. "We are going to spend a 3rd of our life on this thing - so it needs to be a really good one" was our thinking. Well, it *was* a really good mattress - it was just too soft. And after 3 years of use, it was even softer.... starting about 6 months ago, both of us were waking up with significant back pain every day. Then we went on vacation for a couple weeks and I noticed that both of our back pain went away. "It\'s our mattress!" I thought. I turned to Amazon and found this thing... and at this price - I thought, "I\'m gonna try it! - what do I have to lose?" Well, that was about 3 weeks ago.... and I am here to tell you, that this is NOT as nice as the $6,000 mattress - BUT IT IS PRETTY DANG NICE. And, most importantly, our back pain is gone. My wife says "there is no way this thing will last at that price" - and I say "WHO CARES!" if I have to buy a new one every year, it\'s still way cheaper than most mattresses! And I am pretty sure this will last longer than a year. It *is* well made and very comfortable. We did not wait the recommended 24 hours or 36 hours or whatever, we opened it and waited about an hour. Put the bedding on.... and hit the sack! We\'ve been sleeping great ever since. Really. It\'s a great mattress, don\'t let the low cost fool you.IMPORTANT NOTE: MY WIFE AND I ARE BOTH 165 LBS OR LESS. So... if you are "big" - your mileage may vary.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Didn't expand the whole way. Lacks foam.", 'author': 'Gregarious Geek', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Update: The seller was quick to respond to me. They told me to measure the height from the middle of the bed rather than the edges. I haven't been able to do that because my bed been set up and covered with a padded mattress protector since I got it. They offered to send me a foam topper if I still had an issue.I bought this mattress because I had a memory foam mattress previously that was just too hot and firm for me. This mattress sleeps much cooler! I don't wake up in a sweat.The springs are good and provide nice support. I used to wake up with stiff or painful hips/lower back. That is significantly better too.I didn't think I would recommend this bed at all. But it's actually quite nice. Especially for the price.Previous review: I got this product 3.5 days ago. I opened the package within 2 hrs of its delivery. I allowed 72 hrs for it to expand. I ordered the 12in mattress so it would have more cushion and be less firm than the 10 in. It expanded to 11 inches at most. The information included in the package says the product may very up to 1.5inches, which seems like alot.The springs go all the way to the top. The picture led me to believe that the springs would stop at the first seam and would have a good layer foam on top of that. The foam is very thin. This is essentially a spring mattress. Not a hybrid mattress.I have yet to sleep on it, since I was letting it expand, but it feels very firm and lacks padding to soften the spring pressure.I will be contacting the seller as soon as I figure out how.I will update after I sleep on it and get more information from the seller.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE IT', 'author': 'Shanice Lewis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I let it expand fully for 2-3 days, it went to the full 12 inches.Careful not to poke a hole when opening the packaging.It’s super soft and firm at the same time. title: 10 Inch Support Plus Pocket Spring Hybrid Mattress, Extra Firm Feel, Heavier Coils for Durable Support, Pocket Innersprings for Motion Isolation, Mattress-in-a-Box, Full, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Zinus extra firm 12 inch', 'author': 'brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Outstanding bed. I did research and going back and forth for months and I’m glad I went with the zinus extra firm. It is extremely firm but still cushioned due to the springs but it’s definitely a much better sleep now than I’ve had in the past. I definitely recommend this mattress It’s a high quality mattress for such a low price, it’s better feeling and quality than some of the $1500 mattress I tested. If you’re thinking about it just do it don’t hesitate', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Firm Mattress- Good Price, High Quality- Worth the Expense', 'author': '@leighttweets', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Short version: My wife and I have had this mattress for over a year now and can say with confidence that it was an excellent purchase- it is still firm and has no sags or dips. I highly recommend it.I have held off on writing a review for this mattress because I felt it was necessary to sleep on it for an extended period of time to give it the most fair and accurate review. My wife and I purchased this mattress over a year ago, in November 2017.After going to all the local stores, from big box to mom and pop, my wife and I found ourselves with a problem: we could tell which mattresses were soft and which were firm, but aside from that we didn\'t really feel much difference apart from the price tag- almost all of which exceeded a thousand dollars, with some approaching two grand. That\'s quite an outlay of cash.So, going off reviews on Amazon we took the leap on this Zinus Extra Firm iCoil 12 inch king mattress. We also purchased a steel foundation upon which to set the mattress in our bed frame. The box arrived a little beat up, but my wife and I muscled it into the house and carried it upstairs together. It\'s a two person job, but not impossible. We set the rolled up mattress on our guest bed and carefully cut away the plastic so the bed would unroll. (Pro tip: Don\'t stand between the mattress and the wall. You might get pinched) We followed the directions and let the mattress sit undisturbed for 2 or 3 days so it could fully expand. After which time, we moved it into our bedroom.It\'s now more than one year on and I feel qualified to report on the mattress. It is firm, but not rock hard. This is obviously subjective, so all I can say is that you know a firm mattress when you lay on one, and this is a firm mattress but is still comfortable. I\'m a side and stomach sleeper, and my wife is a back sleeper. I\'m 5\'11", 230lbs, and we\'ll just say that my wife is plus sized and leave it at that. The mattress supports both of us fine, and a year later has no depressions, dips, sags or problem areas. The last time I did laundry I snapped some photos of the mattress which I have posted above. You\'ll notice the mattress is still even and flat, even after a year of nightly use.I purchased this mattress myself, with my own money, have no relationship with the manufacturer, and am receiving nothing in return for writing this review. I just know how difficult it is take the leap of purchasing something like this over the internet, so I thought I\'d write a review to help people in a similar situation my wife and I found ourselves in last year.This mattress was an excellent purchase, I\'ve recommended it to friends, and if you\'re in the market for a fairly priced firm mattress, I can recommend it to you as well. Cheers.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Firm bed and comfortable', 'author': 'cindy hernandez', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Very beautiful firm bed while being comfortable my have one and now my mom bought a king size love it I had my thought took my time looking for a queen bed I like this bed a lot I wait 190 and my husband 150 it does not sink sturdy try it out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars True to firmness and won’t sag!', 'author': 'Karole', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this in size twin a year ago because I was living in a small room. It was indeed extra firm so I bought a topper and I figured because of the low price it wouldn’t last long. I’ve bought IKEA mattresses (around the same budget) and within 3 months there was sagging/ sinking so I expected to get the same quality but nope. Had this bed for a year and NEVER sagged! Firmness stayed intact and looks like a luxury mattress! Win win.Fast forward a year later, I moved into a bigger place and could buy a bigger mattress so I decided to give away this twin one and spurge on a more expensive mattress. What a mistake that was! I tried the purple ($1100), the winkbed firmest option ( $1300) and both mattress I would sink in and be sleeping in the mattress versus on top. The purple I kind of expected it because it isn’t advertised as firm but I was intrigued by trying a new material. My friend has the purple and loves it but he likes medium firmness. So nothing against Purple, their customer service was fantastic! The mattress has a very interesting feeling when sleeping on it. They do have other more expensive options and their customer service is great so I’d definitely recommend them. Now as for Winkbed, stay away! With their advertised “firmer mattress” I was sinking in as soon as getting it, I waited days hoping it just hadn’t decompress and nope, it has gotten worse. So bad that I’m taking painkillers everyday to deal with the body aches of sleeping inside the mattress. The company although they advertise a “say nothing and get a refund” I have been emailing them explaining my situation for days, and they have yet to process a refund. They give me copy-and-paste like responses that have nothing to do with my issues like saying it will get softer in time when I’m not saying it is hard, I’m saying I’m sinking in. So how will it getting softer help me? So my experience with Winkbed customer service have been awful. No empathy, no responsibility (think they sent a defective mattress), and not keeping to their word. Also, I tried to leave a review on their website and you can’t. So makes me wonder who can leave reviews on their site? Anywho, stay away.After two failed “splurge” mattress purchases and one awful customer service experience (Winkbed), I decided to go back to the bed that was truly firm! Sometimes the “you pay what you get for” isn’t true. I got a way better, true to firmness, no sagging price at 1/4 of the cost with this mattress!Save yourself money, if you need a true firm mattress, and get this mattress.Recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I replaced a $1000 name branded 18 inch deep mattress with this.', 'author': 'tlcstat', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My wife had two complete Knee replacement in three months. She is doing just fine but the very moment she got on our $1000 18 inch deep mattress she would have severe pain and would need to medicate just to get any sleep at all. Long story short I replaced that mattress with this bed-in-a-box and she has had a great sleep pattern from the first moment it was unraveled. This bed is very/extremely firm but has two inches of memory foam on top of that eight inches of HD springs. When I am sleeping, I don't even know she is there. I am personally sleeping so well I don't even want to get out of bed in the morning. FYI the instructions say to give it (the mattress) 72 hours to fully expand, or whatever it is supposed to do after unrolling. For me this mattress was and is perfect from the very first moment. For my wife it was and is perfect from the very first moment. So I can't actually tell you what that first 72 hours is supposed to be like other than perfect. If it is full body support, isolation from another person that may be sleeping, a very comfortable foam top, a ridiculous low price, a fast delivery, and a easy install that you are looking for, this mattress might just do the job. Otherwise I suggest the $1000 18 inch mattress instead. It was actually pretty good until my wife had her surgery.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent mattress. Very comfortable and affordable.', 'author': 'kwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After reading thousands of reviews and shopping the local stores I decided to give this one a try. I liked that this one was climate pledge friendly and didn’t smell like chemicals when we opened it. We purchased for our guest room and didn’t want to break the bank either. We went with the 12inch support plus extra firm after reading several reviews about other ones being too soft. This mattress is the best of both worlds. It’s very supportive with a softer top. I concur with other reviews that when you sit on the edges that it doesn’t offer great support but when laying on it it’s perfect. This first picture was right out of the box before it had expanded fully. We allowed it to sit for 4 days before fully dressing the bed. Ours is on an 18in bed frame also purchased from Amazon as we wanted storage space under. The second picture is once it was made up. It took a 21inch bed skirt to hide the space underneath as it’s tall once you add the mattress to a 18 inch frame but we are very happy with this purchase and would buy this brand again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's only been four nights but WOW! Review September 2017 with follow up April 2021 at the end.", 'author': 'Jan H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Eighteen months ago due to severe spinal stenosis I gave up my once awesome but currently sagging 20 year old beauty rest mattress in favor of sleeping directly on my board like box springs with a mattress topper. For a while it helped but at 68 years old I finally realized I needed at least a little bit of cushion or give. After reviewing pretty much every mattress on the planet for the last six months I decided on an inexpensive bed in a box type of mattress. I didn't want to spend a lot in case it didn't work out. I have had coil spring mattresses for over 60 years so I decided to stick with that familiar feel. However, I definitely needed the firmest mattress I could find… a step above the wooden board I had been sleeping on. Last Monday, July 28th I ordered the Zinus performance plus extra firm 10 inch queen mattress. I received it three days later on Thursday shipped from Amazon. It came in a long box about 90 pounds. I maneuvered it from the porch on its end all the way to my bedroom. Not too bad for a 68 year old woman with a bad back! I set it on the bed and unpacked it with no problem. I slowly cut the wrapper off as instructed and the mattress immediately started inflating and expanding. The smell was very mild and reminded me of dried hay. 10 hours later when I went to bed the smell was completely gone. Before I made up the bed I laid on the mattress for a few minutes to test the firmness. It is very firm but with that tiny bit of give that you get from a spring mattress. Since the 10 inch style has very little padding on top of the springs I decided to use my 3 inch Novafirm gel memory foam topper from Costco. If I was a little younger and not so sore I probably wouldn't need it. I also have a very nice bamboo made in the USA mattress pad that I'm using on top of that. Now the results. These last four nights I feel like I died and went to heaven! I have not slept this well in over two years. I feel like I am sleeping in a $2000 bed! I am not waking up six or seven times a night and it is sooo comfortable. Can't tell you how grateful I am to have found this bed and at such a good price. I was so apprehensive about this purchase and am so relieved and happy about the results! I know this was a very long review but I wanted all of you out there to have enough information in one review to help you make a decision. Also you already know my age but I am 5 foot four and 168 pounds if that helps. Also if you buy the bed directly from Amazon it comes a bit faster. Amazon prime got it to me in 3 days but I had to pay $20 tax. If you order it from Amazon and pick vendor Sleep Revolution( which is like the store front of Zinus) to order it from it takes about 7 to14 days and you don't pay tax. But I wanted it really fast. I just want to end this review with a huge thank you to Zinus for making a product that has so vastly improved the quality of my life!!................... Today is April 21, 2021 and it has been about 3 1/2 years since I bought this wonderful mattress. A lot of times you will see a review for a product and then never hear from that consumer again. But I love this bed so much I felt I should offer a follow up. First of all this mattress is in exactly the same shape as when it was new. I can detect no wear of any kind or any sagging. I am now 72 years old and still have my back issues but I have never slept so well in any other bed that I have owned. I still can’t believe that I paid less than $250 for a “bed in a box” coil spring mattress of this quality. I own the 10 inch mattress and as I stated I at first used a 3 inch memory foam topper but I ended up getting rid of it because foam is just too hot for me. Besides the top of this bed is soft enough even though the mattress is super firm and I use a bamboo USA made plush mattress pad cover which is perfect. This combination allows the mattress to breathe and the whole sleeping experience is cool and comfortable rather than hot and suffocating. I think the problem with foam is your body heat does not dissipate very well and I am a very hot sleeper. So in closing I will just say this. This mattress is worth every penny. If you are looking for a very firm bed that is really comfortable and sleeps cool look no further. I hope this follow up review is helpful.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Skeptical at first, FIRM BELIEVER now!! Hope to order another one in 12 months!', 'author': 'Liz G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I WAS RELUCTANT AT FIRST! I am going to write an unusual review. When we first took the mattress out of the bed and I lay down on it, my first thought was, "Oh NO! What have I done? This mattress is like laying on a padded brick." It took less then 24 hours for the memory foam to completely fluff up. So I gave it another day. And another. It was just SO FIRM! My old bed was like a soft billowy cloud that just wrapped around you. So I called Amazon to check on their return policy. They told me to wait a week and see how I felt, and then we could initiate the return process. I AM SO GLAD I WAITED! I now LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this bed!! Here\'s why: I SLEEP LIKE A BABY THAT SLEEPS THROUGH THE NIGHT! I have never slept so good in my whole life! I didn\'t realize it until about 2 weeks went by. I realized, I\'m not getting up at night to briefly check the alarm clock time, go to the bathroom etc. No. It is literally a SLEEP MAGNET! I lie down on it, and 5 minutes later, I\'m out cold! No more tossing and turning to fall asleep. NO MORE INSOMNIA! I find I am sleeping about exactly 7 hours straight without waking up once.I don\'t even notice if my husband is beside me in the bed or not. If he moves, I am not aware at all. Even though I was sleeping great,for two weeks I just couldn\'t seem to part with our old mattress. I kept having doubts like, "but what if it is just a bit TOO firm? Will I regret tossing our old mattress?" (It was still in our hall. I know I sound like Goldilocks here, but to be absolutely certain we could trash our old mattress once and for all, I took this mattress off, put it in the hall where our old one was, and put the old one back on. The next two nights were the worse sleep nights of my life.Though my old bed is like falling into a fluffy hammock, I realize now that I have not slept hardly at all for years! No telling how many times I wake up at night! So I switched back again to the Zinus mattress. And I also went ahead and shelled out a little bit more money and added an extra layer of padding with a Sleep Innovations 4-Inch Dual Layer Mattress Topper - Gel Memory Foam and Plush Fiber also found on Amazon ($184.10). That made the bed absolutely PERFECT. Very firm support, but a soft topper. If you have bad back issues, or trouble sleeping this bed is for you! It may be a bit of an adjustment at first, but wait a few days, or add just one more layer of foam as we did. In fact at first, my back was just slightly sore, but that\'s because it was used to being curved like the letter "C" at night. Now every part of my spine is firmly supported, and zero pain anywhere. I am 51 yo, and wake up feeling refreshed. My bed is also on platform risers, and because the bed is perfectly FLAT, it doubles as a workspace (wrapped all our Christmas presents on it). It\'s easy to fold laundry, etc. because it is firm and perfect height. We both love this bed so much, I hope by next Christmas to replace our Queen size bed in the other bedroom. My 11 yo son loves it too, and now he wishes he could have one too. Conclusion: It may seem to firm at first, but give it a few days. Your body may be readjusting. Now I realize it\'s the best bed we ever bought! The price is totally reasonable and so convenient having it delivered to your door! PS -- This mattress also has individually wrapped coils, so you don\'t have to worry about springs going bad and that adds to it\'s firmness. I think next time, we may try the green tea 10" memory foam only (no springs) as it reviews as being firm, but probably slightly less than this one. Still, I am a converted believer now in this firm bed.Last thoughts: HOTEL OWNERS/MANAGERS should order these beds! With concern over bedbugs etc., stains etc., these beds are so reasonably priced, you could afford to replace mattresses several times a year if necessary. They are perfect on either platform or boxsprings too. Zinus 12 Inch Performance Plus / Extra Firm Spring Mattress,\xa0King', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy older couple, back issues, love!', 'author': 'alvord13', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have almost never slept on a mattress I find comfortable, as most feel like I’m sagging too much in my hips. Partner and I are each 200-250 lb and 50 & 60 years old. I LOVE this mattress! Bought it to sleep at my brother’s when helping with new baby- his wife liked it so much she bought one for their bed. Now partner and I looking to get for our home bed as our foam bed starting to cause hip and shoulder pain.To me, the firmness is amazing and perfect. I feel like my back is straight, but the cushion on top makes it feel soft and comfortable.We’ve had the original full size around a year and SIL sleeps on it most nights (she’s 150 lb and sleeping solo).I expect it won’t last as long as expensive beds but if we can get more than 5 years about of it I’ll be happy.Saw a video review here saying it’s started sagging after very short use…the video is a hand pushing on it, which is not at all related to how supportive a bed is. Thats just the top, cushiony part. So it’s hard to know if the bed is actually too soft/sagging or not.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Get this mattress!', 'author': 'Sleepers Delight', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don’t have one issue with this mattress! (14” is what I ordered) It’s amazing! I was hesitant to get a bed in a box as I need a firm mattress. Love this bed and recommend it to all my friends. One of the best I’ve ever bought. If you want it and are skeptical, just get it. I’m so glad I did and saved $1000 on more expensive mattresses.Note: it comes in a HEAVY box. So you may need two people to move it. I only had one flight of stairs and it was tough with one person but I managed. Took 18 hours to fully “inflate” after coming out of the shrink wrap and couldn’t be more pleased. Any odor I noticed quickly dissipated and found deep sheets here on Amazon that are also great. Happy sleeper!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I’m really pleased.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Satisfied!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I spent a lot of time reviewing a lot of beds. They are kinda soft, so keep that in mind if you’re looking for something more firm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress', 'author': 'Adam Sayer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have the queen 10in. I was on an all foam 8 to 10in mattress. This was way to firm and small as I am 75in tall. I am over weigh about 290 pounds and this mattress has helped with the back pain I have been experiencing for years. The comfort of the mattress also helps with my insomnia and the comfort (with my addons) put your right to sleep. I use a noiseless 100% waterproof matters topper and an egg foam topper. The foam this mattress used is not for those that are overweigh such as I. We also have put it on a 900pound metal frame. This is defiantly a buy; you will not be disappointed. My brother weight about 180 pound and loves the comfort. I recommend for any new/old mattress that you buy a noiseless 100% waterproof mattress to protect from late night spills. (side note" I rarely give 5 stars for any product as you milage will vary)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING MATTRESS BUY IT!!', 'author': 'Bonita-ma27', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wish I had the chance to make a video.
