title: Twin Mattress 12 Inch - Medium Firm Gel Memory Foam - Cooling Comfort Technology - 365-Night Trial - Forever Warranty ,White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'Ana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I went from a king to a twin bed. Searched for a while until I found this one. It came in a box right to my front door. I was able to bring it inside by myself, im 64 yrs old. It was easy to open and place on my bed frame. It was completely done fluffing up by bedtime. When I laid down on my bed it was soft, cradles your body. I loved it, but....when I went to turn around, I had some trouble. Your sunk into the mattress. Not sunk in like the mattress just swallowed you whole but with my bad back, it was tough trying to turn over. After giving the mattress 1 week for me to get use to it, I loved it. The only thing I do regret is not getting the mattress cover that keeps your body cool. I do get hot under the covers some nights which I never have done with spring mattresses. It's really good in the winter because it will keep you warm, but in the summer, you'll wish you got the mattress cover. I have no regrets buying this mattress other than the mattress cover. I will probably end up going back and getting it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfortable', 'author': 'Frank Walls', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mattress has been great so far! Box was pretty beat up when it arrived, but the mattress inside was all good. Opened it up and let it expand for about 24 hours. Had an incredible nights sleep the first night. I'm about 190lbs and the firmness is just right. I'm a side and stomach sleeper and this mattress has made a huge difference in comfort compared to my old box spring. I would have pretty bad neck and shoulder pain in the morning with my old box spring, that's gone now! Highly recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Needs time to fully "set", little side support', 'author': 'Daniel T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "what others have said is true; if you try to sleep on this the first night, you're going to be disappointed - it will be like sinking into a cloud. Very nice, but not ideal for sleeping. I had to let mine sit for a week before it became firm enough to sleep on - before that, I was very much considering returning it. Even now, there's little side support - so if you're trying to fit two larger framed people on one queen mattress, maybe go ahead and get the king size.It is very comfortable once given time, though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It took a lot of research to settle on Nectar and I’m not disappointed. I ordered a medium soft and I think that’s exactly what it is. It’s not too hard or too soft in my opinion. I’ve learned that you’re supposed to turn these type mattresses every six months which I didn’t know with my previous one so keep that in mind and it should last longer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not What We Hoped For-EDITED! It’s perfect!', 'author': 'Cori Hicks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We’ve had this mattress out for almost 72 hours with 2 nights of sleep. Was not impressed.#1 our mattress never went to its full size. Each corner was dented in and it caused the middle to be much higher than the rest of the bed.2. It advertised this mattress as a 6.5 between firmness and softness. We needed some sort of firmness so that I could breastfeed, yet be soft enough to be comfortable. I haven’t found firmness. After sitting (or applying too much pressure at pressure points of the body) I sink so far in that my MIDDLE BACK feels the mattress. This also makes it extremely hard to breastfeed. When trying to adjust, the baby sinks into the pressure spots (as I apply more pressure than she does due to adult vs child). Even after NUMEROUS pillows, there is just no support, especially since the mattress never evened out.3. The last 2 nights of sleeping on this mattress, I’ve awaken with pain in one of my legs. (I have to sleep on my side to breastfeed and I alternate throughout the night). And the pain hasn’t died down. This mattress was advertised to ease pain, not cause it- but I’m having the opposite effect.Ultimately, we will be trying to return this ASAP.Update!: we decided to keep it a little longer and allow it to shape/form correctly.We placed it on an actual bed support and it was immediately a change for the better. I’m not sure if all the cushion on carpeted floor was the reason, but it was night & day after putting it on a platform bed.Super comfortable, and the movement doesn’t effect everyone sleeping in the bed. Reminds me of that wine commercial mattress. I haven’t done wine, but I’ve done a glass of water and it held place while I got off the bed. It hugs your body without making you feel like you’re sinking into the mattress. Super comfortable & the mattress shaped itself out in a few days after my initial review.No body pains, better sleep, and even my husband doesn’t snore as much or as loud when he does snore. Definitely such a difference from when he falls asleep on the couch watching tv. SO grateful we gave it time & kept it! Definitely a gem for a fraction of the cost of other mattresses. 💯', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thinking about this mattress?', 'author': 'Lacey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old mattress was over 10+ years old. It was a super high end one… but I am disabled and bedridden most of the time… so I wore it out. And it became a trap for the most uncomfortable sleep.We went to a local mattress store to support locally. But I was so out of touch with what a king mattress costs now a days. I mentioned to the woman at the store how I see these mattress online, and they always have great reviews and are really decent prices. Her response was “yeah, talk to anyone who has actually slept on one and you will see why.”That scared me. Obviously. So I went back and forth about if I take the risk and order something like a mattress online that I can’t try, or spend the 2k plus for one that I know I like.I took the gamble because we don’t have that kind of money.I was soooo scared. Being disabled, if this didn’t work… I would be in a world of hurt. Literally. When it came, my anxiety got worse.Out of the box and cut open it began to expand fast! I was so surprised. We let it rise for about 3 hours before we had to sleep on it. It was totally ok and didn’t ruin its process at all.From night number 1- it’s an amazing mattress.Night 3- best decision.It’s more firm then my last one, but had a really nice cushion to it that cradles your body where it needs it.Being a side sleeper this has cut my hip pains down totally.I was scared to try a firm mattress because of how much chronic pain I am in- I always want to be on a soft cloud. I learned that was not the best for me.This mattress is great. If it gets the disabled persons seal of approval, you know that it’s good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is the best purchase I’ve made in YEARS!!!', 'author': 'Paige B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Okay, so I’ve been mattress hunting for some time, but very casually. I owned my previous mattress for almost 13 years, and it was very soft. I heard about these nectar mattresses through a neighbor and also slept on hers a few times and really liked it. So finally I made the plunge and got my own! It’s COMPLETELY different from my previous bed, but in all the right ways. I never knew I needed much much more support than I was getting before and the nectar bed is absolutely perfect. I wake up refreshed every morning. My lower back and shoulders don’t hurt like they would before. It’s been an all around excellent experience. I highly recommend this mattress to anyone looking for a change…for the better!!!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Review for Nectar 13” Queen Premier, our first non-traditional mattress.', 'author': 'The Amadan', 'rating': 4, 'content': '1. Shipping packaging: arrived in cardboard box. Inside, mattress is vacuum-compressed within thick, clear plastic. It is rather heavy (70+ lbs) for its boxed size, so have help ready to lift, etc.2. Unboxing: make sure your bed frame is ready, before opening the plastic vacuum wrap! Once the seal is broken, it expands quite rapidly, and is unwieldy.3. Expansion: 3-5 hours minimum is recommended (by manufacturer). We allotted about 7 hours, before we slept on it, and it seemed OK. There was little to no odor.4. Initial sleep: of course, any new mattress requires a bit of “getting used to”. First sensation when laying upon it is one of slight envelopment. Not a negative, just a bit more initial “give”, than we were accustomed to. Support seemed to be in a 6+ range. Welcome lack of pressure points, particularly when side-sleeping. Back-sleeping was extra restful, for me.5. Consecutive sleeps: after a few nights acclimating, our initial comfort assessments are unaltered. It does feel a slightly warmer, than any previous mattress, but this is easily adapted. Rolling over does take considerably more effort, but due to the comfort level, we found ourselves rolling much less often.6. Incidentals: There is little edge support, with this mattress. If you frequently sit on the edge of your bed, you may find this awkward or challenging. As this type is less rigid than a traditional mattress, moving it around (to do periodic rotation, for example) is more laborious – almost a “dead weight” experience.7. Overall impressions: We are pleased. So far, this seems to be a cost-effective, convenient, expedient means to a new, comfortable mattress. (comments may be amended, as time progresses)Gave 4 stars simply & solely because we have not owned very long.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Cost/Benefit', 'author': 'Frederico Moreira', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Product was delivered on Saturday.The unboxing process was really simple. Once i removed the mattress from the box, i used the Nectar knife to cut the plastic wrap and that was it. Once the plastic cover was cut, the mattress started to inflate to the desired height. After a few hours it was ready.The Mattress is well built and very comfortable. I have a herniatic disc and i was having too much pain in my previous 3K hybrid mattress. Now, i am able to sleep without pain for the first time in a few years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'DG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this mattress for two weeks and I love it! It took about a day and a half to fully expand. There is a smell that's last about a week and a half before it subsides, I can still get wiffs of it now from time to time. But not like im the beginning. It's firm and soft and can not feel someone tossing and turning or getting in and out the bed. It's worth the money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Classic Brands Cool Gel Chill Memory Foam 14-Inch Mattress with 2 Pillows |CertiPUR-US Certified |Bed-in-a-Box, Full
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A Man's review of this thing.", 'author': 'Jesse', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'To clear up a lot of confusion with this mattress, here is an Honest to God review....Summary:- Mattress was easy to assemble (cut package and roll/air out)- Smell was not that bad... It\'s expected, so have a fan ready and air it out.- Firm version of memory foam (Perfect for bigger guys like me) But I have a hunch it breaks in over time.- Quality seemed very nice.I just received this mattress yesterday ( 8/5/2015 ). The packaging was as expected, the Cardboard box was in rough shape but the heavy duty plastic on the inside was untouched. I\'m a 6\'2" 230lb athletic man that spends most of my free time in the gym, so getting the package onto my bed frame by myself was no problem at all. To a regular or smaller person, you might need an extra hand carrying the 90+lb package.Upon opening, I cut the plastic and everything went as expected. The mattress inflated itself within 30 minutes with the corners lagging behind (I just hit the corners with my hand to fluff them up and help them catch up) . I let it sit for 24 hours before laying on it. The smell is strong, but it\'s not as bad as people make it out to be. Looking at the other reviews, some of these people must have had a bad mattress, or simply can\'t take a little odor for a few days (they might be sensitive).Here\'s the biggest point... The mattress is a very firm version of memory foam. Right out of the box the mattress doesn\'t give in as much as you may think. It\'s perfect for someone like me because, like I\'ve said, I\'m 230 lbs and athletic. This thing offers the perfect support for me, giving in to my heavy points and supporting my lighter areas yet I can see somebody who\'s much lighter having issues. I say to those people, give the mattress time to break in. I\'ll update this in a few months with a follow up.Tonight will be the first night I sleep on it, and I couldn\'t be more excited. The 10 minutes I spend laying on it this morning almost made me fall right asleep again. I\'ll keep this post updated because there seems to be a lot of confusion on this mattress.* Off topic *The first one I ordered got mixed up in the mail due to the carrier, therefor I got my mattress 3 days late. Amazon\'s customer service was perfect and I couldn\'t have asked for a better crew to solve the problem.** UPDATE (08/07/2015) **- Last night was the first night that I slept on the mattress and I can honestly say I had a great night sleep. I didn\'t wake up in the middle of the night at all. I was cool all night (Granted I had a 17" box fan blowing directly over me) and the only time I got hot was when my lady friend came over earlier. I\'m usually a very hot sleeper and people who complain about the heat of this thing should invest in a fan. Even without the fan it was very cool at first, but it did start warming up slightly after 30 minutes or so of laying in the same spot - but it wasn\'t that bad.I can say that I\'m very pleased with my first night on this thing.*** UPDATE 08/24/2015Sleeping on this thing has been a pleasure. It\'s not revolutionizing, but it\'s much more comfortable than my last mattress. The smell is pretty much gone although it did take awhile. The smell was honestly not that bad and the only way you could really smell it was if you stuck your nose in the mattress. I don\'t wake up in the middle of the night anymore from tossing and turning. That\'s a huge plus for me because on my old mattress It felt like I had a cycle of waking up at 3 or 4am from tossing and turning. The mattress is still very firm, but like I said before, it\'s perfect for me because I\'m big and heavy enough to actually sink in a bit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy... cannot say enough about this mattress......', 'author': 'Cary R. Hitchings', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATE: 4 years later…. This is still the best mattress for me. No back pain. Still like new. Conforms to my body. It will indent some, (literally have had to turn it 2 times in 4 years) but all you have to do is turn it. And the indented part goes away. It’s truly the best mattress. I took a risk buying a lower cost mattress and I am so glad I did, better than any $1000.00 + mattress I have ever slept on. I bought the 10 inch for my daughter and she LOVES it. First purchase had a smell that went away (see below) but my daughters didn’t smell at all. All the luxuries of an expensive mattress for a much lower price.ORIGINAL REVIEW: Ok, so my pics are of an unfinished bedroom, and a bed that I just painted white from black. So the bed only has sheets on it. As you can see, this mattress is 14 inches and is big. It's all of every bit of 14 inches and started rising before I could get it all of the way out of the plastic. It was at maximum within 5 minutes. The pillows... I LOVE. We bought an original box spring to go with it, and I have to raise my leg high and climb up in it. My dog cannot jump on it or get off by herself. I should have gotten a thin box spring, because now my mattress is way higher than the bedside tables. But I DO NOT CARE... I LOVE LOVE this mattress. The ONLY bad thing is the smell. The smell that came with mine was very strong, and even stronger in the pillows. So bad, I had to throw the pillows outside of my room to sleep. So tonight I will try to put the pillows in the dryer with softener sheets to see if that helps. I have slept on this mattress for 3 nights so far. I can tell a HUGE different. I have lower back pain, and bad hip pain that will shoot down my leg while sleeping. I have also been doing manual labor... and I thank god for this mattress, as I know my back would have been worse on my other mattress. If I lay on my back, it conforms to my back and feels great. If I lay on my side, I barely get hip pain. I don't toss and turn nearly as much in this. This is close to firm, but nothing like a firm mattress with coils would be. I have not noticed it being hot at all. And I live in Texas and it's mid summer. I just hope the smell goes away. It seems to slowly be going away. I probably should have not covered it right away and let it air out for a few days, but I just couldn't wait to get into it. I am so happy with this purchase. I feel like the regular price is steal, and I got it on prime day... which was even more of a steal. If I am already sleeping in this bed so well from day one.... I cannot imagine how much better it will get. I was worried being over weight (215) that it wouldn't support me as well... IT DOES! I feel like I am sleeping on a mattress that cost 5k. I would say (being that my hips are so bad) that this does well for pressure points. Pillows are kind of thin... but I like thinner pillows... and they seem very nice. Once the smell is gone, I will use them. Oh also.... mine is a queen... and I bought a queen box spring. The mattress is about 3-4 inches wider than the box spring is so I just centered it. I love that this mattress fills in the gaps on my bed. My pillow will no longer fall behind the mattress as I sleep.***UPDATE***The smell is still there. I had to put in a Fabrese plug in. I do not understand why this mattress still smells. It’s almost a mildew smell. I love this mattress. I’m not sure what to do with the smell. Sucks I took a star away for it. It still sleeps perfect and I enjoy getting into it. I just want the smell gone.***ANOTHER UPDATE****Smell is gone. It has taken a year or more for the smell to be completely gone. But worth it. I have had it for two years now and it’s amazing. Others posted is sags. I weigh a lot, not gonna lie, and mine doesn’t sag. It did indent a little, so I just turned it and it goes away. Nothing like a regular mattress that permanently indents.I still love this mattress and my back thanks me for getting it. It’s not soft, but soft enough. When you first get in, it feels firm, but the foam slowly confirms to your body and is great for back issues!Soft mattresses hurt my back. This mattress gives perfect support.People that got one that sink, got a lemon. This mattress is tough and holds its shape.I would buy again. And may for other rooms.I don’t use the pillows. Too soft. I had to buy Ikea contoured pillows. They work best for me.I have gotten hot on it, but I think it’s me and not the mattress (I’m 50) so I bought a Bedfan, and it solved my issues.Seriously .... worth it to buy this! Star has been given back too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The One!', 'author': 'RoadRick - TX', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After weeks of research including mattress store visits, finally took the chance and ordered the CB 12" Cool Gel Memory foam King Size. Having been a \'box spring & coil mattress guy my 60+ years\' I was easy prey for the store sales guys, yet I resisted the easy path of plunking down $3 ~ $4 grand and after reading volumes of comparative details and thousands of reviews, would up here. For about 1/10th the cost it was well worth the risk. I even called Classic Brands cust svc and chatted about what to expect between this & the hybrid model that\'s near the same price. My head just can\'t wrap itself around a brutally squished up bunch of springs and foam popping up to a sturdy full size without any long term effect on those springs turning mushy over time, but I can better imagine how squished up foam by itself can possibly be reformed to a strong enough support.My UPS guy had never delivered one of these before and he\'s real interested in what we think after installed. The two of us pretty good sized guys wrestled the very heavy, pretty beat up, nasty, dirty box into the house together without any serious injury. After that, and much room prep + new platform bed set up, I managed to push the box across wood floors into the bedroom myself, carefully knifed away the mangled box, keeping the inner plastic cover intact, then wrestled / rolled the behemoth up onto the platform and into position for the grand opening. Carefully sliced through the cover while watching the mattress come to life and expand rapidly while it rolled itself out nicely onto the bed frame. about 30 seconds into it, I realized it was upside down and fast, drastic action was in order. I had my dainty wife push against the bottom of one side while I flipped my side up and over (thankfully it wasn\'t far from the wall on her side), then dashed around and re-slide the beast onto the bed once again, this time the correct side up. We were prepared to let it expand over night, but it was already fully expanded to it\'s 12" size within a couple hours, so we gave it a whirl the first night. As many other reviewers noted, it\'s firm, yet also plush at the same time. Medium/firm is what I\'d call it. I sink in slightly, enough to make my back feel somewhat cocooned, but it\'s effortless to roll onto my side as well. I\'ve been a \'firm\' mattress mostly side sleeper guy forever, but this mattress actually lets me sleep very well on my back or side as I feel like. I know I\'m changing position a lot less and when I do, the wife doesn\'t notice at all. We\'re both sleeping a lot sounder now, want to stay in bed longer when waking up as it feels so good and the occasional tango between the sheets has not been diminished in any way :-). Also, there\'s no heat issue for me, maybe even cooler for me than the past spring coil mattress. A tiny con may be that the edge is not as rigid as my past mattress, so it\'s less comfy to sit on the edge to put on your socks as you do dip down a bit, but that\'s no prob for us as we\'ve switched to the foot of the bed for that where there\'s extra support platform from the frame that makes sock activity very easy. Perhaps these are not for everyone, but I\'m 100% sold, as is the wife. Best mattress purchase ever for us at an amazingly low cost compared to the stores', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money', 'author': 'Patrick Sparks', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We have been sleeping on this mattress for almost a month now and I must say it is comfortable. Took about 24 hours for it to fully rise. It is on the firm side as most people stated but it does not cause pressure points. Back pain has been relieved from sleeping on this mattress. You do not feel the other person move at all in this bed. Overall I feel like this mattress is worth the money. 2/1/24 and we are still very happy with this mattress. It is not hot and the firmness has stayed even on my husbands side of the bed. We both sleep much betters', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money!!', 'author': 'Shay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don’t usually write reviews but I’ll leave a quick one for this mattress because I was very skeptical about this order. I recently moved into a new apartment and needed a bed that was affordable, and it was almost too good to be true that this one showed up in a box at my front door. I let the mattresses air out and set up for the first 24 hours, and after two nights sleeping on it I am so happy! The smell was pretty mild and went away within a day or so. It’s my first completely foam mattress, was worried it would be too soft but it’s perfect! I weigh 145lbs, doesn’t compress if I sit on the edge of the bed and was super comfortable. Overall very happy with the purchase, highly recommend if you’re looking for a decent quality mattress for a few hundred bucks.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Every Penny', 'author': 'Rebecca', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great value for the dollar. Great quality mattress for a really awesome price. Very comfortable. Makes sleeping much easier. Very thick. Not lumpy at all. I recommend this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress!', 'author': 'Cynthia Thompson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband and I just bought this mattress from Amazon about 12 days ago. It was delivered very quickly, in one or two days. It is very nice and very comfortable. We both like it very much. The only problem I have with it is that the mattress is very heavy and I cannot lift it to put the corners of the fitted sheets on by myself. My husband has to lift it so I can do it. Maybe I'm just a weaking, but thats the only problem I have with this mattress. The 2 pillows that came with it are very full and look great on the bed but are a little firm for my liking. I would recommend this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My second mattress of this kind', 'author': 'Emily', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had this same mattress on a twin bed back when I was in college, and after we married, we needed a queen or king. My mom and stepdad gave us one of their old mattresses and our backs were killing us lol. I was excited to find this same mattress available years later, and at a very affordable price since it was used. The mattress was perfectly clean when it arrived with no smell that others had mentioned (maybe because it had already been aired out by the previous buyer.) We let it decompress for 2 days before hopping on and testing it out. I was disappointed at first because it wasn't as soft as I had remembered, but some folks online said that the foam tends to soften over time, and that it has! It's become very comfortable for us, and has been especially great for my rheumatoid arthritis. I don't toss and turn like I used to, and I find that I sink in just the right amount (145lbs) Perfect for us ladies with big wider hips, who struggle to align our spine in bed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bed in a box', 'author': 'Kevin French', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the queen size 14 inch cool gel bed and a box. This is my first time buying a mattress off of Amazon and without testing it first. I purchased this based on the reviews of 45K at 4 1/2 star review. When I took the mattress out of the box, I did not set it up for 24 hours so it could properly inflate to its actual size. I also received two gel pillows with the mattress. After 24 hours, I set it up and so far two nights of sleep. I have yet to experience any bodily pain and I am sleeping through the night. The mattress I used to have was a Tempur-pedic and it was 20 years old.. I definitely got my moneys worth out of that mattress and the new one feels great! The biggest thing that I’m impressed with is I only paid $400 for the new mattress versus $4000 for a new Tempur-pedic. The cool gel mattress has yet to get warm which is another thing I needed. I like a cool mattress. Because of the thickness it has a firm feel but not too firm and your body will form to the bed. All I can say is I’m glad I went with this option don’t shy away from this. I will try to add another review after 30 days.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised!', 'author': 'Becky Ashwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I hate buying mattresses. They never the same as they do in the store when you get them home, and the sheer quantity of makers, materials, and outrageous promises, coupled with the high prices leaves me overwhelmed and stressed. Add having to buy one for your 84 year old mom with degenerative discs, cancer, and severe arthritis, and it\'s horrible. I spent hours on Amazon reading reviews and researching, and ultimately wound up purchasing this in a 14" Twin XL to use on an adjustable base in her new assisted living. Shipping was okay, it took a couple of days longer than I would have liked, but it was packaged well, and being a larger item I kind of expected it. After it got here it only took around 24 hours to totally puff up. It didn\'t have a chemical smell, either. Mama has only slept on it a couple of times so far, but she absolutely loves it! I\'m so impressed that I told my husband that I\'m ready to kick our overpriced and overhyped Sleep Number mattress out the door and get us one! Best nervous decision I\'ve made in a long time!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Full Mattress, 9 Inch Flex Gel Memory Foam Mattress, Gel Infused for Comfort and Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, Medium Firm, Full Size
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great, affordable mattress.', 'author': 'Su', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The mattress is not very thick but is definitely comfortable. Seems to be well constructed with a removable, washable cover but its heavy so I opted to buy a protective mattress pad cover', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'April Kite', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feels so good', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This memory foam mattress is so comfortable and well worth the purchase I’m loving it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars It’s soft and supportive but only fluffed to 7”', 'author': 'Sharon', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'There is a lot to like about this mattress. Given how many reviews says it is well short of the advertised 9” , the manufacturer is aware. 7” mattresses are significantly less money. So it is a good twin mattress for our 3 year old grandson. title: Queen Mattress, 13 Inch Hybrid Mattress, Gel Infused Memory Foam, Pocket Spring for Support and Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, Firm, Queen Size
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value and quality', 'author': 'intelligentsia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this mattress November of 2023, wanted to give it some time to give a fair evaluation. Quality seems great, no odor when unpacked (a problem with some beds I am told). The coil spring base is firm and supports my wife and I very well, the foam and gel components on top make this very comfortable so the bed does not feel "hard" even if it is firm. Time will tell if the box springs will sag, for now I could not be happier, and the price is incredible. Stitching, construction, etc. all see first rate. The one issue to consider, a hybrid bed will not have the firm edges of a regular coil spring mattress, so if you typically sit on the edge of the bed (to put shoes on or ???), or if you role to the very edge of the bed, the foam and gel layers will not support you the way a firm coil spring would, so you may end up on your butt or role off the side. That is not a negative, just something to consider, especially if you like to sleep on the very edge of the bed. For everyone else, read the features, this mattress has everything a high end hybrid does at a fraction of the cost.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OMG this is heaven.', 'author': 'Original 2 Cups of Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will update this after 3 months, 6 months and a year. I am 5\'10 and weigh 335 lbs. We removed the mattress from it\'s shipping box and rolled the well packed item to the bedroom. Absolutely no chemical smells at all. Using a traditional oak bed frame and box spring we put it on it and opened the package. Easily done, it gently sprang to life. It was 11 1/2" deep and after 6 hrs. of rest opened to 12 1/2". As I had no real choice I had to use it for the night. OMG so soft, but firm. I have sciatica so I was hoping this would help. After a week I can truthfully say I\'m no worse and have spent every night in comfort. The only complaint I have is the mattress doesn\'t really have a firm "edge" to sit on, I have to kind of roll into the middle. Looking at it each morning and measuring I find it springs back to it\'s original shape. Perhaps at a later date it might not considering my excess weight, but we shall see. I haven\'t noticed any "overheating" either because of the material. So far its been money well spent for a wonderful, comfortable nights rest. I have been through two $1000 mattresses in 5 years, so this is a bargain if I onlybuy a few of these. Don\'t be afraid of the horror stories about unwrapping and setting up, the package arrived UPS in good condition. See you later.****UPDATE-3 MONTHS**** A solid 12" all around, still firm like I need it. No noticeable smell from day 1 or now. No lumps developing on it either. We reverse the mattress every 30 days and all is, as it was the first week. With my weight is the "real" test. Still comfortable and keeps me happy. See you at the end of 6 months.****UPDATE 6 MONTHS**** Everything still great. No complaints, still 12"+ and no bumps or lumps. ****UPDATE 9 MONTHS****Still 12", no lumps or bumps, enjoying a restful sleep. I do rotate it once a month as a precaution. See you at the end of 12 months****UPDATE 1 YEAR****All is well, still going strong, very pleased. I\'ll buy again if this EVER wears out !!!***** UPDATE 15 Months*****All is well, still going strong.*****UPDATE 18 Months*****Still retains its original features, money well spent.*****UPDATE 2 YEARS, 2 MONTHS*****Still comfortable, now weigh 350 lb. No lumps or bumps, (on the matteress)*****UPDATE 3 YEARS, 6 MONTHS, Getting a little lumpy in places, move it around hides it, unfortunately I am now 370 lb. but still happy to get a great, restful sleep', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super satisfied so far!', 'author': 'Douglas Atkins', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This may be long. We decided we wanted to try to upgrade from a queen sized bed to a king sized bed. My wife has degenerative discs in her lower back and experiences a lot of back pain. We have 2 small dogs that sleep with us. Just wasn't enough room in the queen bed to allow her to get comfortable. So we wanted to try out a king sized bed on the cheap. We bought a used king sized bed that shockingly matches the rest of bedroom furniture. We read great reviews about this mattress. We got it. I opened it and let it decompress for a full week as the instructions stated. The mattress seemed a little flimsy to me so I had serious doubts. We bought a metal box frame and assembled it so it could fit inside our bedframe. The metal box frames seems to give more support than the old wooden ones. We've been sleeping on the new mattress for 5 weeks now. I have to say we are shocked with the quality. It is firm every where except the very edges of the mattress. Very supportive. We both sleep much better than we were sleeping on our less than 5 year old orthopedic coil spring mattress. It really is comfortable. My wife is able to sleep soundly on it rather than waking up every hour or two and then struggling to get back to sleep. Caveat. I do not think this mattress will last more than 5 years. I could be mistaken. However, at the price we paid, I will still be highly satisfied if it lasts even 4 years. We paid $1,500 for our last mattress and never slept well on it after a year. The mattress before that lasted 14 years (King Koil). I think all in we spent $1,000 including the bed frame, the box spring, mattress, sheets, pillow cases, pillows, blanket and comforter. Highly recommend the bamboo king sized pillows btw. Great for side sleepers or sleepers with neck pain. Don't dismiss it because the mattress is so cheap. It's great so far!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not quite as advertised but for ~ $200 (full) not a bad deal.', 'author': 'David H', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Reading all the reviews, they are all over the place. I am thinking that maybe people are ending up with different mattress that just have the same coverings? Or maybe different mattress sizes are being reviewed differently?Anyway here is my experience with a FULL mattress. This is the 4th bed in a box mattress I have purchased over the last 7 years for both myself and my kids. I\'m 5\'10" and 235 so "dense" would be a good word. I have several herniated discs, bad shoulders and hips. A soft bed is agony. I\'m a back and side sleeper.DAY 1 - Arrived no issues, securely packaged. Inflates within 1 hour to 11.5 inches approx, nowhere near 13 inches. Other than that no apparent issues. Only the faintest odor compared to previous mattresses I have purchased.NITE 1- Was going to let it expand and out-gas for a full day but it seemed perfectly ready to go within only a few hours so I swapped it out with my existing.I find it pleasantly "firm" with about 2 inches of soft give on the top. Meaning if I push my hand into it, my hand easily goes in about 2 inches, typical memory foam feel, then hits strong resistance. If I kneel or stand on it, I can clearly feel the springs compacting and I sink in about 4 inches. Laying on back is great. Laying on side my hips don\'t sink in as much as I\'d like but I bet it loosens up over time. Overall it is really comfortable, just what I wanted. Seems to be pretty well made. I can\'t tell top end expensive from low end, only crap from well done and this seems pretty good. Day 1.Morning 1 - I slept really well. Really comfortable. Still woke up stiff and sore but I think this was not so much from the mattress, just how I always wake up. I bet this gets better.ONE BIG ISSUE though. There is zero edge support. Literally none. If sit on the edge the edge squishes all the way down flat and I bottom out. Well maybe within 2 inches of literally bottoming out. But the effect is that as you swing your legs out of bed and start to roll out, the side gives way and you literally flop out of bed. That is so weird because if I sit 6" back from the edge, no problems. Still firm. I guess the springs don\'t go all the way to the edge? Remember I have a FULL. Queen, King may be different.So aside from having to be careful when exiting my bed, I\'m not dissatisfied in the least because I wanted a decent cheap firm mattress and I got it. I\'ll post updates periodically. I\'m planning to get a high end mattress in a year or two so as long as this ~ 200 mattress holds up that long, it\'s a win.Morning 3 - Still hasn\'t inflated to 13". It is maybe barely 12". Not a big deal. I find that once the foam top gets squished down by my body, it is quite firm. No trouble getting to sleep and not waking up in the night with pain as I did with my previous mattress. Still waking up stiff and sore though. Again, different than my previous mattress though, this is more like stiff and sore if I were to sleep on the floor. LOL. I may add a mattress topper to make it just a little softer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Seriously...BUY THIS BED! >>UPDATE: 6 years later<<', 'author': 'Bunny', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this bed about 9 months ago. Due to its outrageously cheap pricetag i wanted to wait to make sure it was going to hold up before posting a review.Before buying this I spent MONTHS researching mattresses. It was really doing my head in, did I want spring could? Gel? Soft firm? Financially it's best to buy on the internet, but you have to really just hope it's what you want, so it was a difficult decision. The day was fast approaching that I needed to have made that decision when I found this one. It was just about the best reviewed in any price range, plus it was EVERYTHING, individually wrapped coils, memory foam AND gel, plus 13 inches seemed nice and thick. So i ordered it. A year later i still cant say enough good things about it. If id paid a thousand bucks for it i would still be happy, but i didnt, i paid $237!!! If you have been shopping around you know you can barely get sheets for that price! I still cant believe it almost a year later.It as plush, but still very firm, you sink into the plush but supported by the springs. We spend a LOT of time in bed, way more than the average person, and its standing up to it just fine. The spring provide enough bounce for sexy time, but I am still undisturbed when he gets out of bed, well it is a little disturbing when I realize he isn't in bed, because that's how good it is, I never even feel him get up. I will say this, the guy who delivers it is going to be giving you a REALLY dirty look, do not expect any favors from him, he does not like you much that day. The boxbis big, cumbersome and very heavy. Opening the box and watching It spring to life was mot even close to as exciting as it had been described in nearly every review, I filmed it, gathered friends to gaze at it's splendor...there was no splendor, the unboxing was extremely anticlimactic, but the bed? Jeez Louise, don't look any further buy this one...BUY THIS ONE...FOR REAL. (If you are in any way capable of being happy) YOU WILL BE VERY HAPPY.>>2024 UPDATE<<Ok so a bed at that price point that is super awesome out of the box? Sure but time will tell right?Well I have had this bed for 6 years now. It is our main bed that we sleep in every night. Are you on the edge of your seat? You should be because it is not often you get to find out how it is with some mileage.Well guys, I am very pleased to tell you that it is still just like new! Can you believe that? At this price point. This may be the greatest purchase of my life. Honestly I was expecting a few years out of it. If it lasted 2 years even, I’d still consider it money well spent, but it has been six years and it is going strong. It is a bit on the soft side but this brand makes a ton of different varieties. I like it soft. I have turned several friends onto it and they bought it and they are all as stoked about it as we are. So yes, 6 years later it is going strong with no sign of losing steam. Great mattress and best deal on the planet!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded expectations; great gamble on a hybrid mattress for back problems', 'author': 'Rochelle YG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'll start with why I chose this mattress out of the thousands to choose from online and in store. My first and most important priority was something that would alleviate my lower back problems. I have longstanding back issues and I needed something that would help with the stiffness in my back and hips. My previous spring mattress was a firm but I liked the support. I found some relief on my boyfriend's mattress, but found that his was a tad too plush, that it did not properly support my pressure points and I'd even wake up with numbness sometimes. I would classify his as a medium-plush to medium. His mattress is a hybrid spring, just like this one with the memory foam layer that is much like a topper. I am not too fond of straight memory foam mattresses because I have yet to find one with the proper support and I personally believe that they hold their shape less longer over time than a spring mattress. So as I researched for a hybrid spring mattress with a deep depth, I went through several websites, vendors, and reviews. I came really close to purchasing two other extremely similar mattresses to this one on this same app, and wayfair. What it ultimately boiled down to and what made me decide on this one was the amount of positive reviews it had and the price point. The price combined with the amount of people who are satisfied with this hybrid spring mattress, just can't be beat. I told myself that if I'm going to take a gamble on buying a mattress online and get a horrible mattress, I'd rather beat myself up over losing out on $240 as opposed to $500 or even $1000. So I convinced myself to bet on this one, and hoped that the odds would be in my favor and so far so good!I was a little wary of these new mattresses that come compressed in a box. The box was too heavy for me, someone with back issues, to take up a flight of stairs. There was no chemical smell at all. As soon as we removed the about three layers of packaging, it immediately began to grow! After about an hour, I would say it was 75% there. 24 hours later, I felt that the corners still needed time as the directions state to wait the full 48 hours before putting any weight on the mattress. It was about 90% there, and although my boyfriend insisted we should try it out already, I stood firm and told him no we should wait the full 48 and I'm glad we did! We've slept on it for the past week now on the floor as we wait to purchase a new bed set and it's like a dream. I wake up with no back issues whatsoever, no numbness, nothing! It hugs my hips in a way that is supportive, but not too firm, yet not too plush. Ever since messing up my back, I am not able to lay on my back for an extended period of time. I'm a side sleeper. But I've found that I can even fall asleep on my back with this mattress, and I haven't been able to do that in years! My boyfriend is a big guy, and his side is not uneven or sunken in any way. Now my only concern will be if this mattress will stand up to the test of time because unfortunately I cannot give my word on that yet but I'm very impressed and hopeful so far! If anything changes, I will edit this review. I'll give an update in 6 months to see where we're at with the mattress. If you're looking at this mattress and you've researched for weeks like I did, I say go ahead and take a chance on it, because you won't be able to find such a cheap hybrid spring mattress anywhere else with so many great reviews. If I had to rate the firmness of it, I'd say it is between a medium and firm, a medium-firm if you will (on a scale of plush-medium-firm). I tried to measure it with an old school ruler (as shown in pictures) and I'd say it's a solid 12 inches, probably not 13 but honestly I'm so satisfied with the comfort of the mattress, that the exact depth is the least of my worries.EDIT AFTER OVER A YEAR: We've had this mattress over a year now, and it's still going strong! Hasn't sunken in anywhere and it is still as comfortable as the first day we got it. I wish I knew a long time ago that it was my old mattress that was not allowing me to sleep on my back, when I thought it was just me. I fall asleep like a baby on my back now, and I didn't think that would ever be possible again due to my back issues, but now I see I was just sleeping on the wrong mattress. I can't recommend this one enough!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Durable and Sturdy Sleep Experience', 'author': 'Nataly Kratos', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience with the Olee Sleep Queen Mattress. The mattress has consistently provided a comfortable and supportive sleep surface, ensuring a restful night's sleep. The long-lasting performance and robust construction make it a reliable investment for those seeking a high-quality mattress that stands the test of time. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally, a firm mattress!', 'author': 'hannah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really comfortable and soft! Don't wake my partner up when getting up for work. 10/10 rating for me cause I got exactly what I wanted", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It’s almost perfect', 'author': 'Kau Lehua', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I had purchased the plush Lucid mattress for my other house & that one was PERFECT. Needed another mattress & for some reason could not ship the plush to Hawaii. But the medium mattress could be shipped, so I went with that. If you are reading this then you know mattresses are a very personal choice. How can a mattress feel like sleeping in a cloud & also feel like sleeping on a slab of concrete? Is there truly that much difference in 2 people’s experience? Or is it quality control of the memory foam? At any rate, I had a good experience with Lucid once. And had a bad experience with a different brand where the new mattress had zero support & gave me back pain like I’ve never experienced before. It also was so hot! And if you get the mattress & don’t like it, good luck getting it back into the box & returning it! I ended up selling it to some poor soul that didn’t know what a torture thing the mattress was. But hey, there were a gazillion 5 star reviews on that brand. Maybe the buyer got an almost brand new “like sleeping on a cloud in an inferno” for a fraction of the price!Anyways, back to this medium support Lucid. It’s OK. I wake up with ZERO back pain & does not retain heat, so maybe it does deserve a 5 star instead of 4 star. But, I just wish it had a tad bit more softness. Like maybe one or two more inches of soft memory foam. I’ve had it for a couple months. I am hoping as it breaks in it will soften up a bit. This mattress is probably good for people larger than I. And I sleep alone with a couple little furry friends. I tried putting a 3” memory foam mattress topper on it but it was too much, a little too soft. Maybe a 1” or 2” topper will work. Don’t get me wrong, I really do like this mattress. No back pain is worth a lot!!! This mattress is almost perfect! I would have traded the plush for this medium, but he let the old dog sleep on it with no waterproof protection & guess what? He can keep it! Also, the softer they are the faster they degrade. That plush mattress… the person sleeping on it is about 30-40lbs heavier than me. He’s been sleeping on it for 5 years & its has an indentation where he sleeps. But he has not complained about that. He does complain about the fact that there’s no support at the edges when you sit. That is true for any memory foam mattress. He ended up putting padded side boards on his bed frame to give it support (my bed frame already has side boards, which is perfect for memory foam!) I really wish I could have ordered the plush Lucid, even if I would have to replace it in 5 years. For the price, to me, it’s worth it. That plush mattress was perfect, this medium is almost perfect & since it is firmer, hopefully it will last a little longer. Good luck with the search for the perfect mattress! If you can afford to pay a little more, buy one at Costco or somewhere that you can return it if it doesn’t work for you. Or go to a mattress store & take a lie down on different brands. Or lie down on a friend’s memory foam & see how it feels. There’s just no way to know, since every mattress on Amazon has contradictory reviews. I do believe that if you are not sure, go with the firmer one. If it’s too firm, you can always put a topper on it. But if it’s too soft & causes crippling pain & makes you feel like you are sleeping in an inferno of heat, you are pretty much screwed. I do recommend this medium Lucid mattress. It is a good mattress at an affordable price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love This', 'author': 'Joy Panico', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This really is like sleeping on a cloud.. it forms to my body and its really comfortable. wasn't what to expect. my mother had gotten a medium firm mattress and that was like sleeping on a rock.. she let me test it out as i was planning on getting the same exact bed and mattress she did.. but yeah hers was bad and she's regretting it. so i decided not to get that.Anyhow back to this mattress.. I've never had a memory foam mattress before and after seeing the luck my mom had i decided to try the lucid plushy mattress and I'm glad i did. It is the best thing i got and it definitely is comfortable. I made the right choice.. If You want something comfortable I'd say this is the one for you. Not to hard not to soft but for me i think its perfect", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy with one minor lesson learned!', 'author': 'Jared', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So my girlfriend had an old queen size box spring mattress that was in terrible shape. When we moved in together, we brought her bed with. The mattress kept getting worse and worse so we ended up going to both several chain and local mattress stores. The cheapest we could find for a basic queen size memory foam mattress was $700.We bought this, somewhat hesitant about buying an off brand mattress from Amazon. We left it to inflate for 4 days before sleeping on it and it was so comfy, not too hard and not too soft. Just right! We then put a plastic mattress protector/cover on the mattress to protect it from spills, etc.Shortly after that, we noticed the bed wasn’t very soft or comfy anymore, almost too hard. We thought that the mattress had finally showed it’s true colors and we were a little upset.On a whim, we removed the mattress protector/bag and all of a sudden, the mattress was super comfy again. Lesson learned!So don’t put a mattress protector on the mattress and it will be fine. Just don’t spill anything on it, although the mattress does have a cloth cover that goes over the foam that’s removable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn\'t be more pleased, and yes I opted for "Reg" and yes it was firm enough!', 'author': 'Virgil', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I researched this one very carefully before deciding on it. The issue was weather to get "firm" or not, since I wanted a firm mattress.It was a good thing I trusted other reviewers who warned only to get the "regular" level of firmness (no additional firmness) or it would be too hard. And they were right. After unboxing (more like unrolling, or actually "allowing the blob to expand automatically), and placing it on the metal bed frame (also purchased at the same time for the purpose) upon which I had placed an extra-dense piece of heavy duty cardboard (do not use corrugated) to prevent "oozing" of the gel and foam construction through the slats of the bed frame, I had to sit on it for firmness. Too soon to tell, as the instructions said to wait a while for it to expand out to full size.They were right that it takes a few days to reach "full power" meaning expanded to full size and density. But even after a few hours it was evident that it was probably going to be firm enough.Guess what? After a few days it was confirmed that this thing was super firm, as firm as or even firmer THAN a regular firm mattress. But it is different- wait til you try it. It really is nice. It STAYS put. Or should I say YOU stay put and do not jostle around when you move around on it. I like it a lot. I don\'t think I would ever want a regular mattress ever again.This was for a spare room, and guests love it. When the time comes to replace my queen size bed I\'m gonna get me one of these gel thangs! I am very impressed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Received the wrong one', 'author': 'EmilyDawn', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered a Plush 10” but got the Medium 10”. Not bad for a cheap mattress!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Firm is Hard', 'author': 'kkemppai', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought the 10” Lucid in the firm version at the very end of December 2020 (post Christmas sale). Wanted the overall height of the bed to be lower than our previous 14” Simmons memory foam on foam platform supporting box spring. That was furniture store bought and which was about 10 years old. It had depressed where we each usually sleep. Kept the platform which really didn’t appear to have any sag and added a wood slat support on top of it to preempt it from getting any from the thinner mattress. Let the new mattress breathe after unboxing for four days. Put it in place and attempted sleep for a few nights. Then we talked and found out we were sharing the same pain. Bone joints; shoulders, hips, knees, and elbows, ached for both my spouse and me; hubby 6’3” 188 lbs & wife 5’3” 118. Tried sleeping on back, sides and front.By the 7th of January we bought a 4” combination mattress pad that’s 2” more memory foam and 2” polyester padding. So much for the thinner profile and actually seeing much of our headboard. This made the bed comfortable and our sleeping nightly remained sound until November 2023. By then the sleep spots were getting depressions in the top of the bed which were no longer removed by a wash of the fiber pad and fluffing. Removed the mattress pad combo and replaced with to another pad set that claims 4” but is really 2.5” memory foam and 1” polyester pad and this has rejuvenated full night’s sleep and a flat bed top again.No depressions were noticed in the mattress when making the topper switch. It was so hard I don’t know that we could depress it.Overall thoughts - Really wished we could have done a lay test. Pleased the Lucid mattress has held shape. Sad it was about 40% of the price to make it sleep worthy. Okay with the fact that add got us 3 years of use and it was about that same amount to renew the feeling rather than buying a new mattress. If it goes another 2-3 years then the value decision to get a bed in a box has been comparatively inexpensive to the store experience and we’ll do it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far looks good', 'author': 'Brian M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We just got it haven't tried it yet open it up on it's a good fit it's exact size or old mattress I guess was just some throwing the dealer put in when you get the box it's going to be compressed it took a little bit longer than we thought to expand but I believe that's because of the temperature so we left it overnight in the camper and the next day it filled did everything out well I'll add more later after we gone out and tried it but so far we're pleased with it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Great quality!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Too soft', 'author': 'skatdayl', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I bought this mattress in part because it said it was firm and could support anyone’s body. I found that the mattress was much too soft and I sunk into it. It is not firm by any stretch of the imagination. I threw away the box, so I cannot return the mattress, or I definitely would.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable mattress but the design of the pillowtop can improve', 'author': 'SAU', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After enduring back pain caused by my six-year-old memory foam mattress, I decided it was time for a change. The discomfort had become unbearable, making it a struggle to get out of bed each morning. Opting for a firmer mattress, I chose a hybrid with inner springs instead of a full-spring mattress, aiming for a balance between support and comfort. The well-packed mattress, vacuum-folded in a box with dual layers of plastic wrapping, arrived in excellent condition. Despite the instructions recommending three days for expansion, it reached its full shape within a few hours. Although we adhered to leaving it for an additional two days, there was no further change in size. However, noticeable "dents" persisted on two of the pillowtop corners, and despite almost two months of use, they haven\'t resolved.Here\'s my honest review after two months of usage:Pros:Weight: The mattress\'s substantial weight contributes to stability.Firmness: As a hybrid mattress, it provides the necessary firmness, significantly alleviating my back pain and promoting a refreshed wake-up experience.Air Circulation: The "egg-crate" design on the pillowtop facilitates better air circulation, preventing heat buildup and ensuring a cooler sleep.Cons:Tilted Pillow Top: One side of the foot end of the mattress exhibits a slight tilt in the pillowtop, noticeable right out of the box. Whether intentional or a defect remains unclear, raising questions about the design.Deeper Bumps: The bumps on the pillowtop are somewhat pronounced, easily felt during sleep and occasionally disrupting my rest. A more seamless design for these bumps would have been preferable.In conclusion, while the hybrid mattress offers stability and the desired firmness, the persisting pillowtop issues and the somewhat disruptive bumps leave room for improvement. Despite these drawbacks, the positive impact on my back pain and the cooler sleep experience make it a worthwhile investment.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

Its durable as well, theres no spring indents. Its great for back sleepers, but it feels comfortable enough when sleeping on the side. Two adults can sit on here without it indenting. Overall, this is great if youre looking for affordable, ready to use mattress. But if youre really looking for overall comfortability, then I'd suggest looking into a memory foam one. BUT if youre like me and dont care, as long as youre not sleeping on the floor, then this mattress is great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It'll Do", 'author': 'DK Cotton', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Just remove the plastic and roll it out... instructions says take 24-48 hours to fully decompress. My photos show it at 24 hours so am hoping another 24 hours will smooth out all the wrinkles and make it look less frumpy. The inner springs are definitely plastic, you can hear scrunchy plastic noises when sitting or laying on it and can slightly feel the springs so if you suffer from princess-and-the-pea syndrome it will definitely need an additional foam topper for best comfort. But then maybe that is also something another 24 hours will resolve.As it is I purchased it for a daybed in our spare room hoping it wouldn't be too soft for sitting on and comfortable enough for occasional use by my daughter and granddaughter when they visit. It seems firm enough to handle the sitting, time will tell on the sleeping.I will try to post an update if everything improves ... otherwise, for now, It'll Do.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for the money.', 'author': 'Mac', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought this for my daughter who has upgraded to a big girl bed. It’s not as firm as it says and not very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice mattress', 'author': 'PJ Hazel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered for my todders' floor bed. Great size, comfortable, easy to set up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just get it!', 'author': 'Cari', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I'm terrible about making decisions while shopping online. I looked for days at twin spring mattresses for a bunkbed going over reviews and everything for my two kids. I said whatever I'm just going with it, if not I'd never actually get it. They arrived today and I immediately opened both of them. They are great mattresses! I'm very happy with my purchase. Letting them sit for two days while waiting for the bunkbed to arrive. I believe it's going to be perfect for exactly what I wanted!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars for the price...', 'author': 'Evans', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Again, for the price, it\'s "good enough." Admittedly. I haven\'t slept on it without a 2" heavy foam mattress pad I already had. I think the pad though, has to make it a bit more comfortable but I don\'t think I\'ll ever know. It replaces a very thick SERTA Perfect Sleeper. I replaced it because the Chihuahuas are getting older and may soon have trouble jumping up there. They like to snuggle when I "cat-nap" there or they just sleep there when I\'m in the office. Someone mentioned unusual manufacturing odors, but I didn\'t detect anything unusual for a new mattress. I\'m reasonably picky about the "feel," smell, or comfort of a bed. Again, I have the mattress pad. It\'s comfortable and supportive enough for me to easily fall asleep. That\'s pretty much all I needed. I will say it\'s definitely not as quality built, as the one it replaces. But, that "top of the line" SERTA mattress was 3, 4 maybe 5 times more expensive. I\'d say it\'s fine for a child(s) or guest(s) room. (occasional use) If something changes, I\'ll certainly mention it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Quality for the Price!', 'author': 'Blake', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this for my almost 4 year old for her first bed other than her crib. I was a little worried as some of the reviews said that the mattress was really hard. We did not find that to be the case at all! This is a really good quality mattress for the price it is! It’s firm, yes, but not hard. I laid on it and I found it very comfortable and I normally sleep on a pillow-top mattress. My daughter loves it too. She sleeps so well on it! She falls asleep faster and has better quality sleep than she did on her crib mattress. We put a 1/2 inch foam topper on the mattress after a few nights just because we had one already but I don’t think the mattress needs it. Might be worth getting one if you like your mattresses softer but I definitely don’t think it’s too hard especially for little kids. A few reviews said that it didn’t inflate to its full size which we did not find to be the case either. It maybe took overnight to reach its FULL size after we opened it but it was ready to sleep on after only about an hour after opening. I’m really happy we purchased this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is an incredibly firm mattress and is not intended for adults', 'author': 'Wendy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We got this mattress for my five year old - he is comfortable on it but I tried to lay with him and could feel every spring. I wouldn't recommend this as a full time use mattress for anyone over maybe 65 ish lbs. It is very firm and wasn't super comfortable for me. I am going to get a foam topper to help add some softness. Overall I can't complain considering the price, but I will have to fork out more money for a thick topper so I almost wish I'd just gotten a better mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

That did not seem appealing to me at all. Also, some of the other memory foam products I have used, smelled unpleasant even after letting them air out and treating them with deodorizers. I have tried many memory foam pillows and seat cushions. Fortunately, this is not the case with this mattress. It does not feel like a giant sponge and smell terrible. The cooling effect is only temporary, because your body warms up the mattress gradually as you sleep. I found that rolling over every once and awhile it become cool again if you move some, which I do. If you like soft mattresses that you sink into, this is great. If you like firm mattresses, then this is not so great. Unfortunately, I wish the mattress to be more firm. Don't get me wrong, I have had some of the greatest sleep ever on this mattress. It does a great job of relieving pressure throughout my body, so I can relax, maybe a little to well. The size of the mattress fits perfectly for my bed. Also, it's definitely a very high quality material that hasn't shown any signs of wear after a month. This seems like it will last longer than old box spring mattress if it's cared for. The first one was king that was $450 dollars by a cooking brand.. This purchase is a Queen for $250 on sale.My first king mattress is a 5 star. It expanded to full, as advertised size in 24 hours. This one has not fully expanded and it has been 2 days. The mattress is also 1inch short of the 60inches in width that a Queen is supposed to be. Like other reviewers have said, this contains 1 inch of memory foam maybe two if I’m being generous. I am not a large person either. I wear a size medium shirt, i’m 5-10” 175lbs. This is an item I would pay $125-$150 if I intended to sleep on it daily. I can’t see this mattress lasting more than 12-18 months with out problems arising. I will be contacting the manufacturer and updating my review.Update 11/26. I have been in talks with the manufacturer and am I awaiting their reply. title: King Mattress, 14 Inch Hybrid Mattress in a Box, King Size Mattress with Gel Memory Foam and Individual Pocket Springs, Cooling Sleep & Pressure Relief, Plush Feel, 80"*76"*14"
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised! Great sleep and good value for the money!', 'author': 'Nan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Never having used one of these types of platform mattresses before, I was pleasantly surprised.It arrived vacuum seal packed in a 5\'3" tall x 11" wide, approximately 79 lbs in weight, box. There was help getting it inside to the bedroom where it was unfurled directly to the Amazon purchased, platform foundation.One thing I am disappointed with is I ordered a 12 inch and this is only 11 inches in height, and a little bit smaller than my 16" deep pocket, queen size sheet sets. I hemmed and hawed and read too many reviews, plus, asked around about these over the past couple of years to have a bit of an understanding and expectation of how these actually work before I finally ordered this well made one made by Dourxi.I was able to order ahead of time and lucky enough to let it expand for the Dourxi recommended,FULL THREE days, before trying it out.With that said, this is a VERY well made mattress from a box in my opinion! And, I would purchase Dourxi again based on my excellent sleep experience with this mattress.This is also well sewn with quality seams and trim.The casing is soft to touch but my mattress protector and sheets completely encase the beautiful material and trim so I don\'t understand why people talk about that.There was NO odor or ANY chemical smell that released from it at ALL.The box says \'natural and organic\', but I don\'t really know if that is true or not. What I do know is that it hasn\'t caused me any headaches, back, hips, or lupus flare ups.So far, my experience is it\'s very comfortable sleeping on it.I ordered the plush medium soft and it\'s exactly what I wanted.I do not like firm, hard, or full sinking into, memory foam mattresses. I have previously had and slept on well known Casper, Denver, Serta, Sleep by Number, etc. and those hurt my back and hips.Plus, I couldn\'t afford thousands of dollars to hit or miss this time around.So far, this plush medium soft Dourxi is a very comfortable experience for me andmy troublesome back and hips to sleep on.Amazon also had this one on an affordable deal, andI am VERY glad I ordered it!So, if you like a plush medium soft pain free, good night\'s sleep experience, I would highly recommend getting this affordable well made Dourxi mattress!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect firmness and great value!', 'author': 'Jennifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this mattress had it the third day. I am going to use the seller’s recommendation and wait the full 72 hours before sleeping on it but I did sneak a little test lay and I have to say for the price of this mattress I am pleasantly surprised.
