title: Full Mattress,10 Inch Hybrid Mattress with Gel Memory Foam,Motion Isolation Individually Wrapped Pocket Coils Mattress,Fits All Bed Frames Mattress,Medium Firm Feel Mattresses
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars For the price, this is excellent', 'author': 'mammasteed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So, this is the first time I\'ve ever purchased a cheap mattress. I am the girl who usually buys the mattresses that are several thousand dollars.So, anyway, I did not know what to expect with this. I didn\'t even get to test it in advance. I just took a gamble and tried it.Well. So, it came in a box that was plenty tall, but way too, well, narrow. My first thought was, what the hell? My second thought was, that can\'t be the mattress, can it? Well, yes, it is.What I learned was that somehow or other, probably using dark magic or something, they deflated it and rolled it up to get it into the box. They also sealed it into plastic.Well, this is extremely convenient for getting the mattress into the room you want. It is a lot easier to maneuver this rolled-up mattress than it is to maneuver a queen-sized mattress.That said, this mattress is extremely heavy. I needed two people to lift it - not because it\'s bulky, which of course it is because it\'s a mattress, but because of the weight. That is definitely an issue for someone who lives alone, or someone who lives in a household where one (or even zero) people cannot manage very heavy things. If you are in this situation, plan to get someone to help you move it, or else it will be decorating your porch or entryway for a while until you figure that bit out.I have no clue why it is so heavy. Other mattresses are not this heavy... at least, I\'ve never had one anywhere near this heavy before. It is baffling.But, anyway. At least it is easier to navigate through doorways than a fully-inflated mattress, because it is rolled up. Make use of that bonus.Once you get the mattress to where you want it to go, you release it from the plastic. They warn you to step back when you do this, and they are not kidding. It was like my mattress suddenly gasped for a breath of air, and its "lungs" expanded.That said, they ALSO tell you to wait 72 hours after it begins the inflation process. This, too, they are not kidding about. The mattress continued to inflate, slowly but surely, for at least that amount of time.It is my understanding that you absolutely should not use it, even so much as doing a test-sit, until the mattress is done inflating. It is my understanding that if you do, you can prevent the mattress from fully inflating (ever), and thereby have a less-than-stellar mattress which is awful and lumpy and thin (at least in some spots). Well, I did not test that theory. I closed the door to my room to make sure even the dogs and cats did not sit on it until it was done inflating. I would strongly suggest you do the same, if you want this mattress to be the best it can be in the end.Obviously, that creates a short-term problem. WHERE do you let this mattress inflate? You could put it on your bedframe, but if you do (and it\'s not a new guest bed or some such), then where do you sleep for 3 or 4 nights? You could put it on the floor NEXT to your bed, but that takes up a lot of floor space. And, too, if you have kids or pets, or even if you\'re just clumsy, you run the risk of someone stepping on it while it\'s inflating. So, basically, I think most people will find that it disrupts your household quite a lot for that time period.Well, then, you\'re asking, why do I still give it a good star rating? Well, see, now, that issue is temporary. Yes, it\'s a pretty big, pretty annoying issue. But, once it is finally done inflating, it\'s done. You have your mattress then. Problem over.And, yes, the quality of the mattress once you finally can lie on it is good. Very good.No, it doesn\'t compare to the luxury of a multi-thousand dollar mattress. I would be lying through my teeth if I said it did. The super-expensive mattress is definitely better.But for the price you pay, this mattress is AMAZING. It\'s pretty comfortable. It cradles your body a bit while you sleep.I admit... I haven\'t had it long enough to know if the greatness lasts. But it is pretty great so far.I also will say that you do sort of sink in a bit more than you might be used to with more traditional mattresses. As a side effect, the mattress gives you a bit warmer sleep than a regular mattress. If you are a cold person when you sleep, you will probably find this a bonus. It\'s like an underneath blanket snuggling you, sort of, kind of. But if you sleep hot and find yourself kicking blankets off in the middle of the night, then you will probably find this a minus.I do wonder if that makes this bed somewhat better in winter and somewhat worse in summer. Well, I\'ll find out in time, for sure.It is my understanding that this type of bed is supposed to be a good bed for about 5 years, maybe a bit less. So, if you are seeking a bed that will last 10, 20, 30 years, nope, this is not it. But it is a very affordable option that will get you a really nice bed right now. And if you don\'t need or want that sort of longevity in a mattress, then this might be exactly what you are looking for.I\'m not looking forward to hauling it out when its lifespan is done, on the theory that it will be as heavy then as it was when we moved in it... but that\'s a future problem.Count me a happy customer who is sleeping just fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and affordable', 'author': 'Cynthia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve never tried a hybrid mattress, but I needed a new bed set so I ordered this 12" queen size mattress. It arrived in a large cardboard box, a heavy box, so I knew it would substantive. I followed the opening instructions carefully. It came fully compressed inside a heavy plastic sheath. I opened the sheath first, then unrolled the inner plastic , which contained my mattress. A small opening tool was included, basically a letter opener type thing, and slit open the final packaging. As soon as it got some air, it started to expand. It was very quick and easy, and within a couple minutes it was nearly fully decompressed. I was expecting a stale-air plastic smell and was pleasantly surprised that there was none. After letting the bed "grow" for a couple days, I put it to the test. Wow! Very comfortable! The inner springs provide plenty of support and the foam top provides the soft comfort I like. The fabric seems durable and the size is as advertised. I\'ve been able to sleep on it for a week and I\'ve slept better and longer than on my old mattress. I\'ve already recommended it to family and friends. So far, a very good purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I expected for this price range', 'author': 'Spacen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Mattresses are very personal items with a wide range of preferences. Therefore, I am going to try to give you the facts more so than my personal opinion. First, some background. My wife and I have slept on an expensive Tempurpedic mattress for the past for the past 12 years which we purchased for $3,000 at the time. We purchased this queen mattress for $200 with the coupon that was available at the time of purchase. The tempurpedic has begun to sag and we are considering upgrading to a king so we thought we'd buy a cheaper mattress for now until we decide if we are going to make the upgrade. All of this is to say that our expectations are different than if we were coming off a mattress in the same price range.We received this in a much smaller box than I anticipated. When I first rolled it out while still sealed up, it was barely thicker than a rug. Once I broke the seal and the air came in, it expanded to its full size. We let it rest for 72 hours as recommended.I have spent several nights on this mattress now and can say that it is very supportive. My back had started to hurt on the tempurpedic because of the sag. I weigh 230 lbs so back support is very important to me. This mattress is on the firm side so it is good for back and tummy sleepers. This supports my back very well and my back pain has eased since we got it. I expect it will soften a bit after a few weeks of use, but I am not sure given I have never had a hybrid mattress before.One thing I am not used to yet is the softness of the edge of the mattress when I am sitting on the edge of the bed. It compresses a lot more than my old one which is to be expected. Anywhere other than the edge is pretty evenly firm. I do like the divot pattern in the top cushion because it allows air to circulate. This is helpful on warmer nights.Overall, this is a great mattress for this price range, much better than I expected, honestly. When I compare this to what I have seen and tested out at the local brick and mortar store at the same price point, I think this one is much better.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks fine, haven’t slept on it.', 'author': 'Kyle James', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have sat on and laid on the bed and it feels like it is comfortable enough. I needed an affordable mattress for my guest bedroom and this seemed like a decent deal. I haven’t slept on it, but it does not feel like it would be a bad sleep.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This Mattress is Fantastic!', 'author': 'J Kim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Mubulily 12-inch Memory Foam Mattress, and it has been an absolute game-changer for my sleep quality. I cannot express enough how impressed I am with this mattress.First and foremost, the construction feels solid and durable, and the stitching is flawless. Additionally, the mattress comes with a 10-year warranty, which is a testament to the manufacturer's confidence in their product.Another standout feature is the motion isolation. My partner's movements during the night no longer disturb my sleep, thanks to the individually wrapped coils that absorb and minimize motion transfer. It's truly a blessing for light sleepers or those who share their bed with a restless partner.Setting up the mattress was a breeze. It arrived conveniently compressed in a box, and once unboxed and placed on the bed frame, it expanded to its full size within a few hours. No hassle, no fuss!Overall, I highly recommend the Mubulily 12-inch Memory Foam Mattress to anyone in search of a luxurious and supportive sleep experience. Its combination of comfort, cooling technology, and durability make it worth every penny. Trust me, you won't be disappointed with this purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Dreamy Oasis of Comfort !', 'author': 'Nicole Doyle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently bought and had the pleasure of experiencing the Mubulily Queen 10-Inch Hybrid Mattress with Gel Memory Foam, and I must say, it has completely transformed my sleep experience. This mattress combines the best of both worlds - the support of a hybrid mattress and the plushness of gel memory foam.First and foremost, let's talk about the heavenly comfort this mattress provides. The gel memory foam layer contours to my body, cradling every curve and relieving pressure points. It feels like sleeping on a cloud, ensuring a restful and rejuvenating sleep every night. The medium-firmness level strikes the perfect balance between softness and support, allowing me to sink in just enough without feeling like I'm being swallowed by the mattress.One of the standout features of this mattress is its hybrid design. The combination of individually wrapped coils and the gel memory foam layer provides exceptional support and motion isolation. No more disturbances from my partner's restless tossing and turning during the night! The coils also promote airflow, preventing heat from getting trapped and keeping me cool throughout the night.In terms of convenience, the Mubulily Queen 10-Inch Hybrid Mattress comes compressed and rolled in a compact box, making it easy to transport and set up. Once unboxed, it expands and regains its full shape within a few hours, ready to provide a luxurious sleeping experience.In conclusion, if you're in search of a mattress that combines unparalleled comfort, support, and durability, I highly recommend the Mubulily Queen 10-Inch Hybrid Mattress with Gel Memory Foam. It has truly transformed my sleep routine and made every night a blissful experience. Say goodbye to restless nights and hello to the luxurious comfort of the Mubulily mattress!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality & comfy queen mattress in compact box, so convenient!!', 'author': 'Nicole', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was looking for a queen mattress that would be delivered right to my door. I remember the days when I would need to rent a big truck to fit a big mattress in it and what a pain it was to get it up the stairs, especially a few flights up in a tight hallway! I ordered this mattress with Amazon Prime and it was here in 2 days, it doesn't get more convenient than that! The box was compact considering how big a queen mattress is! It will be easier if you have 2 people to bring it in and up the stairs, the box is about 70 lbs. I unpacked the mattress and gave it about 3 days to decompress before I slept on it. Overall I'm very happy with it!! The gel memory foam is very comfortable, the material is nice, and it looks well made and modern. I love that it gives me support but that it's not overly firm, I didn't want it to be hard as a rock. I would say it's somewhere between plush and firm which is perfect for me. I've dealt with back pain and sleeping on this has been great, it's almost like the mattress relieves pressure because it conforms to my body (even when I'm tossing and turning some nights). I've been sleeping very well on it so I'm very happy with my purchase, especially for the great price!! I also love that the company gives 100 days to try it out, as well as a 10 year warranty. So worth trying it out, nothing to lose and only good sleep to gain!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome bed!', 'author': 'LiLi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is exactly what I was looking for. The comfort ability is outstanding, and I love that it’s high, not a small dinky bed. The price is just right also', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars New Mattress', 'author': 'Sha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been looking for a mattress for a long time it was time to get rid of my old one I shopped around for the longest reading different reviews I really wanted a 14 inch but settled with a 10 inch and I’m glad I did cause I love it the mattress came just as expected and I also had help bringing up I live on the 4th floor it was easy to take out the box and remove the plastic set up was great and the mattress is very comfortable and great for my back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's a good bed!", 'author': 'Amanda Marie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Its a good bed, my son loves it. It inflated to the size it was supposed to. It's comfortable, soft and firm in ways you'd expect it to be. It does not have side support. It's good for a kids bed, or guest bed, but for full time adult use I would get something else.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Leesa Original Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Springs/CertiPUR-US Certified /100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous out of the Box!', 'author': 'Mollie MaKay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all it’s beautiful! Came right out of the box fluffed up!! It’s the perfect firmness and softness! I had ordered a nectar that was awful. I was falling off the mattress but this is a dream! I can’t believe how wonderful this is!! Exactly what I was hoping for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars DANGEROUSLY COMFORTABLE', 'author': 'anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If I could get paid to just lay in this bed all day...... I probably would.... It's SO COMFORTABLE, I worry sometimes I'm sleeping too much! Didn't have this problem with any mattress in the past... Also it is amazing at absorbing shock! Like if i set a glass of wine on it and lay down near the glass, it doesn't tip over! I love this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every cent', 'author': 'Major_Chunks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my 2nd Leesa and once again im really pleased with the whole process and product. Medium firm and conforming. Super comfortable and a great nights sleep', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Cured my jaw, neck pain!', 'author': 'Lydia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I didn’t buy this mattress with the intention of resolving my TMJ, but by the second night it was gone! Must be the head and neck support that was missing with my old mattress!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars This mattress causes significant back pain', 'author': 'Justin Sorensen', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I was hoping for a supportive mattress that offers a comfortable nights' sleep. However after a month of sleeping on this mattress, I was in significant pain. The mattress offers little to no lumbar support. With two people on the mattress the mattress caves in on itself. If you need back support please do not buy this mattress", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced a firm mattress', 'author': 'Mark Schilling', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got one for my teenage son to replace a firm mattress. He says that he sleeps so much better now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This mattress is not 60" wide', 'author': 'Apple', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'So disappointed with this mattress. I had read all the great reviews and the recommendation from wirecutter.1) The mattress is not 60" wide as indicated, the mattress is out of square and it less than 59" at the ends. This leaves a gap on the bed frame, also queen size sheets are too big for it it slips and slides.2) You can feel the springs protruding on the side of mattress (on all 4 sides).3) The edges are super soft and the mattress cover is too big for the mattress so it slips when you try to stand up. If you any disability sitting up you won\'t have any thing to help stabilize you.I bought this mattress from Amazon and not from Leesa directly. That\'s my mistake for trusting that Amazon will honor the same return options. Returning through amazon was to complicated so now I\'m stuck with it. What a waste of money as I will have to get a new mattress soon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and good level of firmness', 'author': 'Nish', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good edge support, firm, and comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not great', 'author': 'Rhiannon Marshall', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'We had to return an extremely uncomfortable a firm bed from another company before trying this Leesa. I was nervous because the last one was so awful. Initially, it seemed this was better, and it is a bit. Unfortunately it’s not comfortable as all the reviews have raved. I can’t see going a month of being in extra pain and unable to sleep to see if it adjusts to you. You can feel the coils on the sides of the mattress. It is a bit bouncy but not in any way that provides comfort. It’s too firm, after just a few days coils squeak, no cooling or softness. Even with an additional pad it’s just too hard.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'Pamela J. Trinch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had my Leesa original hybrid for 3 years and it is as comfortable now as it was brand new. I love it. Great value for a great product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Leesa Sapira Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen Size, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Spring / CertiPUR-US Certified / 100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional mattress', 'author': 'Innovator', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Yes, it\'s a tad firmer than I was used to, but the back and edge support this hybrid mattress offers are exceptional, eliminating the back pain I had with my previous memory foam-only mattress. The build quality and luxurious materials used are high grade. Overall, the Sapira is a class act.Day 1: The mattress arrives in a tall square-box, about 2x2x4. I attached a photo of what the mattress looks like compressed inside the box. Upon placing the mattress on my boxspring, I cut the plastic off and the bed immediately sprung to life, literally, as the coils decompressed. Yes, there is a noticeable off-gassing smell, but it\'s not offensive. I left my window open at night, and 90% of the smell was gone by the next morning.Day 2: At first, the mattress was a bit firm, but after about 24-36 hours the mattress had fully decompressed and was much more comfortable. It\'s probably a 6.5/7 out of 10 on the firmness scale, the way most online professional mattress websites suggest. The top Avena foam layer sleeps cool, so I don\'t overheat. The bounce the Avena foam + the pocketed coils provide makes moving around, and getting out of bed effortless. The off-gassing smell is just about gone now.Day 3: Decided to get rid of my old mattress and keep the Sapira. I sleep mostly on my back, but sometimes on my side and stomach throughout the night. The only sleep position I thought wasn\'t going to work out was the side position, because of the firmness, but the 3 inches of Avena + memory foam actually provide just enough sinkage, while keeping my spine aligned. The off-gassing smell is completely gone now. I bought a mattress protector, and then my bed sheet goes over that to complete the package.When I bought this mattress last Sunday, there were 20 left in stock with Amazon. As of this morning, only 9 Queen-size beds were left in stock, while some sizes other than Queen were already out of stock. So clearly word is getting out about this mattress. At $1,325, it\'s also a lot less expensive than every other hybrid mattress on the market, most of which will cost at least $2,000 more than this one, and will require you going to a showroom, and taking time off work to be home for delivery.In conclusion, I highly recommend this mattress. Please feel free to ask me any direct questions on here. Also, if you have time, I recommend reading the review on Sleepopolis, as it\'s the most comprehensive professional review that matches my own experience.Update: although I bought a Claritin mattress protector, and although when I called Sapira customer service they recommended having one too, I removed it on Day 4. It added a "plastic" feel to the surface of the bed that became unbearable. Once I removed it, that initial softness I experienced on Day 1 came back again. I only intend to use just my bedsheet from here on out. I recommend you do the same.((On a side note, I suggest ignoring the only other two reviews on here, both two stars. Unlike myself, neither one is a confirmed buyer of this product. The first review is too short to be real for a legitimate mattress evaluation by an actual customer. The fact that this mattress has the firmness rating it does shows the Sapira is designed for superior back support, so the reviewer\'s complaint is illogical. The second review is also partially off topic, as they discuss the manufacturers\'s website, which has nothing to do with how the mattress feels. Yes, they are correct the mattress is a little firm, but every other online review already confirms this. So to slam the product with only two stars for performing how it was designed is unfair.))', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good quality and definitely med firm', 'author': 'KC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slept on this mattress now for a week and am very pleased with its level of firmness. I prefer firm (side and stomach sleeper) and this is definitely medium firm and I feel supported when side sleeping. I'm using an adjustable base (Lucid - highly recommend) and have it in up position frequently and it retains its shape . The only downside is that the edges are soft which makes it hard to sit on the edge, but I knew that when I bought it. So far I have no regrets with the Leesa Sapira.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress!', 'author': 'Donna S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this mattress. Needed a replacement for my 15-year old Therapedic. Took a chance on this highly rated product and have not been disappointed. It feels as good as my Therapedic. Soft and firm. Relieves my back and hip pain (I’m a side sleeper.) And it was HALF THE PRICE of a new Therapedic. I would recommend this mattress to all former Therapedic owners.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Feels comfortable but produces me back pain. Reimbursed by Amazon', 'author': 'Juan Diego Barco', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'When I lay in this mattress is soft and feels good. However, I always get up with back pain and I never suffered from back pain in my life.I have been trying to return the mattress for more than 2 months without sucess. As the mattress is unboxed, UPS will not allow pick it up.I have talked with several Amazon representatives but they have only forwared my petition and at the end they have not solved it.Update:After several calls and weeks trying to return the mattress, finally Amazon decided to reimburse me the full amount I payed. At the end they were cooperative,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Needed to try - not THE BEST but good', 'author': 'KayDawg', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Heard rave reviews and was inundated with social media ads after looking Leesa up online while mattress shopping, so the Hybrid won out for, well, being a hybrid and because Leesa is a B Corp.Queen mattress on a slatted platform frame without a box spring.It's really soft - softer than I expected it to be for a hybrid, and you can feel the springs on the edges and right through the side of the mattress. But good for stomach/side sleepers and can be good for back sleepers if you don't already have a lumbar spine issue, IMO.My friend had one that I spent just one night on and I don't remember hers being this soft. Will the softness dissipate over time?I'm afraid I overpaid for something that won't last up to the standard 8-10 years since it's already soft and I can feel the springs. We'll know more when we get to the 100 days of trial (it's only been 30)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’m a new person.', 'author': 'Chelsea Breza-Berndt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, I’m not a product reviewer. I generally ignore any and all opportunities to write product reviews. But I felt the Leesa Hybrid was deserving of my time to write a review.We had been searching for a mattress for a couple years, mainly paralyzed by the fear of not liking whatever we decided to buy. Our old pillow top was about 9 years old and at 28 years old I was starting to understand how boomers feel when they wake up in the morning.We tried the Leesa in person at a local store and were sold, but Amazon had by far the best deal we could find.My boyfriend likes firm mattresses, but I’m 5’ 2” and 130 lbs so we needed to find a balance between firm and too firm. The nice part about the Leesa is the memory foam top, so you get a softer feel while still enjoying a medium firm mattress. It’s even perfect for my lighter body weight and the boyfriend thinks the firmness is satisfactory too. We are both happy.The one thing that has taken some getting used to is it sleeping cooler. We’ve had to play with the thermostat in the house a bit since our previous mattress slept so hot.However the most striking thing is the GREAT SLEEP AND TOTAL AND COMPLETE LACK OF BACK PAIN!!!! I would recommend this mattress to anyone!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Was nervous ordering online!', 'author': 'R. Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so nervous ordering a mattress online. I had been able to try the mattress at a local store that carries the brand. Their delivery time was out 4 weeks. Amazon offered a discount and delivery was a few days out from the order date.I purchased a platform bed and it was recommended that I get a 9-11 inch high mattress. I like pillow top mattress especially. Not really available in the 9-11 inch range.I love this mattress! So comfortable and just soft enough for my liking. Very supportive yet comfortable. I am so happy that I picked this brand. Lessa is not as advertised as others, but well worth a look when thinking of spending a couple thousand dollars on a new mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really excellent', 'author': 'Jenna.Leann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have had this mattress since July of 2018 and still love it. My husband prefers a slightly softer mattress, I prefer firm, and neither of us have any complaints. I am generally a side sleeper, no issues there.We have a king and I really wanted a mattress with good edge support and this one definitely does. It makes the mattress feel larger to us. Right now there’s three of us sharing this bed (us plus our 18 month old) and I love that the mattress is firm enough for us to feel safe having our son sleep with us. We all have our own space and never wake up sore.My husband has had two of his buddies buy this mattress and they were also happy with it (plus their wives). I also love that it’s a hybrid, full memory foam isn’t my thing and this just seems durable. Negative reviews on this mattress genuinely surprised me. Maybe we aren’t picky because neither of us have any back issues, but we sleep so much better than we did before!Mattresses are such a personal preference and I know it’s risky to order online, but this one is a pretty safe choice in my opinion (unless you prefer soft mattresses).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Painful Sleeping Experience But Amazon Honored Their Refund Policy', 'author': 'New Homeowner', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I really hoped this mattress would work for me, given all the positive reviews and ratings it\'s gotten from reputable (?) national media outlets, but it turned out awful for me. Maybe because my body is just too used to the firmness and bounce of inner spring mattresses, this memory foam hybrid caused pain in my back and hips so bad that I never slept through the night during the trial period. Some reviews say this mattress is too firm, but I found it too soft. Lying on my back, I could feel my butt sink down into the foam a good 3 inches; lying on my side, my hips would also sink down that far, pulling my spine out of alignment. Yes, the memory foam "bounced" back to normal once I got up, but that didn\'t help while I was lying down! Also, as someone used to moving around easily on an inner spring, moving around on this mattress also created pain in my back and sides since the memory foam basically "immobilizes" you.To Amazon\'s credit, they issued a full refund when I requested it, efficiently and quickly without making me go through a lot of paperwork or red tape.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Arrived mishappen.', 'author': 'Kathleen M. Sheehan', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'As shown in the attached photo, the mattress was narrower on the bottom than on the top at one end. This was the case on both sides of the mattress at that end. Thus, the mattress does not come to the edge of the foundation at this end. This defect may have been due to the mattress being compressed for shipping causing a permanent distortion in its shape. This was my first time purchasing a mattress that is shipped this way, so I do not know whether this is a common problem. I plan to replace with a mattress that is not compressed for shipping. Other than this defect, the mattress seems to be as advertised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Jenna 14” Innerspring and Memory Foam Queen Mattress With Individually Encased Coils, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very firm, but not hard - comfortable and supportive even for big people', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is for the 14 inch Queen. Like most reviews about this mattress here, including mine, they are from someone who hasn\'t had this mattress very long, so I will be updating this from time to time. It\'s easy to say it is nice and comfortable when it\'s new, but how does it hold up over time is important to know so updates will be coming to this review from time to time.Pros:Shipping was right on time and it was packaged carefully and received in great condition. We received it on Thursday and put it on the bed and unwrapped it as soon as we got it. There was no odor or chemical smell of any kind right out of the box. We let it expand for more than 48 hours before sleeping on it Saturday, or last night. The mattress is very firm with a plush topper on it. It\'s very firm but not hard. I had the best nights sleep last night that I\'ve had in a very long time last night thanks to this mattress. It is very supportive and comfortable. I am a side sleeper that turns frequently and I found myself turning last night much less than I usually do. We are coming off a twelve year old 10 inch Serta mattress and I am pleased as punch that we went with the 14 inch mattress this time. I\'m really impressed with how tall it is. As a big and tall person, the height makes is real easy to get in and out of.Cons:None yetOther information:I am a big person, 6\'3" and 330#. My wife is pretty small, about 5\'3" and 135#. After the first night her opinion is that she was comfortable on it and slept better than she has in a while. It may actually prove to be a bit firm for a smaller person or for someone who doesn\'t care for a firm mattress, , but for me, I am very surprised and happy with how well it supports me. Again, it is very firm but not hard - very supportive. The topper adds just the right amount of plush softness on top where we lie. When either of us move or roll on our side, the other person doesn\'t feel it on their side.Recommendation:If you are a big or tall or heavy person and need a firm mattress, or just someone whole prefers a firm mattress, I recommend this one in the 14 inch height. The 14 inch height is well worth the additional cost over the 10 inch in my opinion. I also recommend for the 14 inch mattress that you let it expand 48 hours before sleeping on it. The website recommends 24 hours, but I can tell you that after the initial 24 hour period, ours expanded another several inches over the second 24 hour period. Give it 48 hours to expand before sleeping on it, you will be glad you did.11-26-2019 UPDATEHave slept on the mattress 10 nights now. No change in opinion, 5 stars...12-18-2019 UPDATEWe\'ve been sleeping on this bed for a month now and still loving it. The past week has been with our little grandson sleeping with us.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just WOW! Never imagined a 14" bed-in-a-box for under $250 could be this comfortable.', 'author': 'MomtoBoys', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE FEB 2024: Mattress is still going strong. It has been moved home and then back up to another apartment. We were able to fold it in half and hold it with ratchet tie straps in order to transport it in a SUV. It does take at least 2 people and ratchet ties to get it folded top to bottom ends. Surprisingly, folding didn’t negatively affect the mattress. It easily went back to its normal shape.So I bought this mattress for my son\'s bed at his college apartment. I wasn\'t sure what to expect, but I have been pleasantly surprised. He says that it is very comfortable and he sleeps well on it. The mattress pairs nicely with the ZINUS Judy Upholstered Platform Bed Frame / Mattress Foundation / Wood Slat Support / No Box Spring Needed / Easy Assembly, Full (and no box spring needed). I do recommend going with 14" mattress because I think the thicker the mattress, the more comfortable it is. My only complaint/issue with this mattress is that if you sit on the edge, you are going to slide off because there isn\'t much support along the edges (as you would see with a $1000 coil mattress). But for only costing $250 and arriving condensed in a box that allowed it to be easily put in an SUV and transported up to school, I can\'t complain. We were originally looking at mattresses at C*stc*, but this was about half the price and fit inside the SUV. It did expand to its almost full-size within minutes of removing it from the plastic, and had minimal (if any) odor. I did immediately place the mattress in a Four Seasons Full Size Mattress Protector Bedbug Waterproof Zippered Cover Hypoallergenic Premium Quality Encasement (which I also recommend.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Good night's sleep", 'author': 'Roger Goodwell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I went into a store and the guy actually recommended I buy a bed from Amazon. I never thought about doing this because I didn't know how it would be shipped.Surprisingly, they had compacted the bed really well into this vacuum seal. I let the bed to rest for about 36 hours for it to fully come into shape.It's been about 1.5 years I had this bed with no issues so far. The bed has a nice consistency of being soft, but the springs hold up support well so you dont feel like your sinking into the bed.Im not sure how the springs may last long term but it's been well so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars For the price, it seems like a good mattress', 'author': 'babette', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The mattress is very comfortable if your not by the edge. There isn’t many support springs around the perimeter, so when you sit or lay on the edges it sinks. However if you stay away from the edges it is very comfortable and has support.After unwrapping the mattress, which took me (I’m a 57 year old woman) only 15 minutes from start to finish, it reached 12 out of the 14 inches. It’s a really nice looking mattress. Never ordered a mattress out of a box before. I live in an apartment and when it was delivered it was dropped off in the foyer. Didn’t even press the buzzer to let me know it was there. I found it by accident. It was a very heavy box I couldn’t move to my apartment myself. Had to borrow a dolly to move it before it was stolen.Other than that, it would be good for a kids room/ dorm or guest room.It’s a good mattress for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely buy!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update May 16, 2020It’s been officially over a year we’ve had this mattress for our little one. We LOVE it! It’s comfortable for her and me. We haven’t had any sagging. It’s still in its original shape. It’s excellent support. We will definitely be buying more in the future as we have to buy multiple new beds.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars You can’t beat it for the price', 'author': 'Brittany Dunn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this mattress for $430. It’s very comfortable and my husband and I have almost no back pain upon waking up anymore. I will say I can feel movement more so with this bed when my husband turns over but it’s not a lot. It was super simple to open. Just pull the plastic off and let it rise. We opened it and it inflated almost fully immediately. I let it continue to inflate for almost two days and if you measure from the poofiness of the bottom and the top it’s about 13 inches but I ordered the 14 inch. That’s not a big deal for us. Everything feels just fine. You can see in the pictures that all the corners didn’t fully untuck but again it’s not a big deal for me. You really can’t beat this bed for around $500. I obviously could go spend a thousand dollars and probably get a better one but I’m cheap. If you’re reading this, you’re cheap also. That’s why we’re buying a bed in a box from Amazon. So really this is a great deal even with minor appearance issues.Also, there is a smell it has when you first open it. You’ll smell it for hours if not a day. The cooling effect is only temporary, because your body warms up the mattress gradually as you sleep. I found that rolling over every once and awhile it become cool again if you move some, which I do. If you like soft mattresses that you sink into, this is great. If you like firm mattresses, then this is not so great. Unfortunately, I wish the mattress to be more firm. Don't get me wrong, I have had some of the greatest sleep ever on this mattress. It does a great job of relieving pressure throughout my body, so I can relax, maybe a little to well. The size of the mattress fits perfectly for my bed. Also, it's definitely a very high quality material that hasn't shown any signs of wear after a month. This seems like it will last longer than old box spring mattress if it's cared for. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Was Apprehensive but Extremely Happy!', 'author': 'Kyndley R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased a full size memory foam mattress and was actually surprised on how well that turned out that I decided to try a King Size Memory Foam mattress for my guest room. title: Twin Mattress 12 Inch - Medium Firm Gel Memory Foam - Cooling Comfort Technology - 365-Night Trial - Forever Warranty ,White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'Ana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I went from a king to a twin bed. Searched for a while until I found this one. It came in a box right to my front door. I was able to bring it inside by myself, im 64 yrs old. It was easy to open and place on my bed frame. It was completely done fluffing up by bedtime. When I laid down on my bed it was soft, cradles your body. I loved it, but....when I went to turn around, I had some trouble. Your sunk into the mattress. Not sunk in like the mattress just swallowed you whole but with my bad back, it was tough trying to turn over. After giving the mattress 1 week for me to get use to it, I loved it. The only thing I do regret is not getting the mattress cover that keeps your body cool. I do get hot under the covers some nights which I never have done with spring mattresses. It's really good in the winter because it will keep you warm, but in the summer, you'll wish you got the mattress cover. I have no regrets buying this mattress other than the mattress cover. I will probably end up going back and getting it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfortable', 'author': 'Frank Walls', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mattress has been great so far! Highly recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Needs time to fully "set", little side support', 'author': 'Daniel T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "what others have said is true; if you try to sleep on this the first night, you're going to be disappointed - it will be like sinking into a cloud. It’s perfect!', 'author': 'Cori Hicks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We’ve had this mattress out for almost 72 hours with 2 nights of sleep. Was not impressed.#1 our mattress never went to its full size. Even after NUMEROUS pillows, there is just no support, especially since the mattress never evened out.3. The last 2 nights of sleeping on this mattress, I’ve awaken with pain in one of my legs. (I have to sleep on my side to breastfeed and I alternate throughout the night). And the pain hasn’t died down. This mattress was advertised to ease pain, not cause it- but I’m having the opposite effect.Ultimately, we will be trying to return this ASAP.Update!: we decided to keep it a little longer and allow it to shape/form correctly.We placed it on an actual bed support and it was immediately a change for the better. I’m not sure if all the cushion on carpeted floor was the reason, but it was night & day after putting it on a platform bed.Super comfortable, and the movement doesn’t effect everyone sleeping in the bed. Reminds me of that wine commercial mattress. I haven’t done wine, but I’ve done a glass of water and it held place while I got off the bed. It hugs your body without making you feel like you’re sinking into the mattress. Super comfortable & the mattress shaped itself out in a few days after my initial review.No body pains, better sleep, and even my husband doesn’t snore as much or as loud when he does snore. Definitely such a difference from when he falls asleep on the couch watching tv. SO grateful we gave it time & kept it! Definitely a gem for a fraction of the cost of other mattresses. 💯', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thinking about this mattress?', 'author': 'Lacey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old mattress was over 10+ years old. So I went back and forth about if I take the risk and order something like a mattress online that I can’t try, or spend the 2k plus for one that I know I like.I took the gamble because we don’t have that kind of money.I was soooo scared. Being disabled, if this didn’t work… I would be in a world of hurt. Literally. When it came, my anxiety got worse.Out of the box and cut open it began to expand fast! I was so surprised. Shipping packaging: arrived in cardboard box. Inside, mattress is vacuum-compressed within thick, clear plastic. It is rather heavy (70+ lbs) for its boxed size, so have help ready to lift, etc.2. Unboxing: make sure your bed frame is ready, before opening the plastic vacuum wrap! Once the seal is broken, it expands quite rapidly, and is unwieldy.3. Expansion: 3-5 hours minimum is recommended (by manufacturer). We allotted about 7 hours, before we slept on it, and it seemed OK. There was little to no odor.4. Initial sleep: of course, any new mattress requires a bit of “getting used to”. First sensation when laying upon it is one of slight envelopment. It does feel a slightly warmer, than any previous mattress, but this is easily adapted. Rolling over does take considerably more effort, but due to the comfort level, we found ourselves rolling much less often.6. Incidentals: There is little edge support, with this mattress. If you frequently sit on the edge of your bed, you may find this awkward or challenging. As this type is less rigid than a traditional mattress, moving it around (to do periodic rotation, for example) is more laborious – almost a “dead weight” experience.7. Overall impressions: We are pleased. So far, this seems to be a cost-effective, convenient, expedient means to a new, comfortable mattress. (comments may be amended, as time progresses)Gave 4 stars simply & solely because we have not owned very long.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Cost/Benefit', 'author': 'Frederico Moreira', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Product was delivered on Saturday.The unboxing process was really simple. title: 14 Inch Queen Mattress – Plush Memory Foam Mattress – Bamboo Charcoal Foam – Gel Infused – Hypoallergenic Foam Mattress– Bed-In-A-Box- CertiPUR-US Certified,White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fibromyalgia vs Lucid: An in-depth review', 'author': 'Sunshine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Note to reader: This is an in depth review. I hope it helps in your search.For about a year, I have been conducting online research on mattresses waiting for the day when we could finally purchase new mattresses. I concluded that Talalay latex would likely be the best since I have a severe case of fibromyalgia. We went to our local mattress store to try one out. The three layer wasn’t soft enough. The four layer was better but not “it.” However, anything was a vast improvement on our now 16 year old mattress with its his and her respective ditches. I planned to buy online, but out of curiosity I asked the clerk how much it cost. Good thing we both were lying down at the time. Over $3500! Online prices started around $1500, much better but still a crazy price to me as I would need to add a foundation, sheets, etc. and do that times two since my husband and I sleep in separate bedrooms out of physical necessity. I figured we needed to save at least $4,000 for both of us to get new mattresses, which I could not wrap my head, nor my budget around.Six months later, my body was screaming for a new mattress. One day, we stopped at a different mattress shop to try out a memory foam mattress. I preferred the feel of the memory foam to the latex. Again, I asked how much. Again, we were glad we were lying down. They were having a sale: Queen size reduced from $1800 to $1299. I calculated about $3000++ for both of us to get fully situated, which was still a crazy price. I returned home and started round two of research.I searched “mattress” and “fibromyalgia” to help narrow my search. I went to Amazon and found Lucid and reviewed all of their mattresses. I watched a YouTube video about the 14 inch gel foam memory mattress by Goodbeds.com (I also watched Goodbeds video reviews of competitors) and felt that the Lucid 14 inch gel memory foam was the standard by which to compare all others. I took Goodbeds test to help narrow down likely best mattresses for me, which included questions about health issues and specifically fibromyalgia. They generated a list of mattresses that would support a side sleeper with fibromyalgia. The Lucid 14 inch gel memory foam was one of their top recommendations for me.In the Goodbeds video, they described the top 5 inches of foam as “premium comfort materials.” And they gave the density for each layer.Layer 1: 5.3 lbLayer 2: 3 lbLayer 3: 1.6 lbFurther research about density confirmed Goodbeds statement of “premium comfort materials.Out of curiosity I researched the competitor’s foam densities.T&N. Layer 1: 2.8. Layer 2: 1.8Dream Foam: Layer 1: 4, Layer 2: 2.5, Layer 3: 1.8Novabed, Casper, Nectar, Loom & Leaf, Ghost, etc. None came close to the density levels of the Lucid. None came close in price with prices starting at $800.Determining that quality and price couldn’t be beat, I ordered my Queen Lucid 14 inch gel memory foam mattress for under $500.As stated before I have a severe case of fibromyalgia, which means I am in pain 24/7. As stated before, the old mattress was greatly increasing my pain levels. I was waking up every 2-3 hours in pain. My hips and shoulders hurt greatly as I am a side sleeper. In the mornings, I was so stiff, that I needed to walk for at least 15-20 minutes to loosen up and to reduce the resultant pain spike. I was so tired by the end of my work day that I would be in bed by 6:00 or 7:00 pm. Needless to say, I was beyond excited to be getting a new mattress.However, my two main concerns were 1) firmness since there were a number of reviews who felt this particular mattress was firm m, and 2) off gassing as I am very sensitive to smells. Therefore, we bought my mattress first because if it was too firm or to smelly, my husband would take it as he doesn’t have issues with firmness or smells.The delivery day arrived. Like others have noted, the box it was in had has a hard cross country trip. It was a bit banged up, and the tape on the top had been fully slit. However, the mattress was still in the box and fully protected by the heavy duty plastic. The tool to cut it free was very useful. It was a bit cumbersome, but nothing two people couldn’t manage. Thankfully, my mattress had practically zero smell. My husband had to put his nose on the mattress to smell the off gassing. I just got the smallest of whiffs of off-gassing. It did not bother me at all and fully went away in a few hours. Finally, the mattress plumped up to 14 inches in 4 hours not the 24 hours some reviewers had experienced.Now the real test was to take place - Fibromyalgia vs Lucid! The winner? Lucid!!!My aching body feels like it has found a friend that fully understands how it feels and who wants to make it feel better. The mattress has the perfect balance of plush and support. Pain is not waking me up every 2 hours. My hips and shoulders do not ache. But most amazing of all is that when I get out of bed to start my day, I am not stiff AT. ALL.! I do not need to walk 15-20 minutes to loosen up. I figured the the overall stiffness was 100% fibromyalgia, but it wasn’t. In short, I am sleeping. I am also noticing that because I am better rested certain situations do not wipe me out like they used to. Finally, the memory foam keeps me at the right temperature. On my old mattress, I had to use a heated mattress pad because I was always cold, which increased my pain levels.The Lucid wins on so many levels: supportive comfort for a painful chronic illness, quality of materials, and price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price', 'author': 'Rachel McGrath', 'rating': 5, 'content': "6/8/18Bought this mattress at the end of May. Like many other reviews have said, the box came pretty beat up. It seems the box is too small for the mattress. After cutting the mattress and letting it expand, it did have a smell to it like other reviews have also said. It reminds me of wet paint, everyone's favorite smell. This is my first memory foam mattress, but I tried others out in an actual store, and this mattress is pretty comparable to more expensive mattresses. It's pretty comfortable, I feel like it is a little firm but my fiancee thinks it is pretty soft. It isn't firm enough to complain about by any stretch. It is also important to note I am a pretty small guy, about 5 foot 7 and 140 pounds and my fiancee is also pretty small. I'm a combo sleeper and I'll start out on my back, go to stomach, then side and it is comfortable in all of those positions. It also transfers movement less than a regular spring mattress. It also sleeps pretty cool. The summer has been pretty hot so far and I haven't woke up sweaty or anything. I'll update the review as time goes on.EDIT 7/15/18The bed is still going strong as far as I know. Nothing has really changed with it, which is good since it has been only a month. Not sure if I wrote this above, but the smell took around a couple of weeks to go away, but I didn't grow an extra arm which is good. It's been really hot here in Maryland and the bed hasn't been all that hot, I haven't noticed it anyway. We've been sleeping really well. No negatives as of yet. My fiancee said she does wish she would sink more into it, but the mattress supports all the heavy stuff like your hips and shoulders well.EDIT 5/3/2020This mattress is heavy. Lordy lord this mattress is heavy. It is thicccccccccc too. I have since moved a handful of times, and the process of moving this mattress sucks. I moved it alone once, and the second time had the help of a friend. Moving it with two people isn't horrible (I weight 150lbs and my friend is also small). My rabbit has peed on it, chewed some of the bottom, and enjoys digging into it. I still have not had any problems with it approaching 2 years of use. I sleep in the same spot and haven't noticed sagging (again I am relatively small). I haven't had any heat issues and I'm a cold sleeper. I am always comfortable. The only complain I have is how big it is. If you aren't moving though, that won't be a problem. I love the mattress and if I had to buy another mattress I would buy Lucid again, just maybe a thinner mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice bed for a great price!!', 'author': 'Tabatha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This bed is firm. I read some reviews saying it was as hard as a rock and I\'m confused to what rocks they are holding but it is firm. It is not hard by any means. I\'ve slept on some hard spring beds and this is nothing like that what so ever. I\'ve slept on pillow tops harder. It\'s a great supportive soft bed. It reminds me of a marshmallow. Firm yet squishy. I slept on my mattress last night and I didn\'t wake up once to roll over and the noise is gone from the old spring mattress.The bed is thick. I wish the the cashmere cover on it wasn\'t as loose but oh well. It doesn\'t slide but it isn\'t as tight as I wish it was but it\'s not been the complete 48 hours either since. It has been 24 and I really don\'t think it will be expanding anymore but if it does I\'ll add to this review. I am doubting it will.The smell it has airs out quickly. It\'s winter here and 24 hours later there is only a hint of a memory foam smell. It\'s the same smell my pillow had when I bought it. Nothing to crazy but if you\'re not expecting it it could worry you. It\'s fine though. It is no worse than craft glue or paint. Only these fumes can\'t hurt you.The only reason I don\'t 5 star this bed is because it\'s not quite as high as I thought it would be. I measured my bed frame and how high my mattress needed to be and it isn\'t quite as high as expected but it is foam and that happens. nothing a topper or a bigger pillow can\'t fix. The smell was a bit to be desired for and the fact that you smell like it if you sleep on it. If you plan to buy this mattress don\'t plan to sleep on it the first night. One, it might not be done expanding. Mine took several hours it says in the book it may take 48 hours. Two, the odor coming from the bed it very over whelming at first and you will smell like it if you lay all over it. It isn\'t fumes it\'s just the smell of the foam. It can\'t hurt you but no one likes a bad smell at their house.Other than that the bed is well worth the 400.00 + they ask for it. I would have paid more. I am actually shocked at the price for the quality and now I\'m interested in how long it will last. I plan to add to my post when it needs to be replaced or if it begins to wear down.The bed is amazing though, not hard. Not too soft but as I said a firm soft mattress. It\'s not like sleeping on feathers. Like I said it\'s like sleeping on a jumbo marshmallow. That\'s the only description I can give. Unless you want to call it baby bears bed, not to hard not to soft.I did read some reviews about the top not being 100% cashmere and I have to say "duh" cashmere is expensive and you shouldn\'t expect a entire mattress to be wrapped in it for 400.00. You can\'t get a scarf that is made of 100% cashmere for less than 150.00 unless its on sale. This is a HUGE mattress. It is soft. It probably has cotton in it I\'m not sure but it is soft. I do think they expect you to put sheets on the bed though. So why the mattress cover matters is beyond me. I also read a review about the bed not being made of 100% memory foam. If you look at the picture and read the arrows it clearly tells you how much memory foam to expect and how much support foam ect. I am not sure I could sleep on a bed that is 100% memory foam. I think it would be hard to get out of seeing how you melt into it.The packaging was beat up a bit. But my package only had a few holes from being thrown around in the truck. The mattress is wrapped very tightly with 2 players of tape and plastic so it doesn\'t really matter but don\'t expect this to be perfect boxing. It is a bit heavy to lift. My eleven year old daughter and I together brought it in off my deck porch. My husband got it up the stairs him self. I would suggest you unroll the bed on your box spring or plat form bed. Between the weight and the smell unrolling it and them moving it is a bit much. That\'s just my suggestion to others though.All in all great product! I\'m very pleased! I can\'t wait to sleep in it again tonight! Thanks LUCID for the deal and a great bed!UPDATES-It\'s been a little over 2 years or so and I just recommended this bed to a friend. I\'ve had no issues with this bed. This bed was moved and got smashed down our tight stair well. It has been jumped on by kids, smashed, moved, flipped and still the same as when we bought it.The only issue is the memory foam on top ripped. I expected that with the price and plan to add just another piece over top of it. It\'s not really noticeable while sleeping but it\'s a crack.Still a great bed & I would buy another!It is now 2017. I bought this bed in 2013 I believe. It\'s still working great and I get compliments on how soft and comfortable it is. Still not sinking or losing height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Happy Once We Got Used To It! Money Well Spent!', 'author': 'sstone', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So, it took us a while to get used to sleeping on a foam mattress after having a pillowtop, traditional innerspring mattress(which we LOVED by Serta) over the last 9 1/2 yrs. But, after several weeks of sleeping on it, we are both happy. It has certainly helped the problem I was having with my arm being a firmer sleep and also the same with helping my husbands back. The mattress is pretty firm. Anyone who gets this mattress and is looking for a fluffy, cloud-like experience...you WILL be disappointed. We wanted something more firm, but for a while we thought this was going to be too firm. At first, it truly is like lying on a very flat surface (floor even). There is a lil room for "sinking in" but not a whole heck of alot. After sleeping on it for the last couple months that has become better. We did not have any serious issues with getting the bed out of the box and plastic wrap. Once I convinced the UPS to move it from the side door to the front door (the box weighs close to 100 lbs), my husband and I was able to easily get it in the bedroom and out the box. Cutting the plastic was very simple also. It does "inflate" fairly quickly, so I would suggest you having it on the bed when you cut the plastic open and be prepared to get it in place quickly. We used out old boxspring from the prvious bed and had no issues. The mattress is heavy and awkward to try and move after, as there are no handles so be prepared and have things in place. Easy to tell top from bottom from the cover on the mattress, which is nice to touch. It is however a lil big for the mattress. While others may not like that, I do because it will be easier to get off and on as we try to take it off and wash it. We did not have any problems with size. The mattress expanded to the 14" promised maybe even a half inch or so more. I was very happy about this, as we purchased this specific on so we would have the height. Our mattress was not over sized like some of the reviews were stating, maybe even a lil smaller. It measured 59 1/2 X 79 1/2 so a great queen size. Our original boxspring was a lil smaller than the mattress so it does hang over the edges of that all four ways, but creates no issues for us at all and when you make the bed this cover very well. You will certainly need a deep pocket sheet that will fit the mattress being 14 1/2 inches. I had two sets already as our old bed was this deep and was prepared for the height. If you are looking to be lower to the floor, you will not like this bed, unless you are not putting it on a traditional bed/boxspring. The mattress allows my husband and I to sleep through the night feeling VERY little movement from the other should one get up for the bathroom or water or any other reason. It is very easy to sleep through any of that. My husband does not notice any difference in the temperature of the mattress compared to our old one. I do however notice it gets a lil warmer under me the further into the morning I sleep. I know that sounds weird, but it is true for whatever reason. Overall, we are VERY happy with our purchase and see it as money well spent during a time when these mattresses can be so expensinve, it is hard to buy online without trying on out. We did a lot of research, and feel like we may a lucky choice from the 1000\'s of mattresses out there. I would say, we prefer a fluffier pillow with this mattress, though a nice firm one it had to be overfilled, as the bed is so flat so a traditional pillow does not provide enough support, nor did any of the foam pillows we tried. Good luck, and I hope this helps anyone considering this bed. Unless your experience is different than our.....we think you too will be pleased if you are looking for a firmer sleep!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced a fancy-pants spring mattress', 'author': 'Chris Schoerning', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered this one yesterday after reading about a dozen other memory foam beds available on Amazon. Was initially skeptical as any buy should be when ordering an object that is used for everyday comfort and health...The bed arrived with minor scuffs on the cardboard but nothing that penetrated the plastic surrounding the mattress itself. It was pretty heavy - so much that the FedEx guy asked me to help him carry it to the door (he did offer to carry it into the bedroom but I figured he's busy enough).Once again, it's pretty heavy even when it's rolled up like an over sized cake roll - you probably want some help to get it setup for maximum ease or have a practical knowledge of physics.I tossed it on the box spring that used to hold our spring style mattress, opened up the plastic on one side, and slid the plastic off the other end without any problems. It immediately began decompressing. After approximately 5 hours it was almost pretty huge and my wife and I gave it a test run. I thought it was great! Our other mattress was a thick pillow-top that had suffered from having a valley in its center from extensive use. This mattress provided enough support to take pressure off of my back yet it was soft enough to feel well-cushioned.Oh, the smell. It's only been airing out for approximately five hours now but I hardly notice it - the wife says it smells like a chemical womb... we'll probably be sleeping in the guest bed tonight just so it can have more time to air out. The card that comes with the mattress states that you're supposed to give it 48 hours to expand and air out which seems reasonable.I'll give it an update after we had a night's sleep on it but I almost fell asleep on it during the test run...so far - great! I don't believe you can find a mattress for this price unless it fell off a truck and a hobo was selling it for booze.**Update 5/29/2012Slept a full night on this bed two nights in a row. If you've purchased this bed and find that it's too firm, try removing any fitted sheets or top sheets that you may have usually slept with and just sleep directly on the mattress cover. The cover itself is very comfortable and appears to help the mattress form better to your body. The fitted sheets I had for our previous mattress were pretty snug when I attempted to utilize them on this mattress and caused the mattress to not conform to your body as well.We both slept great the past two nights! Before the troubles with our current mattress, I generally only slept 5-6 hours a night and felt well-rested. When the troubles slowly began, I was increasingly sleeping 8-10 hours (of broken sleep) and still feeling groggy in the morning. That's pretty much gone now - slept a very good 6 hours of unbroken sleep and woke up refreshed and invigorated. So much so that I had to write this review almost immediately after taking the garbage and recycling out to the curb ;)Would highly recommend so long as you give the mattress its recommended 48 hours to expand and 'fumigate' in a well ventilated room.**Update 02/21/2013Still loving it. The quality of the mattress hasn't diminished at all. Doesn't cause pressure pain on any part of the body. No noticeable sag. The mattress cover is still soft and enjoyable to sleep directly on. My wife finds it to be more firm than she'd like but when she spends a night on the older fancy soft spring mattress, she comes back to this one because her hips hurt from sleeping on springs -- I have my share of upper back problems and the LUCID mattress helps to not further aggravate them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best sleep ever!', 'author': 'greg', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This bed is so comfortable I overslept the first 3 mornings I had it. Had to set 2 alarms!Highly recommended, you can't beat the price, and it's so comfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good mattress. but not plush', 'author': 'Ken Cook', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update:Love this mattress! Best sleep either of us have had in ages. Look forward to bedtime!After going to every bed store in town , finding a mattress I loved but my husband didn’t ( plus WAY expensive) decided to follow my sons advice and find a box bed online.Read every review. But my husband wasn’t sold on a memory foam mattress. So stayed with our old worn out one. Until I ordered one for our daybed that needed replaced. He laid on it after I told him how comfy it was. He fell asleep and had a great nights sleep for the first time in ages.Three days later I crossed my fingers and ordered one for our bed( different brand)I wanted plush, and cooling gel. Don’t want to over heat.Once we got it unboxed, it filled quickly to full size, 14”.I should have gotten a 10” as our frame is high and I’m short.This is not plush. It’s more medium. I had wanted to kinda sink into it. But you don’t really.That said, it is comfortable. Offers support, and we don’t feel the other person when they move. We have both slept very well on this and really like it. My husband loves it.Would I buy it again? Yes. It’s a good buy. Just don’t expect plush.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Quality Issues & install/haul away service is false advertising. “They never take old mattress”', 'author': 'Sheracr', 'rating': 1, 'content': "UPDATE: It is two weeks after delivery. The plush/soft assessment below was incorrect. The mattress had just expanded for about a 1/2 hr when I evaluated below. After settling for the afternoon it was harder and after a day was what I would call firm. It has remained that way for the two weeks I have had it. I would NOT call this a plush mattress. The foam does not allow my hips to sink in and straighten my spine, and my back is sore. I am not sure if this is a quality issue, a symptom of the latex like top layer, or this is how the manufacturer designed the mattress.The edges are easier to get in/out of bed than usual soft memory foam. They don't crush down when sitting on the edge.After two weeks, I do not like this mattress and do not recommend it both for lack of plushness/softness advertised as well as the quality issues mentioned below. From other reviews it appears if I return it they'll just refund money and then we're stuck with disposal. Not great considering this thing weighs 100 lbs.I bought a memory foam RV mattress a few years ago from Travel Happy via Amazon and it was soft as described and no quality issues. So...it is not an inherent problem with memory foam mattresses to be firm. This is an issue with this specific brand and mattress design.The delivery options have changed and they don't offer the same service level with haul away now.Very disappointing. I had such high hopes. I will start shopping for another mattress that is (actually) soft.ORIGINAL REVIEW:MATTRESS: See pictures. Quality issues with the cover. Left side is smaller/tighter than the right side. Foam expanded immediately to full height, but tight left side of cover is restricting foam expansion all the way. Mattress is very plush, as described. Maybe too plush. I did want a plush mattress though! [**See two-week update above - firmed up later]DELIVERY & INSTALL SERVICE: Amazon box truck arrived. Installers informed us that we need to remove and haul away our own mattress. They said they “never take away the old mattress.” The bed frame was required to be empty and ready for an install. They would not wait. Since we expected they would remove it, our old mattress was still on the bed frame. SO…they left the mattress at outside our front door. A 100lb box for my husband and I to handle!VERY DISAPPOINTING when the service I selected during order clearly said removal of old, install new, and haul away of old (with limited old haul away exclusions).Interesting when I look now they only offer delivery and unpack. They changed the service after I ordered it. Talk about bait and switch!HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! And so I have to live with the mattress cover issue? Even if they sent a new cover this thing weighs too much to switch. Ugh!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars reserved but pleased so far! purchased March 2012. Now 8/2013', 'author': 'Catholic Mom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We ordered this mattress last week, it was shipped from Commerce City, Colorado, to us here in Wichita, KS in two days (the ordering is what took so long, but the shipping was quick Thursday showed shipped and Friday it arrived). The box is huge! It was very heavy even for my hunky husband. The box was very damaged obviously. With something this large and heavy, it can\'t be avoided at all. However, it was obvious the mattress was well wrapped and just fine upon arrival. It was marked KING and LUCID all over the box and was obvious that it was the correct item. It had been raining here for the past week nonstop and I was worried if I wasn\'t home when it arrived that it would get soaked. However it was wrapped sooo well in plastic, I know I wouldn\'t have had anything to worry about. The UPS man heaved it into my garage for me on a dolly. It arrived in the morning around 1030 am (and it wasn\'t raining at that time). DH took the mattress box all the way to the bedroom, it was easier to do that than take the mattress out. It had two nylon straps he was able to grab to pull it. He put the mattress roll on the bed and popped the plastic it began to expand quickly. You could smell the "new paint" smell but it definitely was not overwhelming by any means. We had readied the windows and fan, but it wasn\'t necessary. The plastic wrap held the paint smell in so I know that it was sealed well. To me it just smelled new and after about a half hour you had to put your nose on the mattress to smell that "paint" smell at all. It was expanded almost to 14 inches tonight around 10 pm. The last few inches are taking the longest. But right away the mattress was expanded to about 8 to 10 inches (with in about 5 to 10 mins). It expands at different rates so one side of the bed was higher than the other at first, but it\'s evened out just fine. We had the mattress turned wrong as in upside down, as you want the plain cashmere side to be down, and the fancy stitched side that says, "cashmere" and "Lucid" stitched all over it upwards to the ceiling. ALSO, we had the foot and head sideways on the bed too, so it had to be turned one more direction to sit right on the bed. But you can figure all that out pretty quickly...lol Do it before it expands too much, it\'s much easier obviously. I put sheets on it and am sleeping on it tonight as I have no choice really, but I think in the morning it should be close to 14 inches. I have pictures and hopefully the video which you will be able to see. I do believe if you want to seriously consider memory foam this is a good way to go, I dont know about it\'s longevity yet. But the foam base it the largest out there- I looked at every single memory foam mattress that is being manufactured and that\'s not a joke. You need a big dense foam base for these beds. Also if you want to go the Tempurpedic route as far as denisty 5 lb density or 7 pound density, this is comparible. We laid on the Tempurpedic beds in the store and compared their composition to this bed. I might get a 6 lb 2 inch memory foam topper for it as I prefer it to be really firm. The Allura is 7 lbs and 5 lbs memory foam, the closest topper I could find was 6 pounds. It costs about $500 too. So even with this mattress and that mattress topper, I am still WAAAAAY under the cost of the Allura Tempurpedic which is almost $5000! We also tried all the other major name brands of memory foam. The other companies like Serta, or Sleep Innovations really don\'t compare. Their densities are much lower and the bases much shorter and in my opinion too small. I even looked at Bed in a Box (although a good company), their beds don\'t boast a higher density foam, and dont\' have a deeper base, I believe they use 3 pounds or less for their memory foam. The Dynasty mattresses are a better buy here on Amazon if you are considering one of those. Just look at how the mattress is made and see for yourself. I called Dynasty and spoke to a very nice man and he answered all my questions as well. They go 1.5" on their 20 year warranty. Most companies I found don\'t list the density of their foam bases, so that\'s the only unknown. I couldn\'t even find that with Tempurpedic\'s mattresses. I think minimum for two regular sized adults (my husband 6 foot and 210) and I am 5\'6 and pregnant (no need to go there) that 12 inches minimum is what you need.
