Anything else would not be adequate from what I read. I have been through 2 mattress on warranties in 4 years- from a different company and store (NOT THIS MATTRESS), so I am super paranoid. We aren\'t even trying to go warranty this last mattress as we don\'t even want to deal with it. The first time we did the warranty process was easy and we had it done with in a week, but it\'s just the trouble of hauling it around and taking pictures and being pregnant, I just dont have the energy. I just want a good nights sleep ;) So basically if you want a good memory foam, compare heights, densities and bases. Go from there. I am crossing my fingers that this thing will hold up through the years. I will try to update and answer questions if I remember. I really appreciated the folks who already wrote detailed reviews and one guy even put up a video on another LUCID I think. Oh and the warranty card was stuck right there to the mattress. It states the typical 1.5" sag, but there are no other stipulations about the 20 year warranty. Bed in a box is 1.25" and Tempurpedic is .75". So although they have LinenSpa beat there I still went with this mattress. I even called LinenSpa during regular business hours and someone answered the phone and answered my questions. Be back soon with more info. I really do hope this helps someone else out, even if you don\'t buy this brand, at least maybe it will educate you a little. Check Sleeplikethedead.com for info too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just give it time', 'author': 'chris matheny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased this bed at the end of September, after opening the package the bed got progressively harder. After 24 hours when it was time to sleep on it for the first time it was super firm. We were both seriously worried lol. My fiance was not pleased at all LOL. Over the next two weeks my side began to break in nicely, I am a little heavier than her. Hers took a little longer to break in. I would say after a month my side was perfect. Hers took a little longer but now she is fine with it. I think going with the firm was the correct decision, she would have probably opted for the plush. She would give this only four stars, I love it though. It was definitely worth the price we paid.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 12 Inch Euro Top Pocket Spring Hybrid Mattress, Pressure Relief, Pocket Innersprings for Motion Isolation, Bed-in-a-Box, Queen White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally - an affordable, firm mattress', 'author': 'Daniel DeJong', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a man of gravity (approaching 300lb) I look for a mattress that’s decidedly on the firm side. I can’t speak for everyone, but this was exactly what I was looking for to provide firm (but still comfortably soft) support.Out of the box, the top layer of foam did look rumpled and lumpy beneath the mattress cover. But by the end of the first night, everything was settled and smooth. (Make sure to let it unroll and rise fully in one place before trying to move it - I think trying to move it while it was expanding was my mistake.)After just one night, I feel morerested than I have in years of sleeping in memory foam and soft “hybrid” mattresses. It doesn’t seem to sleep hot - I’m like a space heater but this passed the sweat test in a 74° room. Dry and comfortable all night.For my weight, this mattress is great in any sleep position: side, stomach and back all feel natural. It has just enough sink so that my behind is flush with my spine if I’m on my back, which no mattress has ever managed to do for me before. If you’re on the lighter side, this might not be the same for you, but again, just speaking for my own size.The quilted top doesn’t have large divots like some mattresses, and the top layer of foam is just thick enough to feel plush without the marshmallow/quicksand feel of the Zinus memory foam mattresses. Great edge support too - sleeping on my side it felt stable right up to the edge. I wouldn’t sit on it to put my shoes on, though… it smashes flat under my weight in a sitting position.All in all, an extraordinary mattress for the price, and one I hope to keep for years. Hope this helps, big dudes!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best mattress I've owned. Better than a $1500 mattress. Soft but not too soft.", 'author': 'HShield', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great hybrid mattress. This mattress is so good, I realized my last mattress was too firm and was the reason I couldn't sleep more than a few hours. Best mattress I've owned.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the price', 'author': 'Deserai', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We are thrilled with this purchase. Bought queen size for our 8 year old who wanted a "big bed". For the price, I cannot complain. We\'ve had a few months and its just as cozy as day one. It\'s soft but also firm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress', 'author': 'tabinormal@hotmail.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Had to replace my mattress because the dog peed on it >.<. I bought Zinus before for my guest room and knew it was good for the price. I admit being a bit sad because my old mattress was really nice quality and very comfortable- I thought Serta? Beautyrest? But needs must, so I bought the Queen Zinus. As I was removing the old mattress I checked the tag- And it was ZINUS!!! Sure enough, swapped the mattresses, and no change in quality of sleep!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars This is the second ZINUS mattress we have ordered- that's saying a LOT!", 'author': 'aprilrrain', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We ordered a king size ZINUS in November 2020 to replace a LUCID mattress we got just two years before. The Lucid was compressing (we are average size people) and was MURDER on our love lives: so much effort.. the mattress was too soft. The Zinus is a whole different animal! The inner spring coils did the trick. It is soft but super stable with the springs.ONE MONTH LATER- We wanted to replace the queen mattress in our Airstream and due to such an impressive experience with the king size, we opted to take a chance it would fit (RV mattresses are usually somewhat smaller). The queen is much bigger than the intended space but we are making it work (maneuvering around an RV bed is a pain when the mattress fits: its a game of Twister with a big ol mattress! But its still the firmest, best sleeping mattress for a Mattress in a Box. I wish we could speak to the longevity of the support features but that will have to be an update, later. For now, we wake up and nothing hurts!* One suggestion for the manufacturer: Please label the head/foot on the plastic wrap and IF possible, fold it with the spring side, out. Otherwise, you have to flip it before or after cutting the plastic and at 80+ pounds for the queen size, that's a struggle.. for the king size, that's a hernia!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3 years & we still love it!', 'author': 'Ashley R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve never had a better mattress in my life. We love our bed! When we are away we say “it’s not as comfortable as ours!” We turn it every month or so, but other than that, no maintenance or upkeep.For reference: husband is 6’4 270 and I’m 5’10 205Also note… this is the 7th mattress I’ve bought of this brand. The first was for my mom, then I bought one for me and my 6 kids!1 king1 queen1 full4 twinLOVE THIS BRAND!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The full Zinus (Cal King) mattress experience!', 'author': 'S', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Function/ comfort: I have used this mattress for about six months now. At this point, I am literally sleeping in a hole in the middle of the mattress and it continues to rapidly deteriorate. In just the past couple weeks, I went to no longer using a pillow because I sink so far down inside the mattress, I just use the edge of the hole I am sleeping in as a "pillow." To turn over in the night, I have to do a pushup to push myself out of the hole to turn over. Hard to imagine, but this Zinus mattress is worse than sleeping on the floor.I wondered if there is a warranty for this portable sinkhole, so I called Zinus. The first several times, it really appeared they simply refuse to take calls by using an AI phone tree that denies all calls. But after calling multiple times, I realized it\'s just a terrible quality system (could this be a pattern?) Pro tip: the phone tree asks if you purchased from Amazon- if you say yes, they immediately hang up on you. I call back and said I just want to talk about mattresses, and the robot says "Sorry, I can\'t help you with that" and again immediately hung up, etc. So, after saying, "Buy a mattress" repeatedly, I finally reached a person to inquire about the warranty:The Bottom Line: The decision to issue a replacement mattress will be made by sending Zinus a picture of the mattress taken with no sheet or object on the bed. If an observable 1.5 inch sag can be noted, then they will issue a replacement, which takes a week. (Note: They pointedly have no interest in my actual experience with the bed, and or any pictures of me actually in the quicksand mattress of death.) However, Zinus has no pickup service for the old mattress, so the responsibility to dispose of the giant CalKing- sized piece of used bubble gum is mine. So, while the prospect of getting a replacement terrible-quality mattress from Zinus and the joy of watching their delivery workers simply walk away from my current La Brea Tar Pit-style mattress because "they don\'t do that" is tempting...In closing, I shared my unique view with Zinus customer service that if a company saddles a customer with a (unwieldy, impossible to carry) lemon, they should recognize the significant imposition on that customer and take steps to make it right. Zinus thanked me for this new, deep insight that I provided to them and promised that they would consider it, so that perhaps in the future some other person who absolutely wastes their money on a Zinus product will no longer be burdened with how to dispose of said item. You\'re welcome everybody!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars very firm, although okay for back sleepers', 'author': 'Omar Siddique', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'All too firm with somewhat mushy corners, this mattress may work for solo back-sleepers.Although I\'ve had this bed open and "expanded" for 2 years, I only recently rotated it into my MBR and have slept on it the last 2 weeks.Even after some extended efforts to break it in via "knee-walking" (which is just what it sounds like, to break in a new mattress rapidly), it\'s still rather firm. The reinforced several inches near the edges feel like sleeping on the floor, although they do provide the advertised non-collapsing edges. For a couple who might be making use of those edge areas it\'s not going to be terribly comfortable.Despite too-firm edges, the corners are soft and feel like they never fully expanded. They slope in as if belonging to a different mattress-- although that does mean fitted sheets are easy-on/easy-off.The 13" height is a good intermediate one -- any thinner is guaranteed uncomfortable for adults and will come in too low versus traditional bedside tables. Normally I\'d aim at 14 or thicker.It\'s okay for a single person but I\'m actively planning to replace it with a more welcoming, more joyful-feeling mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Quality changed on this product', 'author': 'Isabella Justiniani', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'We bought 3 of these mattress.-The first one was perfect! my husband loved it, his back pain was gone and I really liked it too, because you could turn without disturbing the person next to you.-The second one we purchased was a King size and it was perfect, just like the first one.-The third one, was nothing like the previous two we bought, it was jumpy, very soft, if you sat on any side of the bed you would slide down, if felt like water bed, you could feel any movement from the person next to you. We thought the mattress was defective and asked to be replacement,-The fourth one...(replacement) was bad as well. same terrible quality as the third.I gave 3 starts because the first two mattress where perfect, unfortunately for us the last two were the opposite.Before my first purchase I read good and bad reviews of this product. Now I can say that ALL the reviews where correct! We experienced two incredible perfect mattresses and two terrible ones. I guess the people who gave this product a 1 start received the bad batch, and those who gave 5 stars received the good quality ones.Good luck and I hope you get one of the good ones.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good replacement for our King bed', 'author': 'JillCW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This came quickly - and was very easy to 'assemble' if you will. Followed all instructions, had watched video --- and read a lot of reviews. My daughter suggested this mattress --- I had had an older King mattress - very good quality but could tell it was done as I had some hip pain. I decided, based on her review, and the many here to give it a try. It's been about a month...it's pretty darn comfortable --- but I do find when 2 of us are in bed --- toward the middle it does sink a bit. And, like others said, when you sit on the side of the bed it's kind of mushy - but tolerable. It did not smell like others indicated --- and we slept on it pretty quickly with much success.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 5 Inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress, Firm Mattress, Low Profile Bed Twin 5 Inch Mattress
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oh em gee!!!', 'author': 'DonnieAwesome', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ok. So I'm one of those people that absolutely suck at buying big purchases like new mattresses when they're clearly needed. I tend to just sleep on the old original, make due, suffer, and complain about it every waking hour..I want to first admit. I did get a discount on this one. Not sure how, just put it in my cart and it was cheaper than what the list price was. Might have been a credit from Amazon I wasn't aware of at the time..So I bought it anyways.First the packaging is awesome. Came in a really small box vacuum sealed with 2 layers of plastic.Remove from box, remove first plastic. 'roll it out', remove second plastic, and watch it expand right before your eyes..It DOES take about 24hrs for it to fully expand. Do not be discouraged. The middle portion expands fast, but the ends (head and foot) do take a little extra time but it's not a big deal honestly.. Give it time!First I sat on it, and it was amazing! Firm, but plush against me, supported but didn't push back so much I was uncomfortable. Then I laid on it. Super firm for the first couple seconds, but once your body sinks into it it really does add great support, but cradles at the same time..It's firm for support, but plush enough to still cradle you like a softy.. Best of both worlds.First sleep.. Now. I've had chronic sleep problems, and severe pain for years, and I really believe it was due to bad sleep on an older spring mattress that's seen better days.. I'd toss, turn, wake up over and over. and though I was laying down for 8-10hrs. I was probably only actually asleep for 2 of those nightly. Life sucked! (although I'm sure the chiropractor enjoyed all the visits)First sleep on this mattress. I slept through the night, turned over once and woke up fine. Sat up. did my morning twist and turn, snappity, crackity, pop. stretched out and actually felt muscles stretching and not just bone/joints grinding.. After about a week. (because there's no miracle pill) I lost 90% of my chronic pain. Because I'm sleeping through the night, not tossing and turning constantly, and the mattress is supporting me no matter my angle.I would 100% recommend this, and other products by this company.. It's cheap! (I mean inexpensive), well worth the money, it comes in different firmness's, and trust me. Your body will love you..", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality fabric, comfortable and strong', 'author': 'Sara Lorrai', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Surprisingly soft and firm enough for kids to attack.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Just what was needed!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My son constantly asked to sleep on the couch. We bought this mattress, replacing his one. He sleeps in his bed every week night with no issue. He says it is comfortable. He actually goes into his room to relax in his bed now.It was delivered on time in a box. I hauled it upstairs alone, but it is on the heavy side. I carefully opened the box and stripped off the plastic covering it was in. After maybe 3 hours the mattress was puffed. I have not measured it. I laid in it and was pleased. It is just what was needed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great memory foam mattress!', 'author': 'Jennie A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this for our son’s bed and it’s a great mattress for a great price. We left it out for about 2 days so it could expand to its full size. It’s nice and firm which is what we wanted for him. Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fit perfectly in my palomino truck camper', 'author': 'Greg Fishell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Brilliant rv mattress replacement! Since it’s a memory foam mattress the extra 1” you don’t notice with the height of the camper. Very comfy too.They say “firm” but compared to my zinus mattress at home it’s “semi firm”.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just what we needed', 'author': 'Kay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We needed a quick set up and take down, (and also portable) twin bed for a college age guest that occasionally stays with us. We needed something better than an air mattress and something we could hide away. This worked out to be the perfect floor bed. We added a 2 inch memory foam mattress topper on top of it along with a fitted sheet. It’s pretty comfortable in this configuration - firm enough to lounge on and read, but also cushiony and supportive enough to sleep on for the week our guest spent with us during a winter storm. Our guest reported it was so comfortable, they would like to order a similar one for their first apartment. This mattress immediately came to life and expanded to full size right out of the box. There was no smell. We began using it 24 hours later. It is light enough than I can move it from room to room. Great solution!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Good mattress, but the 5-inch thickness wasn't enough.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Slice of Heaven! Firm, Comfortable, Well-Packed, Very Low Odor, at a Reasonable Price.', 'author': 'Morethanimages', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely love it! Unlike most people that have written reviews on this, I bought it to be my bed, not for a guest room or bunk-bed, etc.. I was looking for something that didn\'t take up much room (currently renting one room in a house) and could be rolled up or stood up during the day to provide more space. I needed it firm but not stiff (60+ male, 200 lbs with a few chronic med issues), since it would be laying on a piece of carpet on a wood floor (no frame). It has more than met my expectations so far. I can\'t wait to go back to bed later :-).It came vacuum-sealed and rolled up, encased in a thicker (4-5 mil?), "tube" of plastic inside a good-quality, thick cardboard box. Carefully cut the thicker plastic (too tight to slip off) tube off (use scissors if you want to be sure not to slip and cut into the mattress) with a box cutter and cut off the plastic "bag". No big release of chemical vapors like others I\'ve dealt with in the past. I was very surprised how low (almost non-existent) the odor was. Had to get really close to the mattress to notice it. It expanded pretty fast to the full 5" and I let it lay on the living room floor overnight and into the next day to air out (instructions say it can take up to 48 hours to fully expand but mine took less than an hour).Next day I replaced my bed-roll (2" mattress topper with a couple pads for easy roll-up and stashing out of the way) with this mattress and tested it out. Super comfortable for me. It is firm (some would say very firm) but for me it has just enough give and provides great support). For a lighter person, it may be too firm depending on your taste. It\'s too thick to roll up like my make-shift bed roll but it will stand up in an area out of the way. I\'ll take that trade-off of a better sleep vs a bit more room any day.For those who want a softer feel, get a mattress topper for $20-$35. A topper of 1" - 3" will provide the softness and "give" that many like. It can then be removed for those who like a firm to very firm feel like I do. In any case, I was just going to lay on it for a while to read and check comfort level but ended up falling asleep before I had even put the sheets on. Got a great nap. Hadn\'t slept that well in months. Can\'t wait to try a full night of testing tonight :-))). Your mileage may vary. Sleep comfort is a very individual thing but for me and my needs, this mattress is a great fit. Hope it works as well for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Does the job, but...', 'author': 'Shannon Nicole', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Ordered 2 for a bunk. Arrived on time. Opened immediately upon arrival. Let sit out for 3 days, flipped each day to a new side. The corners still didn't come all the way up, on both. One is bright white, the other a little off white. One definitely looks like 5 inches, the other didn't quite make it. Does the job for now. Definitely not keeping it for years to come. Stepping stone mattress lol.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for bunk beds', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These low mattresses are great for bunk beds. They definitely need to be aired out for 2 days before using though!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Queen Mattresses, 12 Inch Queen Size Mattress in a Box, Hybrid Construction Individual Pocket Springs with Memory Foam, Cooler Sleep with Pressure Relief and Support
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cautiously Optimistic', 'author': 'E.S.J.B', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So far so good! I know most of you reading this will be just like I was when I was shopping for a new mattress, to sum it up into one word, nervous. This is a big purchase, and one that is difficult to undo should things not work out. I have issues with low back pain on firmer mattresses, but I also don't do too well on ultra plush mattresses either, so it is a fine line of what will work for me. I also deal with shoulder pain on both sides when side sleeping. I'm a physically fit guy, 6'0, 155 pounds, but I've been in a lot of tumbles in my three and half decades, and consequently I have some pain that typically only develops after several hours sleep on a mattress that is not ideal.I am relieve to report that so far, this mattress has performed beautifully. It came quickly and safely, was very easy to unpack, and very quickly took full form. As soon as I laid on it for the first time I knew this was going to be a game changer, instant comfort, softness and a plush that is just right, not too plush, but more importantly, definitely not too firm! I've had the mattress for about two months now and I have absolutely gotten better rest every single night in the past two months then I was getting on my old mattress.At this point I have to say this mattress is not only excellent quality, but an equally excellent price for what you're getting. I would have imagined having to spend twice or even three times this much for a mattress with this level of comfort, unless it unexpectedly begins to decay or lose its form, comfort or otherwise, though I do not expect that to happen.If I remember I will will post another review in six months to see where its at and hopefully help others to make an informed purchase, but at this point, I'm very pleased with my decision to purchase this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not what I excepted', 'author': 'Dawn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old bed was so bad I was sleeping on the couch.I had gone to numerous mattress stores trying to find something reasonable. As with the present economy spending a lot on anything is not on my wish list. While at one store I laid on a bed and said this isn\'t bad but just a little soft for me. He explained it was a bed in the box. When I looked the reviews up on that one they were similar to what I felt when I was on it.So I continued to search. After reading the reviews I thought well its 1/4 of the price of the other ones I have seen and liked. Its incredible to me they can put this in a box. There is no way ever it will go back in one without a device to suck the air out and some work.According to the manufacture you have to let it decompress for the full effect of about 3-7 days. However, you can sleep on it before hand and doing so will not effect the decompressing.So night one I laid on it and it felt extremely springy and I was like "oh no this isn\'t going to be good". Plus it was very soft. It sank when you got on it. Second night wasn\'t to bad but not great. It didn\'t sink as low as the first night. However, I slept through the night. I also found it to be a bit hard more firm than med /firm, by the third night.I had a mattress topper from my old bed that is still in like new condition. I threw it on top and the next night it wasn\'t much better. Now I\'m on the fourth night with it and I have to say its comfortable. I\'m keeping my topper on it and if I take it off its to firm for me. Its firm more than medium. Plus it doesn\'t sink at all now. Nor do I feel the springs, nearly as much as the first night but I can still feel them.Side note: The center is softer to sleep on than the sides. So that is a little odd to me. Its not consistent around the mattress and this is night 6. I have a king size bed and have normally always slept one side or the other but right now its strictly the middle.Firm in todays standards is more like sleeping on a board. 20 years ago firm is more like a medium in todays time. Will the mattress last ten years? I don\'t know about that but for the moment it will work for me.Now it is two weeks in to sleeping on this and I don\'t wake up in the night nor do I toss and turn all night but I wake each morning with the middle of my back slightly sore. I\'m not sure if this will be good for the long term but for the moment its working. Would I buy it again? yesWould I recommend it? probably so. Size and weight do matter in mattress shopping. Would I buy it for my son? No because he has a 6k bed and would know the difference.EDIT: It\'s now been several months since I bought this. It\'s completely decompressed, and I love it. Legit its so comfortable I actually want to go to bed. I have left my topper on it and its perfect for me. If you like a firmer mattress, you don\'t need the topper, but my topper makes it kind of like a pillow top. I sleep like a baby. I also live in FL on the beach and even in the worse of the storms we have gotten this season I slept through every one of them. My neighbors look at me like I\'m on crack when I told them I didn\'t wake. i think they are now concerned for me. Just saying. I\'d definitely buy this again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Bed for the Price', 'author': 'Jen Grant', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was skeptical. I have never purchased a bed in a box before and within a matter of months, I had to purchase a new bed for the house and the camper. It was way to expensive to get traditional beds for both places. We chose this one for our everyday bed, and I'm glad we did. Right out of the box it started to expand. Be aware though, and follow instructions so that you don't get hurt!!! It comes out fast once you use the provided tool to open it up. It says to give it like 3 days to fully expand, we only gave it 2, and it was perfect. The only thing, I wish I would have went with the thicker one. We were replacing an old mattress and it was a tad thicker with a pillowtop, so when we put this on top of our box springs, it sat a little lower and that took some adjusting. But it fit perfectly on the box springs, our queen mattress cover and sheets fit it very well, and the overall of it was great. It didn't smell either. I think I read somewhere that out of the box it had a strange smell, ours did not. Actually, no smell at all.Now, let's talk comfort. It is very soft. It does sleep well, but I have issues with my hip (and of course I'm a side sleeper) and sometimes if I sleep too long on one side, my hip will ache. Not a big issue, because my hip hurt with the old mattress too, but that old mattress was 20 years old! LOL. I feel like this one should be more cooling, as well. My husband is always hot and this doesn't help in that area, so if you are looking to have some cooling.... wouldn't be my first choice.Overall, for the price, you can't beat the bed.Happy Bed Hunting!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality/good value', 'author': 'Ignatius Reilly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a pretty firm yet comfortable hybrid mattress. The best feature, IMO, is the design that prevents one person's movement from rippling across the mattress. Because of shoulder bursitis, I have to shift a lot when I sleep. The mattress makes no noise when you move and isn't felt on the other side.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'jjasso', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comfortable, affordable, and good quality. Best sleep in a long awhile. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It’s amazing', 'author': 'Olga Cowo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The quality of this mattress is amazing. It was ready to use the same day. Very very comfortable. Has no smell and the packaging was top tier. I would recommend this 100%', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality and inexpensive', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great alternative to shopping in the store. So comfortable. This is the third one I purchased of this mattress and this one is for me. I bought one for a grandson and it was so comfy I bought one for another grandson. I got mine on a flash deal and am very happy with them all. Definitely recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Sarah S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this for myself and I was a little skeptical at first. I received this in a box that was huge and extremely heavy, so I would recommend two people getting it into the house. Once I got it upstairs, I got it opened up and it was puffed up almost immediately. I did leave it on the floor to get to its full height for 3 nights before using it, just to be safe, and it seemed to be perfect when I moved it onto the bed frame.I did notice a chemical smell, but it wasn’t overwhelming and after spraying some fabreez on it, it seemed to clear it up. I slept great on it. It is a little firmer than I anticipated, but I got a great night of sleep on it. I will definitely buy this again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Be careful.. ripped the cutter out of my hand when it flew open!!', 'author': 'Jeffrey T. Rue', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love that I have it (Coolvie California King Mattress).I love that it fits the frame I purchased for it. I love that the frame came Sunday (it was supposed to arrive on Monday) and the mattress came Saturday..I'm thrilled I could dismember my old queen size bed with my wife, clean the bedroom, build the new frame, and install the mattress and now relax and sleep on our couch until Wednesday as per directions..72hr resting and to allow the mattress to take full shape..I can't rate it properly as of yet...update this review the end of the week or month of January.. 🤙🐼😎🤙Update (3am Monday morning) OMG the California king mattress looks so inviting!! It's puffed up enough to install the bamboo waterproof bed cover...and we're sleeping on the couch.. until Wednesday...ughhhh... filling out nicely and the hardest part is NOT sleeping on it ...And realizing sleeping on the couch even with my wife SUCKS....(I'm hurt, body is shot so I'm a light sleeper as it is. This doesn't help. On the other hand my wife can sleep on a bed of nails instantly..so jealous of her!! 🥴So I waited and suffered through the 72 hours of agony waiting to sleep on this mattress. So today I moved it to another part of the room to make sure I am keeping to their rules and rotating for weight/wear control..and noticed that the springs are shifting like the leaning tower of pisa... It's on the California King frame specifically designed for this mattress.. I have to contact the company 😭😞😭 not sure if there are enough coil springs in this mattress that's giving them room to fall (defect) it shouldn't do this this soon or at ALL.I don't want to have to go back to my chair or my couch for another 72hours!!! That's GD Torture!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Mattress EVER!', 'author': 'KEITH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Alright, listen up people, this is my first review ever - but I just HAD to tell you about the best damn mattress I ever laid my head on! Let me tell you, this mattress is like sleeping on a cloud made of dreams and unicorn fluff! I used to wake up feeling like I got hit by a truck, but now I bounce outta bed like I just won the lottery! It's like my body is getting a VIP treatment every night. And let me tell you, my wife loves it too, which means happy wife, happy life, am I right? So do yourself a favor and level up your sleep game with this mattress. And it’s affordable AF! Trust me, you won't regret it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cooling Infused Gel Memory Foam Firm Support Latex-Feel Mattress, CertiPUR-US Certified, Queen Size, White/Dark Gray, 80 x 60 x 12 inches (LxWxH)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Guest Room MVP: Cool, Comfy, and Budget-Friendly Find!', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Let me tell you, this Amazon Basics Memory Foam Mattress is a total GAME CHANGER for my guest room. I snagged it on a whim, needing something comfy and stylish without breaking the bank, and let me just say, it's delivered!First off, the quality is surprisingly top-notch. The memory foam conforms like a dream, cradling your body without that weird sinking feeling. Plus, the cooling gel is NO JOKE. My guests rave about how they sleep like babies, all cool and comfy. And speaking of looks, this mattress is sleek and modern in grey and white, totally elevating the guest room vibe. Bonus points for the breathable cover that never feels stuffy, even in Arizona heat. Honestly, for renters or anyone needing a spare mattress that won't disappoint, this is the one. It's comfy, cool, and budget-friendly – basically the guest room MVP. So ditch the air mattress blues and snag this gem – your guests (and your wallet) will thank you!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Clean Non Toxic, Comfortable Mattress', 'author': 'Ryan Schreck', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The best mattress money can buy for quality, price, and NO FIBER GLASS, NO SMELL, NON TOXIC!! Have purchased 2 of these now and am in LOVE. Purchased a nectar premier copper before this and found out it has fiberglass and comes with muscle aches and pains terrible unworthy of the price. This Amazon Mattress is the way to go, you will NOT be disappointed!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable for the price', 'author': 'Aaron', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've thoroughly enjoyed this mattress thus far, and I liked that it fully expanded with 24hrs instead of 72. I took one star away because it's a little more firm than iwas expecting and compared to my last Nectar mattress, but it's also half the price so I can't complain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still in love (2 year update)', 'author': 'PaSoccerDad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My stats: 6\'1" 200lbs pinched spinal column, sciatic nerve impingement, poor sleeper, hot sleeperAbsolutely LOVE this matress. When it arrived it was well packaged. Upon opening I had doubts it would expand fully. Took it to an open room and cut open vacuum sealed bag. Bed started expanding rapidly. A few hours later and it looked completely expanded but I followed the directions and waited. 72 hours later it was ready. I pressed on the top of the bed and I was worried, it felt stiff almost hard. I then laid on it and my worries went away as it formed around me beautifully. It is firm but very comfortable. The initial smell of plastic was almost completely gone. The first night I we slept on it I did not wake once during the night and awoke feeling really good. I have a bad back and since sleeping on this mattress I have noticed that I awaken with less back pain and stiffness. I am sleeping a lot better also. The gel top on this mattress is amazing as it keeps a nice cool layer even if you stay in the same spot for a long time. When summer comes I see this being a HUGE plus.Pros: Firm but giving, cooling, even firmness over the entire surface area, smell fades within daysCons: Honestly none as of yetI will update in a month or two.4 month update:Looks and feels brand new.No dents, soft/hard spots, and no signs of wear or breakdown.We live in western Pennsylvania and it has been in the 90s during the day and 68-72 at night. The beds gel layer has been a Godsend.I go to bed 2-3 hours after my wife and when I sit and then lay down she never knows.My back has been better in these last 3 months than it has been in years.1 year update:Still looks brand new.No bowing or drooping areas.Every night the wife and I get in it feels like the first night we slept on it.This mattress has literally helped me get the best sleep in the last year than I have in 20+ years of having a bad back.2 year update:Yes, still in love!Every night feels like the first night in this dream. Cooling still works fantastic, it is still the same firmness as when brand new, and it stills forms to my body perfectly. Would and will buy again!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded my expectations!', 'author': 'Jenny Marquardt', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Amazon Basics Cooling Gel-Infused, Medium-Firm Memory Foam Mattress in Queen Size, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This mattress has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort and quality. The medium-firmness level is just right, providing excellent support for a good night's sleep.The cooling gel-infused memory foam is a game-changer, especially for hot summer nights. It keeps me cool and comfortable throughout the night, ensuring a restful sleep. I also appreciate that this mattress is CertiPUR-US Certified, which gives me peace of mind knowing that it's free from harmful chemicals and safe for my health.The 12-inch thickness adds a luxurious feel to the mattress, and it fits perfectly on my queen-sized bed frame. The white/gray color scheme is sleek and modern, making it a stylish addition to my bedroom decor.Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics Cooling Gel-Infused Memory Foam Mattress to anyone in need of a comfortable and affordable mattress. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I've been sleeping better than ever since I started using it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this mattress', 'author': 'Margaret Butler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a super comfortable mattress, I love it. It forms around the body so no pressure points, and I move around less at night so I'm sleeping better. We put it on a 14 inch platform so it's 2 feet high, like a 5 star hotel where the bed is nice and high. The price is fantastic. We tried other beds at the store for much more money but none were as comfortable as this one. Yes it was shrink wrapped but we had no trouble getting it out of the wrapping and it was ready to go in 72 just as they promised, and no smell. I highly recommend this mattress for a great night sleep.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable bed at affordable price', 'author': 'Heath', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered this bed for guest bedroom, not worrying too much if it wasn't the most comfortable bed in the world because we don't have a lot of guests. The price was good and delivered quick. Set up was easier than I expected because I put it on top of the metal frame and cut the plastic open and it opened right up onto the frame. Within minutes it was full size, full expansion, and no offensive smell. I still let it rest for 2 days before putting sheets on it, then I laid down on it and couldn't believe how comfortable it was. It's actually more comfortable than our $1000 Tuft & Needle memory foam mattress. Great purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Meh - It's Ok, but consider saving for a better one", 'author': 'Tnek', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'TLDR - Mattress is well constructed but the memory foam isn\'t dense enough to support me fully so I sink into the support layers without the cradling feeling from denser memory foam. It\'s not terrible, and is better then what I have used recently, but it may go back. And yes, it sleeps hot.I have been somewhat on a mattress sojourn the last 2 years after a decade old tempurpedic became too uncomfortable. The first 8-9 years with the Tempur were good, but I sleep hot, and vowed to move to something that had more air flow/didn\'t trap heat. I started with a bed in a box mattress that was great the first 30 days, painful the next 30 days, and returned shortly after. After that, I bought a cheap Ikea mattress after spending an afternoon at the store trying every one they had. I thought I had hit a home run - it was cheap, the one in the store was super comfortable, and it was a spring mattress so it would be cool. 90 days later my back was sore, my sleep was terrible, and I wanted to burn it.I had happend to travel for work, and stayed in a hotel where I got three nights of amazing sleep. I called the hotel and asked what mattress set up they had - and bought the retail version of it. But apparently something got lost in translation between the hotel version and the home version or my body rejected it after 90 days, but it too ended up being uncomfortable.So I finally gave up and decided I would get another memory foam mattress and deal with the sleeping hot with either highly breathable sheets/blankets or a fan. I did some research and after reading a gazillion reviews on the myriad of memory foam beds out there, I went relatively cheap based on the good reviews on Amazon for this mattress. My general thought was - it sounds as good as any of the others and is cheaper, and it\'s through Amazon.And.... it\'s OK.The big issue, in my opinion, is Amazon doesn\'t say what the foam density is. It says it\'s a medium firmness mattress which is highly subjective. As I understand it, there are different densities for memory foam. For instance, a soft memory foam can support 2.5 lbs per square inch, a firmer one 5 lbs per square Inch. I would guess this one is on the softer side because rather than cradle you like the old Tempur did, I kind of sink through and end up on the very firm support layers. If you have a softer memory foam, you probably need more than 2" of it. Denser ones probably work fine at 2".What this means for sleep - sleep is just OK on this mattress, not great. Some days I wake up with similar back pain as I did on other mattresses. Some days I sleep decent. This is a better mattress than the last three I have tried as I can get more than 6 hours of sleep on it before my body completely rebels, but it sleeps hot and I still wake up with aches. I will give it another 30 days or so to see if my body gets used to it, but I am starting to lean towards returning it.Rating mattresses is of course a very personal thing. We are all different. My recommendation on this mattress would be to pass on it, and find one that either had 3" of memory foam or denser memory foam so you get the true cradle effect memory foam is known for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon Basic Memory Foam Mattress', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased a memory foam pillow a decade ago. The smell was so horrible that I banished it to the garage. Weeks later the smell was still so strong and offensive that I threw the pillow away.That experience made me very hesitant about purchasing a memory foam mattress, but a close relative assured me that she had experienced no odor when she purchased her memory foam mattress. After talking with her and reading numerous reviews, I made the decision to purchase the mattress above. I offer the following comments to help others decide if they want to try a memory foam mattress.1) Prepare for the EXPANSION EVENT.A memory foam mattress comes in a box and is rolled tightly in plastic. As you unroll the plastic, physics takes over and the mattress starts a growth process you cannot stop.My husband removed the box, stood the mattress up on one end and began unrolling the outer plastic wrapping as I rolled up the plastic he was removing from the mattress. We had cleared a twin size area on the floor. The mattress immediately started expanding and it was necessary to lay it on the floor before we could cut off the heavy plastic bag in which the mattress was sealed under the outer plastic wrapping. Once all the plastic was removed, we left the mattress on the floor for two days to firm up. The third day my husband carried the mattress to its bed frame, where it continued to firm up. Moving the mattress was challenging because the expanded mattress is very wobbly and difficult to handle. We would have needed a second or third person if the mattress had been a larger size. Consider letting the mattress expand on the bed frame so moving it is not necessary.2) PlasticThere is a lot of heavy plastic to dispose of. Find a store or recycling center.3) Waterproof Mattress ProtectorIt is essential to have a waterproof mattress protector and our mattress did not come with one. The mattress is a foam product and anything you spill on it - food, blood, urine, vomit - will stain the foam and is likely to create permanent smells. Amazon has a good selection of waterproof mattress protectors.4) Memory Foam OdorOur mattress had no odor.5) Corners Not ExpandingSome reviewers mention corners that did not fully expand. Our corners expanded fully once the inner bag was removed from the mattress.6) FirmnessHow firm do you want your mattress? After reviews and recommendations, we decided on Amazon\'s medium firm, 10 inch mattress. It is comfortable, and does not "trap" you in the foam as some reviewers said could happen with softer mattresses.7) HeatConsider this issue carefully based on your preferences. As you lay on a memory foam mattress you will feel a warmth. This gentle warmth is comfortable and relaxing, and is one reason I would choose a memory foam mattress again. Removing or adding a blanket can help control the heat level.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable and affordable.', 'author': 'Violet', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had my previous mattress for over five years. It was a cheap-ish one that was definitely well past its prime from use.Changing to this new mattress was an instant dream. We recently moved and I couldn’t afford much more than we paid for this one, and also have yet to get a bed frame (new size for us).Now that I’m more used to this mattress, I can really appreciate it beyond being better than the old one. I never get overheated, I sink into it but have plenty of support, I’m never sore and I sleep HARD. I’ve also noticed that I don’t get woken up when my partner leaves the bed or is shuffling around- this is so huge to me because I am normally a very light sleeper and wake up for anything. This is easily the best, most quality sleep I’ve had in years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Gel Memory Foam Mattress, 12-Inch CertiPUR-US Certified Bed-in-a-Box, King, White
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Lot's of support and really comfortable.", 'author': 'Peter Brodell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered another mattress a hybrid for a little less money and for some reason, a few days later I was browsing something else and then looked at my order, and pulled up the mattress info I just ordered. I delved into the customer reviews which I usually pay closer attention to but I was focused on the low price. I read review after review with a bunch of really unhappy customers. So many that I freaked out a little and went to cancel my order and although I thought it would be too late it was not. So I dove back into the mattress pages and after about 6 hours of serious shopping, I found the Vibe. I read every review and there was 77% rated it a 5. There were a couple of haters (there always are)and they were complaining about fiberglass, and apparently, this product had an issue with fiberglass particles sloughing off of it. That didn't make sense 77% gave it a 5. Then I see the company got sued for the fiberglass and then I saw it, the review was from 2013. I did some further research and found yes the company was sued years ago for the fiberglass issue but this problem was rectified completely years ago. So after that, it looks like the company went really hard into quality control and is certified by several companies as 100% all good! Now, I am a 60+ disabled veteran, and the mattress I had, was really soft and comfy but was now leaving me in agony every morning. It was horrible. So I ordered the Vibe Twin XL and paid a little over $200 for it and the price was right in my wheelhouse. It came in a very manageable box, 40 lbs totally deflated, and in two thick plastic bags. I freed the mattress and placed it on my bed frame, wooden slats are fine. Almost immediately, after 1/2 hour, my 12-inch mattress was now 10 inches thick so I could sleep on it that night. It takes about 24 hours to completely reach its full size. There was zero odor, zero issues. The top few inches are some really luxurious dense memory foam. They say it's medium plush but I disagree, I think it is more like medium, medium firm. I went to bed early and slept all night for once in a long time but when I got up, I sat right up and there was... NO PAIN!! I'll always be a little stiff due to age and several motorcycle accidents, but man I was so happy! There is a 10-year warranty as well but for $210 I am ecstatic. I weigh 265lbs. I am fine. The bed is firm but with the memory foam top layers, it is also soft in just the right way. I don't know what else to say, great mattress, great price, Prime delivery 0%. Very very very happy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best value in memory foam beds', 'author': 'Bobobon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After researching for many months (you know the drill: Consumer Reports, paid articles, YouTube, etc.) we had the opportunity to test ride a Vibe bed for 10 nights at a friends home. We loved it. The friend had simply needed a bed quickly and he saw that the Vibe is an Amazon Choice. He ordered it and then bought another. I saw the price and clicked "Buy Now"!I would agree with the assessment that it is "medium firm". But this subject has been butchered by opinions from so many directions, it\'s a joke. To qualify: if you are familiar with memory foam bedding, "medium firm" is IMO, accurate. If you have been sleeping on a classic inner spring mattress, you might call it soft or "medium soft". Let\'s clarify.Beds like this have "pressure relieving" softness on top. The Vibe has two inches of it. It really feels soft on the hips and shoulders. But...this bed is also really firm in terms of back support. I think it is the perfect combination of comfort and support - great for sleeping on your back, stomach or side. We have slept on Tempurpedic brand beds and found them comfortable but actually "hard" compared to the Vibe.Our history has been classic moderately expensive inner spring mattresses. Plush from Stearns and Foster. Pillow top from Sealy. Each was about $1000 for just the mattress. The vibe is so good I would have been OK with paying that again. But we didn\'t! Ours was $266 (it will be plus or minus based on the day you buy).One complaint which we think will resolve itself. Everyone has a different sense of smell. My wife smells stuff I don\'t and vice versa. The Vibe has an odor. We have been airing it out for a couple days. It does seem to be dissipating.I attached a picture of the bed about 30 minutes after we released it from it\'s plastic captivity. Fun to watch. It\'s about 11" high and soft. By the next day it was the full 12" and the firmness set in. While you could probably sleep on this bed right away, we recommend waiting several days for the odor to fade and for the total firmness factor to be established.Based on the hundreds of reviews and sales pitches I have read, I don\'t think you would do better if you spent 4 or 5 times the price - and that is easy to do. If this bed is still performing well in 5 years, then all my effusiveness will be an understatement. Wow. What a bed.Update a few months later: The odor we mentioned has all but disappeared. We have been using this mattress in the guest room and as a secondary bed when one of us is ill. We like it so much that we are planning to swap it with the mattress in the master bedroom. It will be the primary bed for us. I think you could easily spend 3x this price and possibly be less happy. Highly recommend.Update June 2021. We made the swap. The Vibe is our every night bed. Wonderful. Almost zero motion transfer. Awesome back support. I see that the price is now more. It is still a bargain. Best bed ever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I was hesitant, but this was a great purchase.', 'author': 'JWT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This item arrived one week ago. I allowed it to expand for 2 days--a full 48 hours--and it did reach the full 12" thickness. (When I first took it out of the packaging, I was certain I\'d made a mistake since it was so flat and misshapen, but after giving it some time, I was pleasantly surprised.) I\'d had my previous mattress, a standard mattress, for nearly 14 years--well beyond it\'s normal life--and I\'d been shopping for a new mattress for about a year. So far, this one is firm where I want it to be and softly supportive where I need it to be. I read the reviews about a lack of firmness on the sides of the mattress. I can\'t tell any difference between this mattress and my last one, but the sides aren\'t any more firm than the rest of the mattress. So far, I\'ve slept better and I feel better after sleeping. I\'ll try to update after a month and again after a year if possible. But, so far this is money well spent. OH--I detected no smell, and that\'s something I\'m really sensitive to.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good deal on a firm and WARM mattress.', 'author': 'Midmofan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We got this mattress to replace a 25 year old waterbed that was giving up. Did not want to spend a ton of money on a mattress right now since might be moving sometime in the near future and who knows what we will want to do then.The thousands of reviews on all of the memory foam mattresses are all over the place! It does not help that, the way Amazon groups the reviews, you cannot always tell exactly which mattress the reviewer purchased (10 inch? 12? Gell/no-gell/hybred??). Here is my impression of the VIBE 12 inch California King Gel Memory We have only had this several weeks, so take that into consideration.First off, the mattress arrived a day earlier than Amazon said it would. That was great for me, but be sure to check your tracking # with the delivery company if you don\'t want yours sitting out in the rain or snow unexpectedly. The box was huge as you would expect for a King size. Not sure exactly how much it weighed, but based on shipping documents, it was somewhere between 80-100 lbs. Don\'t worry too much about someone stealing this off of your porch! Despite the size and weight it was not that difficult for me to "walk" the box into the house and then push it up the stairs to the second floor.The hardest part of the unboxing was how many heavy staples were used to close the box. After got it open, the procedure was just like the video. Cut open the outer plastic bag and the thing starts to unroll itself. You can hear the air hissing already into the mattress. Then cut the inner plastic and the thing starts to expand. Funny note: The instruction sheet on how to open the bags is INSIDE the bag! You will want to get the mattress pretty close to where you want it to wind up - especially if you buy a big one - as it expands quickly. The quality of the mattress seems very high. Made in Vietnam. Seems like they do good work there.I was hoping that the mattress would fit into the old waterbed frame so I set it sideways on the bed frame with boards underneath it (see pic 1) to let it expand and air out as many reviews (and the inside-the-bag instructions) all talk about a "smell" when you first open it up. However, we notice absolutely no smell from the mattress at any time.Almost immediately the "outer" end of the roll (closest to camera in pic 1) expanded to almost 11 inches. The far end was pretty close to the same. The middle was at about 8 inches (pic 2) and only very slowly expanded. It took more than 48 hours for it to get to about 11 1/2 while the two ends went to 12 quickly, so I was worried for a while there would be a big sag, but it eventually evened out.After it got to full size, just spun it 90 degrees, put on some sheets, removed the boards, and it fit perfectly into the old Calif-King waterbed frame.How does it feel? I think some people (and some mattress makers) do not understand the differences between apparent "softness" and things like "compression." If you just push your hand on the mattress, it feels very-very soft, your hand goes down several inches quite easily with no effort. That is most likely the upper "gel" layer. Once you are on the bed however, your body hits and is supported by the next foam layer and that does not give very much at all. This effect is not really noticeable when spread out on your back and weight evenly distributed on the gel, but you really feel it if rolling on your side where there is more weight on smaller pressure points. At the same time, while it is firm, it is different from the firmness of a standard mattress, it is not like a board, there is at least some give even when on your side, but you feel the foam\'s resistance.The end result is, overall, a very firm mattress. It is not as firm as some really hard mattresses I have slept on, but it is up in the top 10-20% or so on firmness I would say with it feeling more firm when on your side than on your backVerdict? For me, this might be the absolute most comfortable mattress ever for lying on you back. Propped up reading a book, you feel like you are floating but with support. It really is amazing., much better than the old waterbed or any standard mattress I have ever been on. On my side, which is how I often sleep, I decided that I would be happier - and would get to sleep sooner - if it was a bit softer. Thus, I purchased one of those quilted pillow-top mattress covers.The mattress also holds heat pretty well, despite the "cooling gel" claim. If you are under a comforter or or even a lighter cover that does not "breath" the heat is going to build up. The heat dissipates quickly if you pull the covers back. The quilted mattress cover/top I purchased really helped out here so you can get a bit of air between you and the mattress.Overall then this is a very good deal on a very good mattress, and you are saving enough to go ahead and budget for getting a good mattress topper if the firmness or heat is a problem. So, under $300 for a Cal-King mattress that is working this well (so far), is very good price and value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm Comfort, Sleeps Cool', 'author': 'T. Bull', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wanted to replace an 8-inch Tempur-pedic Simplicity Medium mattress at a second residence that I found to be too soft and slept too warm. Having previously purchased and been happy with a Zinus 12-inch Gel-infused Green Tea mattress for a guest room at my primary residence, I planned to buy another one this time. However, the Zinus was out of stock and I did not want to wait, so after reviewing several other brands I opted to order the Vibe 12-inch Gel Memory Foam mattress. As typical with most memory foam mattress reviews, a few people complained that the Vibe was either too soft or too firm, but a high percentage of reviews were very favorable. I am a 6 ft 2 in, weigh 240, sleep mostly on my side, and prefer a firmer mattress, and the Vibe appeared to be a good match for me. After delivery, I rolled out the compressed mattress on the bed slats and opened the bottom end with scissors. The attached picture was taken about an hour after mattress expansion. As many have commented, the corners were a little slower to fill out, but they were in pretty good shape within a few more hours. Some odor, but it mostly dissipated within about 8 hours, and I slept on the mattress that night. If you are sensitive to odors, you may want to wait a bit longer, but I was fine. I was pleasantly surprised with the firmness of the mattress finding the top layer gives enough to be comfortable while the base layers provide excellent support. I don't sink into the foam like I did with the previous Tempur-pedic mattress, so I don't find myself partially waking at night to lift my body up from the depression to roll over. I have also found the Vibe mattress to sleep much cooler than the previous mattress, so I don't find myself waking up sweaty and having to toss off the comforter or top sheet to cool off. Overall, a much higher quality level of sleep with no back aches from too soft of a mattress. Too soon to predict how the mattress will hold up in the long term, but at this point I am very happy with the quality of the materials, the higher quality of sleep I am now getting each night, and I think the Vibe mattress is an excellent value for your dollar if you are looking for a comfortable firm mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Support and Comfort', 'author': 'Julie Bishop', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'updated on 12/21/18: still enjoying this mattress. I ended up putting on a kohls "big one" mattress topper as I like a soft bed. this mattress was a little firmer than I preferred as I noted in my first review. I read a few reviews saying they found the mattress stayed "dented" as they slept on it. I haven\'t found this, I weigh 170 lbs and the mattress refreshes its shape as soon as I move away from the original area. overall, still pretty impressed with this mattress. its on the firm side, but the topper I put on it has made it absolutely perfect and I sleep well, and yes, it does stay cool.Was a little hesitant to buy a gel memory foam mattress online, but after looking in all the stores and their prices, I figured I would take a chance. I am very pleased with my purchase of this king mattress. It is hard to comment on the plushness level as not everyone agrees on what is soft, hard or plush due to their personal taste. I was replacing another regular king foam mattress that I have had for 6 years. I cut it down to queen size for a guest bedroom as I found it so hot to sleep on. It was a great mattress, nice and soft, and I really liked it. But I am a very hot sleeper and was getting tired of waking up several times a night literally sweating (Im in FL). This mattress was put on a king platform bed with bungy boards for support. It expanded to 12" within about four hours and there was absolutely no odor as I had read some reviewers had a problem with this. It was packed very well, the box was a little beaten up upon arrival, but the mattress is packaged so well, this did not matter. I m in my late 50s and I had no problem dragging it into the house on a dolly and then dragging it into the room. Once I got it out of the box, I had no problem getting it onto the platform bed and removing the packaging and placing it to expand. I have slept on it for about 3 weeks now. At first I thought it might be a little too firm for me, I like a very plush mattress. But I decided to give it a chance as I could always put my old gel memory topper back on if needed. After 3 weeks I find it\'s not too firm, it\'s just right for good support for my back, but plush enough that I sink into it a bit. Once I move, the small indentation goes immediately back to its original shape. And I no longer wake up many times a night in a sweat. The mattress is not overly cooling, I find it just right. The side edges are firm enough to offer support if sitting on the edge. The cover on the mattress is beautiful and high quality. But I still put on a mattress cover just in case. Overall, I am quite happy with this purchase. Buying a mattress online can be intimidating as I am not sure what people do when they have to return a foam mattress. But this mattress is a keeper and I sleep so much better now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Firm Mattress', 'author': 'Mackenzie Hungerford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So glad my husband and I chose this bed! We needed to upgrade from our queen to a King size bed, and being broke college students we had a very small budget. This mattress seemed almost too good to be true for the price, but because of the good reviews we decided to go for it. I had spent weeks researching just about all memory foam beds in our budget, and this one seemed to fit the bill as far as quality, price, and durability.The bed arrived in the box a day sooner than expected, and was surprisingly easy to carry up the stairs into our bedroom. We unboxed and unwrapped it and let it air out on the floor for about 30 hours. We didn’t really have anywhere else to sleep so we did decide to set it up and sleep on it after only a day and night for it to expand and air out. It was fully expanded by then and had lost any “factory” smell and was absolutely perfect to sleep on. My husband is tall and just over 200lbs, and he’s a side and back sleeper, and I’m also tall and around 140lbs and a side sleeper. We both prefer firmer beds, and this mattress is definitely firm, which is perfect for us. I also have Fibromyalgia though, so I was worried that the bed would be too hard, but it still has lots of cushion and give. We’ve both been sleeping better than ever on it, and my husband says his chronic back pain was gone after sleeping the first night on it.Something important to note is that the entire bed is memory foam, even the edges, so they do slope if you sit/lay right on the edge. This hasn’t been a problem at all for us, especially as we got a King and have plenty of room, but I can see that possibly being a bigger issue if you got a smaller size.Overall I could not be happier, and after 6 months we are still incredibly comfortable and happy with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Our Entire Sleep Set Up is From Amazon and This Bed Is the Bees Knees', 'author': '@misfitrightin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We were a bit skeptical of this. We bought it on Prime Day for $270 including a mattress protector. It is by far the cheapest bed me and my wife have owned, but it\'s also the first time we have owned a King bed. Our previous bed was $700+ hybrid. Before that, I owned the Tuft & Needles Queen bed. This surpasses both of them EASILY. Here\'s the run down:Over the past three years, we\'ve slept on a Queen bed. I am a 5\'11 220lbs CrossFitter. I take up a lot of room. She\'s a 5\'4 130lb dainty thing, but she likes to spread out like Shaq when she sleeps. We share the bed with a 40lb Corgi mix, who also seems to think he\'s entitled to at least half of the bed. One of our cats never sleeps with us, but spends most of the night attacking our feet. The other cat sleeps wherever she finds room. Our queen hybrid was awful. We all slept hot and fought for space. I\'m a heavy sleeper, so I never noticed how uncomfortable I was until I woke up groggy and exhausted ALL THE TIME. She woke up dozens of times every night. We were at a point where SOMETHING had to change because no one was all that comfortable (except the dog.......).So we just went for it. A $300 king had to be better than what we had. Our bed arrived three days before our bed frame. Waiting to pop this sucker open was the hardest part. When we finally assembled out new bed (the Zinus Florence and I\'d recommend it HIGHLY), we knew the rules: wait 24+ hours or something before sleeping on it. We live a one bedroom apartment; where is this other place we\'re supposed to sleep? We decided to just do it.And holy crap was it UNCOMFORTABLE. My back was burning the next day. I was miserable. She slept well, but only because there was a chasm of space between everyone in the bed. The dog took up a huge amount of space, but we never noticed him. All the cats even slept on the bed, but we never noticed them. We barely noticed each other. If you\'re living on a Queen bed, a King is like upgrading to the Taj Mahal. Anyway, back to the sleep ...IT WAS AWFUL. So, why am I recommending this bed? Because we didn\'t listen to the instructions. Four hours of having this bed inflate just wasn\'t enough. It felt like sleeping on a slab of hard concrete for me. I dreaded how much my wife liked it because it meant I\'d be stuck with it. Oh well, I thought, that\'s the price I pay for wanting my wife to be happy.But then, something happened. The next night --- a little over 24 hours after the bed had a chance to inflate --- laying down was a DREAM. I sank into that sucker like a melted stick of butter. I slept the sleep of angels. Now I can\'t get off of it. I\'m writing this review from it. Our cat hasn\'t left it in hours. We don\'t even use our couch anymore. This bed is LIFE-CHANGING. It puts my old Tuft & Needles to absolute SHAME. And yes, because we know you\'re wondering, this bed was super comfy to do the naughty stuff on, too... plenty of give and bounce. ;) Anyway, what are you waiting for? GET THIS BED.By the way, like 100% of our bed set up is Amazon. Here\'s the breakdown:-Vibe 12" Memory Foam King Bed ($270.74)-Zinus Florence Black King Bed Frame ($197.00)-Waterproof Mattress Protector (free w/ Vibe bed)-Mellanni Brushed Microfiber Bed Sheets ($29.99)-Utopia Bedding Gussetted Pillows ($30.99)-CuteKing 60x80 Weighted Blanket ($39.99)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best Value for Your Money!', 'author': 'D. Marie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It seems to be a common theme that those of us that need a new mattress, but at an affordable price, do a ton of research. I searched for weeks online for different mattresses at different stores and tried to see who was having specials (I tried to know which one I wanted by Amazon Prime week, but I just wasn't ready to decide by then!). I looked at beds that had thousands of reviews because I thought those would be most reliable due to the quantity of those that had tried the bed. I looked at beds that didn't have a ton of reviews (like this one with I think like 400-700 hundred, I can't remember), and I also did Google searches to find more thorough reviews from professionals. My goal was to buy a king size mattress for $250-$300. I was really close to picking the Amazon Basics (or something like that) and I can't remember exactly what pushed me to this bed, but I think this one was actually a bit less expensive for the 12in size vs the 10 inch and from my research I did gather that the general consensus was to get as many inches as possible (that's what she said) because a memory foam bed probably wouldn’t expand as largely as it should. So the Vibe bed it was!I ordered on a Thursday and it was supposed to arrive on Saturday (the day my new bed was to arrive), but lo and behold I had it by Friday night! As you see the box came it a very good condition (something I think some have complained about). So I am a single woman and had to get it up to my bedroom on the second floor. I will say it took a bit of elbow grease, but I managed to walk it into the house and then slide the box upstairs and into my room. DEFINITELY do not remove the bed from the box until you are ready to open it.Once upstairs, I laid some blankets down and then pulled the box off (while leaving the plastic on). I unrolled the mattress and it expanded to about 8 inches in less than 20 minutes and 10 in less than 20. I couldn't resist trying it out, so I cut the plastic a little bit and crawled in (seems weird, but with two kids I did not want that plastic off until the mattress was going to be immediately covered with a mattress protector and sheet!). It was decently comfy!Like it wasn't super firm by any means, but my ideal bed is one that literally feels like a super soft pillow, so I did notice a difference there, but it was 95% fine. Like I know a topper would take this bed to 110% amazing so I am good with that.Two days later (I didn't really check the next day) and the bed was fully at it's 12 inches. I was VERY impressed, because the pics in some review of memory foam beds made it look like the edges of the mattress never really took on a rounded square shape. Not this one! This bed fully looks like a completely even, regular mattress.And I have been super tired lately so that could contribute, but honestly I have never slept better on a bed! I set an alarm to wake me up halfway though the night so I can see that I have more time to sleep, and with this bed I always miss that alarm!I snuggle up in this bed with my nice warm comforter and that is all she wrote!I have no comment about whether the mattress gets hot, because with comforters I would have no idea how someone is able to attribute being hot to the mattress and not, um the covers?Overall the only thing that could make this bed better is if it was just a smidgen softer, but truly for the price I would definitely pick this bed again.Some memory foam users complain that the sides begin to sag eventually so I am praying I don't encounter that. Overall, I know this review is rather lengthy, but I wanted to give a review that would have empowered me to take the plunge when I was shopping. Hope this helps!8/5/20 Update:As a single person I sleep on one side of the bed and I will admit this side is lower. Still would buy this mattress!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars If you're not sleeping well,wake feeling tired,wake with more pain. With this comes many fun things which keeps me quite busy, lol. Even though one pushes through the pain which can feel unbearable at times. No matter, we all have to sleep at some point. It seems this is where the challenge begins. I mentioned this only for this and hopefully to help others in reading this review. Pain is part of living. I embrace both. My view is as long as I feel pain I'm still kickin it and feel truly grateful for both. Again I only mentioned this to get to the point of my review of this bed. I've tried many things to sleep on some intentional and some not, lol. Soft beds,firm beds, futons, single size up to Cal King with and without foam. The last three beds I've slept on as I would try all of them at various times in various rooms of my home. With my last purchase going against my common sense, I bought a plush, which set me back $1,400 what a waste.
