title: 6 inch Twin Mattress Bed-In-A-Box, Green Tea Memory Foam, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Much Nicer Than Expected ~ A Great Value For The Price', 'author': '.oOo.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My Queen Bed from Best Priced Mattress arrived today, & while it is still airing out, I can tell you that I am very impressed so far. I uploaded a picture to the customer image gallery so people what the Queen Size looks like.This mattress expanded to its full 8" height in about 6 hours, but I cannot sleep on it yet, because of the intense chemical odor. I did lay down on it to "test drive" it for a while, & I am pleasantly surprised by how comfortable it is. I was leery of buying this bed because I have been sleeping on an airbed for 2 years, & I expected a foam mattress to feel like laying on a concrete slab in comparison - but it isn\'t. Not at all. It is not like the horrible foam mattresses I\'ve encountered in motels & guest beds & spent sleepless nights on in the past. This is actually really nice. All of the foam beds I\'ve experienced felt like a foam mattress topper laying on a sidewalk, so I was afraid to invest much, but this bed is actually quite agreeable. Keep in mind, it\'s not like spring mattresses which have a resistive bounce to them - & it does kind of squish around you & cradle your form where you lay (which some people don\'t like)...but the mattress I was sent is neither too firm nor too soft - it really is just about right. I sink into the body-conforming top layers just the right amount, without feeling like I am "bottoming out". All of my pressure points sink in at the right depths, in the right places. There may be truth to the notion that the thinner memory foam mattresses are more comfortable, compared to thick 12" mattresses, because the thinner beds lack the dense 6-8" resistive base layer of foam that makes the thicker beds so firm. When I tested it out, I was enjoying the sound of the vertebrae in my back popping back into place so much that I hated to get up... It felt great, & only my asthma drove me off the bed.About the chemical odor, I would recommend that those with allergies, asthma, & hypersensitivity to chemicals set up alternative sleeping arrangements for 4 or more days to allow this mattress to fully air out. You don\'t notice it right away after unwrapping the bed, but the more it expands, the stronger the odor becomes. I also bought this bed a zippered vinyl mattress cover as an allergy blocker, so together the two of them smell like the interior of a new car, splashed with a bucket full of paint... : } I shut the mattress in the bedroom, & I air it out with a fan about 4 times a day. I put the ailing airbed in the living room to use while I transition to the new bed. I have had 4 airbeds suddenly go flat in the middle of the night in less than 2 years, so for me it\'s worth the wait to air out just 1 memory foam mattress once - rather than 1 new air bed about every 6 months, all of which smelled every bit as strong as this bed does. Some people shaved off 1 Star for the stench, but I am giving it the full 5 Stars, because it is so unexpectedly comfortable. I never knew a memory foam mattress could feel this decent. I was terrified of how bad this was going to be, & actually almost canceled the order, but so far it\'s actually very nice.I manage fibromyalgia, arthritis, upper & lower back pain, & recurring nerve pain in my arms, & I think I am going to do quite well sleeping on this mattress. I have a feeling that the more I sleep on this bed, the more my back is going to realign itself to where it\'s supposed to be. King Size was unavailable when I made my purchase, which I prefer, but I think Queen is about the largest mattress one small person in chronic pain can lug around by themselves if I ever have to move again.One Major Con: Best Priced Mattress really needs to use better quality cardboard boxes to ship their mattresses. My box ripped open in transit, & apparently hit the ground quite hard, then at some point was retaped. When it arrived, the box contents were full of FedEx truck grime, exhaust stink, & about 10 pieces of large limestone gravel rattling around in the box. That is NOT cool, but the bed itself was sealed in its own bag, & although the bag was cruddy, & got my floor dirty, the mattress itself was not affected by the mess. Best Priced Mattress...if you really believe you make a great product...please ship it to the customer with the respect it deserves.11/14/11 Update:The mattress & vinyl casing did take 4 full days for all of this to air out. The vinyl cover was actually more pungent & took longer to air than the mattress itself, despite having already aired it out for 2 days in my car before the mattress arrived. After 3 days passed, all I could smell was the vinyl. Really give things time to fully air out, & know that unlike regularly replacing airbeds, you\'ll only have to do this once. After 4 days, everything was fine.I\'ve slept 2 nights on the new mattress, & one thing I notice is the bed really holds body heat much better than my 18" airbed, which always remained as warm or cold as the air in the room. Even though my mattress is currently lying on a tile floor, I was quite warm when I woke up, & without needing extra blankets or heating. Outdoor temps are below freezing, so it\'s nice, but when we return to 5 months of temps above 90F, this may be a challenge. This bed also works pretty good for sitting on propped up against pillows with a laptop PC or a book.The best thing I can report is I have not been waking up in pain because of the mattress. It feels totally different to sleep on compared to my airbed, but I wake up feeling pretty good. Overall so far, I am quite happy with this purchase.12/20/11 Update:I love this mattress. My lower back pain has improved dramatically. It has straightened out & aligned the vertebrae in my back like nothing else I\'ve found, except maybe my old semi-waveless water bed. Lying on it also gives the nerve pain in my arm a break. Alleviating chronic FM/arthritis pain helps the pain centers in the brain to shut down, & quit firing...which in turn promotes restorative sleep. This has been like no-hassle physical therapy for my back.Also, unlike airbeds, it is cozy on cold nights. And I no longer fear 3am *deflations*... The chemical odors are long gone. I now ask it, where have you been all my life... lol I am very glad I took the risk & bought one. This bed was a lucky find.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2011', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars EXCELLENT QUALITY! Cheap price but not cheaply made', 'author': 'Sonny Nguyen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is going to be in-depth, and objective, as well as a little bit of subjective perspective. It will be ongoing, as I will continue to update periodically for the lifetime of the mattress. I\'m doing this for the potential customers, because I would have appreciated If more reviews were more specific, and informative as opposed to just simple comments, hence the word review. I read a lot of Amazon reviews on multiple memory foam mattresses that Amazon had to offer, researched in store, and online prior to purchasing this Best Price Mattress. You spend a 1/3 your life sleeping, so I knew this was a VERY IMPORTANT investment, and wanted to make an informed decision. Also, my spending budget was under $1k, wasn\'t trying to spend up to $1k-4k on a Tempur-Pedic; plus the ones I tried in store weren\'t that magical anyways considering the price. I\'ve read that memory foam mattresses tend to last 5 years on average depending you got a decent purchase. So if this lasted even 3 years that accounts to $100 a year, that would be awesome, who could afford not to make this type of investment.To give you an idea, I\'m a male, 24 years of age, 5\'8", 165 lbs, no major health issues, illness, or sickness just some occasional neck and back pains. I haven\'t slept well in more than 3 years now, having slept mostly on pillow top spring mattress, futons, and airbeds. I don\'t usually like taking pills or medicine, but have had to resort to taking Melatonin on occasion due to restlessness. I\'m also a very light sleeper (have been for all my life). For instance, I need the room to be pitch dark, no loud, or sudden noises, so I use ear plugs.2/4/2014First off, I ordered this on Sunday, close to midnight, and received it on Tuesday, before noon; via Amazon Prime 2-day Shipping. Shipping was very quick, Amazon is usually very good about getting the product delivered on time, even a day earlier sometimes. Ups delivery man carried the 80 lbs box with the mattress up 3 flights of stairs with a smile. The box itself had minor blemishes as expected, but no major damage, or anything that would have damaged the contents containing the mattress. Inside the box was the mattress rolled up in a thin, transparent vacuumed sealed plastic, within a durable, semi-opaque, white outer plastic bag with a tie string, along with warranty, and instructions.Setup was easy enough for one person. The mattress began to expand immediately, when taking off the vacuum sealed plastic; and within 30 minutes it was already at 9 1/4"H. Ten hours later it has expanded to 9 3/4"H. Dimensions on the mattress are on point, fits on the queen bed frame perfectly. Directions say to allow for 48 hours of uninterrupted expansion for best results. I strongly do not recommend sleeping on the mattress during the allotted expansion time, doing so may have implications such as not fully expanding as per the instructions. I\'m a little OCD, and cautious, so I\'m allowing at least 72 hours for expansion to ensure quality from the very beginning of use. Most of the reviews said that it had a strong chemical odor, and they weren\'t lying it is quite strong, but not enough to give you a headache. It\'s been airing out for 10 hours, the chemical odor is still quite noticeable, and this is with a tall window open and the ceiling fan on high, but again this is to be expected. I took the mattress cover off, and will leave it off for the 72 hours to enable it to expand, and dissipate unhindered, also going to wash it to hopefully lessen, and mask the smell. The white removable cover is thin, lightweight, soft, smooth, surprisingly durable, and seems to be of decent quality; the detail design pattern looks to be little flowers of some sort. Underneath the removable white cover is some type of non-removable beige, mesh cover, not too sure what its purpose is, but if you really needed to you could cut it and remove it I guess. I lied on the bed for a couple minutes when it was initially expanding, and it felt really soft, plushy, not really firm, but supportive if that makes sense.I liked what I felt in the few minutes that I had with the mattress; we\'ll see if it can wow me in the long run though. My only con or gripe about the mattress thus far, would have to be the chemical odor, but again it was to be expected. A friend told me that they actually don\'t compress the bed until it\'s ordered, because if it were compressed for a long time and the chemical dried out, it\'d probably stay compressed to a certain point. I\'m assuming that the chemical helps to compress the foam as well as expand it, a sort of lubricant if you will. Let the chemical run its course, and dissipate, it was implemented for a reason.Additionally I bought a Sleep Innovations Cool Contour Memory Foam Pillow from Amazon coming tomorrow, which I\'m eager to try, should go hand in hand with the bed. Also the frame Sleep Master Platform Metal Bed Frame/Mattress Foundation, Queen was from Amazon too, and arrived before the mattress conveniently; no complaints.I will update when I\'ve slept on the mattress; possibly a video as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing bed, unbeatable price, and LOOK HERE for answers to your ?'s", 'author': 'A. Hamidi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve slept on an old twin spring-based pillowtop for years so this is no doubt an upgrade...but I\'ve owned this bed for over a week now and I still get giddy every time I lay down on it. So much soft, comfortable support it\'s honestly worth more than twice what it costs. My folks own a king size tempurpedic and this mattress is literally JUST as comfortable, not exaggerating in the least. Do not hesitate to purchase this mattress...I genuinely am saddened by the fact that I didn\'t make this purchase years ago. By the way, I am strictly a stomach sleeper...and this bed is stupidly good for that. In fact, it\'s so damn comfortable I\'ve actually been trying out sleeping on my back and sides...and although I end up on my stomach in the morning...I\'ve been able to fall asleep on my back and sides! (Unheard of for me)For those with some common questions I had/encountered before purchasing (Note, this only applies to the queen size...though, I assume all the other sizes are standard and the company knows what it\'s doing):Q: Is the queen size a standard 60 x 80? --- A: Yes. I measured.Q: Does the Best Price New Innovated Box Spring Metal Frame fit this mattress? --- A: Yes, it\'s made for it- perfect fit.Q: Will standard queen sheets fit on this since it\'s only 8" thick? --- A: Yes they fit...albeit a slight bit loosely. I suggest purchasing some sheet clips to go in the corners of the bed to hold it in place. There\'s some available on Amazon for like $13 that are 5-star rated. Buy them, they are awesome.Q: Does this mattress need a box spring? --- A: No. It would be totally fine laying on the floor, or with the Best Price metal frame mentioned above.Q: Does it have a really horrible chemical foam smell when you open it? --- A: I\'m 26 yrs young and have a pretty keen sense of smell. Honestly, the smell is not nearly as bad as I was expecting based on some reviews. The smell was prominent for only the first 5-10 minutes after opening, and after 24-26 hours of having left the window open and a small fan running it was entirely gone.Q: Is this bed very firm? Some of these reviewers are saying the bed is too firm. --- A: This bed is not "very firm"...though, it is definitely a strong, supporting and firm foam. For stomach sleepers this is very good because with foam too soft their center of gravity would sag in the center and be bad for the back. It MIGHT be a little firm for those who are side sleepers, for example....but again, I\'ve slept on a tempurpedic and this bed is just as good and almost exactly as firm (maybe a little bit less firm, if anything).Long story short: BUY THIS FRIGGIN\' BED, HOLY CRAP.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars High quality for the price!', 'author': 'Julian A. Schulz', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Recently, my faithful Simmons spring mattress started poking me withmetal springs, as the bed began to collapse into itself (from years of use).I went shopping for a replacement, never realizing just how ridiculously expensivealmost any mattress is.I began to search online, not completely convinced it would be wise to purchaseone without laying on it first, but the deals were too hard to resist.I had heard good things regarding \'memory foam,\' and thought it might be a betteroption than the typical spring-equipped style.I ordered this one in a full-size, 8" thick edition, which would fit my wood, platformbed frame.The bed arrived rolled up, vacuum packed in layers of plastic.It was pretty heavy, but i managed to get it up the stairs, to my apartment.After cutting through all the wrapping, the mattress expands quickly (within two hours),to it\'s full size.The mattress was exactly 8", as advertised, and incredibly well made & solid.I expected it to be less firm & more airy, but it was a bit heavier than my old springmattress.When i laid on top of it, the bed felt amazing: Firm, but still cloud-like.However, there was a slight chemical smell that bothered me.I opened all my windows & let the mattress air out, while i went to work.When i arrived back home, i could still sense that lingering smell (it wasn\'t everreally strong, but it was there).The next night, i was pleased to notice the smell was completely gone.My first night on the mattress, initially, it felt great (just lying flat on my back).I\'m a side sleeper, so as i changed position, it sort of felt difficult to move ontomy side, as the memory foam forms a slight crater & cradles your body to the exact specificationsof your shape.When you move to another position, it disrupts the original shape you created, so it feltsort of odd.This bed felt cooler than my spring mattress, and higher (maybe because my old mattress wasslowly collapsing).When i got up the next morning, the bed instantly went back into it\'s original shape,as i pulled my weight off the mattress.It\'s amazing, as you sort of expect to see a slight indentation from your body.I do like this bed, i just might need a few nights to adjust to "memory foam."It\'s comfortable, yet it feels so much different than your standard mattress.The quality is top notch, and my tag said my bed was manufactured 9/22/11!My mattress was only a month old, when it arrived.You cannot beat Amazon\'s 209.00 price, and the free shipping makes it a HUGE bargain!I was set to purchase another mattress from a retailer, until i saw my shipping chargeswould be 80.00.It\'s astounding they can offer free shipping, as this mattress is not small or light to lift.UPDATE: After two weeks of sleeping on this thing, i have noticed it gets even morecomfortable, as the mattress seems to adjust to your own body type & weight.It\'s as if, upon lying on it, it recognizes your frame.And, it\'s true, as others have noted, it is difficult to remove yourself fromthe mattress in the morning, because your body is completely relaxed & immersed in it.It\'s kind of strange, yet pleasant.One thing to keep in mind: The mattress sort of cocoons your shape, thus locking in mostof your body heat, in the process.The result is a warmer bed then you might get with a traditional spring mattress.The nights, already, have been fairly cold out here in the Northeast, so this is nota problem at all.However, come Summer, this could be more of an issue.But this mattress still impresses me with it\'s combination of firmness & softness,and the way it adapts to YOU within a couple of weeks.Don\'t dismiss this after one or two nights, because it will adapt to you.The low, low price offered, still baffles me, though.This is a high quality, thick (8 inch is all you need) mattress.There\'s nothing cheap about it, from material to comfort.I can\'t imagine what a 900.00 memory foam mattress must feel like!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2011', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet Dreams!', 'author': 'Old Retired Guy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wow! Let me start by telling you why we tried this mattress...We just bought an old 1921 house and needed to get a mattress up the narrow stairway. After many measurements and several visits to various mattress stores, it turned out that a standard king size mattress would not fit up our stairs. Our options were to buy a smaller mattress from a store, hack away at the staircase, or try a king size memory foam mattress.I read many reviews of this particular mattress and saw comments about odor, permanent dents where someone\'s butt was, etc. We decided that for the price, if we got it and it was really bad, we wouldn\'t be out that much money. So we ordered this product.It came a few days earlier than they originally estimated. As others have mentioned, it\'s shipped in a large box. I\'m 59 years old and was able to slide the box around alone. If I remember right, it weighed around 70 pounds. One step at a time, I was able to nudge it up the stairs. The box fit with no problems.I slid it into the bedroom and we opened the box, slid the rolled-up mattress onto the floor, and cut open the final container. We then laid it out on the floor and it slowly began expanding into a real mattress. Our bed frame was shipped via a different method and it actually arrived about an hour after opening the mattress. So while the mattress was expanding, we built the frame and slid the mattress on top. Somewhere I read that you should allow 24 hours for it to fully expand but we actually slept on it after about 9 or 10 hours.I have to say, this is a GREAT mattress product. It\'s just firm enough but not too firm. We had tried around 15 much higher-end mattresses at the stores and were able to get a good feeling of very firm, firm, soft, and very soft. We definitely would not have done well with very firm because we both have bad backs. Firm was closer to what we liked, but we weren\'t sure if this would be good either for our backs. Soft was too soft! We didn\'t want to sink into the bed! Anyway, I would place this mattress between the high, high end of soft and lower end of firm. It feels great!We\'ve had it now for about 2 1/2 months. We see no "dents" where we lay. You can sit on the edge with no problem. You don\'t sink in or fall off when sitting on the edge. And when you lay down, you only sink in a few inches. (I\'m guessing down to the bottom foam layer). I think it\'s perfect. It feels better than many of the $1,500-$2,000 ones we tried at the stores!Regarding the initial odor, there was a slight smell to it but not tremendously strong. After a couple minutes, we only noticed it if we left the room and came back in. The smell lasted for probably around 5 or 6 hours. I\'m guessing it\'s just the new foam material smell or maybe something done in packing. But to be clear, it only lasts a few hours.So my wife and I love it! We\'re both in our upper 50s and it seems to have been a great decision. And our backs have no problems with it either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best price mattress 6-in', 'author': 'Annie Dunn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very comfortable mattress. I got this mattress for when guest visit, they enjoy sleeping on it. Mattress is definitely worth what I paid for it. You will like this mattress as I do.🙂', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars HEAVEN ON A CLOUD for this PRINCESS ON THE PEA!', 'author': 'Daenerys Targaryen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am not sure how anyone can sleep on any other kind of mattress now that we have this wonderful mattress. We have used every kind of mattress over the years and memory foam types are the only kind we will use since they are the best for pain relief and comfort. We have this one in queen for our bed. This is by far the best mattress we have ever used and here is why.We looked at memory foam mattresses for days on end after deciding to buy a memory foam mattress. We went to stores and tested everything from Tempurpedic to lesser priced memory foam mattresses and still weren\'t sure which one we should get. I know Temperpedic\'s reputation and love their mattresses but we didn\'t want to shell out 4 to 7 grand for their best mattress so I investigated the science and foam levels of their mattresses at length for days on end for weeks prior to this purchase to find the secret to their mattresses so I could apply that to finding one of equal comfort for a fraction of their prices.I found many other memory foam mattresses here on Amazon and in the stores that boasted about their 3 inch memory foam and 7 inches of base support foam but after close investigation I found that though it sounds great at first all we would really get was 3 inches of memory foam comfort and that to me is no different than a 3 inch memory foam topper. I wanted more comfort than that, and the most inches of memory foam for the price for myself and my family.More memory foam means you will sink in a lot more (less pressure points that you feel) before your body hits the other base foam. As I have back problems and Fibromyalgia (which my mom refers to as the Princess and the Pea Syndrome) I knew we had to have a mattress that would alleviate any and all pressure points such as my hips and knees.The #1 secret most memory foam mattress makers won\'t tell you to look for is the size of the memory foam (top portion), and the super soft foam (middle portion) vs the high density foam base (base foam). Some makers say theirs are the best because of more total mattress inches (14" 17" etc) this is not true. Height does not measure how much it will sink in. The key secret is to look for the size in inches of memory foam and to add that to the size of the super soft foam, this is how many inches of pure comfort and sink in you will really get! Temperpedic knows this as their mattress have smaller foam bases and more LAYERS of memory and super soft foams. The foam base is made of a firmer type of foam used as a foundation in much the same way as box springs are to create a firm base, that type of foam does not provide much give and is definitely not something you want to feel while sleeping so keep that in mind. This mattress has 3 inches of memory foam + 2 inches of super soft foam and that gives us 5 inches of LAYER memory and super soft foam comfort. Just what we were looking for!At first look, you may be shocked at how a quality memory foam mattress could live in such a small box, but just give it a day or so to puff back up to its regular size which it does incredibly fast, it took less than 30 mins for ours to reach 8 of it\'s 10 inches. This mattress is compressed tightly for shipping purposes so it will not look fluffy and soft when you first open that box. Wait to open the plastic wrap covering until you get it to the room you want it. Once its opened up, it is very difficult and hard to move around so I suggest placing it on your bed frame or box spring before opening the plastic seal. The rolled up mattress is incredibly heavy, think about getting help with this if you have back problems, and is even harder to move once the plastic wrap is taken off, hence the advice to place it on the bed before unsealing the plastic. We bought a memory foam mattress frame platform bed for our memory foam mattress as well as a Malouf mattress protector. We have added pictures of the box before opening as well as the mattress once it was opened for a few hours above. My little brother loves it and even named it Heaven on a Cloud, and we all agree!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Mattress, King, was a lemon...', 'author': 'Disappointed 😞', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'UPDATE: I\'ve bought 3 mattresses from this brand. Two of them were great! The Twin and the full. Best beds I\'ve slept in. See the full review below. The King however, seems wrong and or defective.(King sized bed review)This mattress was a lemon! The plastic vacuumed sealed bag had a tear in it, since it exposed the mattress, it developed a dirty spot and divet. It expanded unevenly and parts of it on the edges are still not expanded. The bed itself is SUPER soft, I immediately sink in and I feel like I don\'t have any support. It\'s hard to move since it the spot I sleep in remains dipped for a moment so it feels like there is a hole sucking me in if I turn to a different position, very uncomfortable.I bought this brand because the beds are firm, yet soft enough to relive pressure, however, this was not the case with my most recent purchase. Very disappointed. I asked for a refund and I\'m getting rid of the bed.(Original Review) (General Disclaimer): Bed comfortability is a subjective thing! What may be a great fit for me, may not be a great fit for you! Please know that when reviewing a bed and when selecting a bed. Than being said, let\'s get on to the review.(What I came from):I\'ve owned a memory foam mattress for at least 6 years. My old mattress was more on the softer side of things, so much so that whenever I slept on my stomach (rare) I\'d need an extra pillow on my torso for support, otherwise stomach would sink into the bed. After a few years I ended up flipping the mattress and sleeping on the "hard/support" foam, which was still soft, but not as soft as the side I was supposed to be sleeping on. My body got used to the soft foam, but I knew I needed firm, yet soft support.(The Review):Enter the "Best Price Mattress 12-Inch Memory Foam Mattress" (Full). I was careful when selecting this mattress; I checked the average positive review, made sure that the negative ones weren\'t criticizing for the wrong reasons (e.g. expecting a soft mattress when this one is under the "firm" search category), made sure that the positive review mentioned things that I needed (Firm but not hard, supportive yet soft, no pressure points), and this mattress fits the bill!This mattress seems very firm at first, in fact it took my body a day or two to get used to this bed, now, I don\'t want to get up in the morning! It\'s sooo comfy. I woke up this morning and stayed an extra hour and a half in bed because it\'s so comfy lol. But uest it is firm, so it supports your body well, BUT, when you\'re in bed, and your body heat warms the mattress, it quickly softens and molds to your body.I\'m mostly a side sleeper and this mattress does not give me sore shoulders, in fact, I\'ve so far woken up in the same position I\'ve slept in and that\'s RARE for me, so this mattress is very good and eliminating pressure points and supporting your body.(Unboxing): Was pretty painless, although I had to use a knife because when cutting through the tape I accidentally slightly cut the mattress and it expanded slightly. But once I got it out of the box and the bag, it pretty much expanded to its full size almost instantly. That\'s just for me though, so don\'t expect it to expand instantly for you.For me, I can sleep on this bed on all positions, sides and back seem to be best. Keep in mind that all bodies are different and for me, this works perfectly. If any of what you read is what you\'re looking for in a bed, please, feel free to purchase this mattress.My Body type: Male, \'5 "10, 230Lbs,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It’s a bed', 'author': 'VWilliams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So I got the 6 inch for my daughters full sized bed. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this bed.', 'author': 'Lily', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I must of looked at 15 different mattresses before deciding to buy this Novilla. I ordered the mattress on the 3rd and UPS delivered it on the 5th. In the tracking info it said it weighed 88lbs, but this definitely felt like it was over 100lbs. I had a Serta mattress before this and this mattress felt much heavier!Novilla included a manual and a tool to open the vacuum sealed plastic without running the risk of cutting the mattress itself. As soon as the plastic was pierced it started to make a hissing noise. Once I cut it open all the way the mattress just popped completely open. It did open upside down though so just be mindful. Also, be careful because it can unfold quick.Once open it expanded to full size. The photo below of the mattress opened was taken 10 minutes after removing it from the plastic! My wife and I left it for 4 hours without laying on it, but I don’t think it needed any more then 30 minutes!*As of right now, it’s 9:10PM on the 7th so tonight will be the 3rd night we sleep on it. It’s make no noise, it’s more on the firm side for us, and it feel so much better then the Serta we had!! My wife is about 120lbs and I’m around 195lbs. I know depending on your weight it might feel softer or firmer.I hope this review helps someone who is considering this mattress! If I didn’t already know and had to guess the price, I’d say it’s in the range of $800-$1200. So if you’re thinking about making the purchase and you like a slightly firmer mattress that’s quiet and really comfortable, look no further!I’ll be sure to update this review in the next 2-4 weeks to let y’all know how it’s going.**1 week update 08/12/23I know it’s only been a week, so I don’t have too much to say. It’s holding up great and still feels the same as the day we received it. It has no noise issues, no sinking issues, it’s still very comfortable! The only con I can say about it is it’s just a tiny bit larger then a traditional queen mattress. Each side hangs off the frame by about 1 inch. That’s just me nitpicking though because it’s not a problem whatsoever. Anywho, I hope this review helps someone with their purchase, I’ll check back in at the 1 month mark.***2 months & 2 weeks later! 10/19/232 months with the new mattress and it’s still like brand new! No sinking or anything. I wouldn’t guess this mattress was so cheap if I didn’t already know. 3rd photo posted is from the 2 month mark.**it’s now October 19th and still, the mattress feels brand new! I’ve been rotating it every 2 weeks when the sheets get washed. It’s more broken in now so it might of just gotten a tad softer, but not in a bad way. even a $3,000 mattress will break in after a bit of use. There’s no sagging or anything! It still looks brand new when the the sheets and mattress protector are off of it. I recommend this bed to everyone! Someone on Reddit bought it with my recommendation and I heard from him twice now about how good it’s been for him. So yeah, I’ll continue to check back in, I’m glad my review has helped so many people!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable. title: Mattress Twin, 8-Inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress for Pressure Relief, Enhanced Support & Plush Comfort, Twin Mattress in a Box, Bliss
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality Sleep at an Economy Price', 'author': 'AROD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'To say that the bar was set very low for this mattress to exceed the one it was replacing is an understatement; however, it also had to live up a comparison to the comfort and quality of my full time mattress which is a sleep number. To be clear, this mattress was intended to replace a junk, coil spring mattress in my part time residence, where I wanted to maximize my comfort (and reduce pain) at a price point that made sense. Coming in at just around $300, I figured I had little to lose and, at worst, it would have to be a step above the old mattress. Imagine my utterly pleasant surprise to come and find out that this little gem not only met that low bar, but overwhelmingly exceeded it. I\'ve had this mattress for a little over a month and have slept on it probably near three weeks out of that month. In that time what I have found is that this mattress is extremely comfortable, super easy to set up and provides just the right amount of support where I need it most. In fact, I would say that it almost.....almost provides the same comfort level and support factor as my sleep number mattress. Almost, but not quite.Pros:1. Extremely convenient packaging and set up: A queen size mattress in a box, delivered to my doorstep. How easy is that? The box itself is hefty so you likely will need a helper to get the whole deal into position and especially when it comes time to cut the packaging and have it ready to go "inflation". Instructions provided and easy to follow. Once we properly positioned the wrapped mattress on the box spring it took a simple slice of the plastic (using the slicer provided to us in the box) and voila! new mattress. The directions tell you to allow the mattress to shape for at least 72 hours, but I was extremely hopeful that I would be able to us it that night as one more night on the old mattress was absolutely out of the question. Some people have noted that their mattresses didn\'t form properly or didn\'t reach the intended height (some even after the 72 hours) but I found that my mattress was fully formed and at the right height in no more than 12 hours. I made the choice to use it that night2 Comfort: I\'ve found over the years that I need a firmer mattress to alleviate much of my lower pack pain and stiffness that I\'ve found in using mattresses of lesser quality. The one advantage of a sleep number bed is that you have 100s of different combinations available to you to find just the right amount of firmness or softness to achieve maximum comfort, and over the past year or so that I\'ve owned it, I\'ve found that I fall neatly within the medium firmness category (for those familiar with sleep number, I\'m about a 55 to 60 setting) so having this mattresses advertised as falling into the medium to firm category was really important - and I was counting on that description being accurate. And I can tell you that , at least in my experience - it is. In fact, if I had to assign a sleep number to this mattress for comparison, my guess is that it would fall in the 65-70 range. I say this because while extremely comfortable, it does seem to be just a bit firmer than my current sleep number setting. Not enough that it creates any moderate discomfort, but just enough that I can feel the pressure. For reference - I am in the range of 180-190lbs - I can\'t speak to how well that level of firmness holds for someone in a different weight bracket, but my best guess is that it will hold relatively stable for most people.3 Sturdy - I can\'t speak to how other foam mattresses are in this category, but when sleeping with someone else, I don\'t feel them moving or turning/tossing.4 Price - Sure, you can invest in other, more expensive mattresses, foam or otherwise, for your needs, but out of the box, at this price point, you get a lot of mattress with very little downside. That being said, I cannot speak to how well it will hold up over the long term, or whether it will still be the same mattress in 1 year or even 3, but at this price point, I would be satisfied with with a handful of good quality years.Cons - Really very few to mention, but:1 Edge support - I believe this is an issue with every foam mattress, but the edge support is absolutely not on par with a traditional mattress. That being said, it does not affect my use of the mattress one bit, but for those that need the extra support to get out of bed, or, for those that want to utilize some edge support for "extracurricular" activities - you\'ll find that you\'ll have to adjust for the lack of edge support and plan accordingly.2 Cooling - foam mattresses in general are notorious for running warm and while this mattress attempts to compensate for it by using a cooling layer, I believe that warm sleepers are still going to find themselves sleeping warm. I generally don\'t tend to be a warm sleeper, so it hasn\'t been an issue for me, but it also certainly doesn\'t offer any more cooling features than any other mattress available.All in all, I rate this mattress very highly and certainly would recommend purchasing it assuming its specifications meet your needs. It\'s a high quality, comfortable mattress at a very affordable price point.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A dreamy night's sleep", 'author': 'Kris', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently upgraded my sleep experience with the Novilla Queen size 10-inch gel memory foam mattress, and I must say it has been a game-changer in terms of comfort, support and overall sleep quality.The mattress arrived neatly packaged in a surprisingly compact box. Once I unboxed it, the mattress quickly started expanding to its full size. I left it out for 24 hours before using as the instructions said.The 10-inch thickness of the mattress strikes a perfect balance between support and plush comfort. The gel memory foam adapts to the contours of my body. The medium plush feel is just right, creating an ideal sleep surface for a wide range of preferences.One of the standout features of this mattress is its incorporation of cool sleep technology, ensuring comfortable sleep environment throughout the night.As someone who occasionally suffers from back pain, I can attest to the therapeutic benefits of this mattress. The targeted support to pressure points, has noticeably reduced the discomfort I used to wake up with.In summary, the Novilla queen size mattress has exceeded my expectations. From the compact delivery to the luxurious comfort and pain-relieving properties, this mattress has transformed my sleep experience. It's an excellent investment into a good night's sleep!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still new out of the box, but sleeps great!', 'author': 'Sandra', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just unrolled this mattress 8 days ago, so please keep this in mind when reading this. I will update this review in the future to see how the durability of the mattress holds up. I didn't think mattress shopping would require such an in-depth comparison on different brands of mattresses, but I spent quite a bit of time looking into my options since this was my first memory foam mattress. I was looking for something like a Casper mattress, but didn't really want to spend $800 on a mattress if I didn't have to. I started looking on Amazon to see the mattresses available, and found Novilla. Initially the price drew me in, but the reviews made me make the purchase. I saw how many people enjoyed the mattress on multiple websites and figured it was worth the shot. It looked like a similar version to Casper and Novilla was less than half the price.Mattress came in great condition, and I let the mattress inflate to size for 2 days before sleeping on it. It grew to the full 12 inches and looks great. The first night I was hot, but I just moved into a new apartment and am figuring out the heating and believe this is why. The second night was a deep and solid sleep, and I think the mattress is extremely comfy. It's somewhat firm (probably medium-firm?) but the foam adjusts to your weight and supports you nicely. I'm extremely impressed with this mattress and can't believe it's this comfortable for the price. I really hope this mattress holds up well over time, even if only a few years, because it is very comfortable and I have slept great on it. I can't compare it to Casper or any other brands, but I'd imagine they're similar to Novilla but for a higher price. So far, I would recommend this mattress!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great price on a queen memory foam mattress', 'author': 'Grace D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price you pay, it is a very good mattress. This mattress was clean and did not have a noticeable smell when it was unwrapped. I\'ve been sleeping on it for 7 nights now and it has a softness that contours your shape, but there is still underlying support from the medium firm feel as it is listed (I am 6\' and 195 lbs.). I previously had a medium firm Ashley Sleep Respond (Queen - not bed in a box) that\'s was around $1200, and this Novilla Mattress was more comfortable the first night I slept on it. I believe this is an exceptional value for the quality and cost.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy, Supportive, and Stays Cool', 'author': 'TheKingOfGod', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just moved into a new house, got this queen size mattress. Setting it up, I noticed a note saying it needs 24-72 hours to take its shape. However, it looked fully expanded after just 1 day. First night sleeping on it was amazing, not too soft nor too firm, just right. The layers of foam really worked together to make me feel supported and wake up without any aches.What caught my attention was how cool it stayed. The gel-infused memory foam and bamboo fabric kept me comfortable all night, and there's this airflow thing in the middle that helps too.Setting it up was easy, and it fits great on our queen bed frame, and you can use it on the floor too if you want.Overall, I really recommend this queen size mattress. It's comfy, supportive, and stays cool. Plus, it's good for the environment and doesn't have any strange smells. Just give it 72 hours to be at its best.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A first impression...', 'author': 'Michael W. Black', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Make no mistake, memory foam (gel foam) mattresses WILL feel very different from what you are used to.I have slept on coil spring mattresses all my life and was stubbornly skeptical of the claims on these. After 24 hours and a first night sleep I am beginning to convert. No morning pains and only mild stiffness from my spine getting used to this new (and better) feeling. So a few notes on what to expect...You WILL need to get used to the very different FEEL of this mattress, I figure a week will do it...You CAN sleep on it after the first 12 hours of waiting for it to pretty much stabilize and expand. The comfort will increase after a few nights I expect...Edge support is surprisingly good, but if you are an "edge sleeper" like my wife is you will need to train yourself to stay at least 6 inches away from that edge or risk an undignified plunk on the floor...Whatever your decision, before you buy KNOW you will have to get used to a different feel before you click order...As this is my first memory foam mattress I have no way to compare brands, but Novilla appears to be very quality conscious. It has a cotton outer casing and looks to me like it will last a long time. So far I am happy and that first night\'s sleep was really good. I thank them...**Oh, a side note...I was expecting a foam mattress to be light, but this one weighs pretty much the same as my 15 year old coil spring mattress...**Two week adendum**I have read a number of negative reviews about these Novilla mattresses and felt compelled to address some of them...I can only presume that some people want their expectations matched exactly OR ELSE...1. Several complaints were about ordering a specific thickness and the actual thickness was less. Mine is a 12 inch and at first I thought it was only 10 1/4 inches after the first 12 hours. The next day (after I had slept on it BTW) it had caught up to just under 11 inches. When I put a new 9-12 inch mattress cover on it on the third day it went on a little snuggly, so yes it is a 12 " (I messured the cover thickness), and I would call that pretty exact...2. Don\'t know about these strange smells I read about, I have had this mattress for two weeks and only experienced something of a "new product" smell on the first three days, then nothing else.3. Lots of complaints about firmness on both ends of the scales. Some say too soft and others say hard as a rock...My suggestion if you are not easily pleased is to go to a local mattress store that includes "mattress in a box" types and lay down on their floor model BEFORE YOU ORDER ONLINE. For me I knew there were three different layers, a dense bottom firm support layer, a less dense middle layer that can be called "medium firm, and then the soft feeling top layer that \'YOU EXPECT TO SINK INTO A BIT\'...I am 6\' 2" tall, 75 years old and weigh 212 pounds, and I am enjoying my new mattress...thank you for putting up with my rant...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An INCREDIBLE Surprise...', 'author': 'Joseph', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The average person spends around 120 days sleeping every year. Where you choose to sleep is important, so it has never bothered me to splurge on a quality mattress — sometimes spending up to $3,000.Our very expensive top-brand "hybrid" mattress had springs that began stabbing us after just 5 years (despite a useless 10 year warranty). This time, we took a chance on this very affordable Novilla 12" Memory Foam Mattress... and we couldn\'t be happier. The mattress is cool and comfortable and it doesn\'t transfer motion.Unpacking and setting up the mattress was a breeze. I chose to leave it in our guest room for a couple days to fully expand, however it was actually "ready" after just a few hours. I\'ve read a few horror stories about the smell and — I have to admit —\xa0the box did have an odor that concerned me initially. However, the aroma was gone shortly after carrying the box and packing materials outside.I highly recommend this Novilla mattress and would purchase it over-and-over without hesitation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised! Great sleep and good value for the money!', 'author': 'Nan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Never having used one of these types of platform mattresses before, I was pleasantly surprised.It arrived vacuum seal packed in a 5\'3" tall x 11" wide, approximately 79 lbs in weight, box. I hemmed and hawed and read too many reviews, plus, asked around about these over the past couple of years to have a bit of an understanding and expectation of how these actually work before I finally ordered this well made one made by Dourxi.I was able to order ahead of time and lucky enough to let it expand for the Dourxi recommended,FULL THREE days, before trying it out.With that said, this is a VERY well made mattress from a box in my opinion! title: Full Mattress, 10 Inch Victoria Hybrid Cooling Gel Infused Pocket Spring and Memory Foam Mattress, Full Size Mattress Bed in a Box, CertiPUR-US Certified, Fiberglass-Free Mattress
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My Son LOVES This', 'author': 'mavenmags', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I caught this on sale for my oldest son’s impending launch, with the expectation we’d store it in his closet until he was ready to move (a few months from now- he’s in his last semester of his college program). He has a smaller closet, and the way it’s packaged makes it totally feasible to stand in a back corner until you’re ready to open it. As it turns out, he was excited and ready to open it now. Oof.Fast forward 10 days, after I’ve ordered the up-sized bed frame and mattress protector (I’d already bought the sheets, pillows, and comforter set) and arranged to borrow the neighbor’s guest bedroom so the mattress had a flat place to lay undisturbed for three days, and now he’s lodged a complaint that this new bed is too comfortable and he’s struggling to make himself get out of it for his 9 a.m. class.Our experience was kind of an obstacle course, but here’s what you need to know:• The package is heavier than it looks. Proceed accordingly.• Don’t open the plastic vacuum wrap until you’ve got a flat surface this can lay on for a few days to fully re-inflate.• We didn’t notice any strong odors after opening.• It expands rapidly when you open the plastic. Like… RoadRunner cartoon rapidly. Proceed accordingly.• Standard full-size sheets and mattress protectors accommodate it just fine.• It’s more plush than we expected, but still has minimal motion transfer.• It really does stay cool. My kid sleeps hot and even after sleeping on it for 8 hours, he’s still comfortable when he wakes up.• We have it on a bed frame with closely-spaced metal slats and no box spring, and it’s still fully supportive. I’ll add a board to extend the life of the mattress, but it’s comfortable without either.• I had also planned to add a 3” mattress topper to this when I bought it, to further extend the life of the mattress. I’m still going to do that, but for comfort and cooling, it’s not necessary.• It’s too soft for me, but I have a long-standing angry hip flexor condition that demands a bed only slightly softer than a sheet of plywood.Overall, we are super impressed with this mattress; both at the sale price AND the regular price and we recommend it. It’s a fantastic value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is a quality product', 'author': 'Lindamarie S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This Nap Queen mattress easily shaped itself in a couple of days, and there was no odor of any kind. The corners filled in nicely also. I highly recommend a foam mattress such as this one which has the specially designed heavy foam coils at the bottom. These make such a big difference in balance and support, and I am guessing the mattress will keep its shape much longer than those built out of layered sheets of foam.I have a tricky antique bed which has carved side and end boards, and it has been difficult to accommodate, as it is neither a queen nor full in size. The air mattress I was using died of old age; this Nap Queen full mattress tucked right into the padded and zippered mattress cover which had held the air units. A good starter mattress, and an overall good deal.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Sam K.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this bed for my daughter. title: Queen Size Mattress, 12 Inch Memory Foam Mattress, Hybrid Mattress in a Box with Independent Spring, Soft and Comfortable Medium Firm Mattress, Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US Certified
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saver', 'author': 'Catrina Burks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ok EVERYONE this mattress is awesome 👌 Period.! So first.it arrived in 2 days, I was so scared that it was going to be striaght trash. But omg 😲 😍 I love it we went with the 12in on a platform It soft but firm also. Literally slept the whole night through, I had not had a goodnight rest in a week prior to its arrival. Great buy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Gojef Queen Size Mattress, 12 Inch Memory Foam Mattress, Hybrid Mattress in a Box', 'author': 'Chris Ann of the North', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I ordered this mattress to replace a mattress that we got 6 months ago that was far too soft. After one night on our new Gojef hybrid mattress, we're very pleased with the comfort and quality of our sleep.This mattress is medium firm. Plenty of softness while providing ample support that isn't hard to roll out of when you're getting out of bed. The side walls feel sturdy and firm. No excessive bounce from the springs. The Queen size does a good job of filling most of the space between our headboard and foot board, unlike the previous mattress. No more gap at the head of the bed that swallows remotes and pillows and our fitted sheets fit much better as well.The mattress arrived vacuum sealed, rolled up in a long cardboard box. It's not terribly heavy for most but may require two people to lift, as it is a bit awkward. Unpacking was easy. Simply tear off the box, unroll the plastic, cut the vacuum sealed bag with the included blade cutter and watch your mattress inflate to full size in seconds.We opened our mattress around 2 pm and it was ready to sleep on within minutes, though we waited until our usual bedtime. I didn't notice even the slightest odor or any off-gassing whatsoever. We both had a deeper sleep with less wakeups through the night and no stiff or tingling arms or hips for me. I'm very pleased with the quality and comfort of this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars soft yet firm mattress', 'author': 'Xinyun kang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely love my Queen Size Memory Foam Hybrid Mattress! It arrived neatly packaged in a box, making setup a breeze. The combination of memory foam and independent springs provides the perfect balance of support and comfort. It's soft yet firm enough to provide excellent pressure relief, ensuring a restful night's sleep.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent', 'author': 'Indllen', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'True to size , firm but has a STRONG smell after removing from seal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable', 'author': 'IanTF', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this to replace a Sealy mattress that I had for about 7 years that did not age well. In fact I have never owned a foam type bed in a box mattress before. Instead usually buying standard type mattresses over the years. I have owned Sealy, Serta, Beauty Rest, and Stern and Foster over the years. Ever since mattresses have changed to a no turn type mattress they seem to have less and less durability and longevity to them but the price has either stayed the same or increased. So it was interesting to see how a memory foam bed in a box mattress would compare to these.So first let me say I'm impressed so far. I have slept on this mattress for a total of 4 nights and so far I really like it. I have noticed it sleeps cooler than other mattresses I have owned which I love since I usually sleep very hot. When first laying on it it seemed it might be too firm since it is a medium firm mattress, and I thought this might be a problem. However after a min or two you actually conform into the foam so to speak and it feels really nice. I also know from research that the firmness of the foam will change overtime so it will get softer with age which is perfect, and I also will be using a pillowtop topper with it as well.Secondly I was expecting there to be a smell and I would have to let the mattress/foam out gas for a while before being able to actually sleep on this. This was not the case when I unpackaged it there was absolutely no smell whatsoever. I also followed the online directions of letting it sit for 48 to 72 hours before sleeping on it. Even though the box it came in only specified 24 hours.As far as construction goes. From what I can see on the outside it is well made and looks just like a traditional mattress. There are absolutely no areas of concern that I see with the quality of stitching or anything for that matter.Overall I would say compared to other mattresses this is a great value, is well constructed, and very comfortable. I also have to say I will definitely be purchasing another foam bed in a box type mattress in the future if this one holds up for the same amount of time as a traditional mattress. Simply because the quality and comfort is a no brainer for the cost vs traditional.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy', 'author': 'Tksfirst', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It’s a medium firm mattress. Super easy to pull out of the box and cut the plastic and let it unfold. It immediately turns into a full blown mattress. Soft material on the outside and is breathable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Queen Sized Mattress', 'author': 'OldSenior97', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this 10” Gojef Queen Size Mattress, after my son and daughter-in-law complained about the full sized mattress I had in my guest room. This mattress comes compacted and rolled in a vacuum sealed bag. It weighs about 63 lbs, but I was able to take it from my front porch to our guest room with a small hand cart. My spouse helped me get it on to the bed frame. When we started unrolling it, it was rolled in a clear wrap and inside of the wrap, the mattress was in a vacuum sealed bag. When we unrolled it, it was upside down. I convinced my spouse that it would be easiest to flip it over, before taking it out of the bag. After flipping it over, we cut the bag open. Immediately, the mattress started to get thicker. Within about a minute it was almost 10” thick. We waited 24 hours to use it. It is medium firm. It is very comfortable. We might move it to our bedroom, because it is more comfortable than the queen mattress we bought a few months ago, for our bed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Back pain reliever', 'author': 'JungleGrape', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this Gojef Queen Size Mattress and it is amazing how they shrink wrap it up. Immediately when opening I noticed no weird chemical SMELL! Already knew this was going to be a good mattress, I let it inflate over night and it was ready to jump on. Would say this is medium firm and relief off my back pain', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Linda Mack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Exceeded my expectations…very comfortable and well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price', 'author': 'jakese martin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It looks great! Very comfortable, easy to set up, highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This my second mattress, but only the latest of my lucid products', 'author': 'Maxwell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'IMO: LUCID makes great products. It does weigh a little so if I ever move again I’ll prolly donate it to a local family in need.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not plush but I still love it', 'author': 'JenB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The pros: it expanded to 12 inches thick. It's not a full queen of 60x80, it's a few inches shy (not a deal breaker though as it's just me and I was sleeping on a twin for the last 5 years)All in all I love it, but if you're looking for plush this is not what I expected. I did purchase a topper and that definitely gave me the plush feeling I was going for.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased similar mattress over 6 years ago.', 'author': 'Mitch H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased similar LUCID mattress over six years ago and have been very pleased with the quality. Also like the removable cover which is simple to wash and re-install.Recently moved into a home with a guest room and placed the existing mattress there and ordered an updated version for myself. So far, very satisfied with it as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid, Dependable Quality, But a Little Soft', 'author': 'bobngso', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is my second Lucid mattress. I bought a 14” medium queen right at the beginning of COVID and have been very happy with it.This summer, I was refitting a bedroom in my summer home and bought a 12” plush queen. It’s fine but only fine. The plush is too soft. Don’t mistake me—I get a good night’s sleep on it, and it’s comfortable. I just find the medium firmness better for me.I’ll probably move this to another room in a few years and buy another 14” medium queen for my personal use. The moral is to be certain what degree of give you like in your foam mattress. I now know that I like Lucid’s medium feel better that their plush texture. Your taste may vary. And to be clear, I still get a good night’s sleep on the mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable mattress for side sleeping', 'author': 'FlyGuy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very pleased with the mattress and value for money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm support but soft enough to use on an adjustable frame.', 'author': 'Ron G', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We are using this mattress on an adjustable frame and it has provided a comfortable support while being supple enough to conform to the different settings.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for daughters room', 'author': 'Adriana', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall this was a great purchase. I did get it on sale so it makes it even better. Bought this bed for my daughters room and it is comfortable, it’s the plush mattress so it is way on the softer sink in side. I think this is a great bed for 1 person to sleep on. When more than one person sleep on it it does sink and it makes it uncomfortable to sleep on. If you are 2 adults sleeping in this I will say it is uncomfortable. When I slept on it by myself it was comfortable and I did not have any back pain. I was pleasantly surprised . My 10yo daughter thinks it is that extremely comfortable.For a kids bed or just a one person sleeping bed I do recommend it. If you are a couple looking for a bed, I don’t recommend it, at least not the plush full size. Maybe something a bit firmer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars sleeping good now', 'author': 'kyle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i sleep better and my back probs are not 100% but better then they was im glad i picked this one over others', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Foam mattress', 'author': 'Becky Otto', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy manageable to get upstairs. Works best to set up and don’t sleep on it for at least 12 hours, allowed for firmness to be set', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great quality cover, but VERY Soft, lots of Sinking', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Let me start by saying this was very nice looking right out of the box, super nice cover and was 10.5" within the first 5 minutes. I let it fluff for 36 hours in a 70 degree room with the fan on and it got to 11.25" total height. The first night was horrible; constant tossing, every position I tried I just sank and got stuck. My lower back and hips were killing me with the lack up support. This continued to get worse with every night after, tossing all night in pain getting stuck in a hole. By night 5, I was done with this mattress. I weigh 162 lbs, I need way more support than this. Look at the photos; there is 5" of SOFT foam in this mattress, so soft that with just the strength of my hand/arm I can push through all 5 inches and make it paper thin = no support. Maybe a good kids bed, but won\'t hold up for normal sized people. Thank you Amazon for giving me my money back to put towards another bed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Leesa Sapira Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen Size, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Spring / CertiPUR-US Certified / 100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional mattress', 'author': 'Innovator', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Yes, it\'s a tad firmer than I was used to, but the back and edge support this hybrid mattress offers are exceptional, eliminating the back pain I had with my previous memory foam-only mattress. The build quality and luxurious materials used are high grade. Overall, the Sapira is a class act.Day 1: The mattress arrives in a tall square-box, about 2x2x4. I attached a photo of what the mattress looks like compressed inside the box. Upon placing the mattress on my boxspring, I cut the plastic off and the bed immediately sprung to life, literally, as the coils decompressed. Yes, there is a noticeable off-gassing smell, but it\'s not offensive. I left my window open at night, and 90% of the smell was gone by the next morning.Day 2: At first, the mattress was a bit firm, but after about 24-36 hours the mattress had fully decompressed and was much more comfortable. It\'s probably a 6.5/7 out of 10 on the firmness scale, the way most online professional mattress websites suggest. The top Avena foam layer sleeps cool, so I don\'t overheat. The bounce the Avena foam + the pocketed coils provide makes moving around, and getting out of bed effortless. The off-gassing smell is just about gone now.Day 3: Decided to get rid of my old mattress and keep the Sapira. I sleep mostly on my back, but sometimes on my side and stomach throughout the night. The only sleep position I thought wasn\'t going to work out was the side position, because of the firmness, but the 3 inches of Avena + memory foam actually provide just enough sinkage, while keeping my spine aligned. The off-gassing smell is completely gone now. I bought a mattress protector, and then my bed sheet goes over that to complete the package.When I bought this mattress last Sunday, there were 20 left in stock with Amazon. As of this morning, only 9 Queen-size beds were left in stock, while some sizes other than Queen were already out of stock. So clearly word is getting out about this mattress. At $1,325, it\'s also a lot less expensive than every other hybrid mattress on the market, most of which will cost at least $2,000 more than this one, and will require you going to a showroom, and taking time off work to be home for delivery.In conclusion, I highly recommend this mattress. Please feel free to ask me any direct questions on here. Also, if you have time, I recommend reading the review on Sleepopolis, as it\'s the most comprehensive professional review that matches my own experience.Update: although I bought a Claritin mattress protector, and although when I called Sapira customer service they recommended having one too, I removed it on Day 4. It added a "plastic" feel to the surface of the bed that became unbearable. Once I removed it, that initial softness I experienced on Day 1 came back again. I only intend to use just my bedsheet from here on out. I recommend you do the same.((On a side note, I suggest ignoring the only other two reviews on here, both two stars. Unlike myself, neither one is a confirmed buyer of this product. The first review is too short to be real for a legitimate mattress evaluation by an actual customer. The fact that this mattress has the firmness rating it does shows the Sapira is designed for superior back support, so the reviewer\'s complaint is illogical. The second review is also partially off topic, as they discuss the manufacturers\'s website, which has nothing to do with how the mattress feels. Yes, they are correct the mattress is a little firm, but every other online review already confirms this. So to slam the product with only two stars for performing how it was designed is unfair.))', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good quality and definitely med firm', 'author': 'KC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slept on this mattress now for a week and am very pleased with its level of firmness. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this bed.', 'author': 'Lily', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I must of looked at 15 different mattresses before deciding to buy this Novilla. I ordered the mattress on the 3rd and UPS delivered it on the 5th. In the tracking info it said it weighed 88lbs, but this definitely felt like it was over 100lbs. I had a Serta mattress before this and this mattress felt much heavier!Novilla included a manual and a tool to open the vacuum sealed plastic without running the risk of cutting the mattress itself. As soon as the plastic was pierced it started to make a hissing noise. Once I cut it open all the way the mattress just popped completely open. It did open upside down though so just be mindful. Also, be careful because it can unfold quick.Once open it expanded to full size. The photo below of the mattress opened was taken 10 minutes after removing it from the plastic! My wife and I left it for 4 hours without laying on it, but I don’t think it needed any more then 30 minutes!*As of right now, it’s 9:10PM on the 7th so tonight will be the 3rd night we sleep on it. It’s make no noise, it’s more on the firm side for us, and it feel so much better then the Serta we had!! My wife is about 120lbs and I’m around 195lbs. I know depending on your weight it might feel softer or firmer.I hope this review helps someone who is considering this mattress! If I didn’t already know and had to guess the price, I’d say it’s in the range of $800-$1200. So if you’re thinking about making the purchase and you like a slightly firmer mattress that’s quiet and really comfortable, look no further!I’ll be sure to update this review in the next 2-4 weeks to let y’all know how it’s going.**1 week update 08/12/23I know it’s only been a week, so I don’t have too much to say. It’s holding up great and still feels the same as the day we received it. It has no noise issues, no sinking issues, it’s still very comfortable! That’s just me nitpicking though because it’s not a problem whatsoever. Anywho, I hope this review helps someone with their purchase, I’ll check back in at the 1 month mark.***2 months & 2 weeks later! 10/19/232 months with the new mattress and it’s still like brand new! No sinking or anything. I wouldn’t guess this mattress was so cheap if I didn’t already know. 3rd photo posted is from the 2 month mark.**it’s now October 19th and still, the mattress feels brand new!
