title: Cooling Infused Gel Memory Foam Firm Support Latex-Feel Mattress, CertiPUR-US Certified, Queen Size, White/Dark Gray, 80 x 60 x 12 inches (LxWxH)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Guest Room MVP: Cool, Comfy, and Budget-Friendly Find!', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Let me tell you, this Amazon Basics Memory Foam Mattress is a total GAME CHANGER for my guest room. I snagged it on a whim, needing something comfy and stylish without breaking the bank, and let me just say, it's delivered!First off, the quality is surprisingly top-notch. The memory foam conforms like a dream, cradling your body without that weird sinking feeling. Plus, the cooling gel is NO JOKE. My guests rave about how they sleep like babies, all cool and comfy. And speaking of looks, this mattress is sleek and modern in grey and white, totally elevating the guest room vibe. Bonus points for the breathable cover that never feels stuffy, even in Arizona heat. Honestly, for renters or anyone needing a spare mattress that won't disappoint, this is the one. It's comfy, cool, and budget-friendly – basically the guest room MVP. So ditch the air mattress blues and snag this gem – your guests (and your wallet) will thank you!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Clean Non Toxic, Comfortable Mattress', 'author': 'Ryan Schreck', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The best mattress money can buy for quality, price, and NO FIBER GLASS, NO SMELL, NON TOXIC!! Have purchased 2 of these now and am in LOVE. Purchased a nectar premier copper before this and found out it has fiberglass and comes with muscle aches and pains terrible unworthy of the price. This Amazon Mattress is the way to go, you will NOT be disappointed!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super comfortable for the price', 'author': 'Aaron', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've thoroughly enjoyed this mattress thus far, and I liked that it fully expanded with 24hrs instead of 72. I took one star away because it's a little more firm than iwas expecting and compared to my last Nectar mattress, but it's also half the price so I can't complain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still in love (2 year update)', 'author': 'PaSoccerDad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My stats: 6\'1" 200lbs pinched spinal column, sciatic nerve impingement, poor sleeper, hot sleeperAbsolutely LOVE this matress. When it arrived it was well packaged. Upon opening I had doubts it would expand fully. Took it to an open room and cut open vacuum sealed bag. Bed started expanding rapidly. A few hours later and it looked completely expanded but I followed the directions and waited. 72 hours later it was ready. I pressed on the top of the bed and I was worried, it felt stiff almost hard. I then laid on it and my worries went away as it formed around me beautifully. It is firm but very comfortable. The initial smell of plastic was almost completely gone. The first night I we slept on it I did not wake once during the night and awoke feeling really good. I have a bad back and since sleeping on this mattress I have noticed that I awaken with less back pain and stiffness. I am sleeping a lot better also. The gel top on this mattress is amazing as it keeps a nice cool layer even if you stay in the same spot for a long time. When summer comes I see this being a HUGE plus.Pros: Firm but giving, cooling, even firmness over the entire surface area, smell fades within daysCons: Honestly none as of yetI will update in a month or two.4 month update:Looks and feels brand new.No dents, soft/hard spots, and no signs of wear or breakdown.We live in western Pennsylvania and it has been in the 90s during the day and 68-72 at night. The beds gel layer has been a Godsend.I go to bed 2-3 hours after my wife and when I sit and then lay down she never knows.My back has been better in these last 3 months than it has been in years.1 year update:Still looks brand new.No bowing or drooping areas.Every night the wife and I get in it feels like the first night we slept on it.This mattress has literally helped me get the best sleep in the last year than I have in 20+ years of having a bad back.2 year update:Yes, still in love!Every night feels like the first night in this dream. Cooling still works fantastic, it is still the same firmness as when brand new, and it stills forms to my body perfectly. Would and will buy again!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded my expectations!', 'author': 'Jenny Marquardt', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Amazon Basics Cooling Gel-Infused, Medium-Firm Memory Foam Mattress in Queen Size, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This mattress has exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort and quality. The medium-firmness level is just right, providing excellent support for a good night's sleep.The cooling gel-infused memory foam is a game-changer, especially for hot summer nights. It keeps me cool and comfortable throughout the night, ensuring a restful sleep. I also appreciate that this mattress is CertiPUR-US Certified, which gives me peace of mind knowing that it's free from harmful chemicals and safe for my health.The 12-inch thickness adds a luxurious feel to the mattress, and it fits perfectly on my queen-sized bed frame. The white/gray color scheme is sleek and modern, making it a stylish addition to my bedroom decor.Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics Cooling Gel-Infused Memory Foam Mattress to anyone in need of a comfortable and affordable mattress. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I've been sleeping better than ever since I started using it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this mattress', 'author': 'Margaret Butler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a super comfortable mattress, I love it. It forms around the body so no pressure points, and I move around less at night so I'm sleeping better. We put it on a 14 inch platform so it's 2 feet high, like a 5 star hotel where the bed is nice and high. The price is fantastic. We tried other beds at the store for much more money but none were as comfortable as this one. Yes it was shrink wrapped but we had no trouble getting it out of the wrapping and it was ready to go in 72 just as they promised, and no smell. I highly recommend this mattress for a great night sleep.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable bed at affordable price', 'author': 'Heath', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered this bed for guest bedroom, not worrying too much if it wasn't the most comfortable bed in the world because we don't have a lot of guests. The price was good and delivered quick. Set up was easier than I expected because I put it on top of the metal frame and cut the plastic open and it opened right up onto the frame. Within minutes it was full size, full expansion, and no offensive smell. I still let it rest for 2 days before putting sheets on it, then I laid down on it and couldn't believe how comfortable it was. It's actually more comfortable than our $1000 Tuft & Needle memory foam mattress. Great purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Meh - It's Ok, but consider saving for a better one", 'author': 'Tnek', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'TLDR - Mattress is well constructed but the memory foam isn\'t dense enough to support me fully so I sink into the support layers without the cradling feeling from denser memory foam. It\'s not terrible, and is better then what I have used recently, but it may go back. And yes, it sleeps hot.I have been somewhat on a mattress sojourn the last 2 years after a decade old tempurpedic became too uncomfortable. The first 8-9 years with the Tempur were good, but I sleep hot, and vowed to move to something that had more air flow/didn\'t trap heat. I started with a bed in a box mattress that was great the first 30 days, painful the next 30 days, and returned shortly after. After that, I bought a cheap Ikea mattress after spending an afternoon at the store trying every one they had. I thought I had hit a home run - it was cheap, the one in the store was super comfortable, and it was a spring mattress so it would be cool. 90 days later my back was sore, my sleep was terrible, and I wanted to burn it.I had happend to travel for work, and stayed in a hotel where I got three nights of amazing sleep. I called the hotel and asked what mattress set up they had - and bought the retail version of it. But apparently something got lost in translation between the hotel version and the home version or my body rejected it after 90 days, but it too ended up being uncomfortable.So I finally gave up and decided I would get another memory foam mattress and deal with the sleeping hot with either highly breathable sheets/blankets or a fan. I did some research and after reading a gazillion reviews on the myriad of memory foam beds out there, I went relatively cheap based on the good reviews on Amazon for this mattress. My general thought was - it sounds as good as any of the others and is cheaper, and it\'s through Amazon.And.... it\'s OK.The big issue, in my opinion, is Amazon doesn\'t say what the foam density is. It says it\'s a medium firmness mattress which is highly subjective. As I understand it, there are different densities for memory foam. For instance, a soft memory foam can support 2.5 lbs per square inch, a firmer one 5 lbs per square Inch. I would guess this one is on the softer side because rather than cradle you like the old Tempur did, I kind of sink through and end up on the very firm support layers. If you have a softer memory foam, you probably need more than 2" of it. Denser ones probably work fine at 2".What this means for sleep - sleep is just OK on this mattress, not great. Some days I wake up with similar back pain as I did on other mattresses. Some days I sleep decent. This is a better mattress than the last three I have tried as I can get more than 6 hours of sleep on it before my body completely rebels, but it sleeps hot and I still wake up with aches. I will give it another 30 days or so to see if my body gets used to it, but I am starting to lean towards returning it.Rating mattresses is of course a very personal thing. We are all different. My recommendation on this mattress would be to pass on it, and find one that either had 3" of memory foam or denser memory foam so you get the true cradle effect memory foam is known for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon Basic Memory Foam Mattress', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased a memory foam pillow a decade ago. The smell was so horrible that I banished it to the garage. Weeks later the smell was still so strong and offensive that I threw the pillow away.That experience made me very hesitant about purchasing a memory foam mattress, but a close relative assured me that she had experienced no odor when she purchased her memory foam mattress. After talking with her and reading numerous reviews, I made the decision to purchase the mattress above. I offer the following comments to help others decide if they want to try a memory foam mattress.1) Prepare for the EXPANSION EVENT.A memory foam mattress comes in a box and is rolled tightly in plastic. As you unroll the plastic, physics takes over and the mattress starts a growth process you cannot stop.My husband removed the box, stood the mattress up on one end and began unrolling the outer plastic wrapping as I rolled up the plastic he was removing from the mattress. We had cleared a twin size area on the floor. The mattress immediately started expanding and it was necessary to lay it on the floor before we could cut off the heavy plastic bag in which the mattress was sealed under the outer plastic wrapping. Once all the plastic was removed, we left the mattress on the floor for two days to firm up. The third day my husband carried the mattress to its bed frame, where it continued to firm up. Moving the mattress was challenging because the expanded mattress is very wobbly and difficult to handle. We would have needed a second or third person if the mattress had been a larger size. Consider letting the mattress expand on the bed frame so moving it is not necessary.2) PlasticThere is a lot of heavy plastic to dispose of. Find a store or recycling center.3) Waterproof Mattress ProtectorIt is essential to have a waterproof mattress protector and our mattress did not come with one. The mattress is a foam product and anything you spill on it - food, blood, urine, vomit - will stain the foam and is likely to create permanent smells. Amazon has a good selection of waterproof mattress protectors.4) Memory Foam OdorOur mattress had no odor.5) Corners Not ExpandingSome reviewers mention corners that did not fully expand. Our corners expanded fully once the inner bag was removed from the mattress.6) FirmnessHow firm do you want your mattress? After reviews and recommendations, we decided on Amazon\'s medium firm, 10 inch mattress. It is comfortable, and does not "trap" you in the foam as some reviewers said could happen with softer mattresses.7) HeatConsider this issue carefully based on your preferences. As you lay on a memory foam mattress you will feel a warmth. This gentle warmth is comfortable and relaxing, and is one reason I would choose a memory foam mattress again. Removing or adding a blanket can help control the heat level.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable and affordable.', 'author': 'Violet', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had my previous mattress for over five years. It was a cheap-ish one that was definitely well past its prime from use.Changing to this new mattress was an instant dream. We recently moved and I couldn’t afford much more than we paid for this one, and also have yet to get a bed frame (new size for us).Now that I’m more used to this mattress, I can really appreciate it beyond being better than the old one. I never get overheated, I sink into it but have plenty of support, I’m never sore and I sleep HARD. I’ve also noticed that I don’t get woken up when my partner leaves the bed or is shuffling around- this is so huge to me because I am normally a very light sleeper and wake up for anything. This is easily the best, most quality sleep I’ve had in years.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 8 Inch Ultima Memory Foam Mattress, Fiberglass Free, Pressure Relieving, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, Short Queen, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Memory foam mattress? This is THE ONE!', 'author': 'Betty K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband and I both have bad backs. Our problems are not the same and we both like this mattress. I\'m not going to exaggerate and say it\'s like sleeping on a cloud or all of our problems while sleeping are gone! They aren\'t gone for me. My arms still hurt and then my fingers get numb and tingly or my hips will still ache causing pain all the way to my knees and sometimes ankles. I will say that I don\'t have to drag myself out of bed anymore. My lower back is not crippling me after being in bed all night. The bed is just firm enough to keep you from sinking into it. For me the mattresses you sink into are awesome when you first get in, but then I can barely turn over and my lower back feels like it is swayed when I\'m on my stomach. OUCH! This mattress isn\'t too firm though. I don\'t feel like I\'m sleeping on a covered rock.I noticed in some reviews people thought the mattress had a smell at first. My husband unpacked the mattress as soon as we got it. I was thinking, "My queen size mattress is in THAT box?" I knew how they were shipped, but seeing it in that box was crazy! He got it out and opened it up, so it could puff back up, and left it for a few hours before looking at it again. It didn\'t take much time for it to reach it\'s full thickness. We slept on it that night with no smell of any kind whatsoever.We both are satisfied with our purchase. We never expected it to take away all of our back problems. It\'s a mattress, not a miracle. Our expectations were met and we sleep as comfortable as possible considering.My advice to you is not to think any memory foam mattress will solve all of your sleep issues. I am totally happy that it made my night, and then my morning, more comfortable than I\'ve been in years. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saver', 'author': 'Catrina Burks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ok EVERYONE this mattress is awesome 👌 Period.! After one night on our new Gojef hybrid mattress, we're very pleased with the comfort and quality of our sleep.This mattress is medium firm. Plenty of softness while providing ample support that isn't hard to roll out of when you're getting out of bed. The side walls feel sturdy and firm. No excessive bounce from the springs. The Queen size does a good job of filling most of the space between our headboard and foot board, unlike the previous mattress. No more gap at the head of the bed that swallows remotes and pillows and our fitted sheets fit much better as well.The mattress arrived vacuum sealed, rolled up in a long cardboard box. It's not terribly heavy for most but may require two people to lift, as it is a bit awkward. Unpacking was easy. Simply tear off the box, unroll the plastic, cut the vacuum sealed bag with the included blade cutter and watch your mattress inflate to full size in seconds.We opened our mattress around 2 pm and it was ready to sleep on within minutes, though we waited until our usual bedtime. I didn't notice even the slightest odor or any off-gassing whatsoever. We both had a deeper sleep with less wakeups through the night and no stiff or tingling arms or hips for me. In fact I have never owned a foam type bed in a box mattress before. Instead usually buying standard type mattresses over the years. I have owned Sealy, Serta, Beauty Rest, and Stern and Foster over the years. Ever since mattresses have changed to a no turn type mattress they seem to have less and less durability and longevity to them but the price has either stayed the same or increased. So it was interesting to see how a memory foam bed in a box mattress would compare to these.So first let me say I'm impressed so far. I have slept on this mattress for a total of 4 nights and so far I really like it. I have noticed it sleeps cooler than other mattresses I have owned which I love since I usually sleep very hot. When first laying on it it seemed it might be too firm since it is a medium firm mattress, and I thought this might be a problem. However after a min or two you actually conform into the foam so to speak and it feels really nice. I also know from research that the firmness of the foam will change overtime so it will get softer with age which is perfect, and I also will be using a pillowtop topper with it as well.Secondly I was expecting there to be a smell and I would have to let the mattress/foam out gas for a while before being able to actually sleep on this. This was not the case when I unpackaged it there was absolutely no smell whatsoever. I also followed the online directions of letting it sit for 48 to 72 hours before sleeping on it. Even though the box it came in only specified 24 hours.As far as construction goes. From what I can see on the outside it is well made and looks just like a traditional mattress. There are absolutely no areas of concern that I see with the quality of stitching or anything for that matter.Overall I would say compared to other mattresses this is a great value, is well constructed, and very comfortable. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very THICK and SOFT - We love it.', 'author': 'mrsdwb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a PLUSH, super soft mattress that sleep like a dream. title: 12 Inch Euro Top Pocket Spring Hybrid Mattress, Pressure Relief, Pocket Innersprings for Motion Isolation, Bed-in-a-Box, Queen White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally - an affordable, firm mattress', 'author': 'Daniel DeJong', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a man of gravity (approaching 300lb) I look for a mattress that’s decidedly on the firm side. I can’t speak for everyone, but this was exactly what I was looking for to provide firm (but still comfortably soft) support.Out of the box, the top layer of foam did look rumpled and lumpy beneath the mattress cover. But by the end of the first night, everything was settled and smooth. (Make sure to let it unroll and rise fully in one place before trying to move it - I think trying to move it while it was expanding was my mistake.)After just one night, I feel morerested than I have in years of sleeping in memory foam and soft “hybrid” mattresses. It doesn’t seem to sleep hot - I’m like a space heater but this passed the sweat test in a 74° room. Dry and comfortable all night.For my weight, this mattress is great in any sleep position: side, stomach and back all feel natural. It has just enough sink so that my behind is flush with my spine if I’m on my back, which no mattress has ever managed to do for me before. If you’re on the lighter side, this might not be the same for you, but again, just speaking for my own size.The quilted top doesn’t have large divots like some mattresses, and the top layer of foam is just thick enough to feel plush without the marshmallow/quicksand feel of the Zinus memory foam mattresses. Great edge support too - sleeping on my side it felt stable right up to the edge. I wouldn’t sit on it to put my shoes on, though… it smashes flat under my weight in a sitting position.All in all, an extraordinary mattress for the price, and one I hope to keep for years. Hope this helps, big dudes!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best mattress I've owned. Better than a $1500 mattress. Soft but not too soft.", 'author': 'HShield', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great hybrid mattress. This mattress is so good, I realized my last mattress was too firm and was the reason I couldn't sleep more than a few hours. Best mattress I've owned.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the price', 'author': 'Deserai', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We are thrilled with this purchase. Bought queen size for our 8 year old who wanted a "big bed". For the price, I cannot complain. We\'ve had a few months and its just as cozy as day one. It\'s soft but also firm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress', 'author': 'tabinormal@hotmail.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Had to replace my mattress because the dog peed on it >.<. I bought Zinus before for my guest room and knew it was good for the price. I admit being a bit sad because my old mattress was really nice quality and very comfortable- I thought Serta? Beautyrest? But needs must, so I bought the Queen Zinus. As I was removing the old mattress I checked the tag- And it was ZINUS!!! Sure enough, swapped the mattresses, and no change in quality of sleep!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars This is the second ZINUS mattress we have ordered- that's saying a LOT!", 'author': 'aprilrrain', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We ordered a king size ZINUS in November 2020 to replace a LUCID mattress we got just two years before. The Lucid was compressing (we are average size people) and was MURDER on our love lives: so much effort.. the mattress was too soft. The Zinus is a whole different animal! The inner spring coils did the trick. It is soft but super stable with the springs.ONE MONTH LATER- We wanted to replace the queen mattress in our Airstream and due to such an impressive experience with the king size, we opted to take a chance it would fit (RV mattresses are usually somewhat smaller). The queen is much bigger than the intended space but we are making it work (maneuvering around an RV bed is a pain when the mattress fits: its a game of Twister with a big ol mattress! But its still the firmest, best sleeping mattress for a Mattress in a Box. I wish we could speak to the longevity of the support features but that will have to be an update, later. For now, we wake up and nothing hurts!* One suggestion for the manufacturer: Please label the head/foot on the plastic wrap and IF possible, fold it with the spring side, out. Otherwise, you have to flip it before or after cutting the plastic and at 80+ pounds for the queen size, that's a struggle.. for the king size, that's a hernia!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3 years & we still love it!', 'author': 'Ashley R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve never had a better mattress in my life. We love our bed! When we are away we say “it’s not as comfortable as ours!” We turn it every month or so, but other than that, no maintenance or upkeep.For reference: husband is 6’4 270 and I’m 5’10 205Also note… this is the 7th mattress I’ve bought of this brand. The first was for my mom, then I bought one for me and my 6 kids!1 king1 queen1 full4 twinLOVE THIS BRAND!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The full Zinus (Cal King) mattress experience!', 'author': 'S', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Function/ comfort: I have used this mattress for about six months now. At this point, I am literally sleeping in a hole in the middle of the mattress and it continues to rapidly deteriorate. In just the past couple weeks, I went to no longer using a pillow because I sink so far down inside the mattress, I just use the edge of the hole I am sleeping in as a "pillow." To turn over in the night, I have to do a pushup to push myself out of the hole to turn over. Hard to imagine, but this Zinus mattress is worse than sleeping on the floor.I wondered if there is a warranty for this portable sinkhole, so I called Zinus. The first several times, it really appeared they simply refuse to take calls by using an AI phone tree that denies all calls. But after calling multiple times, I realized it\'s just a terrible quality system (could this be a pattern?) Pro tip: the phone tree asks if you purchased from Amazon- if you say yes, they immediately hang up on you. I call back and said I just want to talk about mattresses, and the robot says "Sorry, I can\'t help you with that" and again immediately hung up, etc. So, after saying, "Buy a mattress" repeatedly, I finally reached a person to inquire about the warranty:The Bottom Line: The decision to issue a replacement mattress will be made by sending Zinus a picture of the mattress taken with no sheet or object on the bed. If an observable 1.5 inch sag can be noted, then they will issue a replacement, which takes a week. (Note: They pointedly have no interest in my actual experience with the bed, and or any pictures of me actually in the quicksand mattress of death.) However, Zinus has no pickup service for the old mattress, so the responsibility to dispose of the giant CalKing- sized piece of used bubble gum is mine. So, while the prospect of getting a replacement terrible-quality mattress from Zinus and the joy of watching their delivery workers simply walk away from my current La Brea Tar Pit-style mattress because "they don\'t do that" is tempting...In closing, I shared my unique view with Zinus customer service that if a company saddles a customer with a (unwieldy, impossible to carry) lemon, they should recognize the significant imposition on that customer and take steps to make it right. Zinus thanked me for this new, deep insight that I provided to them and promised that they would consider it, so that perhaps in the future some other person who absolutely wastes their money on a Zinus product will no longer be burdened with how to dispose of said item. You\'re welcome everybody!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars very firm, although okay for back sleepers', 'author': 'Omar Siddique', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'All too firm with somewhat mushy corners, this mattress may work for solo back-sleepers.Although I\'ve had this bed open and "expanded" for 2 years, I only recently rotated it into my MBR and have slept on it the last 2 weeks.Even after some extended efforts to break it in via "knee-walking" (which is just what it sounds like, to break in a new mattress rapidly), it\'s still rather firm. The reinforced several inches near the edges feel like sleeping on the floor, although they do provide the advertised non-collapsing edges. For a couple who might be making use of those edge areas it\'s not going to be terribly comfortable.Despite too-firm edges, the corners are soft and feel like they never fully expanded. They slope in as if belonging to a different mattress-- although that does mean fitted sheets are easy-on/easy-off.The 13" height is a good intermediate one -- any thinner is guaranteed uncomfortable for adults and will come in too low versus traditional bedside tables. Normally I\'d aim at 14 or thicker.It\'s okay for a single person but I\'m actively planning to replace it with a more welcoming, more joyful-feeling mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Quality changed on this product', 'author': 'Isabella Justiniani', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'We bought 3 of these mattress.-The first one was perfect! my husband loved it, his back pain was gone and I really liked it too, because you could turn without disturbing the person next to you.-The second one we purchased was a King size and it was perfect, just like the first one.-The third one, was nothing like the previous two we bought, it was jumpy, very soft, if you sat on any side of the bed you would slide down, if felt like water bed, you could feel any movement from the person next to you. We thought the mattress was defective and asked to be replacement,-The fourth one...(replacement) was bad as well. same terrible quality as the third.I gave 3 starts because the first two mattress where perfect, unfortunately for us the last two were the opposite.Before my first purchase I read good and bad reviews of this product. Now I can say that ALL the reviews where correct! We experienced two incredible perfect mattresses and two terrible ones. I guess the people who gave this product a 1 start received the bad batch, and those who gave 5 stars received the good quality ones.Good luck and I hope you get one of the good ones.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good replacement for our King bed', 'author': 'JillCW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This came quickly - and was very easy to 'assemble' if you will. Followed all instructions, had watched video --- and read a lot of reviews. My daughter suggested this mattress --- I had had an older King mattress - very good quality but could tell it was done as I had some hip pain. I decided, based on her review, and the many here to give it a try. It's been about a month...it's pretty darn comfortable --- but I do find when 2 of us are in bed --- toward the middle it does sink a bit. And, like others said, when you sit on the side of the bed it's kind of mushy - but tolerable. It did not smell like others indicated --- and we slept on it pretty quickly with much success.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Sleep Element Mattress, Queen, Grey
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars easy solution', 'author': 'Greg W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Needed a new mattress for our daughters room after she moved out. Went to two mattress stores, prices where out of sight, mattresses were either too expensive or almost like a padded sheet. Ordered this from Amazon, showed up next day. Set up was simple and after we made it up, I tested it out. Very comfortable and affordable. My sister in law visited and slept there for a couple of days and she was complementary of the comfort of the mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I really wasn't expecting much with this mattress, I couldn't be happier with the purchase. Had a wonderful Stearns and Foster that had to go and needed a mattress quickly. My nephew recommended, ordered it had it the next day. Easy to unpack, it took about 5 hours to be ready. There were no odors of any kind, it was packaged very well. For the price you really can't go wrong, the comfort is certainly there. Waking up feeling refreshed and well rested. Highly recommend,", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable bed', 'author': 'Caroline Konopka', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this bed for our guest bedroom. After hearing our family saying how comfortable the bed is we tried it and now we want to buy one for ourselves. It is good quality and cozy !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Some of What you Read is True, Some Isn't", 'author': 'Jasmine Carroll', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Long review incoming, but worth it if you\'re as deep into mattress research as I was.A few weeks ago, we bought a new mattress (different brand) from Amazon and it was a total flop. It didn\'t expand to even half its size and it was incredibly uncomfortable. Amazon Customer Service was AMAZING, so though we were frustrated with the fact that the mattress didn\'t work out, dealing with returning/refunds and all that was a breeze.Fast forward to last week, and my boyfriend and I are researching mattresses like we\'re becoming experts in the field. I\'d looked into the other one we got fairly well, it had over 90% 5-star ratings, but it was awful. We had our old queen mattress stacked on top of our new king frame, and we were staying up until 10 or 11 at night just researching mattresses. I didn\'t know what reviews to trust because so many brands had a high number of five star reviews, but the same was true for the first mattress we bought and it turned out to be a mistake.We decided we\'d try one more time, and then if we ran into similar issues, we\'d just deal with that mattress until COVID restricts were lessened/lifted and we felt comfortable going directly to a mattress store and buying something direct. We searched for hours, read articles, read reviews both on and off Amazon, did BBB searches and got word of mouth reviews, and everything led us back to Casper as a potentially trustworthy brand to invest in.So we gave it a shot.Our mattress arrived today, and though we haven\'t slept on it yet, we\'re already much happier with what we received. Within minutes of unpacking it, it\'d already expanded to about 8/10 inches, and now it\'s sitting at just shy of the 10, only a few hours after unpacking. I\'ve seen people complaining about the mattress being lopsided, curved corners, not expanding, etc. and we haven\'t had ANY of those issues.I laid on it for a little bit just to see how it felt and it\'s heavenly. It springs back and has got give, but it\'s not too soft. I would say that "medium firm" is a good description for this bed. Not too soft/hard in my opinion. I know people report that it\'s comfy at first, but gets worse so I\'m planning to update my review in a month or two with an update to see if the same happens to us.Now, the smell.This is where you can believe what you read, this bed does come with a pretty bad off gassing smell. I was able to smell it just as my bf brought it up the stairs, and he hadn\'t even removed it from the bag yet. Once he pulled it off, the smell got noticeably worse and we were able to smell it from my office which is kiddy-corner to our bedroom. We opened the bedroom window in order to help air it out some. I will say this, it isn\'t a rancid smell, like something you can\'t be around, it\'s just not a great smell. It puts me in the mind of the back corner of a warehouse or a dank basement where all the stuff is shoved that no one has touched in MONTHS. It\'s strong, but it comes and goes, and like I said, it\'s not like smelling trash or sewage backup or something that would make your stomach turn, it\'s just unpleasant. I sprayed some smell good stuff in the hallway outside my office and I can barely smell it now. If you have a candle or incense or something, plan to use it if you sit close to this bed. The weird thing is, when I went and actually laid on the bed, I couldn\'t really smell it a whole lot. It\'s definitely going away, but it is pretty bad out of the box.I\'m prepared to upgrade this review from four to five stars if I find that it A. remains comfortable. B. the smell goes away, and C. expands this last inch to get to its full height. My hope is that I will be diligent enough to update this review in a month or two and then again in six to eight months with how its holding up. I know mattresses are supposed to last much longer, but if we can just get a good year out of it until we can actually go and test some mattresses in person (and maybe spend a little more on a really good one), I\'ll be happy. I realize that\'s low standards, but you have to have them sometimes when you\'re buying blind on the internet.Here\'s to updating again soon!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's on the softer side", 'author': 'Jaztine Reyna', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When I opened it from the plastic, it did inflate. There was a factory smell but I think you just need to give it time to fully inflate and swell out. The smell did go away after a day or two. The mattress is also in the softer side, so if you don't want to sink please consider another type or brand. I'm not sure if this is really a casper mattress from the actual casper store because other casper mattresses i've tried isn't this soft. I hope this review will help other buyers with their decision.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable', 'author': 'Erik Sullivan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So we had our previous mattress a little longer than we probably should have, but it typically isn’t easy money when it comes to mattress shopping. We held off for a while and decided it was time to see what our options were. We wanted to move away from the traditional spring mattress and give a mattress in a box a shot. It was between Casper and Purple. Between the reviews and input from friends, we went with Casper and after only two nights, our aches and pains are subsiding and the mattress is beyond comfortable. Used to wake up and get right out of bed, now we find it difficult to make ourselves leave the bed. Highly recommend, will update this review if anything changes over the next week, but we’re confident and happy with our new bed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this', 'author': 'rainnnaturelover', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I let this air up for 24 hours before putting on my bed. Looks just like the picture and came in Casper box. Delivery guys were nice but scheduling delivery was a hassle. Delivered ten days after original date due to logistics. Bed super comfy and a medium firm. Responds to original shape after exiting. Husband and I are both 250+ and very comfortable for us.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Have kids? Fiberglass nightmare could destroy your life and home', 'author': 'Jimmy Hoffa', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Had this mattress for about a year without issue. It was decent to sleep on, nothing super fantastic, but definitely not painful or uncomfortable. Then I spilled some soda on the bed, so I unzipped the mattress cover to throw it in the washing machine. What was supposed to be a convenient benefit of this mattress turned out to be my worst nightmare.There\'s a fiberglass layer used as a fire retardant just underneath. It\'s supposed to be kept safe from spilling out in a "fire sock" but over time this can apparently wear out and the fiberglass will break apart inside the mattress cover. These shards are very small and if you don\'t have a light pointed at them, very easily missed. By the time I realized, I was already going to put the now "clean" mattress cover back on after pulling it out of the dryer.Fiberglass in my washer and dryer, all over my bedframe, the walls, the floors, my clothes, curtains, pictures, carpet, everything you can imagine, I found fiberglass there. It\'s in the air and been circulating around my house.I\'ve gone through hell for a week trying to clean it up, breathing this stuff in, had to buy special equipment and I\'m still struggling to get it all.NOWHERE is fiberglass mentioned in the description on Amazon for this mattress, and the manufacturer doesn\'t just go out of their way to give up this information when asked. Google search Casper mattress and fiberglass, I\'m not the first person this has happened to, and won\'t be the last. Can it be okay as long as you don\'t take the cover off? Maybe, but do you really want to risk it? There\'s probably going to be a class-action lawsuit over this, run away! Get something without toxic materials if you can, I\'m switching to a Nolah mattress myself.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Softer than I wanted.', 'author': 'Very nice product,worked well for my needs.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mattress was much softer than I understood from the description.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy and fast set up!', 'author': 'Kristina Campbell', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Great mattress and fits perfectly on my daybed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I have called Amazon to have the mattress replaced and have been given the run around. Don't use this Nectar/Dreamcloud Company. Obviously they're sketchy about the mattresses being new and/or willing to satisfy the customer. And therr isn't anything luxury about the delivery.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nectar Premier Hybrid - Watch the Edge of this Bed when getting out of it or sitting down', 'author': 'Scooter', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I did some research for best mattress for side sleepers, this bed showed up in 4 or 5 different reviews. Keep in mind I didn't do a deep dive to see if Nectar was paying for a good review or not, but whatever. Mattress came in big honking box, glad I checked the Amazon Setup Service (free when I bought it) because this queen size bed weighs 100 pounds and I live in an apartment. After 20 minutes of trying to get the outer plastic unraveled for the mattress (amazon dudes), we slapped the bed in the middle of the room, they took the packaging, and all was good.My bed frame was coming in 2 days after mattress delivery, so the mattress had time to breath, foam could raise a bit and I was not sleeping yet in apartment.Fast forward to having the mattress on the bed with sheets and my first night of sleep on the mattress. SLEEP was FANTASTIC, no issues with my shoulder or arm as a side sleeper like on my last foam block of concrete I had.So I am used to having rigid stiff edge to mattress. I saw Nectar on their web site quoted this ------> 8” Infinity innerspring coils with extra edge support <-------So in the middle of the night I need a bathroom break, swung my legs like I had been doing for years on previous mattress with my butt on the edge of the bed, and the EDGE JUST COMPLETELY COLLAPSES and I almost do a face plant on the floor and wall. It is going to take some MAJOR adjustments when getting out of bed to keep my butt off the edge of the mattress. Same with putting on shoes, no sitting on the edge of mattress to put on shoes, because there is no edge on this bed.I bought it for side sleeping, and it works great. I just wish I knew that the edge collapsed when you sit on it, but maybe someone did review it here on Amazon and say this and I just missed it. Hopefully in the next 90-120 days, I will re-wire my brain to not sit on the edge of the bed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Sleep', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My hubbs and I are both "fluffy" and looking for a mattress with sturdier sides, a cooling gel top and more hopeful for a goods night rest. We got all that and more with this mattress! We already had an adjustable frame that it was compatible with, and it started with the first night, slept through the night, woke up relaxed and no pain! Ecstatic! I never thought a "bed in a box" would be worth. Glad we decided to give it a test drive, I\'m getting the best sleep in like 2 years! We paid $3500.00 for our last mattress and it was junk! (Not from Amazon!)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: King Size Mattress, 10 Inch Hybrid Mattress in a Box, Individually Wrapped Pocket Coils Innerspring Mattress for Motion Isolation, King Pillow Top Mattress with Medium Firm Feel, Groove
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected', 'author': 'Craigg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Decided to give this mattress a try after having no luck with a memory foam mattress. Its a firm mattress, but not so much as to be uncomfortable. The pillowtop really helps take the firmness aspect away. I wake up feeling like I did when I laid down, no pain and no issues. With the previous memory foam mattress I had, I would go to bed feeling fine and wake up with my side and back hurting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Crazy comfortable', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Never thought I would buy a matress in a box. So easy to set up. It is heavy so you can't do this alone, you will need help to carry it to the bedroom. One you have it placed, you just cut the plastic wrap off and it does its thing. There is a smell to it but it goes away after a day or two. You have to let it air out.It is a very comfortable matress. Cradles your body and helps at pressure points. Firm. Have it in our guest room and have had no complaints. I have found myself sleeping on it several times and love the comfort.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent mattress for the price!', 'author': 'Mario', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Wow, what a time to live in when you can have such a comfortable bed delivered to your door for under $200! I needed an inexpensive mattress for a few months in a temporary home and pulled the trigger on this one. It ended up being a great purchase! The box it came in is on the heavier side, and maneuvering the mattress around once it starts unfurling can be challenging in tight spaces, so try and have it as close to the bed as possible. Once in place, the mattress unfurled and puffed up in a matter of hours. I didn't notice any strong smells, and I slept very comfortably that night. I would say it works best for side and back sleepers, but was OK sleeping on my stomach as well. The only caveat is that the manual says not to sit for too long on the edges / corners, and they indeed sink quite a bit if a lot of weight is placed on them. Overall, very happy with my purchase--so much so that a friend of mine ended up keeping the mattress after i no longer needed it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Better than Memory Foam', 'author': 'Kim C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great mattress for the price & I recommend it especially if you're on a budget. My husband & I have slept on a memory foam mattress for about 3 yrs. (We lost our Sleep Number to a fire & couldn't afford to purchase another one). We both have had back surgeries & live with chronic back pain. The memory foam didn't help for sure! This is the first time we've tried a hybrid & it surpassed our expectations. We both sleep better & wake up with less pain. The biggest con is that it's heavy! We are seniors & just getting it in the house was a feat. Novella suggests turning it around once a month but there's no way we're going to try moving it again. I also suggest getting a thick mattress pad or topper. I can occasionally feel the wrapped coils. My back is very sensitive & sometimes it's hard to get comfortable when I first lay down, but once I settle in I sleep well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Yes, it’s truly comfortable & not $1700!', 'author': 'Tab27', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I waited a few months to write this review because I kept waiting for my daughter to wake up one day & announce that it’s not that comfortable. We have typically bought middle of the road priced but good quality mattresses over the years such as Stearns & Foster. We were super leery to purchase a mattress online without laying on it and for such a low price. However our daughter doesn’t weigh much so it seemed low risk to try one. I will say I was shocked at how heavy the mattress is and really had to wrestle it out of the packaging & onto my daughter’s new bed. It took very little time to fully “inflate” from being rolled into a log for shipping. I would call this a true medium soft mattress with a little bounce to it. It’s definitely not firm, definitely not too soft so as to let your lower back sway into an unhealthy position. It’s the perfect amount of support mixed with enough softness. It’s not a memory foam sinking feeling, just soft with a small bounce. After tons of research I might even consider this for our queen mattress replacement when our pure memory foam wears out. I realize now that memory foam alone is too hot no matter what they call it or claim it’s made from. It’s hot! This being a hybrid seems different so the inner springs must help dissipate heat compared to a 100% memory foam type. So we’ll see how long it lasts but for now she’s happy & loves her comfortable new bed so everyone is happy!! Yay!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This bed is freaking amazing', 'author': 'Curly Rue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This bed is freaking amazing. So comfy, I never want to get up. That's the same way I felt about my previous mattress which was actually a traditional spring mattress. I liked that this one didn't have negative reviews about fiber particles coming out which was a huge concern for me with the bed-in-a-box style mattresses. It inflated just fine, but be careful sitting on the corners; they just don't have much support there. I got one of their more firmer beds for my guest room (prior to this purchase) and it's not as comfy to me. I wish I'd known. Fwiw, I've had this one for a year and the guest one for 2 yrs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sags', 'author': 'Tei Nic', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The bed is comfortable. Where I sleep it sags and stays that way even when I get up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best value in a mattress', 'author': 'Jennifer Suiter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I can't believe how great this mattress is for the price. We got it for our guest room, and everyone has loved it and slept great. I wanted to check it out too, so I took a nap on it the other day, and yes. It is super comfortable. Excellent value for the low price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It’s really firm', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I actually love this mattress. It’s definitely more on the firm side but I have a 2 inch mattress topper on it. It most definitely takes a little getting used to as my old mattress had a sunken spot right in the middle. I sleep all the way through the night where as I was waking up every couple hours on the old one. It’s heavy so get some help. All in all I think it’s worth every penny.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Highly surprised!!', 'author': 'Amanda B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was hard to let it "fluff" for 72 hours. Had to lay a blanket in the garage and let it sit out there. To be honest there wasn\'t a smell, it is heavy, but was so worth the money, just enough firm and just enough softness! Would order a hundred times over! Such a great value!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: EGOHOME 14 Inch Queen Memory Foam Mattress for Back Pain, Cooling Gel Bed in a Box, Made in USA, CertiPUR-US Certified, Therapeutic Medium Mattress, 60x80x14 Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is a really great mattress. Firm but still comfortable. Happy with our purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely pleased with what I got.', 'author': 'Sam H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have bad lower back pains. I'm 52 and its beyond ludicrous to have my back pain this bad in life but as they say it is what it is. I bought this mattress as I have numerous others to include dreamcloud, nectar and posturepedic and a sterns and foster. The dreamcloud simply had no support on the sides and you could fall off it because of this. It also was so cushy and plush you had to pull yourself out of the bed where it folds around you. Sterns and foster was a regular spring mattress and overall just sucked in every way. The nectar was ok but failed to support my back in a positive way. The posturepedic was ok but again had the fold in feeling of the mattress creating a glove around you.This mattress? OMG is absolutely perfect. Its got decent side support and is not too firm and not to soft. Its just exactly what I've been hunting for. If you want a comfortable mattress with no strong oders and is very comfortable this is the mattress you want to grab up.The price is right, the mattress is very comfortable and has all around good support. Very very happy I made this choice.So today I came back to update my review of this mattress and today is 11/8/2023 and I bought this back in August. Still to this day I don't have a negative thing to say about it. My back pain I had has almost went completely away. Is it because of this mattress? I can't honestly say but I do know that it without a doubt helped tremendously. I just cannot say enough great things about this product, and NO I'm not being paid or offered anything by anyone for this review. Its just when a product and deal comes by me and works as well as this did for me, I want to tell the world about it. FANTASTIC PRODUCT........", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful mattress and very affordable', 'author': 'Nellie Denise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was nervous about purchasing a mattress online without being able to touch and test it out before buying. Best Be Ever!', 'author': 'Alma', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was eagerly looking forward to having an incredible back support bed frame. I took a chance on ordering this after reading the reviews. It arrived on a timely manner. But oh my goodness! After sleeping on it, I woke up with my spinal stenosis feeling so much worse! While this bed frame may have received 5 starts from others, it’s definitely not for me. I’m really disappointed because I really got my hopes up after reading the reviews. ☹️Edit review: It seems I needed time for my back to properly adjust. I can now confidently say that this is absolutely one of the most comfortable beds I've gotten. For whatever reason I felt a sharp pain on my back - I don't know. Could've been because I desperately needed something comfortable. Now I wonder if it's possible to return it so I get the Queen size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A win.', 'author': 'nm nm', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Like lots of reviewers, I was really nervous about ordering a mattress online. This is my third memory foam mattress and my last one was garbage. I have failed back surgery and chronic pain that I hope none of you can comprehend. A good mattress is vital to my mobility and pain management, and to be able to walk around at all. I read reviews for days and finally decided on this mattress.It arrived a week before the projected delivery date. My son came over, dragged it inside, and set it up on my bed frame. It was fully (or mostly) puffed up within 3-4 hours. Enough for me to put linens on and lay on it comfortably. It fits my queen frame snugly. The edges are firm enough that I can sit on it without sliding off. All 4 corners fully puffed up so no problems there.When I first laid on it I was really afraid it was too firm. It doesn't feel soft or have a lot of give when you lay on it. But, this mattress is a win. It does conform to my body when I sleep on it and gives good support. I woke up after the first night with greatly reduced pain, and that is seriously unheard of in my world. Same for the second night. I'm very happy with it so far. I'll edit this review if anything changes but, for now, my recommendation is buy it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Mattress', 'author': 'Abigail Seets', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the best mattress I have ever had, without contest. I cannot recommend this enough- it is SO worth the money!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Bed!', 'author': 'Meg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am pleasantly surprised with this bed. It is amazing! It’s our first king bed, as my fiancé and I have a giant dog that sleeps with us! It has so much room, the bed forms to your body, and is so comfy. I highly recommend. It shipped very quickly and arrived a few days early.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not firm', 'author': 'M Farah', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Couple of things:1. Amazon doesn't ship it, I cancelled it just after I placed my order, but they sent it, and after some thoughts, I decided to take it and opened the box-which I am not full satisfied, cause I wae looking for a more firm mattress.4. The shape is great. It stands nice and shape good.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Mattress (and gorgeous)', 'author': 'Marie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the best mattress we’ve ever owned. We had a memory foam mattress we loved for over ten years, but it finally met its end. I was starting to get horrible back pain and we guessed it was our old mattress. I saw the reviews for this one concerning back pain and took the leap considering the great price. It came without any damage. When we opened it to let it expand we could see one corner that was lifting off the bed frame and one area that was not as expanded as the rest. Within a couple hours everything was evening out. We let ours expand for 14 hours but it looked perfect well before that. Being 14” it’s definitely higher than our old bed. My back pain didn’t go away after the first night but it was better. It continued to improve and after the 3rd night it was 100%. As comfortable as this mattress is, I’d guess that the alternate heights would be great as well. This is probably going to be our best purchase of the year and the year’s just started.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I was skeptical', 'author': 'stacy lester', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I took a chance and bought a mattress online due to all the positive reviews. Let me tell you, it did not disappoint. First night sleeping on it and I woke up with ZERO back pain! I have a herniated disk in my lower back possibly multiple. I haven’t woken up without back pain in years. When I tell you I was shocked, I was trying to figure out if the bed could really hold that much power.I’m here to say…. It can and it did.It’s a firm mattress but not like you’re sleeping on the floor firm.The next test will be time. And oh I hope it lasts.If you’re in the market and have been looking, give this a try.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Erika', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality and good price, really good to relax my back, I have really bad back but this mattress is so good.Good quality and after I opened the plastic at the ends the mattress getting to normal in minutes. It come with the instructions and small and fancy blade for it.My son tried sleep over and he told me is better of his expensive mattress.Think about replace my others mattress.This is for my guess room.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Folks, it's legit", 'author': 'Suz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was initially hesitant to buy a mattress online, sight-unseen - especially at such a low price. Let\'s face it, you probably wouldn\'t have high expectations for a mattress that costs less than $200, right?Here\'s the deal: cash is tight. I\'ve gone back to school and so I\'ve got to be scrappy and pinch every penny I have. So when it became painfully clear (literal pain in my back!) that my old mattress needed to be replaced, I went on an exhaustive search for options - and "exhaustive" is no exaggeration. Here are the criteria I used:1) Has to be a bed in a box - didn\'t want to pay delivery/setup fee and didn\'t want weird strangers tromping around my bedroom2) Has to be less than $5003) Has to be a spring/foam hybrid4) Has to be a size/weight I can manage myself (I am a 42-year-old woman of slightly higher than average physical fitness)If you look around Amazon, you will see that there are a LOT of mattresses that fall under those criteria, so I had to narrow it down. This is where I really need to thank my fellow Amazon consumers for their thoughtful, detailed reviews, because it made my task a lot easier. So.. thanks! :) I will attempt now to do the same.The bed arrived four days early, which was a nice surprise. I came home, and the box was laying on my front patio. I think the UPS person must have struggled with it, because one of the flaps on the end was missing/ripped off. If I had one critique, that would be it: the box this thing ships in would be lots easier to manage if it had handles of some sort. Lacking handles, it\'s pretty unwieldy. As it is, I\'m a pretty crafty gal, so I flipped the box end-over-end through my front door, through the foyer, and up my stairs (three sets total, two landings) to my bedroom. (An aside: I lift weights. Heavy ones. Regularly. It\'s good for you, and you should do it, too, so you can heft heavy mattresses around by yourself without injury.)Getting the mattress to metamorphose from its brilliantly vac-wrapped sausage form to its final flat mattress state was a bit of a trick. The mattress is wrapped in a few layers of thick plastic; included with the mattress is a handydandy thing that looks just like the letter opener on my desk at work. I helped myself to it, and I guess maybe I accidentally poked a hole in the innermost plastic layer as I was cutting the plastic, because the mattress started to expand before I was ready for it! I could hear the air hiss as it was being sucked into the package, so I hurried to finish removing the plastic. The mattress unfurled, and I watched as the product of modern technology unfolded before my eyes.In the span of about ten minutes, the mattress had expanded to near-full capacity. I was shocked! I was also mightily curious about what it felt like. So - I laid down on it for a brief minute... just to see. It was GLORIOUS. It had give while still being supportive. It squished, but the springs have just the right amount of pushback. I was excited! :) BUT - I also am good at delaying gratification, so - per directions - I let the mattress sit for 24 hours to finish any additional expansion. I\'m not real sure if it did, to be honest - It really looked to me like it expanded to full size easily within one hour - but I didn\'t want to mess anything up by not following directions.I\'ve slept on the mattress a few days now, and I can say that this is, without a doubt, the most comfortable mattress I have ever owned. It is perfect for me - it\'s firm, but it has give, so even sleeping on my side is comfortable. It\'s also very well made; all the ticking and the stitching is straight, well-done, and solid.I will, of course, update my review if, over the course of time, something goes awry... but for now, I am a very happy and satisfied customer, and I would highly recommend this mattress to anyone looking for quality and comfort on a budget. Shoot, even if it only lasts for a few years, at $200, I\'m still ahead of the game!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing, amazing mattress', 'author': 'Tom  Whit', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Where do I start...Ok, right here, Freaking AWESOME mattress. I\'m thinking this could be the 8th wunder of the world. So I ordered it. Let me say that about 10 yrs ago I bought one of those new style pillow top King size BRAND name mattress from a major mattress store here locally, and I paid over $1200.00 for it. Just pain, aches , duscomfort, etc for both me and my wife. Naturally store would not refund our money or even swap for another. So now for my cabin. Deciding to build a set of bunk beds and knowing dimensions of this Twin XL, I got to work while mattress was in shipment. I had lumber dry stacked from Amish sawmill, cut all my lumber to size, ran it thru planer, sanded it, and put it together. The mattress arrived in the cardboard box about 44" tall by about 14"x14", and I was still scratching my head, thinking there is a Twin XL mattress inside here....okayyyyy. Removed from the box, and that rolled up mattress was about 12" in diameter. Still thinking , no way. So I laid the coil on the bunk bed base, removed the endless plastic wrap that encased the mattress to prevent it from uncoiling like a cobra snake. Now I could see the white mattress all coiled up in yet was it\'s final vacuum wrap. Now I\'m thinking what wall am I going to end up getting tossed against when I break the vacuum seal on this puppy. I carefully broke the seal cutting a four inch piece off of the corner and watched the magic happen. That thing sucking air to expand sounded like a small jet engine. Took about I\'d say a couple minutes and that think was full size as pictured. My first thought was I\'m really impressed, my second thought , I guess I\'m keeping this, because there is no way in hell this is going back in that box. The only comparison and amazement I can say is that this is like when you see a model sailing clipper ship inside of one of those glass jugs, or 12 clowns exiting a VW Beetle at the circus. In the picture I built the long runs for the bunk beds out of 2x6 cut to 84" long. To support the mattress I cut the Amish wood 1"x 8\'s and 1"x10" boards to 40" long which allowed a half inch clearance on either side of the mattress. Just note here the mattress is like they describe a touch on the firm side but very comfortable. Sleep like a baby. I may share some of the guilt as I had only praise and good things to say about this mattress. Now with a bitter taste in my mouth I can only say I would NOT recommend this mattress and to look elsewhere for better pricing. So much for customer appreciation. Oh well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Firm comfort for a great price!', 'author': 'TomMonger', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We bought the queen sized mattress (60" x 80") and let it expand for 5 days (and yes, it decompresses rapidy once you break the seal)! My mattress before this one was an extra firm traditional double-sided tight top variety. I bought it that way for support. Which it still was after 15 years, but also uncomfortable.I read a lot of reviews and was shocked how mattresses are delivered "compressed and rolled" today. I took a chance on this one which was medium-firm (and gray).I lugged it from the front entry to my back bedroom inch by inch. It is 75 Lb heavy. Which was a good sign because a similar traditional mattress tops 100 lbs. I realized the lighter weight the hybrid is, the lower the ratings were. I got it unboxed and rolled out on my new 3500 Lb bedframe (B09ZRVVXR3). I am not 3500 lbs! Followed the instructions and slit the plastic. It immediately decompressed to 11". Wow!I did not sleep on it for 3 days. My 2 cats however abandoned me and immediately called it home. They were tired of sleeping on the futon with me on the 6" twin memory foam guest mattress. Sorry, but I discovered that I hate memory foam. It is NOT for big people. Neither is a twin bed. I am beyond the point of "shish-ka-bobbing" in order to turn over. And on a pure memory foam, it is torture. Or, at best exercise.In short, this full-size hybrid mattress does support my weight. The inner springs are strong and give me the bounce and spring I need to sleep comfortably and roll around normally! YEA! It also reached 12" bottom to middle-mattress crown. The sides are 11". The side support is OK and as expected. For a thin person it is strong. The sides more or less behaved liked my former mattress. No complaints there.FYI - I flattened out all of the cardboard shipping boxes for the mattress, frame and headboard and placed them as a mattress platform on top of the bed frame\'s slats. I was concerned about the long-term effects of the bottom springs poking through and sagging in the empty spaces between the metal slats. This new mattress is NOT double-sided, and the bottom has VERY THIN support material for the springs. The mattress does slide a bit, but that is OK. It actually makes it easier for me to change the sheets.I also used and left in place a nylon ratchet strap (B01M13QUC7) at the middle of the bed frame to pull the frame tight inward so that the slats would not drop out in the future which can be typical with slatted bed frames.Conclusion.
