You can get anything from Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente confort', 'author': 'Excelente, muy bueno', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excelente producto, muy buena calidad y confort', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Twin Mattress, 10 Inch Plush Cloud Hybrid Mattress, Gel Infused Memory Foam, Pocket Spring for Support and Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, Soft, Twin Size
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I'm THE pickiest reviewer...and I'm impressed!", 'author': 'Gretchen', 'rating': 5, 'content': '***6-Month Update!*** 2/15/2017: We\'re on the 6-month mark and by now, I was SURE this mattress would give me something to complain about. Nope!! We are six months into using this bed and still can\'t be more pleased. I expected some sagging on either side from where I sleep and my husband sleeps, but it\'s held up very well. It is SO comfortable and we no longer wake up with back pain and aches. It\'s been a great purchase and I still can\'t recommend it enough!!**UPDATE** 10/15/16: We have had this mattress 2 months now and enough sleeping on it to give this a more updated review. I\'ll stand by what I wrote below and reaffirm just HOW MUCH we love this mattress. It\'s been extremely comfortable since day one. I no longer wake up with back and hip pain. Never expected as much comfort from such an inexpensive mattress that comes rolled and compressed to your door. We have never had any issues with smell or any sinking thus far. I will say, it was a tad more firm than I expected, even though we decided so within the first 2 weeks of getting it. We did add an inexpensive foam topper which gave us just the added cushioning we wanted with the firmer support from underneath. My point: I have zero hesitations recommending this and I would buy another one tomorrow in a heartbeat.**8/20/16: I carefully scoured the options and read through every piece of feedback on this mattress before pulling the trigger. "A mattress in a box, delivered like a sleeping bag?? AND it\'s supposed to be great?! Yeah right." But, (thank you Reviewers who give their honest feedback), I settled on trying this (I NEVER buy anything without checking reviews). For the price, it was worth the risk. I\'ll say flat out I have never bought a bed I haven\'t tried first. We purchased a $1300 bed 2 years ago we have hated since day 1...and despite promised "warranties", the dealer never made our misery right. So to Amazon I go and I\'d rather buy something many people have unbiasedly reviewed then buying in a store where only the salesman tells me it\'s wonderful. It\'s arrived...ahead of schedule and I\'m thrilled. First off, someone made a comment about it looking like the FedEx truck delivered it with a tow winch....yes, this is has been through the grinder. Thankfully my mattress inside was well wrapped. It\'s heavy - you\'ll need 2 people. Put it near the bed when you unwrap it, because within just a minute or 2, it will fully expand to its size. It puffed up instantly and filled to its shape. I am SERIOUSLY impressed that this shows NO sign of being compressed...it looks like the mattress store just delivered. After letting it puff for 4 hours, I laid on it....it is firm but giving. I cannot wait to try it tonight...and cannot wait to follow up on this in a few weeks/months. Off the bat, I can\'t recommend this enough. How this mattress is this price (thanks China), I have no idea. It looks and feels like one that should be much more. Last note...absolutely NO odor from mine and no feel of the bedsprings either.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Happy with Purchase!', 'author': 'Michelle Dorance', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far so good! I rarely write reviews (good or bad) but wanted to for this, since the reviews are what made me give it a shot. I want to start off with saying; is it a $1,500 mattress quality or feel? No absolutely not. But rating it based off of the price; I am very happy so far.The King replaced our Queen Size Caspar Mattress- I am 8 months pregnant and we just needed a King for my comfort and once baby comes for bed side sleeping- we just had to go to the King. With baby on the way though there was no way I could replace with another Caspar at this time. I knew the price range I was shopping in and got something that I am very happy with for the cost.Some reviews showed the springs on the sides poking out- if you look close or put your hand on the side- yes you can see/ feel the springs. But that doesn’t really bother me. If it’s a deal breaker though I would say maybe not for you.I didn’t measure to see if it rose to its full height.. I’m not that picky, again for the price.It’s kind of a “Goldie Lock” Bed where it’s not too soft not too firm- if you want firm it definitely isn’t for you. It’s a medium/ soft I would say. I weigh 160 right now pregnant- and I definitely sink into it- but that’s what I like and prefer. This is my first “Hybrid”- normally I don’t have anything with springs. But for the price I was too nervous to do a true bed in a box.It is on a new King Size Frame- the mattress is maybe 2 inches short on the sides (width wise) but super hard to say if that’s the mattress or the frame from Wayfair.In summary I’m giving it 5 stars- but basing it off the price I paid- I think it is priced fairly. And if need be we can always do a mattress topper if needed. We may end up doing that- only bc the sides are very soft- so getting in and out is a little hard being pregnant and I didn’t have that issue on my Caspar.. that’s probably my biggest negative.We did let it rise up in the dining room for 24 hours before putting it on the frame as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars No longer feel my husband's flopping around!!!!", 'author': 'KARLA', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So far, so good. We\'ve only been sleeping on this mattress for 4 days now, but we are both perfectly content with it at this point. I love that it arrived in a box that I could handle on my own (I\'m very, very little -- well under 5 feet tall) and the box didn\'t take up an entire room, as we had to first put our new bed together before we could open the mattress box. The box was about 3ft X 16in X 16in, so absolutely able to stick it in a corner of the room while we got the bed built and readied the room. When opening the box, we found the mattress to be well sealed up inside, amazingly shrunken down in size and relatively easy to get out of the box with the two of us working together (there\'s the outer cardboard box, then the vacuum sealed clear plastic holding the mattress in, then another layer of material around the mattress), I must warn future customers: USE GREAT CAUTION AT EACH STAGE OF UNPACKING THIS MATTRESS -- DO NOT USE A KNIFE, SCISSORS OR UTILITY BLADE AS YOU MAY VERY LIKELY CUT UP YOUR MATTRESS!!! Anyway, once out of all the packaging, the mattress began to come to life. Fortunately (I guess, in retrospect), we didn\'t have any new sheets for this new size mattress and we had to wait for the sheets to arrive from Amazon separately, which allowed the mattress plenty of time to "plump up". But even within just a few hours, we could see and feel how soft and comfy it was. I was determined to get a hybrid mattress, and this one has lived up to its description thus-far. The only complaint I have, and I\'ve already sent this comment to the manufacturer, is that the top layer of memory foam is very "memorable" --- I\'m used to doing the old hand trick where you splay your hand and press it firmly down onto whatever memory foam thing you\'re dealing with (a pillow, a mattress topper, whatever) and the imprint of your hand should be easily visible in the memory foam for a little while........when I do this to our mattress, I get NO IMPRINT at all, the mattress immediately goes back to its usual shape. Maybe it\'s me and I don\'t understand something about memory foam mattresses, perhaps they are supposed to spring right back, but it\'s not my idea of "memory" foam if it doesn\'t "remember" anything!Besides the issue just discussed, I\'m only giving it 4 stars (instead of 5) because there\'s room for improvement. It would have to be a truly amazing, awe-inspiring mattress to get a 5-star review out of me as I always want the manufacturers/producers/engineers/etc. to strive for improving their products, especially something so critical as a mattress. That being said, if I could give it 4.5 stars (four & one-half), I would. It\'s absolutely a lovely mattress. It looks and feels like a much more expensive mattress (I\'m truly shocked at how little I paid for this mattress, especially considering what I paid for my last brand-new mattress many, many years ago). The top feels like organic cotton (I don\'t know what it is and I\'m not saying that it is cotton at all, I\'m just saying it FEELS like it), it is super soft and breathable. The individually wrapped coils of the innerspring portion has performed exactly as I hoped it would: FINALLY, I no longer feel like I\'m in an earthquake when my husband comes to bed or when he flops around like a fish out of water all night. I had gone to sleeping on the sofa most nights because I simply could not stand sleeping near him. He doesn\'t ROLL over, he does the human equivalent of a 3-point-turn, and each point of that turn is another huge flopping action. I mean, I was miserable for years. And now, I have yet to feel him come to bed at all, nor feel ANY movement throughout the night. This is an extreme improvement.The quality (so far -- remember, I\'ve only been sleeping on this new mattress for a few nights) far exceeds what the price-point would lead you to believe. Everything is at least as good, or better, than you\'d probably ever expect from such an inexpensive mattress. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for an UNDISTURBED night\'s sleep, especially if you\'ve got an overactive, flippy-floppy bed partner, or a large dog that sleeps with you (or ANY dog/dogs, actually). This is a seriously decent mattress. I doubt you\'ll find others at this price point that are of this same high quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty Firm', 'author': 'Fahim Morshed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Size was 10 inch, not 12 inch. But good product. Not soft like most mattresses.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than I Hoped', 'author': 'CXJess', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I didn't expect much from this mattress, but I bought it a year and a half ago for our guest room, and am writing a review now because I realized what a great purchase it's been. It's very soft and is great quality. It's surprising to me how comfortable it's been for us and our guests because I thought a quality mattress would cost WAY more-I mean hundreds of dollars more. If you need a new mattress for yourself, this will still feel like a luxury item and not break the bank.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive and comfortable', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this mattress 16.5 months (current writing early November 2022, purchased mid-June 2021). I bought it after my ex and I separated and he kept the expensive name brand mattress we picked together ($2k+ in 2017 from Sears). I was amazed at how compact the mattress was inside the box and impressed at how quickly it expanded into its proper shape and size once released from its plastic and cardboard prison. Very little odor, if any at all, when released from its bonds. The fabric the top is made of is quite soft and plush, texture wise. It's not quite as comfortable as I'd hoped so I added a padded quilted topper to it which has helped significantly. I think if the top of the mattress itself was a thicker pillow top I'd be comfier. There's a lot of movement in this bed; not enough that it's noticeable when my cats are rough housing but certainly noticed when a bed partner shifts in their sleep. I apparently like an incredibly soft mattress top, but this has served me very well considering it was less than $300 when purchased and I hadn't felt it/laid on it before buying. I honestly haven't had a single issue with it that the topper, adequate air flow in the bedroom, and super soft sheets haven't fixed. I haven't had any issues so far with sagging anywhere, however only grown adults have used it. If you don't have AC and are a hot sleeper I highly suggest a fan. I recommend getting a mattress protector for it as well, because spilling dark soda in bed can lead to unpleasant stains (I suggest one with a terry cloth texture). Will it be my bed forever? Probably not, but for under $300 I won't feel bad when it's time comes and I need to buy a new one. Thanks!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Used only one night. Great,,,,', 'author': 'krysa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Installed it within my children's room. Very well-made and comfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good mattress, but won’t last forever', 'author': 'Morgan Gardner', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'My husband and I bought this mattress in April of 2020 when we got married. It is now February 2023. At first, the mattress was honestly really nice! Very comfortable, supportive, good motion isolation, etc.Neither my husband nor I had any idea how to properly care for a mattress so it wasnt on a very good foundation and we did not rotate it at all.Now, this mattress is not fun at all to sleep on. There are indentations permanently made in the top layers of foam on the mattress that are uncomfortable for sleeping. It squeaks quite a lot when changing positions or getting in/out of bed. We are replacing it less than 3 years after buying it.Maybe if we had taken better care to rotate the mattress and have a solid foundation for it, it would be in better shape. But all in all I found that it was great for the first 2.5 years or so before it just really went downhill. Not too bad for such a cheap mattress (I believe I paid about $270 in 2020 for a King). But if you’re looking for something to last longer, you will likely need to pay more for higher quality materials.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfy!', 'author': 'Dana Rodriguez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have not slept this well in years! We love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great night sleep', 'author': 'Peanut', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For my room. It’s great!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Queen Mattress-Queen Size Mattress, 10 Inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress for Back Pain Relief /Motion Isolation & Cool Sleep, Flippable Comfort from Soft to Medium Firm, Sunkiss
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good', 'author': 'Beth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my first experience with a mattress in a box. For what it cost it's really pretty good. It has a soft side and a firm side. I thought I would like firm but it turns out soft is better. I was losing sleep with hip and back pain on the previous mattress, a really old hand me down. This is a big improvement. Time will tell how it holds up as I've only had it for a few weeks. I'm enjoying it now.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Cool gel memory foam makes for two levels of comfortable night's sleep", 'author': 'Will Doutre', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I picked up this mattress for my retired in-laws as a thank you gift for all they do for us. Their old mattress was a pillow-top, but after they stayed at our house on our memory foam mattress while watching the kids several months back and hearing how well they slept, we just had to see if this would be an improvement. Our memory foam mattress was 12-inch and we paid about 2 grand for it 9 years ago. This one was not the cheapest we found on amazon, but it looked like a good deal and I wanted to see what the gel memory foam was like.The product arrived via Prime delivery in a big yellow box. Inside the box the mattress was folded in half and rolled up in a compressed form inside a plastic sheeth, which was inside a sort of plastic canvas bag along with an envelope and a little journal, a warranty card, with an amusing cartoon about a thief falling asleep on a Sweetnight mattress and getting caught while robbing a house. The package also came with a little letter opener which I used to slice through the plastic holding it together and I then unrolled it onto my in-laws queen-sized box spring. I then slit one end of the plastic bag that was still holding it compressed and I pulled the bag off of the mattress like removing an envelope from outside of a letter.The first thing I noticed was how quickly the mattress decompressed. Our mattress 9 years ago took about 48 hours to visibly decompress, whereas with this mattress, within a matter of a couple seconds the mattress expanded from about 6-7 inches tall to 10 inches. I laid down on it felt completely decompressed and fluffy soft. I read in the instruction booklet that one side of the mattress was firmer than then other so I decided to video the difference between each side. I had my 6 year old daughter walk and jump around on the mattress with a glass of water sitting in the middle, first with the soft side up, then with the firmer side up. You could see in the videos that the soft side transfers a good bit of motion just walking around on the mattress and the firmer side requires her to jump to really see the water move (well you could see if Amazon allowed me to upload more than one video, but it doesn't so I just uploaded the firm side my in-laws decided to sleep on).How does that translate to laying on the bed, well my in-laws decided to go with the firm side because they were concerned that too soft a mattress might cause back issues. After 3 nights (the amount of time the instructions say to let the bed expand) it is the best night sleep they've had in years and they just keep thanking us for the wonderful mattress. Though, they have not noticed a difference with it from the 1st to the 3rd night, so I'm not sure if it expanded much at all. They see no need to try the softer side of the mattress, they are so pleased with it so far.Pros: Good price, easy to set up, decompresses quickly, pillowy soft and cool, plus an amusing little cartoonCons: Like all memory foam mattresses it, has the faintest foam odor, but after putting sheets on it I honestly couldn't smell it anymore, and the instructions say the faint smell dissipates quickly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value and Comfort from a Box!', 'author': 'tamijj', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A couple years ago we got a great deal on a little travel trailer, but we haven\'t really used because the mattress in it is so incredibly uncomfortable... who wants to "get away" when you end up tossing and turning and getting no rest and having massive back aches while on “vacation”? We had spent THOUSANDS for our king mattress but we couldn\'t spend that kind of money on a mattress for the trailer. Then a friend told us to check this one out on Amazon.We were pretty skeptical but we really want to use the trailer, instead of just looking at it sitting next to the house, so we ordered and two days later FedEx dropped the box on the front porch. The box is pretty heavy but easy enough to move around with a foldable hand truck we have.Inside the box, the mattress is rolled up and vacuum-packed and comes with instructions and a special tool to get the thick plastic cut open without damaging the mattress. It\'s a good idea to unroll the mattress on the bed platform where you will be using it. It\'s just easier to handle that way. We don\'t know exactly how long it took for the mattress to fully decompress since we unwrapped it and then left it in the trailer overnight.When we went in and checked on it the next day, late morning, it was all fluffed up and ready to use! At that point, we took some time to check out the quality of the mattress and we are very impressed with what seems to be pretty high-end materials and workmanship.Then came the real test... we crashed on the mattress for awhile. Wow! A huge upgrade from the flimsy old mattress that was in the trailer when we got it! We went ahead and took nice long nap and really enjoyed it! We cannot believe how great this mattress is for the price.One of the really cool things about this mattress is that you can choose to have the firm side up OR the soft side up. We decided to put the softer side up and, like I said, we really enjoyed the nap! It just seemed to cradle us nicely, but it wasn\'t TOO soft which can sometimes cause back problems.Now that we have a decent mattress, we are so excited to plan a longer trip with our trailer!I\'ll add to this review after we have had a chance to sleep on this mattress for a few nights, but I\'m very confident that we are going to be loving it! We will be adding more pics too (having some technical issues right now with the camera).Also, a couple nice touches that were unexpected in the box… a little booklet with a cute story and what can be used as a sleep journal. All in all, a really great value! We are really happy we got this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Soft cooling side is like sleeping on a cloud', 'author': 'The OG Elf', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I got this to replace a mattress that was 10 years old. It REALLY needed to be replaced, because I was waking up with backaches and neckaches. After exhaustive research, I found this mattress. It had wonderful reviews, a 10 year warranty and the features that I was looking for. I was extremely worried about buying a mattress sight unseen. What if I got one that was either too soft or too hard and then I was stuck with it? But when I saw this one, I felt better about trying it because it's flippable with a softer and a firmer side. I figured that would decrease the probability of not liking the mattress. I was correct because this mattress is like sleeping on a cloud. The minute I laid on it I knew that this was going to change the way I felt in the morning. I sink right into it at night and wake up refreshed with no more aches and pains. I tried both sides and like the softer side. I'm a side sleeper and the softer side feels more comfortable on my neck. I also like that it has the layer of cooling gel memory foam to prevent me from overheating. I tend to get hot at night and this has kept me nice and cool. I'm amazed at how much I like this mattress. Next time we have to buy a mattress, I'll definitely come back to this brand.Here's a little information about how this mattress arrived. It comes compressed in a roll covered in plastic. It was in a smaller box than I expected, but it did have some weight to it. When I first took it out of the box, I was worried that I must've gotten duped and purchased a subpar mattress. Man, was I wrong!! I used the included tool to cut the plastic wrapping around it and then rolled it out over the box spring. It immediately started to grow bigger, but not to it's total height. Like the instructions said, I left it out for 24 hours to make sure it got to it's ultimate height before using. It had a chemical smell to it when it arrived. It dissipated a bit in the 24 hours I left it out, but not totally. I sprayed both sides with Febreeze and left it out another 24 hours. The smell was totally gone after that. Overall, I'm thrilled and extremely satisfied with this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OH THE BLISSFUL NIGHT’S SLEEP!!!', 'author': 'ThompsonFamily', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We were in the market for a new mattress. We had a queen-sized bed and decided to upgrade to a king-sized bed. As such, we researched the best options on the market. My wife and I did not agree on what we wanted. I wanted a mattress that was medium-firm that confirmed to the body and my wife wanted something more on the firm side. We were both leery of a “bed in a box,” but we were willing to give it a try.Since we were upgrading to a king-sized bed, I ordered the king-sized mattress. The box arrives and it took two guys carrying it from the truck. The box had a sticker that said “86 lbs.” My 19 year old son and I were easily able to pick the box up and bring it inside. I opened the box and laid the plastic wrapped shrunken mattress out on the floor. When assessing the mattress and the bed setup, I figured the best way for setup was to put it on the bed before opening it. We lifted it onto the bed and used the handy plastic cutters that came in the instruction kit. NOTE - make sure you read the instructions and use the cutter that comes with the mattress - if you used scissors, knife or other cutting device, you could run the risk of damaging the mattress and/or mattress cover. There is a very sturdy plastic wrapping around the outer area to hold the mattress in the cylindrical form. You cut this plastic first and then cut the plastic around the mattress. As soon as we cut the plastic and got it off, it came alive and started expanding (this the importance of getting it placed on the bed first). I had already read the mattress description that the mattress is firm one side and soft on the other, so I knew which side we wanted. I laid on the mattress right then to give it a try and I was so impressed from that moment. My wife and I both slept so peacefully that first night. We have slept on it several nights now and it is so comfortable. I like the fact that we can roll over and not disturb one another as the mattress limits motion through the whole bed when someone moves. I am very hot natured and I have to say that this mattress does not cause me to burn up. I normally have to throw the cover off several times in the night due to sweating and I have not had to so that once with this mattress.Would I buy this mattress again? ABSOLUTELY!!!Definitely worth the purchase and a very comfortable night’s sleep!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I WOULD ABSOLUTELY BUY IT AGAIN IN A HEAT BEAT!!', 'author': 'mls', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have needed a new mattress for years and just dreaded the expense and hassle that goes with new mattress shopping. And to make matters worse, everyone I knew that had bought a new mattress in the last year or two had numerous issues and gripes which made me want to have root canal rather than buy a new bed.I had recently heard of "bed in a box" but didn\'t take it very seriously until this gem landed in my email. I did some research on the beds and on the company and decided that it would be worth a try if it meant I could avoid aging ten years and having to get a Xanax script to buy a mattress the conventional way.It was delivered in just a few days in a box that looked like it was the original prototype for a "box" - all beat up; taped like my grandmother wrapped it for Christmas. Surprisingly, the contents were unscathed and in perfect condition. The company sends you an email once the bed is on its way to tell you how to open it properly without causing any damage - wow! Someone actually thought enough to take the time to send important instructions in ADVANCE to keep me from attacking the taped to hell cardboard with a razor knife! Customer Service - what a novel idea!I\'m single and the box is heavy so I had my brother help me get the box to the bedroom and get the mattress from the box. It is shrink wrapped and rolled. Unroll it and place it where it needs to be. Open the shrink wrap and watch it grow! It\'s like a bed version of a chia pet on steroids! It\'s phenomenal! And in a matter of minutes, you\'re standing there with your mouth hanging open stunned that that beautiful mattress just came out of a relatively small box.I let it sit and adjust to its new home for a few hours with a ceiling fan to disperse any odors, but there weren\'t any! My dog and I slept on it the first night with no issues or odors. I chose the firm side up which seemed really firm to me, but I had been doing my best fortune cookie impression nightly for years since I\'m a side sleeper who was sleeping on a sagging latex mattress. It took a few nights for my body to correct itself, but this is an unbelievably comfortable bed. It\'[s firm, yet enveloping; there\'s is no sagging anywhere - no matter where I lie on the bed; and it stays cool!! I really love this bed!I WOULD ABSOLUTELY BUY IT AGAIN IN A HEAT BEAT!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprised at the quality! Super simple and easy.', 'author': 'Derek', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'ve always went to physical stores to purchase a mattress. This is my first time taking a leap of faith and ordering one online. I was not disappointed in the least! My girlfriend and I wanted an upgrade in size (we had been using a full mattress before) and decided to go with the Sweetnight King. It came *very* quickly, and we unfolded it and let it air out for about an entire day. We slept on it the night we received it (the instructions say wait 72 hours but it seemed ready after the first night). Before purchasing I read other reviews that claimed there was a smell that eventually went away, maybe we were just lucky but there was no unpleasant odor at all in our mattress at all.As for the mattress itself, there is one caveat I should state here. When we first got it we followed the advice of the instructions which recommend trying the "soft" side first (it can be slept on either side, a soft or medium-firm side) because it was like "sleeping on a cloud." Well, I\'m about 240 lbs and spend a lot of time lifting heavy weights in the gym. The soft side was *definitely* not made for me. It\'s very soft, and probably perfect for someone who doesn\'t weigh much, but felt uncomfortable for me. However, after about 3 nights we made the decision to flip the mattress to the FIRM side, and it was the best decision ever. I wake up with no back pain, feel refreshed and energized. A huge improvement over my old mattress. The firm side does wonders for my back as well, which on both the soft side and my old bed would hurt quite regularly. So if you\'re heavier like me, keep in mind the firm side might be a better option for you.All in all, I absolutely love this mattress. Very happy with the purchase, and would recommend to others, despite never having thought I\'d make such a purchase online!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too firm, odor lasted about 2 weeks, inexpensive but seems to be made well', 'author': 'NJ2F', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'MY RATING & QUICK OVERVIEW3.6/5 starsIt is not soft as advertised, could smell less, offer better edge support and the manufacturer should include all trail period, return policy and warranty information up front, with the product and have it available to read on their website. All I know is that it has a 10 year warranty (prior to purchase).BACKGROUND INFOAbout Me: 32yo male, 5’11”, 180 lbs, active. Incident about 2 years ago caused chronic lower back pain. Stretching/exercises/TENS/heating pad help. I don’t take medication. Recently, my back would take up to 8 hours to relax and loosen up. Then I would go to bed and have the same issue the next day.Typical Sleeping Positions: 90% side with top leg bent, 10% backOld Mattress: Only 3 years and 2 months old. It’s a Steinhafel’s brand luxury pillow top. First 6 months were amazing! Unfortunately, mattress became uncomfortable shortly after the 120 night trial period ended and is just awful now. Still looks brand new.SHIPPING & BOX CONDITIONUPS Next Day Air Saver from Northwest to Midwest USA. Box arrived in good condition with a few small punctures. Tape was ripped off half of one side on top and bottom of box.DIMENSIONS, WEIGHT & PACKAGINGThe queen mattress should measure 80x60x10 and weigh about 64 lbs. In reality, it is slightly wider than 60 inches as it hangs off my box spring and past my headboard a little over 0.25 inches on each side.I was able to get it inside, unpacked and carried up to a second floor bedroom by myself. The average (fit) person shouldn’t have a problem as long as it’s kept compressed until you get it to where you want it.Mattress was compressed in a heavy-duty plastic bag, wrapped several times with heavy-duty plastic, placed in a weaved plastic drawstring bag and shipped in a heavy-duty Sweetnight branded cardboard box.MANUFACTURE DATE & RECOMMENDED OPENING PERIODThe mattress I received was manufactured October 2017.In the Q&A section, Sweetnight mentioned opening it within 6 months and that they add an extra 0.5 inches of memory foam to the total height because if it stays compressed too long the foam may not fully expand. It measures exactly 10 inches with the cover on.DECOMPRESSION EXPERIENCEMattress expanded quickly and reached nearly 100% in about 2 hours. Like another reviewer, I needed to remove the cover and adjust the corners because they initially expanded to only 90%. After adjusting the corners, they expanded in full by the next morning.SMELL/ODORI have an excellent sense of smell and this mattress gives off the typical memory foam odor. The odor was strong enough to fill the room. It did not give me a headache or make me feel sick. I have a Protect-a-Bed waterproof protector over the mattress and after a day or two I detected odor while sleeping. I ended up pulling back the sheets and protector to allow the mattress to air out until bedtime. After 1 week, I washed my sheets and removed the protector to allow the mattress to air out again and this time it did not fill the room with odor. If I put my nose to the mattress and sniff I can still detect a very slight odor. I’ll probably let it air out every week until it completely goes away. Manufacturer should not claim it is completely odor free. Minus 0.5 stars***EDIT: After pulling back the sheets to let it air out for the 2nd week, I noticed no odor wafting from the mattress. Even if I put my nose to the mattress, I cannot detect any more odor!FIRMNESS LEVELS (1=soft, 10=firm)I do not agree with the manufacturer or other reviewers that state the soft side of this mattress feels soft or like sleeping on a cloud. It’s much too firm for what I imagine sleeping on a cloud is like. As a point of reference, I’d rate my luxury pillow top a 3. The Tempur-Pedic TEMPUR-Flex Supreme gets a 4.5. The soft side of this mattress gets a 6.5 and the firm side gets an 8.5. I assume this mattress would feel softer to a heavier person and firmer to a lighter one. Minus 0.5 star.SUPPORT & COMFORTThe gel infused top layer adapts quickly if you roll over. The support feels similar (in a way) to the $2,300 Tempur-Pedic TEMPUR-Flex Supreme that another family member uses. However, the TEMPUR-Flex Supreme utilizes a slower adapting memory foam, is less firm overall and is much more comfortable...but it’s $2,300!Soft side is firm, but your body sinks in (maybe up to 1.5 inches) and the foam molds to your body and supports your curves. So yes, it’s firm, but supportive and comfort is acceptable. So far it’s better than my non-supportive pillow top. The firm side is way to firm and hard for me.The 3-zone middle layer is made up of 3 different pieces of foam. The pieces under your head and feet are softer while the middle piece under your hips is firmer. Just by laying and/or pressing down with my hand, I can feel the difference. I wish the middle layer was made up of the softer foam only.I was reading somewhere that men should look for a mattress that is softer under their shoulders and women should find one that is softer under their hips due to bone density and body structure and where each gender would benefit from pressure relief. With that being said, this mattress should be good for men, but I would caution women because the foam under their hips may be too firm.COOLING GELThe top layer of foam is infused with gel to allow for better cooling while you sleep. This does help and not once did I wake to find myself overheated. If you sleep on the firm side, you will not have gel infused foam to help keep you cool as it is only on the soft side.EDGE SUPPORTEdge support is ok for sleeping, but very poor for sitting. I can sleep right on the edge and do not feel like I am going to fall out. The mattress compresses significantly if I sit right on the edge to put on socks/shoes. If I sit so the back of my knees are touching the mattress, the edge does not sink in that much. Minus 0.1 star.MATTRESS PROTECTOR & DEEP POCKET SHEETSI am using a Protect-a-Bed protector over this mattress and it affects the feel of the memory foam. I think it makes it a bit firmer/harder because the air cannot escape as easily and because the thin layer of waterproof backing on the protector is not stretchy so when you lay down it provides a bit of tension keeping you from sinking in as fast/far. BUT, you really should be using a waterproof protector with any memory foam mattress as the foam will suck up any moisture (sweat, spilled liquids, urine, etc.) and is practically impossible to clean and moist foam can easily lead to mold growth. And mold is bad.This 10” mattress works well with regular and most deep pocket sheets. I am using 15” deep sheets and they work fine.SLEEP QUALITY WEEK 1 (Soft side of mattress)My quality of sleep was definitely a little better than with my previous mattress, however, I did a lot of tossing and turning. One night I made a point to look at the clock every time and it seemed like I was sleeping good for 45 minutes and then had to turn over. This went on all night, every night. I understand my body needs to get use to a new mattress, but I’ve never experienced anything like this in the past. So far, I am not pleased. Back pain is slightly better than with old mattress.SLEEP QUALITY WEEK 2 (Soft side of mattress with 3” memory foam topper)I put a 3” ViscoSoft gel memory foam topper on top of the mattress to soften things up a bit. If the mattress were really like sleeping on a cloud I wouldn’t have needed to do this. I’ve been sleeping much better after adding a the topper. I am tossing and turning significantly less and waking with much less back pain.SLEEP QUALITY WEEK 3 (Soft side of mattress with 3” memory foam topper)Same as week 2. Much better than without the topper. I am happy I already had the topper because I think it’s unacceptable to purchase one just to make the mattress more comfortable (which is what Sweetnight instructed other reviewers to do).SLEEP QUALITY WEEK 4 (Soft side of mattress with 3” memory foam topper)Same as week 2 & 3. I do not notice any permanent depressions or premature wear in the areas I sit to watch TV before bed or actually lay to sleep.PRICINGIf you are looking for a medium-firm to firm mattress, I find it to be reasonably priced at $428 for the queen size, but watch for deals. I was able to get this for $350 right after the holidays as a Prime Deal. I’ve seen it priced at $388 (includes $50 coupon) and another reviewer mentioned getting it for $400. If you want a softer mattress, this is not a good investment because you will most likely need to purchase a separate foam topper. A good one of those runs around $100.TRAIL PERIOD, RETURN POLICY & WARRANTY REGISTRATIONNo mention of trial period or return policy up front. What if I don’t like the mattress? How the heck and I going to ship this thing back? The paperwork that comes with the mattress states you have 30 days. Minus 0.1 star.Register at sweetnight.store for the 10 year warranty. I am disappointed that no additional information is provided. What’s covered? What’s not? Minus 0.1 star.After registration, you are supposed to be able to login with your email address and serial number. That doesn’t work for me, so I will contact Sweetnight to get this sorted out. ***Edit: I contacted Sweetnight and received a reply within a few hours. They verified my mattress was registered for the warranty and assured me I could log into their site. I tried again and still cannot log in on IE, Chrome or Firefox. I tried re-setting my password and I receive a message that there is no registered user with that email address. Whatever. At least they respond to email inquiries fast. Minus 0.1 star.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars An Honest Review', 'author': 'Stefy', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Sigh...I REALLY wanted to like this mattress, but alas this mattress has sadly disappointed me. To start, I bought this mattress back in June, I have had this mattress for about 6 months now.Prepare yourself for my long and winding story...After struggling with my old mattress which had become old and was starting to dent at the middle, I decided to purchase a new mattress from Amazon. In the past I had purchased a Zinus Green tea mattress, and genuinely had a positive experience. However, recent information about Zinus mattresses and fiberglass had kept me cautious about wanting to purchase another Zinus mattress again... so I decided to do a bit scrolling on Amazon and look for possible alternatives. I ended up buying a mattress from an unknown company on Amazon, only to get sent the wrong mattress (please don\'t make the same mistake I did folks! If you do purchase a mattress from an unknown company make sure to buy from a either a reputable company, or one that has a good record of satisfied customers! Also check that your packaging is clearly from the company you bought it in order to avoid stressful returning and refunding policies) Anyways, despite that, I tried to give that mattress a try and it didn\'t work-out; It was a hybrid mattress that was just too soft, and it caused nothing but back-pain and heartache. After Amazon was nice enough to refund me, I decided to give another mattress a try... I found Sweetnight.After my prior experiences I was very hesitant about purchasing another bed-in-a-box, but I decided to take the risk after a bit of research. After reading a fair amount of positive reviews both on Amazon and different mattress rating websites, as well as watching multiple video reviews on YouTube, and even reaching out to the company to ask about whether their they used fiberglass... FYI they don\'t!! And finding out the mattress not only used gel memory foam, but had flippable firmness levels, I was sold!Let\'s get down to it, shall we? (Skip here for the important stuff)I won\'t describe the packaging aspects because I can\'t remember the exact details that far back, all you have to know is that it arrived early and it was packaged well. It came with a little razor blade card/tool to to help you cut the [vacuumed-sealed] plastic wrap. However, I found it kept getting stuck while sliding against the plastic, and it made it difficult to use, so opted for a good ol\' pair of handy dandy scissors instead. It expanded quickly, no horrible smells, no bugs or weird lumps, nor any issues with it\'s expanded height. The mattress itself comes with a cover/encasement that can be unzipped for washing. I\'m not sure what exact materials are used for the cover, but apparently it\'s Rayon. However, I feel like the white top and bottom may be made with cotton or a material similar to cotton. However, it also feels very cheap and delicate. I later found out that it rips easily after my cat decided to jump on the mattress and have a cat bath, she didn\'t even purposely scratch the mattress, but rather grasped onto the top cover and it already started to rip (Side-note: My cat would like to add to this review, she says she\'s sorry and would ALSO not recommend this mattress to other cats and their human servants). To further note, I also remember accidentally spilling something on it, and using water and a wash towel to remove the stain... after rubbing off the stain with a towel and some water, it started to rip. RIP cushiony cover... if you do buy this mattress, please buy a protective cover of some kind. With that said, this mattress also seems to collect a lot of lint (at least on the soft side).The "soft" side is truly soft, it feels like a soft cotton cushion, akin to sitting/sleeping on a marshmallow. I believe that\'s partly due to the first layer of the mattress which happens to be gel memory foam. When you lie on top of the soft side you do sink in a little and at first it feels comfortable and soft, but overtime you realize there\'s not much support and your back will end up hurting after a while. For reference, I\'m 5\'4" and weigh about 175 lbs. There\'s not much edge support, and you do sink at the sides. The "firm" side, is definitely firm and is akin to sitting/sleeping on what I can only describe as sitting on a soft piece of cardboard. Or in other words, imagine getting the firmest couch cushion and placing cardboard on top of it... or better yet, let me tell you how it actually feels like, it feels like base foam... surprise, surprise that\'s because it is BASE FOAM. Gasp!Sadly, their whole "flippable mattress" feature is really just a marketing scheme for customers to think they cleverly designed a mattress with adjustable firmness levels. All it is is basically flipping your memory foam mattress on to it\'s base, you can literally can do this with ANY memory foam mattress that has a firm foundation base. What\'s funny is that they didn\'t even bother making the cover somewhat similar to the soft side, it just feels like scratchy non-slip fabric of some kind (like the type of material you would expect to find at the bottom of a mattress or a couch). Also the cover I received didn\'t even have a zipper handle, I had to hook a paper-clip to try to unzip it.Now for the actually sleeping quality critiques...I\'ll be honest, when I slept on this mattress for the first 2 weeks, I was in heaven. I thought I finally found a mattress that would let me sleep soundly, and without anymore back-pain. That fantasy story didn\'t last very long. After 2 weeks, I started noticing I was starting to feel some discomfort on my lower-back. Prior to this, I had first tested the "soft side" for the first week, and then "firm side" for the second week. I had decided to sleep on the soft side for the third week after finding it more comfortable than the firm side. At first, I thought maybe it was because I had switched sides, and since the bed was still new it maybe needed some time to break-it in... but after another week my discomfort got worse and turned into back-pain. I then decided to sleep on the firm side, and it relieved some of of my back-pain for a good day or two, only to wake-up with a sore arm afterward, and eventually more back-pain. It also started to feel like I would sink-in unevenly towards the middle of the mattress. It was a no win situation. After thinking about it, I feel this bed might better for back-sleepers, specifically back-sleepers that are lightweight. As a side-sleeper (and occasionally combination sleeper), and someone whose not exactly "lightweight," but rather in-between light and someone with a heavier build, I don\'t see this mattress helping anyone who sleeps on their side. It doesn\'t seem to offer support since your hips sink in, and I don\'t think it provides proper spinal alignment. I constantly wake-up with back-pain. At the moment I\'ve been trying to endure with a couple of mattress toppers (even bought one of the mattress toppers from Sweetnight, and a latex one), but even they don\'t really do much, they just make it somewhat tolerable to sleep for an extra day or two. However, every couple of days I have to flip the bed around so my back can find some sort of relief since the mattress toppers eventually give-in to it\'s poor support. If anything, I would recommend to stay clear of this bed and look elsewhere. If you have the money, invest in something better, even if it costs more. This bed is not worth it, sorry. Maybe some might find this bed comfortable, but I feel maybe only a child or someone whose lightweight, otherwise, there\'s 50% chance you\'ll either hate or love it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A good bed', 'author': 'AmyChalfont99', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mattress is great! I got the flippable one because my husband and I both have different firm presences. While I like a softer more cloud like mattress, he wanted something more firm for his back. I took away one star because I got the 12 inch and it only expanded to 11. Not a huge deal but would’ve been nice since I paid extra for the larger size. Overall we are happy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Twin Mattress, 10 Inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress, Gel Infused for Comfort and Pressure Relief, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, Medium Firm, Grey, Twin Size
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome value!', 'author': 'Fuller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If I had based my decision to purchase on product reviews, I likely would have passed on this mattress. However, a VRBO stay was my introduction to this mattress and 4 months after purchase, I\'m not disappointed. A relative (at same VRBO) who usually recommends a Tempurpedic was extremely impressed with the comfort and restful sleep experience as well. A few details: mattress does need 72+ hours to fully expand (may not be full 10" but it was close), medium firmness with decent edge support, gel does sleep cooler than regular Tempurpedic foam topper used for a few years prior, and the queen was slightly longer than old box spring being used as platform. One surprise - I\'m a sidesleeper but found I can comfortably sleep on my stomach like I did in my youth! Obviously, not sure of mattresses life span, but based on the price, dont think I\'ll be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress, Great Value!', 'author': 'Ms. M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE (March 8, 2020): After sleeping on this for about 4 months now I have one addition to add. We purchased this with a metal bed frame/foundation. I regret doing that and will be purchasing a traditional boxspring and frame as soon as finances allow. The foundation we purchased has a large center support "beam" down the middle that causes our mattress to sit differently over that spot. At night I feel like I am rolling up hill just to snuggle with my husband. I don\'t like it at all! Plus, I could see this causing my mattress to eventually have indentations and uneven wear because we tend to sleep in either side of the center beam of the foundation. Also, the foundation is impossible to move as it has no wheels like a bed frame does.The mattress is still fantastic....with a traditional boxspring I know I will be much, much happier!! Don\'t get those metal foundations...splurge for a traditional boxspring, if at all possible!Original review (January 2020): I got this mattress to replace another memory foam mattress I\'ve had for about 7 years. This one is different than my other one...it is the perfect combination of soft yet supportive. The memory foam I had before was very hard and, though I loved it, when you first got in bed, it was like you were laying on a pallet of bricks with a sheet on it. It would eventually soften up, but initially it was extremely hard. This mattress is not like that one...this one is comfortable the moment you get in bed.I was a little concerned getting the 10" since my previous mattress was 14", but it hasn\'t been an issue at all. It opened to full height within about 30 minutes and there was absolutely no smell. We did not follow directions and wait 48 hours....we slept on it 5 hours after putting it up...we don\'t have another bed and we both had work in the morning, so we had no choice.For the price we are extremely pleased with this mattress. We are fully prepared, based on the price, that we probably won\'t get more than a couple years out of it, but at less than $200 for a king size mattress, we are totally OK with that!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great after 3 years (and counting!)', 'author': 'Dejah S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was reading about 1000 reviews on beds before finally committing to one. I will update this review in time to see how it performs in the future, but for now I wanted to add to the reviews the overwhelmed shoppers like myself will see. I wrote this review after having it for 2 weeks, but now after 3 years, my positive comments still hold up!Overall, I absolutely love this bed. It came right when it was promised, and I let it expand for nearly the entire 48 hour recommended time. It\'s only gotten to around 9", but I\'m not too worried about it, it\'s comfortable and a very good size as is, wouldn\'t change a thing. There was a slight chemical smell that has gone away as I let the mattress rise. I also read that people had trouble with fiberglass... well don\'t remove the cover. I believe it is to protect the mattress from some liquids, and it isn\'t intended to be removed. So I avoided that and don\'t have a problem with it at all.My biggest worry was mold. Thankfully no other reviews mentioned mold, so I thought I was safe. And when I received it, there was no appearance or smell of mold whatsoever. Good stuff!When people explain that it is both soft and firm, they are absolutely right. The first maybe 2 inches are soft, while the rest is supported by a more firm foam. This allows me, a small 120lb woman, to sink in but not keep sinking in. I hated memory foam because I would never sink the way I wanted so it felt way too firm. I really feel like I am supported in all the ways I need to be. I have never woken up in any pain, and I have even been sleeping all the way through the nights. I guess you don\'t realize how much you were suffering on a bad mattress until you get a new one!Finally, it is even a very comfortable mattress for 2! I don\'t find my arm getting sore or loosing circulation in any cuddling positions so far. I know that is a little weird, but for anyone looking for a mattress for 2, I hope it helps. The "medium" feel of both soft and firm has kept us both very happy, as I am someone who loves a soft bed, and him firm.The other biggest complaint I\'ve read is that it doesn\'t last very long, so I updated my review about a year later. So far, it works just as well as the first day I got it! I\'m still so comfortable!!I am updating again after 3 years. I am still so happy and comfortable on it! It does feel like the top "soft" later got a little softer, but the high density part beneath remains wonderfully supportive. I also don\'t feel like the additional softness over time is a bad thing by any means. My husband and I do not fall to the middle anywhere, and still cuddle comfortably through the full night.The only bad thing is that I babysat for a dog who loved thrashing around on a bed, and I think his nails caused some small kind of pilling effect on the top foam layer. But even with that, I don\'t feel it and it doesn\'t affect the function of the mattress. You only notice if you are running your hand over the bed and looking for it.After 3 years, I could not be happier. I want everyone to have this mattress!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bought for my Grandson', 'author': 'Priscilla Savary', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My 7 year old grandson needed a new mattress. This came fast and he is sleeping really well on it. I am really glad I chose this one. It 'fluffs' back up nicely and is very supportive. (I know fluffs isn't the right term but I couldn't remember the right one. LOL) The price was good and the quality is excellent. I'd buy this again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality especially for the price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this for my son. It is honestly more comfortable than expected. Good deal for the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best Mattress I've Ever Slept On", 'author': 'Patty Piazza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was extremely skeptical about buying this mattress. Boy, was I wrong! I\'m 68 and I\'ve been picky about my bed for many years. I\'ve paid upwards of $1000 for a mattress several times. A good night\'s sleep is so important. Now that I\'m older I was unhappy with a firm mattress as I would get sore spots - hips, shoulders, ribs, anywhere that the pressure was too much. So I thought about a foam mattress. Upon looking, I saw that this mattress had pages of great reviews, including ones that claimed they didn\'t wake up with sore spots. I checked the return policy and felt safe trying this one out. I was pretty sure it would be going back.I\'ve now had the best night\'s sleep that I\'ve experienced in years. This mattress is unbelievably comfortable. There were zero issues with it expanding and it was ready enough for me in 24 hours. I have no idea how high it got and I didn\'t care. I was just desperate to be comfortable and rested so I used it the second night.Everyone is looking for different things in a mattress, so I\'m sure this isn\'t for everyone, but for me it was the perfect mattress at an unbelievably good price. It came sooner than promised and was perfectly packaged, clean and relatively odor free. I couldn\'t be happier with this purchase and I\'d buy it again in a heartbeat.On a side note, I have a small bedroom and wanted the bed to have as small a profile as possible. I ordered the Amazon Basics Foldable Metal Platform Bed Frame with Tool Free Setup. Listed price at this time is $119, but I checked the "new and open box" listing and got it for $70. The listing said "used" but it was not. This frame was exceptionally well suited as it is a "platform" frame, so it supports a mattress without the need for a box spring.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Fishunter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the most comfortable mattress I’ve bought ,no regrets with it ,we have one in our rv also.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Nick Dray', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I seem to have bought a lot of mattresses over the last few years. Six or seven. I always by fairly inexpensive memory foam ones ($3-400) and all who sleep on them are very happy including myself. This one was for a guest bedroom so I bought this less expensive one. Upon opening it up, it swelled up predictably and has formed a fine shape. It did take over a week for the smell to dissipate but that was only to be expected. It's only been used a handful of times so far but it seems to be perfectly comfortable, supportive and sag-free. Comparable to our other mattresses. One of the above ratings is for softness which is a bit of a daft metric. It's quite firm, which I like but I couldn't exactly give it 5 stars for softness nevertheless the fabric is pleasantly soft.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Súper cómodo! Recomendado!', 'author': 'LilyB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gracias, por ser excelentes con el shipping! El matress es especial, en especifico la marca olee. Super comodo y balanceado , no es duro, ni es blando. Lo compre hace 7 años atras, y ya he comprado 4 de ellos. Es muy bueno en comparación a otras marcas. Gracias Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great guest bed', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We got a twin size for the daybed in our guestroom and it's very comfortable to sleep on! My mother in law and my grandmother both stayed with us on separate ocassions last month and they both slept very well, no aches or pains. I will say the only reason I took away a star is because the edges of the bed are pretty squishy so sitting on the edge of the bed, there's not much cushion between your bottom and the bedframe, but it's not uncomfortable. Enough cushion for putting on shoes, etc just not for prolonged edge of bed sitting for an adult. Otherwise it's fab!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

He says that he sleeps so much better now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This mattress is not 60" wide', 'author': 'Apple', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'So disappointed with this mattress.
