title: Folding Mattress, 6 inch Tri-fold Memory Foam Mattress Topper with Washable Cover, Foldable Mattress Topper for Camping, Guest - Queen Size, 78" x 58" x 6"
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty decent: Couch Mode isn’t Perfect', 'author': 'Cate S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'TL;DR version:-Firm cushion, not thin foam. Dense, supportive, didn’t overheat.-Decent as mat for bed.-Pretty sold as couch with a little tweaking.Subjectively more comfortable than cheap couches from stores that collapse in a month or goodwill second hand broken couches.-In couch mode, full size is about the width of a loveseat.-Highly recommended for cheap couch option or temporary bed.Long version:I bought this after I moved because I can’t afford a decent couch right now, (can’t anyone really in this economy?!) I generally don’t mind floor furniture but even Amazon floor couches seem costly.But this little mattress, for its price, is actually pretty decent! I mainly use it folded up in couch mode, the back cushion does kind of sink as the design folds so there’s no cushioning. But I found if you put a long narrow box against the wall on the floor, then line up the mattress against it, and let the back rest sit on the boxes, it doesn’t sink so far. Honestly for $80 it’s more comfortable than most second hand/goodwill couches ive dealt with.The mattress pads themselves are dense but squishy but two stacked on top of eachother creates a nice firm seat. Seriously, I’m a plus sized person and these cushions still support me well.It’s also pretty comfy as a bed. Had a few nights while sick that I just unfolded it and fell asleep watching tv. Again you may have to adjust due to the creases but for $80 I’m impressed.I’ve not tried it car camping yet but considering every air mattress I’ve ever gotten, even the fancy ones has popped in really looking forward to trying something more comfortable.Highly recommend! Insanely reasonable price.P.S. throw a nice blanket over it in couch mode and it honestly looks even better than the $200-300 “floor couches” on Amazon', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Three-fold mattress that elevates your dorm room sleep experience.', 'author': 'Janice', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for an alternative to a mattress that night be typically paired with a futon for when my daughter came to stay for a few nights.She has some pain, and autoimmune issues, so I was on the hunt for a portable, thicker mattress that is a few cuts above your typical mattress used for this purpose.And I did my research.I knew I wanted a mattress that was meant to be used directly on the floor, without a frame.I Did end up pairing it with a 3” cooling gel mattress topper, And a soft, padded cover—which had a skirt much like a fitted sheet that could accommodate a 10-12” thickness overall.This worked Beautifully! And my daughter reported that it was Extremely Comfortable.Not to mention, that as soon as she left the bed,(a hard thing to do)—my cats took turns taking it over like the little Queen & King that is used to being pampered in comfort!I would classify the 6” structure as softly firm—with no chance of being labeled as too flimsy or too hard.It folds in threes for convenience and ease of storage. Light enough to easily move.Only modification to the styling would be if they had added a handle as an extra, feature of convenience for transport.I think I made a wise choice And she says—It definitely beats the Air Mattress experience.Sleep was augmented and improved with this alternative, bedding arrangement. Particularly if you don’t have an available extra bedroom for guests.Janice', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely perfect', 'author': 'cyn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this product to use as a playmat for my new born. It quickly made its way from there to being used as a mat in front of my television. What I didn’t expect was it to be as comfortable as it is convenient to put away.On my lazy days where I am too tired to get out of bed I transition from bedroom to my living room where so get an extra 30 minutes of sleep while my Toddler watches his favorite show. On days that I have company over I fold it up and put it away with ease.I completely recommend this bed for any tired parent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good bed for guest', 'author': 'TKO', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'You want your guest to be comfy but not too comfy right? They might overstay their welcome. These are nice memory foam and they fold up for storage. They’re firm enough and good for occasional use. When you wake up I recommend you take these off the floor so the nights moisture can dissipate otherwise they’ll get moldy on the bottom. (This happens to most mattress that are placed on the floor and not on a frame). So just beware.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job well', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this to replace blow up beds that always pop. It’s wonderful and firm but comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very skeptical', 'author': 'Chelsea Mullen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased an air mattress for a guest I have over often. It didn't last a week before it couldn't hold air well. I got this instead. I was very worried that it would be junk. I was wrong! I didn't think 4 inches was thick enough to sleep on but my guest loves it! Even my kid likes it for laying in the living room to watch a movie. It is great quality and super comfortable. Absolutely a great buy and would buy again, but I don't think I will have to for quite a while.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Home and Camping', 'author': 'MulliSC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was interested in a folding mattress when one of my daughter’s friends brought one for a sleepover. We have gone through so many blow up mattresses as they all seem to fall apart or puncture or get big humps in them after a couple uses. Also, inflatable mattresses just suck and are not very comfortable. We were using a higher end one to make our pull out couch “more comfortable”. Glad I was not sleeping on it. Also whenI camp with buddies, I would have an inflatable mattress in the bed of my pick up and I slept crappy each time. After our “high end” inflatable got one of the humps, due to some internal problem, I vowed to never buy one again. After some research I bought this from Amazon.The queen size fits perfectly in the bed of my truck (have a camp shell, so I can sleep while camping. I was so happy the first time I used it and slept great for the next 4 nights while camping. Our guests are much more comfortable. We even have used it while visiting the in-laws since they have a crappy pull out sofa and now I even like going to visit them since I know the bed will be comfortable.Get one!Pros:Very, very comfortableIncludes CaseFolds up to make somewhat smallerDid I mention comfortable?No inflation, humps or deflating issues!Guests are much more comfortable.Fits perfectly in the bed of my truck.Cons:Handles on the case broke almost immediatelyIt is much larger to store than an inflatable mattress - we sucked it up because of the obvious benefits.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy!', 'author': 'Lee S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is very comfortable. We both need good support but also some cush. When it’s on the floor, it’s a little firmer than I’d like (but my hubby loves it). When it’s used as a topper, it feels juuuuuust right. I don’t notice the gaps/sections once I’m laying down.The materials seem to be good quality. The fur fam loves it when we bring it out in front of the TV and lounge around all day.Might order another one and stack them and replace our traditional mattress.Over the years, we’ve tried many mattresses. Literally none of them have lasted more than 2 years. Doesn’t matter how much it costs! We then sink more $$ into “toppers” to try to save the mattress for years 3-5. And ultimately, we have to replace our mattress at least every 5 years. Years 3-5 are way less comfy than years 1-2. And then it’s just landfill material. So wasteful!The sleep industry is a racket. This product proves that it doesn’t have to be so expensive to sleep comfortably.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it, don't think twice", 'author': 'Ingrid Thurston', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband and I bought this after moving into a smaller space where we don't have room for a traditional bed. We have been using every night for 4 months and it is super comfortable we forget its not a whole bed. We don't wake up in pain and the put away is easy. The only thing I didn't like is the bag is flimsy, we don't even use it anymore. We just fold it and keep it to the side. I will say if you get the bigger beds it is large even folding up, it is after all a queen but still easy enough for me to fold up and put away by myself if needed. We bought an extra pillow top but quite frankly don't need it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Much smaller/thinner than expected', 'author': 'jen', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Was only around $10 cheaper than the regular twin mattress I purchased at the same time...and a lot less bed. Also didn't come with cover/case that was shown in pic.I wouldn't by again, but 7-yr-old slept on it on the floor for equivalent of 2 weeks total & said it was comfortable. Now it's just used as a mattress topper.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Tri-Folding Memory Foam Foldable Memory Foam Mattress with Washable Cover, Twin XL Size (78"x38"x6")
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm, clean, soft, 4 inch is thick enough, Single size is perfect fit for SUV', 'author': 'Ghost', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was smiling too see my package waiting for me. I took it out of the box, it was covered in a thick vacuum bag clear plastic which was easy to remove and tear off. I could hear the air being sucked in as I made a hole to take the plastic off, lol. It expanded fully instantly! Amazing! I bought the single 4 inch which fit perfectly in my SUV. What a blessing it is to have a clean new bed. Compared to my old one which had no cover, smelled like garlic and was a six inch thick. I jumped right in and layed on the mattress for a few seconds and I couldn't believe how supportive it is. I am about 175 pounds and didn't feel the floor with my hips. It is like sleeping on air. So delightful. This really made my day and if I ever need a new bed, I will choose Millard Firm 4 inch. It has cute little bamboo designs on the bed. No worries over here, I had a deep sleep last night which I really needed.Thanks Millard!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfection', 'author': 'Peggy DeGroot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Laying in front of the fireplace has never felt so good. And now I can actually get up from the floor without my back spasming from laying on the floor with just a few pillows and blankets. Perfect size for napping by the fire. Great balance between soft and supportive. Simple set up and tri-fold makes for easy storage. When paired with the matching fitted cot sheet it really holds the 3 sections together so no falling in the cracks. Incorporated handles make carrying a breeze. Very well made. Took about 24 hours for it to fluff up completely after being shrunk for packaging. Removable cover makes for easy washing. Overall, one very happy living room camper!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BEST GUEST MATTRESS EVER!', 'author': 'love2travel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I cannot sing enough praises for both the quality and comfort of the mattress, but also for the company itself. My Mom (who is almost 80) came for a visit with her friend. I ordered the mattress late, having just gotten over covid I wasn't even sure if I'd be ok by the time they were to come so everything was on pause, and the order went in late. I ordered this because though I do have a cot I did not think it was going to be comfortable enough for my Mom and because she was not able to get upstairs to the guest bedroom she had to stay downstairs. The company immediately shipped right out, which I so appreciate, and though the mattress did not arrive the day they got here it DID arrive exactly the day it noted on the order sheet, and they tried to get it here as fast as possible. My Mom slept (or rather didn't sleep) on the cot the first night, was not very comfortable for her. This mattress showed up the next night, I set it on the sofa/coffee table square, which was exactly the width of the mattress, and two chairs for the end support, sounds awkward but I didn't want her to have to get down on the floor. I also ordered the fitted sheet, fits like a glove and well made, also ordered the storage case for the XL mattress, fits like a glove and no dog hair or dust getting on it. Back to the comfort.. so I set the mattress up for my Mom, it was about normal bed level, I laid on it myself to test, felt like a dream, got it ready, my Mom got on it and told me it was SO comfortable she thinks she was asleep before I even got upstairs!! She did not toss and turn at all because it held her so comfortably, making this daughter SO happy because it was my Mom's first time at my new house and I wanted her trip to be great. She slept on the mattress the next 2 nights she was here, slept like a baby each time. The tri-fold is not noticeable at all, did not separate, was absolutely PERFECT, and I'd buy it again in a heartbeat! I will be taking this mattress, instead of my cot, to my Mom's if I bring a friend along. Also seems like it will work perfectly in the back of my Honda in case I'd like to put down a seat and camp in comfort going cross country. I am utterly thrilled with the quality, comfort, and company behind this mattress. I would give 100 stars if I could, so happy for reading reviews and making the right choice. Thank you for comfort for my elderly Mom, means the world..", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy for a back sleeper', 'author': 'Renee S', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a good product for back sleeping on the hardwood floor. It has the right amount of firmness to not feel the floor while back sleeping, although it’s not quite as comfy as a regular mattress. I can’t speak for side sleeping on this thing, since I’m not a side sleeper. It’s also a good size for laying on top of a large (and old, not very plush) couch, to use the couch as a bed when needed.At first I was a little hesitant because of the price, but upon using the product I became satisfied due to the high quality. No regrets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Far So Good! :) Would Recommend!', 'author': 'Michelle R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this Milliard Tri Folding Memory Foam Mattress with Washable Cover Queen (78 inches x 58 inches x 6 inches) so my adult son and his girlfriend wouldn't have to sleep on an air mattress while they are staying with us for a while. There was no noticeable odor when we opened the mattress, which is good for me because I am sensitive to smells. It took about 2 days to get to it's full fluff as expected. I haven't slept on the mattress, but I laid on in for a little while and it seemed comfy to me. I like how it folds up out of the way. :)My son and his girlfriend have been using the mattress for a little over a week now and they haven't complained. They started out with the mattress on our laminate floor. Before I bought this, I had read some comments about feeling the gaps between the sections of the mattress, so I asked them about it. They said if you have a smooth floor you may notice the mattress slipping and pulling apart so the gaps are more noticeable. My son and his girlfriend noticed it a little at first, but they got used to it and didn't notice it after they had been laying on it a while. They also noticed that if the mattress is on top of something that isn't slippery, like maybe carpet or in their case the suade-like top of an air mattress, the mattress won't slip apart as much. My son's girlfriend said the mattress is comfy, however she felt a little like she sank into it and could tell she was close to the floor when it was on the floor. My son thinks the mattress is comfy as well. They both like the mattress better on top of a raised queen air mattress, just for height since we don't have a bed frame, but they also both agreed it is better to sleep on this folding mattress long term than on just an air mattress.So far, this purchase has been well worth the cost, as it is serving its purpose well. My son is working from home and this is perfect for two adults to sleep on at night, then he can fold it away so he can use the space for his office during the day. :)I also bought a Milliard Carry Case for Tri-Fold Mattress, Fits up to 6 inch Queen (58 inches x 26 inches x 18 inches) storage bag to go along with this mattress but I haven't opened it to review it at this time. I will try to give an update when I do. I like the idea of being able to put the mattress away when not in use and having it protected from getting dusty. :) I hope this helps.Update 9/12/20 - The mattress case fits perfectly and is easy to use. It is easy to open up all the way then fold the mattress and set it on top and zip the cover. You can even keep a basic mattress cover on the mattress when storing it away. My 78 year old mom slept on the folding mattress on top of a raised air mattress so it would be easier for her to get on and off the bed. It worked really well and she said it was comfortable for her. I would recommend this mattress and case to others. Thank you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Long lasting and definitely worth every penny. Shikibuton topper makes a great compliment.', 'author': 'mcdsweettea', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been sleeping on this on the floor for over 6 years and still love it. So much better than big bulky mattresses and frames, and my back feels better. I bought the 4 inch twin and added a fluffy shikibuton mat on top. The shikibuton mat is getting a little flat in the middle, probably because I never beat it. There's a whole process around beating the shikibuton with some tool to keep it in shape. I never imagined this would still be in good shape after 6 years. Sometimes I fold it up and put it against one end of my couch to create a chase lounge. It makes a really comfy seat when folded up against the wall as well. Definitely worth every penny.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, supportive and convenient for guests!', 'author': 'Claudia R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have a full house at Christmas and all the major holidays and nobody wants to go to a hotel so that we can all be together… “part of the fun” is what they all say. As a result, we’ve struggled with pull out couches and the bar in your back, countless blow up mattresses that deflate by morning or are cold, as well as folded over pillow tops used on the floor to meet the sleeping needs of 9 people under one roof. I finally broke down and bought this (yet another temporary bedding option) for Christmas this year after watching several review videos and reading great reviews on this product. We bought the Queen size hoping two people could fit. I liked the idea that it is easy to fold up or store when everyone goes home. Final decision: It was amazing! We used it for about a week and a total of 5 people slept on it (no more than two at a time) as people rotated in and out of the house. They all loved it. As one of the review videos shared, you can’t feel the gaps between the sections for some strange reason.Also, it is far firmer than I expected for a foam mattress, thankfully. I hate when I sink into a pillow top. I have back problems and need more support than that. This gave me plenty of back support.We let it breathe to “off-gas” one night so nobody would be worried about any strange foam smells and to let it fully expand. Frankly, nobody said anything about it on the second night so I’m not sure this is really a problem anyway for this product.The packaging offered a good tip to leave the end zippers open to allow it plenty of space to expand since it comes vacuum packed and super compressed in the delivery box. We zipped it up easily after it expanded and put sheets on it the 2nd night and off we went to bed!I wish I would have known about this sooner as we wasted tons of money over the years on products that never met our needs. I wish I would have started with this instead.Also, our 5’11” and 6’ boys did fine on this as well as it was sufficiently long for their bodies.We didn’t even bother folding it up during the day time. Everyone loved lounging on the floor during the day to watch tv or hang out in addition to the couches in the living room.Great purchase! Don’t hesitate!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, firm, easily portable', 'author': 'Lauren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this tri-fold mattress 3 or 4 years ago and have been using it daily since. The mattress is amazing. It is easy to carry and pack when moving and very comfortable. I have slept on it everyday for 3 or 4 years now, no problem. I put it on a wooden IKEA bedframe I bought separately and it is stable, comfortable, and firm.The main reason I got this mattress was because I wanted to sleep on something more firm (not too soft or cushy because I cannot wake up in the morning). Also, I hate spring mattresses, it hurts my back. This foam mattress works really well and it does not trap much heat or sink in! And an added benefit, it is roughly 20 lbs (twin size) and very easy to carry or transport around. It is easy for me to place or remove my sheets after/when washing. I think you can also directly put the mattress on the ground and it would still be comfortable even without any sheets. I also have the carry cover and using it helps me move the mattress very easily by myself. No trouble. Another thing I should say is I have moved 3 times including being in a different state and this mattress has stayed with me! 10/10 recommend.Lots of reviews say it is good for only a temporary or short-term guest bed but I use it as my permanent mattress! There have been no issues, no smell, no other issue in my 3-4 years of use.The only downside is the height (4 inch) is not very high so when I put it in my frame the bed is very low compared to a normal mattress. The blankets and sheets droop to the ground. I think you can also put memory foam mattress topper on top or something if that is an issue, or add a layer underneath. For me, it did not matter. I just have it directly on the wooden slacks of my bedframe.Would NOT recommend for someone who does not like firm mattresses and is looking for something cushy. It is very firm and is in between the consistency of a yoga/exercise mat and an office chair cushion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comparable but less comfortable', 'author': 'Public Name', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'ve slept on this bed for around a month. It has pros and cons, but overall I would say it is relatively close to being comparable in both price and comfort to an air matress with fibertech. There are things that could have been done better from my perspective.Here are a few things I\'ve noticed.One. The foam used in this mattress is two different foams put together. The top layer is a very soft memory foam. The bottom is a stiffer memory foam. I hate this a lot. One reason I was interested in this bed was it sounded like it\'d be a firm bed. It\'s not. It\'s squishy and soft and underneath is like a slowly deflating hammock sensation. If it weren\'t six inches thick I\'d be feeling ONLY floor. Air mattresses are much more comfortable.Two. The "sheet" that holds the three cusions can be unzippered and rezippered with relaive ease. The bottom and sides of the "sheet" is grey mesh. The top of the "sheet" is soft, white, and mattress-topper-looking-ish. I LOVE THIS SHEET A LOT. You can take the cushions out and change them around, which is almost a necessity because of the foam type used wanting to stay compressed. (You could maybe even replace the lower-quality foam with a better foam of the same size and shape, which I might try.)But that said, regular twin-sized sheets placed over the trifold "sheet" will not keep this bed "together." I can already tell that with more use, the cushions will separate a lot further. Something like an additional extra zippered sheet that goes over the trifold one, just the right size for this entire mattress, would have been a boon. It could have kept everything together tightly during the night.Three. The trifold capacity. Is just fantastic. You CAN prop it up just fine (and really should when it\'s not being used, it seems to help the foam recover slightly better from use, and this foam needs that extra help.) You can also make it into the softest marshmallow chair ever and sit on it and become alarmed over the next 15 minutes as you slowly descend farther and farther down to the floor D:Four. This bed... requires a lot of upkeep.When using it on the floor, even though the bed itself does not cause sweat, somehow condensation on the very bottom of the mattress forms every night. I thought this might be because of the floor being cool, so I put a closed-cell foam camping pad under the mattress to alleviate the issue. It did not alleviate the issue. The pad got damp instead of the floor was all. The problem is not due to sweating through six inches of foam. The foam above is bone dry. Maybe it\'s because the bed bottom does not have fabric, it has mesh, but it means an extra concern.In any case it\'s weird and I have been dealing with it by removing blankets, and pillows, and propping it up on its side, so the bottom gets air circulation, to dry during the day. Every. morning. It\'s not acceptable if my bed grows mold, period. Needless to say this is tiring. People in Japan who use futons may be used to this. I\'d rather be able to have my bed in its place and not have to make it up every single night and unmake it every single morning.You cannot put this mattress onto a bare frame if it\'s a frame with bars. It will just not work. You could put this mattress onto a twin XL frame upon which you had placed a separately purchased twin XL boxspring. Or if you got a piece of wood suitable for placing on top of a frame, it might be okay.On to other pros and cons.Cost analysis: Before purchasing, I compared the cost of this mattress to the cost of replacing a quality type of air matress I\'d been using. (Intex, 18", twin size air mattress, with fiber-tech. Incidentally a wonderful camping bed. I tended to have to replace them 2-3 times a year with constant daily use but was always concerned about sharp objects) ...Should I get a year of functional use out of Milliard\'s bed, it\'d cost me close to replacing an 18" Intex twin mattress with fibertech: 4.5 times. In other words, if I had to replace my durable, well made fiber-tech air mattresses once every three months, the cost would be similar to if I successfully manage one year using this Milliard\'s mattress. (Will this mattress hold up as comfortably as a decent air mattress for a year? After a month, I can tell you, the answer is: no. That foam could be much, MUCH better than it is.)Comfort comparison: The bed is very close to the floor, which makes getting up harder than getting up out of an 18" air mattress. Even with 6 inches of foam altogether, the foam is far too soft. It does not provide a feeling of support, but it does succeed at cushioning the floor. Flat out, any air mattress that retains its air through the night, is twice as comfortable as this mattress is a month later. My back is starting to hurt using this mattress due to lack of support. Replacing the cushions with a quality and appropriate high-use foam isn\'t inexpensive, but I\'m looking into that as an option to be able to at least keep using the trifold "sheet" which I really do like.Durability Comparison: Hands down a foam mattress is aimply much more durable than any air mattress because you do not have to worry about punctures.Ease of moving it: Hands down this foam mattress is also much easier and convenient to move or put away than any air mattress. You do not have to deflate it. It is relatively light. It is less awkward to move around. It is NOT a static magnet for every speck of dust and every gross little piece of shed hair or pet fur that can collect on the floor no matter how hard to keep it clean, like the plastic bottoms of air mattresses.ll said, if the cushions were just more comfortable to sleep on (resting on them for 10 minutes is suitably comfortable, but after that you start to sink...), this would be a much better bed. I\'ve slept on plain old couch cushions that were significantly more comfortable for similarly long periods of time in the past, so I know it\'s possible. It\'s just that this is not that kind of foam.If the company offered just the trifold "sheet" as a base, and then options to customize what kind of foam would be put into it, this bed would be better. I\'m not sorry that I purchased it. title: Hybrid Mattress, Medium Feel, Memory Foam, Motion Isolation Springs, 10 Inch, Twin, White & Gray
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good with this mattress', 'author': 'C&J', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First update (July 2020) I'm now a month in and I'm still very happy with this mattress. It is very comfortable, my quality of sleep has improved and I have way less back and shoulder pain. Only thing I've been looking into is a cooling gel infused mattress topper because it's now the dead of summer and uncomfortably warm even at night.I bought this and it arrived at my doorstep within 5 days. Very convenient. Packaged neatly, compressed and delivered by UPS. Total came out to $358.37 which is cheap for a bed, I was questioning the quality but decided to go for it because Amazon's return policies are decent.I ordered this mattress, along with the ZINUS Arnav Modern Studio 10 Inch Platform 2000 Metal Bed Frame (which I also reviewed so it is now available on my profile), after the old mattress I’ve had since high school developed a crater so deep it was visible even when no one was on the bed. Even the box spring was flattened in the center so I decided I needed a whole new setup. I personally spent hours reviewing various mattresses, weighing pros and cons of memory foam vs. spring vs hybrids. I decided on this hybrid mattress from AmazonBasics because I trust the brand a bit more than some of the unfamiliar online-only ones, and I chose hybrid because before this I had a pillow top spring mattress so I wasn’t sure I’d like a 100% foam bed. This mattress is firm without being too hard, it’s comfortable and the motion isolation claims are true, especially for a couple like myself and my spouse who previously had a spring mattress and felt every movement. It is nice being able to turn over without waking each other. The price is very good for the quality and honestly I’d recommend purchasing this bed, I don’t feel like this mattress will have any issues with indenting. However I will be back to update my review especially if anything goes wrong. Also I’d recommend purchasing a mattress protector, I have one on the way. The foam seems like it’d be absorbent and I’d rather not damage it with accidental spills.I think I made a good choice. Overall the process was easy, unbox and unwrap the mattress on the frame or wherever you choose to keep it because it’s easier that way. Personally I think my mattress was full after about 2 hours or so, we slept on it that night with no problems. I ordered the 12 inch / queen version so it’s definitely higher up than I’m used to, but I enjoy how much easier it is to get in and out of bed with the height.I’m comfortable, I slept well, no weird aches or pains, but with the shape that my last mattress was in, anything is an improvement. I fully believe I made a good choice with this bed, as comfortable and well made as it appears. I am a guy in my early 20s though so there was no struggle for me to pick up the box and since it was delivered to my doorstep I just had to drag it down the hallway to my room, where I eagerly tore open packaging like a child on Christmas day, only for this thing to spring open and the impact was like an air-bag. Don’t open it the way I did - watch a video on opening them and for best results, lay it in your bed frame before opening it.TL;DR Freshly ordered and set up, so far so good. No noxious odors, no issues with quality or damage, very comfortable. Will be back to update as time progresses. First night of sleep went really well. If my review helped you, please let me know by hitting the helpful button. Thank you!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No complaints!', 'author': 'Mamy B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We are in our mid 40s and we were starting to experience a good deal of neck and back pain (leg too). After realizing our old Serta had a bit of a sink hole - we decided to get a new mattress before chalking up the aches and pains to getting older.After a good bit of research and working within our budget - this Amazon mattress looked like it would fit the bill. We’ve never had a memory foam but have the slept on them before. We live in a climate that runs 100-115 degrees in the summer. Memory foam is usually too warm for us (even in the winter they make me hot). So we opted to try out the hybrid. We liked the idea of memory foam for our joints but wanted some support from some springs.Delivery Day: It puffed up pretty quickly after removing the plastic and the out gassing wasn’t particularly bothersome to either one of us. It smelled new sure but it wasn’t that bad.Trying it out: Our first couple nights were actually kind of weird. It was firmer than I thought it would be and we were pretty used to our 20 year old mattress so it took a second to get used to not laying in a hole? 😂 But the first night we both woke up with fewer aches. And by day 3, pretty much no aches and we were reveling in how soft something so firm could feel when sleeping on it.We got this mattress in Nov 2021. It is now almost May 2022 and unlike some reviewer complaints - we’ve not had any issue with the mattress denting or caving in. It still looks pretty much like it did when we got it. I weigh about 140 and my husband weighs about 180 - neither of our sides have dents. We have rotated it once since we’ve had it (just swapped what was the head end).It does run warm. Not as warm as full memory foam mattress. But it still runs warm. In the winter it’s actually fantastic. We haven’t tried it in the summer but we’ve already begun to see some warmer temps and I’ve found less blankets and lighter weight clothes was all we needed to adjust to manage the warmer mattress.I’ll try to update my review after a year has gone by. I hope Amazon keeps making these. They are comfortable, good quality and more affordable than similar options.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great value, could be firmer', 'author': 'Mason Caiden K', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a good sized mattress, it comes sealed nice and tight, and it didn't take too long for the memory foam to expand to it's full size. I'm happy with my purchase and I'll be using this mattress for a while.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress', 'author': 'CS74', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We needed to get our daughter a new mattress and we could never seem to find the time to go mattress shopping. One day at Costco I saw a mattress selling for almost $1800 and after trying it I was about to buy it but told my self to go home and do some research and that's how I came across this bed as I do purchase a lot from Amazon.You will find everyone giving mixed reviews about most mattresses because we all have our own preferences when sleeping.With that being said I prefer a medium firmness and am a side sleeper with sleeping issues that I have had for decades. Anyway knowing it's Amazon and if it's not good for whatever reason I could return it so I pulled the trigger and bought this bed. I was anxious to get it and was amazed that it fit in such a small box but it was heavy. I managed to get the king sized mattress upstairs and opened it up and in amazent watched it expand. I know they say it takes 48-72 hours to fully expand but mine was fine in 8 hours.The mattress does have a slight smell like most memory foam beds do, my kids beds had it as well and theirs were from a major brand. Anyway I left my windows open for the day and closed it at bed time and have to say there was still a smell to the bed that night. It eventually went away after 3 days.Now for sleeping on it, it took me a day or two to get used to it and following that it has been the best night's sleep I have ever gotten. It is firm when you get in and then it conforms to your shape and let me say no back pains, like I had in my last bed. Unlike standard memory foam this has not trapped the heat and kept me comfortable and given me great support from head to toe.Is this comparable to a casper mattress, I can't say but it's one heck of a bed at an amazing price with Amazon backing it up.It has just been a few weeks now so I can't state how it will do over the years but I will provide an update in a few months.Again for the money you can't find anything comparable out there and it seems to be built well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best mattress EVER! It's 11 inches at the biggest part and 10.5 at the corners. I bought a12. Darn.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolute hell getting upstairs...otherwise so far so FANTASTIC!! Great Value!!', 'author': 'Mister July', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got the mattress shipped and delivered over the weekend. It\'s been just about a week and so far so good. A couple of suggestions I would make are these,1. Make sure the room you are putting this thing in is WARM!! - This helps air in the memory foam expand quicker, which alongside the pocketed coils can shorten prep-time to 24-48hrs.2. Rotate your mattress 180-degrees WEEKLY!! (most important) - It is important to rotate these mattresses more often than not the first month or two in order to reduce the chance of uneven sinking. It will also help to even out the expected "setting" of the coils, which might look light slight sagging.Other than that, it feels great!! It isn\'t marshmallow soft but not brick hard. It has a plush firmness, I\'d say medium-plush to be more specific. title: Short Queen Mattress, 10 inch Gel Memory Foam Mattress with CertiPUR-US Bed Mattress in a Box for Sleep Cooler & Pressure Relief, Medium Firm Queen Size Mattress 60" x 74"
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars !!! FINGERS CROSSED !!!', 'author': 'Cherie Volante', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i just now got my mattress, so don\'t have a lot to say yet (gave it 4 stars, cuz so far, so good ;) ) ... 1st, i want to acknowledge the local UPS guy - he went above & beyond! i had a path all cleared to the bedroom, expecting to be dragging the box thru, but the guy offered to bring it right in, set the box exactly so & even offered to stay & help me set it up! i said thanks but i know they\'re busy & was grateful he brought it all the way in for me :) ... i immediately set about to opening it so it could start expanding/airing out ... i did NOT notice any unusual odors (yet anyway) ... i did notice as i was unrolling it that it was very cool (probably a result of the vacuum packing) ... it looks almost inflated already, but i have it up on its end in the window - so the top of the mattress is getting the fresh breeze & i have 2 old fans (on their last legs, the neighbors were throwing out) blowing at what will be the bottom when i lay it down - i\'m hoping all the air circulation might prevent any of the horror stories i\'ve read about these types of mattresses :O ... it seems the bigger the mattress is, the more prone it can be to unpacking problems (mines a double/full) ... so fingers crossed that i don\'t experience any negative effects the way some have :/ ... the storms we were having have all blown over to Honolulu, so Hilo atm is sunny & dry & warm - optimal conditions for mattresses like this to re-inflate - + i opened it right away upon receipt, so hope that helps, too ... when i have more info, i wish to update this - until then: fingers crossed! ;) ..... ..... ..... it\'s only been not quite a day; mattress seems to be inflating well, tho i\'ve noticed some lumps & bumps in the base foam only - i\'m hoping that\'s due to the fact it hasn\'t yet had a chance to fully expand. i haven\'t sat nor laid on it yet - i want to make sure i give it at least 3 days before putting any weight on it ... ... ... ... ... today marks the 72 hrs! most of it\'s decompressed to about 14 1/2 ", tho some parts are still at only 13"; still some bumpiness in the base foam --- am gona give it a few more days before i sit/lay on it cuz i imagine having that much foam sucked down to a few inches & then go thru the shipping process for X amt of days is traumatic to the foam & it takes some time to recover (putting any wt on it seems like i\'d just add to problems :/ but i lived w/out it this long so a few more days or so won\'t bother me) - still haven\'t noticed any unusual odors, so i think all is going as it should be, am just giving it more than the recommended 72 hrs to see if the shorter areas plump up & i think the bumpy ridges in the base are just parts that are still compressed & need to inflate - fingers crossed! lol ... UPDATE after having it out of the box a few wks now: well, i have sat on it & laid on it to check it out & it seems like it\'s gona be comfortable - but i still wnat to wait a while before sleeping on it every night! ... the hard lumpy bumps ARE smoothing out the more acclimated it becomes! i think it\'s just gona take time, after all, it was squashed/sucked flat to maybe an inch in thickness! LOL ... one end has actually expanded to a bit over 15"; the other end isn\'t quite 14" (so far!) but i\'m _not_ complaining: it\'s supposed to be healthy for us to sleep w/our feet slightly elevated than the rest of our body (better heart circulation; helps dispel fluid build up in legs, feet; etc benefits you can google :) ) so i intend to make the higher end the \'foot\' of the bed (tho the other end may continue decompressing & gain more height) i also am thinking: there\'s probably more lumpy-bumps inside the mattress that i can\'t see & they still need time to adjust from being a large thing, sucked into a tiny space, then needing to re-expand back to it\'s original size! that simply cannot happen in only a few days & i fear putting any weight on it will interfere w/this process - so i\'m content to wait even a couple months before sleeping on it, & hope it doesn\'t ever develop problems i\'ve read about on-line - as long as i can be patient & let it fully acclimate & decompress as much as possible after the trauma of it\'s compressing, i think it may be a very comfortable mattress for some years! ... the company also seems to be thoughtful & considerate.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 14" King. Honest Review', 'author': 'R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I never write reviews, ever, but I have to write one for this mattress. I was so skeptical at first, I\'m so used to having to go lay on every mattress in every store and usually wound up paying a huge price for one. This is a firm mattress but soft, If that makes any sense. I love this mattress, this combined with a nice Amazon basic mattress pad and a heated mattress pad its like my dream mattress. If you have back issues and need a firm mattress and not something you feel like you\'re sinking in and curving your back they way your back dosent like. This gives great support but is so comfortable. I will admit it has only been a week or so and my old mattress is on standby in the spare bedroom. But If this has longevity I will proudly throw that Sterns and Foster to the curb. Time will tell but I hope this helps someone. Oh and, after I opened it, I let it sit for 3 days in the spare bedroom and I would peek in on it every few hours. Talk about skeptical. It is exactly 14" thick and its beautiful when fully expanded. Like I said, the only thing I worry about is 6 months from now but for what I paid, It was well worth the risk.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Arrived early and exactly as described....well almost....', 'author': 'Robbielou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second "bed in a box". The first one lasted 14 years, so it was just a matter of choosing. After reading SO many reviews I settled on this mattress in a queen. I\'ve kept the old mattress for the guest room. When unboxed it I didn\'t see HOW that pancake was ever going to reach anything approaching 10". After 36 hours we\'re at 9.5 inches and the corners a fully inflated. The cover is VERY nice and I expect that missing 1/2 " will show up in a day or so. Even if it doesn\'t, this is a great mattress for the price and very firm and comfortable, but a caution , if THIS is "medium firm" , Firm must be cement. I love firm and this fits the bill for me. High quality, NO odors and exactly as described.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fair but firm', 'author': 'Danny', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I do actually really like this bed and the fact that it has no springs makes it a very solid bed that does not shake everything when you move. The only reason I gave 4 stars was that I was not really sure what type of firmness I was going to get. At times, I melt into this bed, then other times it seems I cannot get comfy. It is a very firm bed. So this is great for someone that needs that, but just know before you buy it, it's fiiiirm. I may end up buying a soft memory phone layer to put on it to help even it out a bit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful for a back sleeper', 'author': 'Taj', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My previous mattress solution was a 6 inch foam mattress and an 8 inch hybrid mattress. This was less than ideal, trying to keep both from sliding around was an ordeal in itself. It didn't have the same sleep quality as a single thick mattressI wasn't quite sure what I wanted -- I previously had a 14 inch hybrid mattress before the last set, but wanted to try gel. I have to say it was worth the switch. My partner and I both rotate like Rotisserie chickens and this isolates that enough we can't feel each other turn. No more waking each other upIt's almost as solid as the hybrid mattress and has just the right amount of firmness. You don't really sink in very far. It conforms a bit, but you don't feel like the bed is trying to eat youIf you're a shoulder sleeper you probably won't enjoy it as much -- the firmness will tend to make your shoulder sore by morning. If you're a back or stomach sleeper this one is the one for you!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars THE BEST', 'author': 'marly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "such a comfortable mattress and great for the $!! buy this you won't be disappointed. setup was so easy", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars If you are looking for a firm mattress, look no further!', 'author': 'Tee R.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It arrived clean and intact. The 10 inch mattress was easy to set up. It inflated pretty well after 48 hours. However, it took an extra 24-36 hours for for the corners to catch up. I think unzipping the sides helped it along. Happy with the end result.Let me preface what I say next by stating I am a back sleeper and require a medium/firm mattress. I bought this for a guest room, but naturally I wanted this test it out myself. I slept in it for 2 nights. It was 2 nights too long. I awoke each morning with my lower right arm and hand tingling and my fingers were numb. Apparently, I turned to my side at some point during the night.This bed does not conform to your body whatsoever and I found it to be too firm. There is no give. I will have to purchase a 2-3 inch memory foam topper. If I could have returned it, I would have. If you love a firm mattress, look no further. I really wanted to love this bed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Initial Review', 'author': 'Christopher Farrell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Ordered this mattress along with a Secretland bed frame for a guest bedroom. At this stage I cannot make any comment on the sleep quality of this bed as no one has slept on it yet. What I can say is that the ordering and delivery process was simple and fast. The mattress came delivered vacuum packed as most memory foam mattresses do. Once it had inflated again, the mattress cover is nice material and zipped so it can easily be removed for washing. The mattress doesn't weigh a ton like some mattresses, so is relatively easy to move by one person. I have laid on the mattress and feels very comfortable as MF mattresses do feel. Compared to my own MF mattress, I would say it is more medium to firm.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these foam mattresses', 'author': 'Victoria A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Comes rolled up, has to be unwrapped and left alone in the room with a closed door for at least a day, to let the chemical smell out. After that it's great. My last one lasted well for a decade, I only replaced it because I moved and it was easier to just buy a new one. It's so comfortable and lasts longer than a traditional mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprised', 'author': 'Jayyyy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is actually really great and comfortable. Using in my guest bedroom and my family fell in love. I let it rise for about 3-4 days. Tip: unzip the covering to help with rising', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 5 Inch, Twin Mattress, Memory Foam Pink Mattress - Medium Feel - CertiPUR-US Certified - Twin Bed Mattress in a Box, Breathable Soft Fabric Cover
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BEST PURCHASE I HAVE EVER HAD', 'author': 'Carlos Rodriguez', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the NapQueen 5 Inch Twin Memory Foam White Mattress, and I've been pleasantly surprised by its performance. It arrived in a compact box, and once I opened it, it expanded to its full size within a few hours. There was no noticeable off-gassing or odor, which was a pleasant surprise.Sleep Quality: Since switching to the NapQueen mattress, I've noticed a significant improvement in my sleep quality. I fall asleep faster and stay asleep longer. The memory foam contours to my body, eliminating pressure points and allowing for uninterrupted rest.CertiPUR-US Certification: The fact that this mattress is CertiPUR-US certified gives me peace of mind regarding its safety and environmental impact. However, it's reassuring to know that there's a warranty in case any problems arise.So NapQueen 5 Inch Twin Memory Foam White Mattress has proven to be a wise investment for my bedroom. I would take advantage of the delivery service if you can, I chose not to and kind of wish I would have. It was totally doable with two people just a pain to move around. It came rolled up and vacuum sealed but as soon as I opened it it plumped up to full height. It’s good quality and did not flatten out after sleeping on it. The sizing is not perfect but pretty close. I haven’t had to adjust the mattress due to sliding yet and it’s been about a week. It’s springs right back when you push on it. I am happy with this purchase so far. Bonus I noticed my husband is snoring less.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Seems to prevent the mattress from sliding.', 'author': 'UncleDweeb', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Product: LUCID Mattress Elevator BaseReview date: 10/9/2023I purchased this product because of my doctor's recommendation I get something to elevate my head and body to prevent acid reflux complications. Previously I had slanted boards under my box springs, but the mattress kept sliding down. Sinnce I'm an old disabled geezer, I couldn't put the mattress back in place myself. This foam wedge (2 pieces for a queen size bed) is placed on top of the box springs with the mattress placed on top of the wedge. I've had this a few months now and my mattress stays in place. I do admit that I sometimes slide down myself before the morning breaks. It does not interfere with my sleep and highly recommend this product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and firm support', 'author': 'K Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I need inclined support due to a circulation problem that causes my face to swell if I sleep on a normal horizontal bed. This mattress wedge arrived well packaged, and was in perfect shape to install after only 4 hours. It works wonderfully. So well, in fact that I got to tinkering with the wedge to get even more incline. Probably not recommended by the manufacturer, but I cut the wedge about 16 inches above the foot. The toe end of the pad is about 1 inch thick, so that dropped my foot by that extra inch. Then I installed that cutting under the head which raised the head by over 2 inches. This 2 step alteration made an effective 3 inch addition to the wedge and the mattress is still smooth. LOVE IT!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars What to expect, how to decide', 'author': 'eh3 2daMax', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My 5 inch raises one end only 3.5 inches higher than the other end.This is because, as some have stated, it might only inflate 4.5 inches. Then the slope is not down to zero inches, but down to 1 inch. Therefore, 4.5-1=3.5 inches of elevation.This possibly also means the 7 inch mattress will elevate one end of the bed 5.5 (maybe 6) inches higher than the other end. Most need at least 5 inches for GERD, so I will try this next…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wait! Take the handful of bad reviews with a grain of salt!', 'author': 'Kenley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me start by saying I was hesitant to buy this product because of some of the reviews. Hearing that I could possibly receive a defective product and be left having to deal what would likely be a nightmare to return, didn\'t really inspire a lot of confidence. But I clicked the buy button anyway and I\'m glad I did!The product arrives in two pieces, tightly rolled up, and put in a box. I\'ll admit, I was worried when I opened the box and rolled the pads out and noticed how different in shape they were to each other... it really did look like I was given two different sizes. But, knowing how finnicky memory foam can be, I took them outside and let them lay out in the sun for a few hours. It wasn\'t very warm outside, but I imagine the higher the temperature is, the quicker the foam will gain its proper shape. Unfortunately, with the foam being white, it won\'t absorb the light from the sun and heat up on it\'s own.A few hours later I went to check on them and they had fully gained their shape. I placed them on my box spring and threw my mattress on top. I was half-expecting the foam to give when I got on the bed, but it didn\'t even seem to give at all. Just to put things into perspective, my mattress is not light. It\'s a hybrid mattress with springs and memory foam and it\'s very thick. I am also not very light as I weight 280 pounds. These pieces of foam can hold some weight!So why did I purchase this? I got tired of feeling all stuffy and unable to breathe through my nose every night when I laid down because blood flow to the upper part of my body increases. I\'ve also been told that I sometimes snore and thought this might help that. It took a little getting used to, but this product has made a big improvement.One important thing you may want to consider is how firm your bed is you\'re going to go for the 7". While I don\'t personally have issues with sliding down my bed, I could see that it may be a possibility with a firmer mattress. One other quick thing to note is that I did not purchase the cover and my mattress doesn\'t try to slide off the foam.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Five-Star Queen Mattress Worth Every Penny', 'author': 'Phat Tran', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, firm, affordable mattress', 'author': 'Post tenebras lux', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was reluctant to purchase a mattress sight unseen but took a chance on this one. Super comfortable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good mattress and almost perfect', 'author': 'Mr. Dip', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Having used spring mattresses for over 20 years, decided to finally switch to memory foam.This mattress was a good value and after about 2 weeks of use, it has converted me.There were both good and bad that I experienced within the past 2 weeks.The good:--Is firm as any spring mattress I\'ve owned--The length and width fit a Twin size perfectly so it will existing cots, bunk beds, box spring, etc--It comes with a fitted cover and straps in the bottom, and was sealed fully in plastic out of the box--The initial chemical smell didn\'t last more than a couple of days, and I used a couple of fitted sheets initially and that helped in tue first couple of days--All my existing Twin sheets all fit this mattress--The firmness is perfect for anyone with back problems like me--It stays cooler than my previous mattress so it\'s more comfortable to sleep--Does not make any squeaking sounds like springs so don\'t have to disturb the other person in the room when tossing/turning at night.The bad:--It took 2 more days to inflate fully than expected--The height was listed as 6" but after fully inflating it measured around 5.6" to 5.7"--There were no instructions included about washing or removing the fitted cover it came with--Realized quickly that can\'t sit on the edges of the bed like a regular spring mattress - I slid off when I tried to do this on this mattressOverall a great bargain, and almost perfect in every way.
