title: Queen Mattress, 12 Inch Bamboo Charcoal Foam Mattress for Pressure Relief, Plush Queen Size Mattress in a Box, CertiPUR-US Certified, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price and quality！', 'author': 'Song', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great bed at a great price. Have been sleeping on this bed for one month now. In the box comes with a plastic tool to cut open the plastic wrap and as soon as you do, not even 5 minutes later it forms into shape!! The mattress is definitely a firm but with a soft top and a quick response when you push on it so you don\'t have that sink in feeling.The product is of high quality material and high quantity finishes. it was comfortable and relaxing. The two sides are independent, no matter how how tussle and the turn the other side can be, it would affect the other side, not like the traditional spring loaded mattress, you will tussle and turn from the other side.The mattress I bought last year was an 8"，it\'s not perfect for me. So I bought a 12" one at the end of the year.My profession is a truck driver.Driving for long hours every day is very tiring for me.I was having such an issue with back pain due to long driving and hurting my back so much. I think it\'s an occupational disease among truck drivers.now all that pains are no more and I am really sleep like a log .. this mattress the price was wonderful in comparison to other regular stores I checked out and I am quite pleased. I definitely recommend buying this mattress to make the bed EXTRA plush! One caveat, this thing is heavy. Be advised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bed to sleep', 'author': 'H. Lam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i like this mattress sofar , good quality with good price. i brought 12 inches in queen size . It is more comfortable than i expected. The one i had before is too soft and when u lay down it is hard to get up But this time, much better than before. I am satisfied my purchase. Is big and good texture. i can sleep longer than before. I highly Recommend to people who looking for mattress that not too soft and too hard.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars To sleep perchance to dream.', 'author': 'Aleksander', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My daughter outgrew her crib and we needed a bed big enough for her to sleep on with us since she refuses to sleep alone. We decided on a full-size bed but needed a comfortable mattress that would accommodate the adult body and toddler body.Pros:1. Packaging. The mattress came in vacuumed packaging and seemed small at first. I will admit that for a brief second after opening the bag, I had my doubts that this would be 12 inches thick as advertised. I was wrong. This mattress is 12 inches thick and maybe even a little over. Amazingly, it was so well packaged despite its size.2. Size. After opening the mattress, be sure to let it sit for a few hours to let it expand to its full size and potential. As you can see in the pictures, it is quite thick.3. Comfort. My daughter is used to the hard mattress in her crib which is what was recommended for infant cribs. My old body prefers a mattress with some plush and softness. The foam allows a decent amount of firmness but remains easy on the back. The mattress underneath my body does not heat up like other foam mattresses that I have slept on. It also allows me to sneak out of bed after she falls asleep without causing too much motion or shake which would wake her up since she is a very light sleeper.4. Cover. There is a cover on the mattress that looks like it might be possible to remove with zipper although I have not tried to remove it. The cover itself is very soft and I have slept on it without sheets. It does not appear to be waterproof, so I recommend getting a waterproof cover to protect your mattress if your toddler sleeps on it.Cons:I don’t see a con to this at all except that it’s relatively heavy but that’s probably because it is a high-quality mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’ve fallen in love (and asleep)', 'author': 'Anonymous', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my first memory foam mattress, and tbh I had trepidation in buying it. But it’s great! Super easy to…unfurl, it inflated by bedtime, no weird smell, and very comfortable. Initially I thought it was a little too firm, but either I adjusted or it did, because now it’s perfect. These are a bit chilly in winter (it’s damn cold here, and I’m skinny and poorly insulated) but I put my heated mattress pad on it and it’s perfect. I think I’ll love the coolness in summer. It also arrived promptly and very well packaged. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good support', 'author': 'marie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice and thick. Easy to set up. The memory foam contour my body with support. Perfect firmness foam mattress. And softness. Waited about two days for this queen mattress to inflate before use. It hug my back like cloud. No back pain anymore.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and good value', 'author': 'Evan Dewald', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this mattress for our guest room. We thought it would be nice for our guest to have a big King sized bed to sleep in. We have hosted multiple guests and everyone has been excited to sleep on this mattress! It supports your body as you sleep and conforms to your body shape. We have not experienced any sag in the mattress. I think that this mattress is a good value paired with the right bed frame. It will make your room more homey. The mattress came in a box rolled up in a vacuum sealed bag. We followed the directions that came with the mattress. After opening it we let it expand for 48 hours before laying on it. I am very pleased with this mattress and will be using it for a long time!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great plush bed 👍, poor labeling for fulfillment👎', 'author': 'Sparkle Stephens', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I ordered the Sweetnight Queen Mattress, 12 Inch Bamboo Charcoal Foam Mattress. This is my 5th memory foam type mattress in a box from various companies. The mattress is surprisingly plush for a memory foam. It's pretty soft as you lay on it, then as soon as you've sunk in a bit it gets a little more firm and supportive. You can't sit on the very edge of the bed because it has no support at the edge and will just melt under you. I like my mattresses softer so I was very pleased with the plush feel. This one is definitely in my top 2. The only other memory foam bed I think is better is from Bed-in-a-Box website (like the original bed in a box memory foam mattress people).Unfortunately, we had to return this mattress because the company has not figured out how to properly label their mattresses for fulfillment. I ordered and needed the 12 inch mattress, however, the mattress only expanded to 10 inches. But it is fully expanded. NO WHERE on the external shipping box, the labels on the mattress itself or the included instruction manual did it reference what size mattress you have received. I assumed we received a queen size because there was a 'Q' at the end of some random numbers on the shipping box. But that was a guess. It was indeed a queen but there was no way of telling how tall it would expand to. I have no doubt that the 12 inch mattress would have been perfect, but I don't think Amazon fulfillment could even decipher what sizes they are sending out to people. So, I think the real issue people are having is not that the mattress is not expanding to full size, but that they received the wrong size mattress to begin with but you have no way of knowing what size it will be until you break open that shrink wrap. If you're getting the 10 inch, you'll probably be fine because that's what they're sending out. If you need 12 inches for your frame like we do, then you might be rolling the dice. If I knew we would for sure get the 12 inch mattress I would have reordered, but again, the labeling/packing provides NO information on what is actually inside. So, we'll have to pass.Otherwise- nice material, no weird chemical smell, expanded to full 10 inches pretty quickly, and the feel was soft and plush. Amazon customer service was excellent in helping me rectify the problem.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars You get a quality semi firm mattress.', 'author': 'Mamie Priestly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like that this mattress is 12 inches thick.I like that this mattress is comfortable.I like that this mattress was affordable.Well worth the hype. I looked at 8-10 different mattress and I read all the reviews. This mattress is what I chose and I am happy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect mattress', 'author': 'mike brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Falling love with this mattress is easy!1. I bought a full size 10 inch one. It’s not too heavy. I moved it easily by myself from first floor to 4th in my apartment building.2. It’s packaged nicely and cleanly, so it’s very easy to setup.3. The firmness is perfect. It’s soft enough to contour my body, at the same time supportive enough for my back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfort and quality', 'author': 'Eilleen Pena', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i did not add a photo because i could not wait to put the sheets on. however the quality of the mattress 10/10 it is so soft yet firm. i slept in one spot all night no tossing no turning. this was an upgrade from a queen to a king and my first bed in a box. i will def recommend this brand.!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Queen Size Mattress, 10 inch Cooling-Gel Memory Foam Mattress in a Box, Fiberglass Free,Breathable Bed Mattress for Cooler Sleep Supportive & Pressure Relief， 60" X 80" X 10"
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny', 'author': 'Brielle Ann Mckeever', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We wanted to upgrade from a queen to a California king. I was nervous about buying a cheaper mattress off Amazon and I was scared about cheaper ones that contain fiberglass. I picked this one because there’s a reviewer who opened it up and confirmed no fiberglass. This was the best price and the highest ratings. Still coming from a tuft to needle mattress I was nervous…The mattress came quickly and we laid it out flat on the ground and let it air out for 48hrs. We did open a window for most of the time so I didn’t notice too much of a smell. It puffed up instantly and I really had to restrain myself from pressing on it or laying on it.After 48hrs everything reached the full size there was one corner that was just ever so slightly deformed but after rubbing it and a week of sleeping on it the entire bed decompressed.Initially when I first layed on it the bed was very firm and I felt like I was going to have to get a topper. The first night I slept so well and we were so relived that we didn’t pay an arm and leg for a California king.After a week I feel like I sleep better at night and I wake up with less pain though still firm it contours perfectly to our bodies and it’s so comfortable. I really am so glad we got this bed and I think it’s high quality considering I’m sleeping better on this than my $1000 tuft to needle bed. BUY IT!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'JennMom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought the Full/Double 12" memory foam cool sleep matress for our guest room to place on a metal bed.Unboxing: item arrived in a box weighing 55 pounds. My husband brought it upstairs by himself. The box was a manageable size for 1 person. The mattress was folded in half, head to toe, then rolled up tight and shrink wrapped. There was an envelope opener tool taped to the side. I highly recommend using this tool over scissors or other sharp objects so you don\'t accidentally cut into the mattress cover. You only need to carefully slice through one layer of plastic, then you just unroll the remaining layers. The mattress cover was nice and clean. No odors or off-gassing smells detected (and I have a sensitive nose).Set up: Admittedly the matress looks pretty sad and flat immediately upon unwrapping. DON\'T BE ALARMED! It will expand. At this point, make sure the matress is on a flat surface where it can expand freely without any pressure or pinch points. We unwrapped ours around 7pm. Within 3-4 hours, the mattress had risen to 10." By morning, it was at the full 12." The corners were nice and square. We then positioned it into place on the bed frame and made the bed.The bed frame we used is a metal frame with round metal pole type "slats" for a base. The metal head and footboards kept the mattress from shifting around. It\'s a nice and snug fit. No gaps.Comfort: When I assembled the bed frame, I was a little concerned I might be able to feel the round metal slats through the matress. I\'ve never had a foam mattress before. I\'m happy to report that was not an issue. Can\'t feel them at all. If you\'re worried at all about the mattress being folded head to toe for shipping, don\'t be. It lays completely flat and I can\'t even tell it was ever folded now that it rebounded/expanded.I would describe the mattress as medium firm. At first it feels firm, then the matress gives way to your body\'s pressure points and it feels just right, neither firm nor plush. With memory foam, there\'s no bounce like spring mattresses can have, which also means there\'s no movement when your partner moves. With 2 people, we did not experience any rolling toward the center. I\'ve also laid near the edge and had no problems with edge collapse.I\'m super pleased with this purchase so far. Too soon to tell yet how it will hold up longterm, but since this is for a guest room, and based on my initial impression of the product, I\'m not worried.Only bummer was 3 days after delivery, the price dropped 29%, which would\'ve made this an absolute steal of a deal. Even the regular price is a bargain.I would not hesitate to buy again.EDITED TO ADD: We bought a 2nd mattress. Our teen wanted to upgrade from a twin to a double, so we bought another. She loves it. Quality is consistent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good and Firm', 'author': 'E', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So my dog peed on my bed because my husband didn\'t want to take her out...my old bed was an 8" medium from Amazon bought about 3 years ago. It has needed replacing and i spend a few hours reading reviews and investigating my options. I knew i wanted a more firm mattress due to my previous experience and that the toppers usually break in reducing the level of firmness. I slept my first night on the bed last night. It is probably the most firm bed I have ever had. Its not bad but I am aware I am getting used to it. I could sleep on my stomach and not have my lower back hurt which has been a problem with medium to soft beds. My shoulders were not crammed up to my ears; again a problem with softer beds and I didn\'t wake up with shoulder pain or numb arms which has been an issue since old bed has been needing replaced. I did notice there is some give in the topper/memory foam but definitely not as much as my other bed. I can lay there move my leg and feel an impression which also expands back within seconds. My only issue is my lower back was hurting very minorly after my sleep BUT i have been go go go with chores and lifting and moving and my back also hurt worse in my old bed. I do know my body will need to adjust to the new level of firmness so I am not going ot say my back pain is due to the bed. I will have to wait a few weeks and see. Overall, I love the bed so much more than my other one and am already happy about the changes I see I do hope once I let my body rest and adjust to the bed my back will be fine. Otherwise that is my only concern and I wish i had bought a replacement bed much sooner.1 Week in and I notice my body has adjusted. I feel like i sleep deeper, my husband doesn\'t wake me flopping around like a fish in his sleep. I don\'t wake up with any pain. I do notice the bed is cooler and I find myself actually getting cold so I don\'t have to have the AC on anymore. It is still weird to initially lay down as I am still surprised by firmness but I have zero issues and will be curious how it breaks in in the next few months.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No fiberglass – really!', 'author': '🌴 Tropical Panda 🌴', 'rating': 5, 'content': '** Initial review: 4 stars ** (see updates below)I got this mattress in 10" queen in gray. I’ve had many memory-foam mattresses/“bed in a box” kits over the years. What appealed to me about this one was the price and that it’s fiberglass-free.UNPACKING ITHubby and I opened the mattress at 4:00 pm and closely inspected it — no mold or dirt. Whew. Looked totally clean. I have allergies and am a STICKLER about clean mattresses. Had I seen a smudge of anything remotely suspect, I would have immediately returned it. I was horrified by the stories from other reviewers about finding mold (and then being told by the company that it was “just dirt” — equally unacceptable!), and honestly I was expecting the worst. I literally tried to cancel my order twice, but Amazon refused because it had already shipped. Fortunately, to my great relief, the mattress arrived 100% clean. And believe me, I inspected every inch of the thing.As part of my inspection, I checked the fabric and stitching all the way around. I saw no open seams or loose threads. The zippers ran smoothly.There was no smell at all once we got it out of the packaging. Memory foam mattresses have a very recognizable odor (if you’ve had one, you know) and usually off-gas for a few days. This one had a faint odor ONLY during the five minutes we were removing the plastic packaging. (And honestly, a lot of products do that if they’ve been cooped up in plastic wrap for a time.) It went away immediately.FIBERGLASS DOUBLE-CHECKI unzipped the cover a few inches — gingerly at first — to confirm that the mattress is indeed fiberglass-free, as advertised. THANK GOD. The slabs of foam are held together by a knit “sock” that clearly does not contain fiberglass because it is matte and has no shiny bits, nor did it shed any fibers. It appears to be a cotton-poly blend. See my attached photo.This means the cover is washable! (To be clear, I’m talking about the *zippered cover*, not the inner sock.) Although I don’t personally need to wash the cover — because I use an allergen-proof mattress encasement — I can see how having the option to wash it could be useful.HEIGHTWe set the mattress on the bed frame, and two hours later, it had plumped up to 8".Twenty-four hours later, it had only plumped up to 9", and one of the corners by the footboard was still a bit crumpled.At this point now (a week into it, at the time I’m writing this review), I’m not sure it will ever fully inflate to the stated 10". Not a huge deal, though, as I only ordered this mattress as an emergency stopgap until we can buy a nicer one locally.FIRMNESSEveryone’s perception will be different, but on a scale of 1-10, where 1=plush (squishmallow) and 10=firm (plank of wood), this mattress feels to me like an 8. It’s quite firm. I honestly wasn’t expecting this. All of my memory foam mattresses over the years have been a ~5 (fairly cushy), so I assumed this one would be too.Despite my reservations about its firmness, I have slept VERY well on this mattress over the past week. No pain, zero complaints. I don’t normally go for firm mattresses, but I may be a convert now. LOL.FINAL THOUGHTSOverall this is an excellent mattress if you have a smaller budget and want to avoid the dreaded fiberglass sock. Despite its minor drawbacks, for the price, it’s a perfectly acceptable mattress.** UPDATE, four days later **The crumpled corner has fixed itself, but the mattress is still only 9" tall.** UPDATE, two weeks later: Rating increased to 5 stars **I changed the bed linens today and, for craps & cackles, measured the height of the mattress again. It’s at 10" now. I was shocked that it actually got there. I’m still loving the firmness and have been waking up blessedly pain-free. I’ve increased my rating to five stars.** UPDATE, three months later, January 2023 **I am IN LOVE with this mattress. I don’t think I’ll bother buying a different one locally, as this “stopgap” mattress has exceeded all my expectations.I noticed the manufacturer is now, at the time of this update, offering more variations of this mattress than were available when I bought it. There are now “firm” options.My best guess is that the mattress I bought & received is the “firm” variety, and they are selling a new, softer mattress slotted into the plain “8/10/12-inch” categories.Why do I think this?Because I cannot imagine how a memory foam mattress could possibly be firmer than mine without either defying the laws of physics or being a slab of literal stone.If we end up ordering a new mattress for the guest room, you can bet we’ll buy this one again, and I’ll report back and either confirm or refute my theory about the new “firm” variety.** UPDATE, six months after original review, April 2023 **WE DID IT: We bought the exact same mattress, 10" gray, for the guest room — and my theory was right!The new mattress is softer, about a 6 on the 1-10 firmness scale.It also plumped up WAY faster than the original one, probably because it’s less dense. The height measured 8.5" a mere 30 minutes after opening and reached the full 10" by the next day. All four corners were immediately crisp with no crumpling. The cover was clean & pristine on all sides. No odor. We are extremely pleased!Our original mattress is still phenomenal. Zero complaints. Would buy again in a heartbeat.I can confidently give my full endorsement of this mattress, both the “firm” and “not firm” varieties.May you have restful and pain-free sleep, my friend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even better than I had hoped!', 'author': 'Traci', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’m usually not one to leave reviews but this mattress….. I love it! I wanted to give it a couple weeks before reviewing but I was satisfied the first night we slept on it.For reference, I purchased the 12” Blue Firm king size mattress. I got my first memory foam mattress right at the the time “bed in a box” options first started to pop up online. That initial mattress nearly made me avoid memory foam entirely. It was a “medium-firm” 14” king size and it was TERRIBLE. It was dipping within the first week. And my husband and I were much smaller people at the time. Hip and back pain became a constant companion but it was quite pricy and we were trying to make it work. A couple weeks ago I simply had enough. It was time to look at other options.I couldn’t find much that wasn’t memory foam though. Over the years I purchased other memory foam mattresses for our boys and I found them quite comfy so I figured maybe we’d have better luck trying a different firmness or maybe design had come a long way since we bought ours. I read through reviews for days before landing on the Molblly brand. I was still a little unsure on which firmness to get because some reviews said the medium firm was too firm. Others said too soft. The reviews were equally mixed on the firm mattresses.Ultimately I decided to go with firm for more support to help with my pain and figured I could always put a topper on it to add extra softness.The mattress was here within 48 hours. I immediately unboxed it to expand. It was much firmer than our previous mattress but again, there was the topper option if that turned out to be a problem. It was MUCH lighter than my previous mattress too. I was a little worried at first that it had only expanded 9” in 12 hours but based on other memory foam mattresses I’ve purchased I knew I needed to trust the process. Besides, in my experience, memory foam can expand up to an inch off so as long as it hit 11” I would be satisfied.72 hours later and it expanded to around 11.75”! Perfect. When I first laid on it I immediately thought “uh oh” as it was FIRM. Plusher than the floor but pretty firm all the same but…. Trust the process.That first night’s sleep it was pretty clear that while this was indeed a much firmer mattress than the one I had, it was also incredibly comfortable. I can’t explain it but after you lay down a few minutes it gets a bit softer as it molds to your pressure points. It was the best nights sleep I had in YEARS. No topper needed. Over the last week I’ve also noticed my back and hips are less sore. My husband also saw a reduction in headaches he had been waking up with a couple times a week too.I can’t speak to longevity yet but it seems to be a higher quality than my previous mattress. And you can’t beat the price.Speaking of price, I had purchased the mattress on Saturday during Labor Day weekend. I figured any holiday sales would be up already so just bought it. I didn’t want to wait ;) but when I hopped on to check my order that Monday to check tracking I noticed it was marked down $45 less than what I had paid less than two days before.Totally my fault as I shouldn’t have assumed there wasn’t a sale planned for Monday but I figured it wouldn’t hurt to contact the company. They were very kind and helpful and immediately refunded me the difference. I’m pretty much their customer for life now ;)I definitely recommend!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6 month Review, Still feels like NEW', 'author': 'StormTrooprSubZ71', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My back would feel sore in the morning from my old mattress so it was time to replace it. I was looking into getting the "Purple" one but at $2000 for a King size mattress i decided to shop around. I found several ones on Amazon but i was nervous about buying a mattress online. I did a lot of comparing between mattresses on Amazon and this one had the best reviews and a awesome price.The mattress came quickly and I laid it out flat on the bed frame and let it air out for 48hrs. It puffed up quickly and it looked ready but i decided to wait the 48 hrs. After the first night of using it my back soreness was gone. The mattress feels very firm and is very comfortable. 6 months later and the matress still feels like its brand new. The price of this mattress is a steal compared to those other Name Brand Mattresses. I\'ve actually recommended this mattress to my friends and i will buy another one in the future when i need one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Very FIRM!', 'author': 'Alexandrea Courtney-Wilson', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The three stars I give this product are based solely on comfort. The quality of the product is great! The material doesn’t feel cheap, the mattress inflated about 98% of the cover, there was no foam smell, and the cover felt soft and no fiberglass. Now the comfort:I travel around a lot and sleep on different beds and am comfortable on any bed most of the time. I was excited to buy this bed because it is affordable and has very good reviews about being the perfect amount of firmness/softness. I even made sure not to buy the “firm” version of this mattress to ensure it was more on the soft side. I’ve had it for a week now and it is SOO FIRM! By the fourth night on it I couldn’t even sleep anymore I had constant pain no matter how I slept. I even woke up feeling like my sides were bruised. I am 5’6” and 260 lbs (so I’m a bit on the heavier side) but my fiancé also complained about it being really firm and she’s not overweight. We ended up buying a 3 inch foam topper and it still feels pretty firm but at least I no longer feel pain. The point is it’s VERY FIRM and felt similar to sleeping on thick carpet floors.That being said, I’d still recommend because of the price and quality but you will likely need a foam topper if you don’t like sleeping on extra firm mattresses.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far so good', 'author': 'Madison', 'rating': 4, 'content': "*10/12/2023*OKAY this literally just arrived so my first update will be on shipping and unwrapping alone.First off my box came super damaged I didn’t grab photos of it because the mattress inside was obviously SUPER wrapped and looked fine. Thanking the heavens my UPS driver left this ginormous HEAVY box on top of a wagon I had outside making it super easy for me to get through the garage and inside. That being said I am a average build woman and I would consider myself very much in shape and this mf thing was HEAVY and so awkwardly long (king blue 14in). I recommend at least two people unless you have yourself a big strong man to help you lol.They included the tool to help cut through the thousands of layers of vacuum seal plastic they wrapped it in which is awesome. The bed looks nice, no smell so far, and no stains (I checked every inch). They recommend 72 hours for it to plump back up so I’ll be back then with a update.🙂**72 HR UPDATE 10/16/2023**I waited the 72 hours WOOHOO everything measures 14'' except two corners that are still a bit scrunched on the bottom. I took the advice from another reviewer and I gave those two corners some heavy massage in hopes they will plump up. Time will tell if they get to 14''. This wasn't a huge issue for me I just put those two corners at the top of my bedframe (where you lay your head) and I am hoping for the best!I did have some snagged threads on the mattress cover that I have addressed with the manufacture so ill update if anything is done about that as well.As far as sleeping I went from a super old memory foam pillow top mattress that had horrible sinking spots from being slept on that was extremely plush from old age. This mattress is FIRM but yet so soft? I was never a fan of firm beds but with the memory foam it really just works. I can tell my body is still adjusting to the mattress plus its only been one night (: Ill have a better update in a few weeks but . For the cooling aspect, I was so used to my old bed being so hot I actually woke up cold and had to grab my comforter! So id say as far as the cooling aspect 10/10! As of right now I am more than happy with my purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firmer than I thought but I like it', 'author': 'Lan4fam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ok so I've had this mattress for a month now and it did take a couple weeks to even out completely and lose the lump down the center it had, for me that wasn't an issue as I have a king and plenty of room to just scoot away lol, anywho... this mattress is FIRM it has very little give and that's ok with me and my husband as we both have back issues and needed the support. It's not like a rock tho and my hips don't ache so it alleviates pressure from my experience with it. I have a mattress pad (cotton down alternative) and satin sheets Over top and it's cooling for us, unlike our old memory foam mattress that had us sweating constantly. Overall it's a decent mattress for the price and I can sit on the edge without sinking or sliding off and I'm over 200lbs, but our bed frame sort of allows the mattress to sit sort of sunken down into it instead of on top of it so take that into consideration when reading reviews as I did considering I have to sit with my feet on the floor before standing due to having POTS. Ok so now you've read my poorly written grammatically incorrect and very awfully punctuated essay, I'd say if you're into a cheap firmer memory foam mattress, that I can confirm is fiberglass free BTW, go for it. We like it and sleep well and we are both over 6ft and over 200lbs each. (Yeah I know we are giants lol)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfort', 'author': 'CLAUDIA NORBERG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my second mattress purchased. The mattress was recommended by a friend who has 2 & said it was more comfortable that her 1800$ mattress.. We love the mattress . Within 24 hours the mattress rose to its proper size, does not smell. My daughter has been sleeping on hers for 4 months loves it. The second I just received a few days ago. Again it was ready within 24 hours. My son and his finance love it! They are finally waking without back aches. We highly recommend the mattress The problem was I placed the order 11/25/23. first order never came. amazon had me cancel and place another order in Jan 2024, well Amazon canceled the order the day it was to be delivered. I made numerous calls to them. When the last order was canceled I was disconnected and the agent never called back. I called again this time getting someone who actually helped by contacting the seller directly', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Queen Mattresses 14 Inch, Hybrid Queen Size Mattress in a Box, 4 Layer Premium Foam with Pocket Springs for Motion Isolation and Pressure Relieving, Medium Firm Feel, 100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 1 year review, surprisingly high quality', 'author': 'james', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was pleasantly surprised by the quality, very sturdy, no noises, no odd smells. so far holding up without issues. the only thing that is a little odd that takes some getting used to is that the edges are not more sturdy than the rest of the bed. I suppose this is an artifact of the fact that it has to be rolled up for transport. It did not take long to get used to. What can I say soft as you like but supportive and I am a big guy (heavy) so it has held up very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Seems to be really well made', 'author': 'Kitty', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We are very pleased so far with the beds. We went ahead and purchased 2 twin xl instead of 1 king mattress. Of course when you do something different you worry about how it will all work out. First of all, within 5 minutes, the beds had reached their 12 inch height. Boy that was a relief. Many do not get to their advertised height. We let them wait for about 82 hours before we actually slept on them. I honestly think that's a very good thing to do. If at all possible let the bed completely fill out inside and out. The only thing I would like to mention in case it matters, is that our 2 beds ended up being about 40 inches wide instead of 39 inches. Now we thought we were going to have a real problem because these two mattresses were going on one king frame. Plus we put side retainers on the frame to keep them from sliding or moving. At first it didn't look like it was going to work for us. My husband lifted them up in the middle and them slammed them down. Voila' we now have our mattresses where they need to be. I didn't have to buy twin sheets either. My deep pocket kings fit great over the 2 mattresses. I actually have to hunt for the seem where the 2 beds come together or I wouldn't know it wasn't one mattress. We've been sleeping on it for about 3 weeks and so far, so good. I think it's just right, not overly firm but not mushy either. I would like to mention that the sides are not real supportive so you might want to be sure you sit a little further back when you get out of the be.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Expanded Quickly!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'm really hoping to be able to keep this bed. I'm letting the bed sit for 3 days as the directions suggest. Today is day 2. It appears to be fully expanded, but still has a smell from the plastic. I'm super sensitive to things like this so hopefully the scent goes away by day 3/4. I picked Firm, it does feel firm in the center so far, around the edges not so much. I felt the price was fair. I'll be super excited to see if this gives me great back support. Will follow up once I've slept on it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny...', 'author': 'CC from MA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Needed a new mattress. We have a king sized frame and my husband has a Layla Mattress on his side. A twin XL that is very firm. I needed something that was softer for my hips and shoulders as I am a side sleeper.This was PERFECT. Mind you I have had it one night but my sleep was greatly improved 90%.This mattress has a bit of bounce to it but you can turn easily and the pressure points were great. Not too soft. Just enough. For the price it was great because if it onlys last a few years it will be worth it to get another one. Our original king was a Sterns and Foster ...about 1800.00 a few decades ago... and it was good but This COOLVIE is just as comfortable and I am a lot older.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Short expansion time, very comfy', 'author': 'Tom M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to open, and quick to expand. Opened it one night and slept on it the next. Firm, but not hard. My sleep has improved.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I expected', 'author': 'Robert Leech', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wasn't expecting much other then a bed but it was actually a little firmer then I expected. I put 2 inches of memory on top and now it's the most comfortable bed I ever slept on. No more arm, shoulder, neck or back pain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Buyer Beware', 'author': 'Dog Doc', 'rating': 1, 'content': "It was delivered and left on the outside of my covered porch. Thank goodness it didn't rain or snow the day of delivery. It did inflate quickly, but that is the only good thing I can say about it. This mattress is ridiculously heavy and required a dolly to move the box. It is hard as a rock with no give at all. I can barely get the corners up to put on sheets because it moves as a plank; no give at all. It is supposed to be compatible with my adjustable bed frame, but no. It just stays as one solid plank above the frame. I even bought a pillow top cover hoping that would help. After 3 weeks of waking up in pain, I have gone back to my old, lumpy mattress.I bought this mattress because of the 100 day trial period. When I contacted the manufacturer, they offered only an 80% refund or shipping it back to amazon in the original packaging. Really? There is no way to get one of these mattresses back into the box. I could buy a mattress box but that would cost me as much as the 20% I would lose from the manufacturer offer.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy', 'author': 'Caylie s', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update they reached out to me and made things right will give them another chance on a different mattress in the futureDon’t waste your money on this garbage the mattress looks awesome but it’s not comfy at all it’s super hard been sleeping on it few nights wake up in so much pain of how hard it is there is no way this is medium firm it’s like laying on a rock and I’m a bigger guy so I figured I would sink a bit do not but waste of money', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and firm', 'author': 'Greg Martinez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’m usually pretty picky when it comes to shopping for a new mattress. After buying this bed, it’s shown me that the bigger brands we all know are just overpriced because of their popularity.This mattress is perfect for anyone who loves medium-firm mattresses and it actually stays pretty cool through the night.It’s so nice my parents also ordered one, they got a 14” and also very comfy with the extra padding.Highly recommend this mattress. I can’t speak for the other mattresses sold here on Amazon. But keep this one on your list for sure!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Far So Good', 'author': 'Jimmyb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will say, we have been impressed with this bed so far. Had it for a little over a week and wife is way happier with this vs that glorified air matress we used to sleep on that had a mind of its own. Nights of not having to wake up and use the remote to put air back in the bed is a blessing.We let it set up for the recommended 72 hrs. There was no smell at all. Only time will tell if it holds up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Queen Size Mattress, 12 Inch Hybrid Mattress with Gel Memory Foam, Bamboo Charcoal and Individually Pocket Innerspring Queen Mattress for Motion Isolation & Edge Support, CertiPUR-US Certified
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Value', 'author': 'CODan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I became a Beautyrest fanboy 20 years ago. I’ve owned a handful of them over the years.When my last Beautyrest started sagging I started looking into hybrid bed in a box type beds like Purple and Casper. I ultimately purchased a Dreamcloud, it was their top of the line mattress at the time and it was close to $2K when I purchased it.The Dreamcloud was a serious disappointment. It was sagging within a month. Based on the reviews, I’m not sure if I had a bad one or they’re overpriced junk. Regardless, it was a complete fail and I overspent on something that didn’t live up to the hype.After the Dreamcloud experience I swore I would never do the bed in a box thing again.Never say never.I recently found myself in a situation where I needed a bed and budget was important. I did a ton of researching, read a lot of reviews and decided to roll the dice on this mattress. I purchased the 12” Queen.As others have stated, the box is heavy. I was able to get it into the house and onto the bed myself but it is a heavy mattress and I would recommend having a helper.The mattress pops up fast once you open the plastic packaging. Mine was fully up within an hour but I let it decompress for 2 days before sleeping on it. The corners were fully up and everything was set after 2 days.This is a very comfortable mattress. This mattress is not as firm as I had hoped it would be initially but I’ve quickly realized it doesn’t have to be very firm. The mattress provides a lot of support. I don’t wake up stiff and I don’t toss and turn while I’m sleeping. I rest and I rest well.The edge support on this mattress is solid when it comes to the sides. The foot and head edge support are a bit disappointing but for the price of this mattress I am happily overlooking that issue.I like this mattress so much I just bought one for my mother and another for my son.This isn’t a Beautyrest but it’s a lot better than my overpriced Dreamcloud and it’s a fraction of the price.You can’t go wrong with this mattress. You won’t regret your purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet dreams!!!', 'author': 'Moni', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I loooove my bed!! I took months to decide on a mattress. Finally, I decided on this one after reading the reviews. Best choice ever. I owned a Sealy Memory Foam mattress. It was horrible on my lower back. This mattress was not only affordable but medium firm and very comfortable. It’s not too soft and not too hard. I am a back and side sleeper. I’m comfortable in all positions in this mattress. I also have an adjustable bed frame, and although this mattress is not recommended for this bed frame, I adjust it and it works fine. I’m 5’6”, 185 lbs.The bed came in a box and it was heavy. I needed help carrying it inside. Easy to open and even comes with a plastic opener so you don’t slice your bed with scissors. ;) The bed expanded quickly although I still gave it 72 hours before I slept on it.The edge of the bed is not bad either. I’m able to sit on the edge without slipping.I’m finally able to sleep through the night! I’ve had the best sleep! If you get this bed, sweet dreams to you too!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible for the price', 'author': 'PMB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Far superior mattress compared to the mattress we are replacing that we paid $1500 for 2 years ago in the Milwaukee area at a salesman-free store. This mattress is incredible!! So comfortable. Best nights sleep in over two years. Excellent support for two adults. No sagging. Great back support. Woke up feeling the best we have in over two years. Don't waste your money on big box retailer $1000+ mattresses, they are a scam. This mattress blows everything out of the water. Be sure to allow the 72 hour expansion period before using.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It’s good', 'author': 'Mimositas', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Very heavy the Cali king you will need many hands to carry this mattress . Overall it is nice and comfortable , I wouldn’t day it’s very firm maybe medium firm . Really good for the price overall .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This Is Embarrassing', 'author': 'Wildflowerrun', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update: After 2 1/2 months, I\'m still loving this mattress. My back and posture are improved and no pain. I also got a gel neck pillow for my neck. Sweet dreams.I researched mattresses thoroughly before buying this mattress. I even read all of the reviews. I was prepared to do this and do it correctly.First, the box arrived and for a King it is well over 100 lbs. I read it was about 85 lbs. but that obviously was for a smaller mattress. It took me over an hour just to get it through the front door. Then it was pretty easy to "walk" it along the laminate flooring into the bedroom.Second, I watched several videos of "bed in a box" type mattresses and they easily slide the box up and over the top. So, I tipped the box over, cut the bottom flaps, opened the flaps, and tipped it back up. The flaps were under the box still, so I ripped the box to shreds.Third, I leaned it on the bed frame and picked up the other end and got it on the bed.Fourth, I read the instructions, which weren\'t very detailed. But it clearly said on the protective film which way it would unroll and an arrow pointing in that direction. Fine, so I have to get the protective film off, and the only way was to roll the tube a little so I could get under it to unwrap it. I did, all the while, keeping an eye on that arrow.And then, POOF, it flipped out and inflated. Voila! it was perfectly laid out on the bed frame . . . except that it was upside down. I spent the next 2 hours trying to flip it over but without success. I finally called a neighbor, and he helped me get it back right-side up. Not sure where exactly I went wrong . . . but don\'t do that.I slept like a baby that night and have had great sleep since. I hope that continues because I love this mattress. It\'s not too soft, nor too firm for me. I\'m a side sleeper with a tricky back so I need both but not too much of one or the other. Getting out of bed is easy with the edges being very supportive. It\'s one of the best mattresses I\'ve had.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Save your money', 'author': 'becntom', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This review is for a Cal King size mattress.I want to start off by saying I wasn't expecting a whole lot from this mattress simply based on price. Our old mattress was starting to cause us back problems though and this one had a lot of good reviews. Also it could be delivered in a short time window which we really needed.It arrived and we laid it out for 3 days (72 hours) to 'fluff' and air out as recommended. The usual chemical smells that come with the compressed packaging used faded after the first day and it was mostly returned to natural size about the same time but we waited for the full amount to be sure. When we finally got it on our bed we were delighted. Slept great for several nights in a row.The good continued for about a month after which the middle of the mattress had started to sag a bit. This is common with larger mattresses though it usually takes longer. At that point it wasn't too bad needing only a thin pad to counter and we assumed it was stable. At least it seemed not to sag any more over the next couple of months. The return date approached and I didn't think twice about it.Less than a month later I was wishing the return date hadn't already passed. We have now slept on the mattress for less than 6 months and are getting the worst sleep we have ever had. We both wake up in pain often as pressure points in the mattress are impossible to avoid. Several times a night I'll have to shift positions to 'wake up' an arm or leg and the minor hip problems I'd had on the old mattress are major ones on this one. The good sleep we had gotten on the mattress in the first month are a distant memory and we are searching once again for a replacement.In summary, this mattress may be fine in the smaller sizes and could work well on a guest bed where it isn't used nightly. But if you are looking for a king or cal king mattress to sleep on regularly shop elsewhere. And don't be fooled by the seemingly long return window. It isn't long enough for the real problems to develop.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable yet firm', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This bed has been sitting on my list for 3 months I been searching for a while for a good firm mattress. I order it two weeks ago and I am in love with it, it is firm yet comfortable you don't sink in. I been sleeping on it for 10 days now and best thing I ever purchased was this mattress. If your thinking about it go for it, it's firm yet comfy and you wont feel when your partner moves or gets up. Love it!!!-Only CON is that I brought king 12 inch and it only got up to 10 inches other than that absolutely great !!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly Comfortable', 'author': 'Shellmom64', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am extremely pleased with this purchase. After reading other reviews, I chose this while it was a flash deal. One review I read explained to line up mattress on frame BEFORE you cut the plastic at ALL. It pops open quick, and starts inflating. I waited 24 hours before I did bedding to sleep, am no longer feeling stiff in the mornings. You can choose different heights, but this BRAND is a great value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very soft and comfortable!', 'author': 'Kiera', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the softest and most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept on!! I love it! 😍 And my kitty gives it two paws up 🐾 We share the bed. I did not wake up with my spine or hip hurting for once! My kitty is diabetic with a bad hip.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love my bed', 'author': 'Owl318', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love my new bed no more body ache hopefully it last for a long time for my daughter and me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Full Mattress,14 Inch Full Size Hybrid Memory Foam and Individual Pocket Spring,Motion Isolation,Medium Firm Mattress,Pressure Relief,CertiPUR-US,100 Nights Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Comfort and Support', 'author': 'pico', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Mubulily Queen Mattress and I couldn't be happier with my decision. The combination of pocket springs and memory foam provides exceptional comfort and support, ensuring a restful night's sleep. I appreciate the innovative design that minimizes motion transfer, allowing for undisturbed sleep even when my partner moves around. The mattress arrived conveniently packaged in a box and was easy to set up on my bed frame. The CertiPUR-US certification gives me peace of mind knowing that it's free from harmful substances. Additionally, the 100-night trial and 10-year warranty offer reassurance of its quality and durability. Overall, I highly recommend the Mubulily Queen Mattress for anyone seeking a comfortable and reliable sleep solution.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Luxurious & Non-Toxic Mattress 🍃☁️', 'author': 'Snowberry', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am so happy with my new mattress! It solved all of my sleep problems like magic! I’ve been having insomnia for the past 6 months.. and I absolutely had no idea that the roots of my sleep issues were coming from my bed. My previous mattress was a gel memory foam mattress. I found an immediate relief the very first night I changed my mattress with this new one. In the next couple of nights my old sleep pattern began to change. This mattress is very different than my old memory foam. It is a very solid and heavy mattress. And it is bouncy. It feels luxurious and high quality, my body got quickly accustomed to the feeling of the surface texture which consists of these soft cushions. I bought a few different types of mattress protectors for it because I wasn’t sure which one it would need. I chose a thin and tight-fitting one with no extra padding because as I mentioned before my body really likes the feeling of the cushion texture that is on the top of the mattress. The mattress came rolled up and vacuumed in a box. It was heavy. It came with a special little cutter tool to carefully cut the plastic instead of using a knife/scissors. It took some time to enroll it, position it and let it expand fully. There is something really important about this mattress that gives me a peace of mind - - it is non-toxic. It comes with a tag that says it’s been “Certipur-US certified” - which means that this mattress is made without: mercury, lead, formaldehyde, ozone depleters, heavy metals, and other carcinogenic chemicals. Everyone has different needs when it comes to a mattress, but for me this one is just perfect and helps me so much with getting a good sleep time while being high quality and non-toxic.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and true to size', 'author': 'Jennifer Hervert', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this, great quality and fast shipping. title: 12 Inch Comfort Support Cooling Gel Hybrid Mattress, Tight Top Innerspring Mattress, Motion Isolating Pocket Springs, Mattress-in-a-Box, Twin
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Comfort and Cooling - A Dream Mattress!', 'author': 'Brittany', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the ZINUS 10 Inch Comfort Support Cooling Gel Hybrid Mattress, and it has been an absolute game-changer for my sleep quality. I cannot express enough how impressed I am with this mattress.First and foremost, comfort is paramount, and this mattress delivers it in abundance. The combination of memory foam and individually wrapped coils provides the perfect blend of support and contouring to my body. I wake up feeling refreshed and without any aches or pains. It's like sleeping on a cloud!The cooling gel feature is a real game-changer, especially for someone like me who tends to get hot during the night. The gel-infused foam works wonders in regulating the temperature, keeping me cool and sweat-free throughout the night. I no longer have to toss and turn, searching for a cool spot on the bed.In terms of quality, the ZINUS 10 Inch Comfort Support Cooling Gel Hybrid Mattress is top-notch. The construction feels solid and durable, and the stitching is flawless. Additionally, the mattress comes with a 10-year warranty, which is a testament to the manufacturer's confidence in their product.Another standout feature is the motion isolation. My partner's movements during the night no longer disturb my sleep, thanks to the individually wrapped coils that absorb and minimize motion transfer. It's truly a blessing for light sleepers or those who share their bed with a restless partner.Setting up the mattress was a breeze. It arrived conveniently compressed in a box, and once unboxed and placed on the bed frame, it expanded to its full size within a few hours. No hassle, no fuss!One minor downside worth mentioning is the initial off-gassing smell that is common with most memory foam mattresses. However, it dissipates within a day or two, and I haven't noticed any lingering odor since.Overall, I highly recommend the ZINUS 10 Inch Comfort Support Cooling Gel Hybrid Mattress to anyone in search of a luxurious and supportive sleep experience. Its combination of comfort, cooling technology, and durability make it worth every penny. Trust me, you won't be disappointed with this purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bed for a modest budget', 'author': 'donna mueller', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently decided to downsize and get a full sized bed instead of the queen I've had for years. My cat and dog also approve of it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Value', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We’ve been using this mattress for about a month and a half now. It was nearly 10 years old and it was definitely time for an upgrade. I was a little skeptical because of the price but I’m really happy. I listen to a lot of the positive reviews. The only negative I could say, is at the box was delivered and was very badly damaged, so it was difficult to move around and bring inside. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This my second mattress, but only the latest of my lucid products', 'author': 'Maxwell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'IMO: LUCID makes great products. I bought a 14” medium queen right at the beginning of COVID and have been very happy with it.This summer, I was refitting a bedroom in my summer home and bought a 12” plush queen. It’s fine but only fine. The plush is too soft. Don’t mistake me—I get a good night’s sleep on it, and it’s comfortable. The moral is to be certain what degree of give you like in your foam mattress. I now know that I like Lucid’s medium feel better that their plush texture. Your taste may vary. And to be clear, I still get a good night’s sleep on the mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable mattress for side sleeping', 'author': 'FlyGuy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very pleased with the mattress and value for money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm support but soft enough to use on an adjustable frame.', 'author': 'Ron G', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We are using this mattress on an adjustable frame and it has provided a comfortable support while being supple enough to conform to the different settings.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for daughters room', 'author': 'Adriana', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall this was a great purchase. Works best to set up and don’t sleep on it for at least 12 hours, allowed for firmness to be set', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great quality cover, but VERY Soft, lots of Sinking', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Let me start by saying this was very nice looking right out of the box, super nice cover and was 10.5" within the first 5 minutes. Maybe a good kids bed, but won\'t hold up for normal sized people. Thank you Amazon for giving me my money back to put towards another bed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 10 Inch Latex Hybrid Mattress - Responsive Latex Foam and Encased Springs - Medium Firm Feel - Motion Isolation - Edge Support - Gel Infused - Pressure Relief - Bed in a Box - Queen Size
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Goldilocks would approve! w/ 6-month update', 'author': 'Raine', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Update. April 6, 2019:The mattress is still going strong. I know it's been only 6 months, but with previous mattresses we've had over the years, none of them made it past the 6-month mark before showing wear. So I believe this is a good sign.Original review: For the last year I've had insomnia due to my chronic pain from Lupus and because our old memory foam mattress apparently had amnesia. I spent over 30 hours ( spread out over several days) researching all kinds of mattresses, and everything one should know about them. I'm considering myself an expert now. Hehe. For our situation, based on everything that is out there, I decided we needed a latex and pocketed spring hybrid, which led me to two choices: this one and one on another website that cost $1700 and who's return policy was questionable. Or course we decided to try out this one. Funny and sad thing is that this was the first mattress that I saw in my research journey. I could have spared myself the 30+ hours of research.We needed a mattress that would sleep cool. I kept burning up at night with our old one. It's not fun. My research led me to two things that keep a mattress cool: latex and pocketed coils. So then I researched which types have the best support. My husband weighs 280 pounds, which is hard on mattresses, especially memory foam. Again, my research led me to latex and pocketed coils. They offered what we needed, soft feeling, but firm. We could have gone straight latex, from what I was reading, but that was very expensive, and my husband was convinced we needed coils because of his weight. Side support was another issue we were hoping to remedy. This mattress offers excellent side support. Sometimes I have to sleep on the side to let my arm hang over because of nerve issues, I can do that with this one and not feel like I'm going to fall off.Our previous mattress, a pure memory foam, failed us within a year. I think we might be partially responsible for that as we did not wait more than a few hours to lay on it because my husband refused to wait. It never rose completely. He kept measuring the sides only on that one, that had reached the desired measurement of 11-inches, but did not care about the head and foot of the mattress that was not anywhere near the required 11-inches. Well, my latest research suggests that all memory foam mattresses need to be aired out the entire duration recommended by the manufacturers to extend their longetivity. Once we lay on them, if they did not reach their full height, they never will. He was fussed at and educated by me on how his decision cost us, so he did not give me a hard time on the 48-hour wait with this mattress. In fact, I've been in so much pain, I was the one willing to cave on the recommended wait time about 24 hours in, but he put his foot down. LOL. So please, with whatever mattress you end up getting, wait the recommended time, even if it looks high enough. It's worth the wait.Onto what we think about this mattress...Let me first explain my situation, I've just recently been diagnosed with Lupus. For the last few years I've been on a steady decline in health and went from occasional pain, to all over massive pain accompanied by migraines, and now a lovely rash. I have nerve pain all over, fibromyalsia, arthritis, etc. I hurt 24/7. I just recently had to start walking with a cane. I'm just a little overweight, and until two years ago, I was doing 5k's three times a week. The last few months were unbearable. The pain and our old bed made it hard for me to get even 3 hours sleep. That would be a good night. This amazing Lucid mattress has changed my life. I'm getting a good 7+ hours sleep now, which for me is a miracle! I would probably get more sleep, but nerve pain still wakes me up, but not as bad. I've never slept in a bed as comfortable as this one. Ever. It even sleeps cool! My husband's snoring is almost non-existent now. He is sleeping soundly now. (Probably because I am. LOL.) We have no complaints so far. We just hope it gives us at least 5 years. If it does, we'll consider it money well spent.When we first rested on our LUCID 12-Inch King Latex Hybrid Mattress we said, wow, this is soft. Yet, we did not sink into the mattress and it really supported us. We are stomach and side sleepers. But I've tried out every position on this mattress, and really you can't go wrong. It's comfy no matter how you sleep. It's not too soft or too hard. It's just right for all of us Goldilocks sleepers. No pressure on joints or our back. It feels amazing. We can even cuddle again! Our old mattress couldn't handle that, leaving us feeling like we were slipping into a sinkhole. In this bed we can cuddle all we want.You've seen other pictures of what the mattress looks like, so I just included what ours looks like made up, and pictures of the condition of the box it arrived it. As you can see, the box arrived all battered up. It looks like UPS did their best to tape it up to keep it together. I want you to see these pictures because if you order this bed and it arrives this way, I don't want you to have the small heartattack I had. The mattress was so well wrapped inside of the box, it was unscathed. So fear not.From what I read it's best to have cotton sheets and a bedspread that is cotton, to help with keeping cool, with any type of bed. The best sheets I've found are at Sam's Club, their $40-$50 brand. They are wrinkle free, soft and silky, and feel just heavenly. They get softer every time you wash them and last for years. We just purchased the oversized king bedspread as seen in the picture, here on Amazon. It's another amazing find. It completely covers your bed so you do not need a bedskirt, which is helpful when rotating your memory foam mattress. You will find my review for this amazing bedspread when you click my name here, if you are searching for one. The manufacturer of our bedspread has other patterns/colors.I will update this review on how well this bed holds up. As of right now, we've only had this mattress a month. I'm good about updating my reviews, so we'll see how this dream mattress holds up and I'll let you know. Fingers crossed! Good luck on your mattress journey, whatever you decide.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light, Airy and Firm', 'author': 'J. K. Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Terrific bed! Aches and pains are minimal since I’ve been sleeping on it. The layers of foam combined with the coils gives the perfect support for robust guys. Mattress conforms to spine and lower back areas, yet gives the correct amount of firmness. So it’s not mushy like other foam mattresses. Again, very supportive. Bed feels sturdily constructed and hefty. It fully expanded within 24 hours. I will definitely consider Lucid in the future. I was also pleased with delivery and haul away service, prompt and efficient.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Yeah... It's FIRM...", 'author': 'sdjeff4sc', 'rating': 4, 'content': '12" Lucid Hybrid Latex Mattress - QueenThis is going to be long, but I\'ll address the delivery first... These are exceptional times we are living thru and the mattress took over a week to arrive which is OK, ordered on 4/16, but for "some" reason, UPS scanned this item into San Diego (where I live) on Fri, 4/24... b/c of "circumstances beyond our control", UPS did NOT make delivery until Mon, 4/27... Like many other reviews who stated that their "package" arrived with a pretty beat-up box, my "Package" arrived with no box, no shipping manifest, no invoice, no warranty information, no "handy package opener" (letter opener), I debated whether to accept the package - just a mattress wrapped in plastic in a tube-like form. After several minutes of consideration, I accepted delivery b/c I didn\'t want to wait an additional 2 weeks...Once inside... It\'s quite heavy, about 110 lbs, by myself, it took some effort to navigate into my bedroom because my apartment is tiny and with my furniture, there is little room to maneuver, but that\'s my problem... Once I got it set up, I had the "package opener" left from a previous Lucid 4" Gel-infused memory foam mattress topper - more on that later... Once I sliced the packaging open, the mattress "unfolded" just like many of the unboxing videos you can watch on YouTube. Just like in all of those videos, the mattress unfolded upside down - must be a manufacturing issue when they package the mattress at the factory (in Turkey and not China! I\'m not sayin\' that\'s bad, it\'s good that not everything comes from China!). Another massive effort to get the mattress flipped over into it\'s proper configuration and it was set. It would be nice if Lucid could get the manufacturer to package the mattress in such a way that when you slice open the plastic, it opens "right-side up"... just sayin\'...There was no noticeable off-gassing, mattress smelled neutral right of it\'s compressed wrapping. It quickly achieved it\'s 12" height, I left it sit for about 4 hours before actually sitting down on it... just kidding... no I didn\'t, I sat/laid down on it immediately, but left the room and left it alone for several hours after that. Coming back into the room, there was no noticeable smell, although I kept my ceiling fan on high the entire time with the windows open.Delivery and setup aside... This mattress is FIRM... I\'m 6\'4", 180 lbs... it is bouncy, just like all the YouTube videos, but it\'s pretty firm, I\'m still getting used to it. Fortunately, as mentioned previously, I purchased a 4" Gel-infused memory foam topper last year from Lucid to try and make my old mattress last just a little bit longer - it worked, I loved the topper for the year I used it prior to taking delivery of the 12" Latex Hybrid (which included the handy "package-opener" which I still happened to have!). Although it\'s an extra $100, I really do like the deep, sink-in, feeling of the memory foam topper. If I didn\'t have the topper, I\'m not sure if I would like this mattress...Although it wasn\'t necessary, I placed the mattress on top of the box spring I had left over from my old mattress - BIG mistake, the bed sat way too high, couldn\'t see my alarm clock, couldn\'t set my feet on the ground if I sat on the edge (and I\'m 6\'4"!)... Decided I needed to get rid of the box spring, had to get a friend to come over to help with the "repositioning" due to the confined space...Overall... Mattress now sets on a structured bed-frame with slats and a slice of plywood over the slats for extra structural support. Memory-foam topper back on top. I\'ve spent 3 nights on this mattress and am still getting used to it. I had a really old mattress/box spring that this replaced, and the old mattress with the 4" Lucid topper really worked well for me - I slept really well, but felt it was time to get a new mattress. We\'ll see how well I sleep on it tonite w/out the box-spring underneath it, but right now, I get a softer feel with the mattress coils doing the work that my old box-spring might have been doing...If you want to "sink-in" like with memory foam, this mattress is NOT for you, b/c I already had a 4" gel-infused memory foam topper, I\'m optimistic that this will work for me. I sleep comfortably, but because I work weird shifts, I cannot comment on whether you get a full, undisturbed sleep with this mattress. without my old box-spring, it feels incredibly comfortable right now. Will update review if the mattress gets a dip or I encounter any issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort, Value, Great Night's Sleep", 'author': 'Robert Fegley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I replaced a very old, worn out, substandard mattress with this one, so bearing in mind that just about anything would have been an improvement, I have to say I\'m completely satisfied with this mattress and not sure what could be better.The latex foam has a little less give and sink, and a little more springiness than memory foam, so it has an overall firmer feel which is just what I was hoping for when I selected this one over the memory foam gel model. Strap in. I\'ve got a lot to say about this mattress.My husband and I have been sleeping on this mattress for a few nights now. I will update this review in the coming months, but my initial reaction is that I am only disappointed in this mattress because it only recently came into my life. (Okay, there is one thing that actually does disappoint me about this mattress, but I\'ll get to it at the end of my review.)My sister-in-law has a Tuft&Needle Mint mattress, and I\'m not going to lie. It\'s freaking amazing. That is why I began looking into boxed mattresses in the first place. I actually had a T&N Mint in the cart and hovered over the button ready to buy it. But my instinct told me to look around first.I began looking at *all* the brands. ALL OF THE BRANDS. Again, I\'m an author...so research is my jam.Neither my husband nor myself are tiny people. I watched mattress review videos on YouTube from The Slumber Yard channel and realized we\'d probably be better off with a hybrid mattress rather than a strictly foam mattress.That little rabbit hole led me to Amazon where I discovered Lucid Mattresses.We bought the 12 inch Latex Hybrid. Both of us loathe memory foam, so that was out of the question.Other reviews say this mattress is not a medium on the firmness scale, but a firm-firm (some even say it\'s like sleeping on a brick). This was actually a selling point for me. While I disagree the bed is brick-like, it is definitely a lot firmer than a medium. For larger people this is an excellent thing. It\'s so supportive! And since all mattresses soften over time, its firmness out of the box, I would think, translates into longevity.The smell out of the box reminded me of a nail salon, but we let the mattress breathe for 24 hours before using it and we kept a fan on, oscillating over it the entire time and afterwards there was no smell at all.Edge support is FREAKING AWESOME. I can be right on the edge of the bed and never feel like I\'m going to fall off.One thing I haven\'t been able to find in a review for this mattress so far is, well, "Will it be good for sex?" Let\'s face it...memory foam mattresses are horrible for sex. There\'s no bounce. This mattress has bounce in spades. I was slightly worried about a foam mattress, or even a hybrid, for this very reason. Don\'t worry.Both my husband and myself are "hot sleepers" and neither of us are waking up in pools of sweat and discomfort. Actually, it\'s the opposite. And my husband\'s back pain has been greatly reduced.Now, onto the only thing that disappoints me about this mattress:There are no handles on this mattress. I\'m pretty sure I understand why (because tugging on the handles would probably rip the mattresses\'s cover) but it\'s at least 134 pounds and there is an *excellent* non-slip element to the bottom of the cover...but that will sort of make it unduly difficult to rotate on the platform.That\'s it. That\'s my only gripe so far: a lack of handles.Listen, if you need further recommendation for this mattress: My dachshund used to get up in excess of 10-15 times per night because she would either get too hot or would just be downright uncomfortable...probably a combination of those reasons.
