Which just means my sleep is less disturbed than it once was *and* I\'m more comfortable to boot.I\'m really, really pleased with our Lucid. I\'ll update in the coming months.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars This Mattress Made our Child Sick would give 0 rating', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This is a long read (and if I could give 0 stars I would). Finally after 1+ year I\'m ready to share our story. On February 12th 2021, my husband and I purchased a LUCID 10 Inch Latex Hybrid Mattress - Memory Foam - Responsive Latex - Steel Coils - Medium Feel - Temperature Neutral on Amazon Prime. Please note our purchase selection was after careful and thorough research (including but not limited to sleepopolis.com).Our shipper received the item on February 19th 2021 and our family received it on Saturday March 20th 2021 (we reside outside the US). We unboxed it and removed compressed mattress (with tool provided) and put new mattress on our son\'s twin wooden bed frame and left it there for 48 hours for it to expand. There was a smell one can only describe as some sort of manufacturer\'s chemical but I was told this was the expected off gassing and we read this was normal and would dissipate (that never happened ☹️).After 48 hrs we made the bed with a 100% cotton fitted shit (the only kind we use) including covering sheet and blanket for our 14 year old son for whom the mattress was purchased. He slept on it for the first time on Monday night March 22nd 2021 at 10:00 p.m. He woke up on Tuesday and and of course our first inquiry was whether he slept well to which his response was yes.However, later on in the evening of Tuesday, March 23rd he asked that we checked his neck as he had some painful swelling there that was not there prior. We did, and observed what seemed like a lump and we presumed swollen lymph nodes. During his second night sleep on the new LUICID 10" Latex Hybrid he complained of itchiness, which we found strange but indulged by changing his sheets. However after his second night\'s sleep he complained again, this time of severe neck discomfort and further checks revealed increase swelling in the cervical column (neck). It was obvious this time it was swollen lymph nodes this time coupled with mild skin rash over his arms and exposed areas where no clothing covers. Since his initial sleep on March 22nd 2021 we observed additional symptoms extreme fatigue, loss of appetite, headache, congestion without a cold or flu, irritated eyes in addition to those listed above (painful swollen lymph nodes, body rash particular areas not covered by clothing e.g. arms, nape). We then decide this was too serious and took him to his pediatrician who after multiple labs and physical examination could find no clinical diagnosis for his symptoms. He lost 5 pounds since his start of sleeping on new mattress and start of symptoms up until his first visit with his doctor. As a result of COVID and extreme protocols we were social distancing and sheltering in place and as per our pediatrician\'s inquiry, the only change in his life was his new bed. He had not gone anywhere and had not been exposed to anything else. So I wrote a very long and urgent email to LUCID inquiring whether the mattress we purchased from their company contains any fiber glass or any chemical or has been treated with any chemicals such as isocyanate or any other chemicals that would be making him sick. I did not intially receive a response.So I decided to check myself and observe what happens when he slept. To my dismay in his sleep he was scratching, so with my phone\'s flash light (in the darkened bedroom) I pulled up the end of the fitted sheet to check the sheet and the mattress. That simple test confirmed my worst fears and suspicions. There was a sparkly like substance on the sheet and the mattress itself was covered with it. So next I checked the label of the mattress (bottom where the grit side is) and confirmed that it does indeed contain fiberglass - 50% to be exact. I was floored. So I woke up my son and performed a tape test on him and was shocked by the tiny fibers that stuck on the tape.We were very thorough before we decided on this purchase, and this LUCID bed like most of not all of their products was one of those deemed Certi Pur. We have a right for full disclosure from the manufacturer LUCID to confirm whether their beds contains fiber glass or any chemicals that can make people (especially our children) sick. Nobody buys a bed especially for their child with the expectation that something like this happens. Afterall, nowhere in their product listing does it state or disclose the danger of fiberglass for the LUCID 10 Inch Latex Hybrid Mattress - Memory Foam - Responsive Latex - Steel Coils - Medium Feel - Temperature Neutral on Amazon Prime.When no one responded I decided to chat with Amazon and then the manufacturer and after explaining all of the above was told that while it was outside the US and they did not accept returns outside the US they would make an exception but I explained this was not possible to ship back from where I was. When I showed them the photos they then said they would make an exception and I refund me the full purchasing amount and I could throw it out which guess what I couldn\'t do fast enough. I was refunded but still absorbed the shipping, freight and duties charges but it was not about the money for us this entire ordeal made our child sick, cost us in ways I cannot even put a price tag on.https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0771P2BN9/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apa_glc_fabc_YYS65XDRJ8Z8EXGYN7WT?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Updated review: no fiberglass, SUPER boingy, buy from Amazon not direct from Lucid', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Quick overview: no fiberglass, super comfortable (if you like boingy mattresses), fixable expansion issues -- overall a good product from a sucky company. Buy from Amazon so you never have to deal with Lucid, if you can ever reach them.------------------Initial review: I just unboxed this mattress, and I am going to post the information I wish others had: the materials list. Lucid was one of the brands that used a fiberglass inner sock for fire retardance a few years back. I am happy to report there is NO fiberglass now. I am also pretty pleased it was made in Taiwan. No word yet on how the mattress functions. It arrived in sub-zero temps, so I imagine it will take a bit to expand.------------------Update day 2: The mattress has mostly expanded, but I am hoping the edges and the most smooshed end fill out the whole way by tomorrow night. Even now, it is insanely comfortable. This is coming from someone who detests memory foam mattresses. We have a split king, so I am not worried about motion transfer. I have been getting by with a 2" talalay latex mattress topper on a foam Nectar mattress that (on its own) left me with stiff shoulders and numb arms.The Lucid Latex Hybrid is super springy, with the added latex boing-effect I was looking for. It was only about twice the price of my latex topper, and I don\'t have to deal with slippage. This is NOT a mattress you will sink into, but instead I seem to float on top. I am a back-and-side sleeper who likes a firmer mattress (but not firm foam, that was a disaster).------------------One month update: I really love this mattress. It is SO comfortable. But Lucid as a company sucks pretty bad. I was trying to get confirmation about the fiberglass issue, as some redditor mentioned it might not be on the materials list. There is a phone number, but no one picks up, and you can\'t leave a message. Lucid doesn\'t answer FB direct messages, despite saying they will, and the company will take for-freaking-ever to return your email. What I finally got back was:"Thank you for reaching out to us. All of our mattresses have been tested and do meet or exceed the federal, state, and municipal safety standards. All materials will be listed on the white law tags under the mattress.Sincerely,WyattLucid Mattress Customer Experience"So, in short, if your tag doesn\'t include fiberglass neither does your Lucid mattress. But their mealy-mouthed reply implies they still use fiberglass in some of their mattresses so shop carefully. Also, I would buy from Amazon just so I never have to deal directly with Lucid.On to mattress expansion. Mine arrived in -15F degree weather and it sat outside my house for several hours, so I knew it would take a bit. I finally took the mattress cover off (which you aren\'t supposed to remove) and took a hair dryer to the foam. That did the expansion trick, although it was time-consuming. If I was doing it again I would use a heat gun on low and be extra careful not to overheat anything. The mattress is now the full 12\' and evenly expanded. One of the complaints I see is the edges not expanding correctly so the mattress puffs up in the middle. That is how mine looked pre-hairdryer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente.', 'author': 'Héctor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Una excelente adquisición. Precio calidad perfecto. La dureza es perfecta. Y el producto es tal cual como la publicacion indica.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: King Mattress 10 Inch Hybrid Mattress in a Box with Gel Memory Foam, Individually Wrapped Pocket Coils Innerspring, CertiPUR-US Certified, Pressure Relief & Support, Medium Firm
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The BEST Mattress Ever!!!!', 'author': 'Stephanie M Freeman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been a little skeptical about buying a mattress off of Amazon for obvious reason, I was concerned about the quality of the products offered. Not only was it nearly fully inflated after only about 8-9 hours, but it continued to fill over the next 24 hours even after used that first night.Another thing we noticed is that in my research a lot of people complained that other mattresses did not fill on the edges making it unable to be sat on without slipping off. Not with this mattress! Even the corners were filled and firm and we both are able to sit on the edge. We both are 200- 300 pounds respectfully and we have had the best sleep than we have had in years! My wife said after the first night that she slept like a baby and had minimal to no pain in her body, even her knee which she has had surgery on five times was not as painful. I also have not experienced much pain and have minimal difficulty walking after waking up.After researching at least 10 different mattresses on Amazon, I am so glad that I chose this one, you will NOYT go wrong in getting this one. The price- EXCELLENT, the product- IMPECCABLE, the comfort- UNMATCHED! It has a soft yet firm feel that works and best of all... NO SMELL when it came out of the wrapping which I'd read from others was an issue. I am glad I chose this one, if you are on the fence with it- GET IT! I can't wait to get another for my guest room, I will be ordering again!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This thing is amazing.', 'author': 'September Carman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Okay. It's got great support, but also cushiony enough. It's like.....a supportive cloud.I'm normally a side sleeper.....but lately I've been winding up on my back in my sleep. (Hoping it lasts longer but I swear it is worth every penny)Be forewarned....it is HEAVY. like.....as heavy as my old king memory foam mattress (which was a nectar and sucked after a year) and because this mattress is a hybrid and has the springs it will POP open when you cut the wrapping so just be careful and make sure you're out of the way 😉Also.....shout out to the Amazon delivery person who took the time to actually carry the box up the stairs to my porch.....you the real MVP. UPS left my equally heavy bedframe at the bottom of the stairs in the rain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent hybrid for those unsure about memory foam mattresses', 'author': 'Nate', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you\'re anything like me, you spent the better part of the last decade with a memory foam mattress, back when companies were still working out the science of making these things comfortable. It\'s thick ("thicc" in cool kid speak), and manages to be both firm and forgiving. While the majority of my nights are sleepless or spent dreaming about my lost love, I can at least say there\'s no back pain. Combined with a pillow top, you\'re looking at a very solid (metaphorically speaking) mattress that will have you set for a while. Also, it\'s got plenty of room for your dogs if they sleep on the bed with you. Which mine do.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress on a budget!!!', 'author': 'Mark F. title: 10-Inch Queen Size Mattress, iCOOL Tech and Cooling Gel Infused Medium Plush Memory Foam Mattress, CertiPUR-US Certified, Bed-in-a-Box, White, Queen Size (80" L x 60" W x 10" H)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! Sleep thru the night pain free!', 'author': 'D. Bermel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I searched and searched and read review after review trying to make the right decision for a new mattress. I was sleeping on a 13 year old Temperpedic Cloud queen that was perfect for me until it wasn\'t. The last 2 years have been progressively worse for waking up from hip and back pain 2-3 times a night. I loved my mattress but it was time to make a change. I need a firm mattress but not hard. There weren\'t many reviews for this one but the ones there were seemed to agree this mattress, queen 12" med firm, might be the one I was looking for. I kept thinking I probably should buy local where I could actually feel the firmness, but I talked myself into hitting the order button after removing this from my cart 3 times and always putting it back. The mattress arrived via FedEx Ex 2 days earlier than expected. By 5 PM I got the box up the stairs and wrestled it onto my temperpedic so it could expand. I cut the box and unwrapped the shrinkwrap which contained the mattress in a bag. As soon as the bag sucked air, the magic started. I worked fast to unbag and roll it out. By the time I got the wrappings picked up the mattress had already grown to 8". Maybe I wasn\'t going to have to sleep in the recliner after all!By 10PM it was fully 12", even the corners! I put on my sheets and decided I wasn\'t going to wait 24-48 hours cause how could it get any bigger?It\'s hard to explain just how it felt, not hard firm as others and not sloppy soft.It was just...comfortable! There is enough \'soft\' to cradle me but not sink in. I had NO difficulty moving from my back to my side nor was there the familiar pressure on my shoulder that I had become accustomed to when on my side. I laid there wondering if I had found what I was hoping for and simply fell asleep. It was 90+ degrees the day it arrived and even with AC on, that night was a sultry 80 degrees in my room. I did not get hot, which was something I was experiencing with the Temperpedic, waking up soggy and trying to find a spot that wasn\'t damp. Whatever this Swiss mattress has as a \'cooling\' layer works!!When I woke in the morning the first thing I realized was that I had actually slept through the night and was basically in the same position that I had fallen asleep in. I moved my legs and was waiting for the all too common spasm to let me know I was really awake but....nothing!! I slid off the mattress and gingerly stood up. No twinge. I took a step and then another, still nothing!I found I was walking completely upright, not hunched over till I worked the kinks out of my back. To say I was amazed is an understatement. I just wanted to get back into bed, but i had to go to work. I wondered if it was a fluke or my imagination or mind over matter telling myself it HAD to be my old mattress making my nights and mornings a nightmare. I was eager to try my 2nd night and see if the results were the same. YUP-!!! I have had this wonderful mattress for 2 weeks and each night and morning has been the same. I\'m not saying this mattress will heal all aches and pains but for me it has made a fantastic difference.I\'m so glad I decided to buy this. If it continues to give me this comfort, cooling and support for the next 5 years, I will be a very happy camper!The zip on cover is well made and the mattress has filled it as expected, no wrinkles or twisting.I would definitely recommend this 12" mattress if you are looking for a firm support that still provides enough softness to gently hug your shape while keeping you comfortably cool through the night.I am totally satisfied so far!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Sleep In A Very Long Time', 'author': 'Leanne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve had the best sleep in a very long time sleeping on this mattress! I took a chance getting this one, not only because of the price, but because of the positive reviews and I’m so glad I did! I think it’s an awesome and very comfortable mattress!Some people on here are saying it’s too soft and others are saying it’s too firm. Mine is listed as Medium Plush. I weigh 138 lbs so, for me it’s firm enough that I don’t get swallowed by the mattress when getting into bed and soft enough to sink in a little bit, and it molds to my body.I have a very bad back. I have three metal rods & a metal plate screwed into my lower spine due to a horrible accident. So, believe me when I say, that I don’t sleep well at all. That is until now. Since getting this mattress, I can sleep several hours now without waking up in agonizing hip and back pain. It’s truly that amazing for me!To be transparent with my review though, the mattress only rose to 11 inches, instead of the advertised 12 inches. I had to remove the cover to cut the mattress so it would fit into the space I was putting it. The bottom support foam is the part that only expanded to 6 inches instead of 7 inches. The second and top layer expanded correctly.I’m not going to make an issue out of this because like I’ve already said, it’s incredibly comfortable and I’m sleeping very well on it so, it’s quite OK. I haven’t read where this has been an issue for people so, I wouldn’t let this deter you from getting one. That’s how highly I like this mattress. Besides, there are multiple reasons why it didn’t expand the entire way and it could have been my fault.Buying a mattress online is difficult and subjective, but for the price alone it’s worth getting this one. I researched for months and was driving myself nuts trying to decide on which one to get LOL. Don’t be like me and just get it. It’s truly an amazing mattress and definitely worth the price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow', 'author': 'Eden H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I needed a new mattress. I have hyper mobile joints and suffer from chronic pain. I definitely was hesitant, but a couple of other reviews made specific reference to improvements to their sleep that really stood out, so I tried it. The delivery was timely, FedEx left it in the driveway on a rainy day. However the mattress is completely sealed and wrapped in two different layers of plastic inside the box. So it's fine. I followed the instructions thoroughly (do not pull it or force it open), and allowed it the time suggested. It is firm. But it is soft. It offers all of the support to hold my bones in alignment, and I have not had an issue with pressure points since sleeping on this mattress. I don't get too hot, or too cold. I don't wake up hardly ever anymore, and was getting up at least twice a night before. Simply put, I love it. I would absolutely buy another one if I wanted to get a bigger size in the future. I'm not exaggerating when I say that this mattress has greatly improved my quality of life.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its good', 'author': 'kristen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Definitely more firm than i originally thought but it is really comfortable.. im able to get on and off the bed without waking up my bf or our son, i feel like it does have that cooling effect but not SUPER effective. I love how it forms to my body perfectly with not too much cushion i have really bad body pain from an accident 5 years ago and been waking up pretty well rested the past mo!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not Medium Plush - Hard as a Rock', 'author': 'Jim M.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'We have used this mattress for a little over a week. It is beyond firm and definitely not the medium plush it is advertised as. We are not able to use this mattress and shipping it back at our cost is the only recourse that we have been given aside from taking a picture of it for the seller. What good is a picture for telling you that the bed is too firm?Shipping back a full size mattress without access to a commercial vacuum sealer seems insane. I have reached out to Amazon as this mattress was to be covered under their A to Z program, but have been advised to work directly with the seller.Buyer Beware. This is not actually covered under the A to Z.We were very happy with our Zinus of 7 years and should have just went back to that brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality at great price.', 'author': 'PAM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to get out of box and wrapping. Very comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Requires a little getting used to, but is an excellent mattress!', 'author': 'J. Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife and I had a plush pillowtop mattress that was getting worn out. We like soft beds, so I wasn\'t sure if we would like this one. Mattresses are so subjective that it is hard to know anything about it from the reviews. However, because it had so many positive reviews and a return policy we decided to take a chance on it. We are happy and will be keeping it - and I honestly have no idea how you would go about returning it anyway. This thing is heavy and huge once it has been opened and expanded.Because this is our first memory foam mattress, it took a couple of weeks to get used to. I didn\'t sleep well the first night. It doesn\'t bounce or sink quite as readily and a traditional spring-type mattress. If you like to jump into bed, you will be surprised at how "solid" it initially feels. However, if I just lay down on it, it conforms very nicely to my body. There are no "pressure" points. Also, the "cooling" gel really does work - which is nice on warm nights and not so nice on cold nights.When I lay on my back or stomach, this mattress is absolutely heavenly. When I lay on my side (which is how I typically sleep) it is also nice, but I wish it had a little more give where my shoulder goes. However, I remember thinking the same thing about our plush pillowtop mattress. Overall, I am now sleeping better and wake up with fewer aches and pains than ever before. I love this mattress.On a side note, the mattress cover that comes with this mattress is very slippery. Our fitted sheet didn\'t stay on at all. I had to purchase "sheet suspenders" which solved the problem!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm but really comfortable', 'author': 'Matthew', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When you noticed it came wrapped up in a box I wasn't sure about it. Once I took it out of the box and it went back to the form I was so happy with it. I wish I got an even higher one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Never Expanded but Customer Service did make it right', 'author': 'Kyndley R.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I previously purchased a king-size memory foam mattress from a different company and it was perfect and just as described. My mother-in-law needed a medium plush king-size mattress and after thoroughly searching I thought I had found one with this product. However, this item was delivered last week and though it seemed a little crushed once it was opened and laid on a flat surface, we thought it would expand just like the other ones I had purchased recently. Keep in mind I have purchased 2 other memory foam mattresses from Amazon over the past 6 months, not including this one. I am very careful opening them as it is a pain to send back anything let alone something that is vacuum sealed. We laid the mattress on the tile floor and waited for a week and yet it has not expanded anymore and the same side is still crushed. When I requested a refund it said I needed to return this item and pay the return postage. I have sent a message to the seller requesting information on HOW to return this item. There is no way that this item can be used, you can see a line in the middle of the mattress, which may be caused by the packaging. After going through the other reviews in the hopes of finding out if anyone else has had this issue, it seems to be a common occurrence. There has to be a better way of returning these types of items when there are defects in the product or packaging. This should not be at the cost of the consumer when they aren't even able to use the product. However, this is the chance you take when ordering any item online.Update: After messaging the seller, explaining the situation, exchanging photos they were quick to respond and offer a refund/replacement. Which is greatly appreciated. Sometimes there will be defects or damaged products but how a company responds to their customers is just as important as the quality of the product they are trying to sell. I really do appreciate that they tried to make it better.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great product', 'author': 'Letta', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'was shipped and delivered within a week! came boxed and vacuum sealed., perfect mattress for my daughter, memory foam is not too firm and has a little plush!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Lechepus Queen Mattress, 14Inch Gel Memory Foam & 7-Zone Pocket Spring Mattress Queen Size, Cool Sleep and Pressure Relief, Medium Plush Hybrid Mattresses in Box for Motion Isolation, Fiberglass-Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mind blowing method to ship mattress', 'author': 'Uncle Vinnie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I've heard about these box mattresses before but had been skeptical and this is my first time trying one. I have to say that I am impressed and find it mind blowing that a mattress can be compressed and shipped this way. This is not an air mattress, it is a gel memory foam mattress. Any mattrss does contain a lof of air in the materials though which allows them to be comfortable. Without any internal springs, this mattress can be compressed and rolled up.This mattress is real. heavy so keep that in mind when moving it. This is a queen size mattress after all. If you have room to unroll it, this would help for getting the outer layer of plastic off of it. I put the rolled up mattress on teh bed frame and managed to maneuver it to get the outer plastic off. Once that is removed you can unroll it and stretch it out on your frame as you see in my picture. You then cut into the final layer of plastic with a provided tool and remove it. Once you pierce that plastic, the magic begins. Air is rapidly sucked in and the mattress expands. Within a few seconds it expands into a nice pillow top gel memory foam mattress. See the video.As far as comfort, I found it to be a little soft but this is gel memory foam and molds to your body. So while I sink in a little more, I still felt well supported. I don't find myself moving around on it and can fall asleep pretty quickly. I imagine we'll be seeing the majority of mattresses shipped this way soon. I highly recommend this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars We Love This Mattress (King 14” Plush)!', 'author': 'Tom M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We love this Lechepus King Mattress (King 14” Plush). We replaced our old brand-name 12” plush mattress and have been very pleased with the comfort we get from this Lechepus mattress.This was our first experience with a “Mattress in a Box”. I was concerned with how heavy the mattress was (120 pounds). Moving the box was not easy, but we used a hand cart and plopped the box on the floor near the bed. We opened one side and slid the mattress out. It was not too difficult to prop the plastic-wrapped mattress onto our box spring base. We then carefully cut the plastic using the enclosed safety cutter until the mattress was free.When you first pierce to the inside you hear the “ssss” air beginning to reach the mattress. Once the plastic is removed the bed automatically decompresses very quickly.Once the bed is open to its full shape, the bed was easy to move on the box springs and the bed was easy to move.What I realized when I had to move our old standard king mattress is that it is also very heavy – approximately 110 pounds. So the weight of these “Box” mattresses is really not that different than a standard mattress, which is why once the mattress was fully opened and decompressed, it felt no different than a standard mattress as far as moving etc.We’ve enjoyed sleeping on this mattress for several nights. It is very comfortable. The mattress appears to be well-made. It keeps its shape after sitting on the edges.I’m giving this mattress 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable twin mattress', 'author': 'dustin adams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mattress came rolled up tight in a box. It included a letter opener that is used to open the plastic holding this mattress vacuum sealed. It was very easy to get out of the package and we let it rest for 24 hours before using it. Mattress is very comfortable and has a plush top, being a twin XL it's about 5 in longer than a traditional twin so my taller teenager fits nicely. This mattress is every bit as good as the expensive mattresses from the big box stores. I've got a similar mattress also in Queen that I've been using for more than 6 months that's perfect", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Have never slept so good in my life!', 'author': 'Reviews for you', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Okay aside from this being super heavy (not really much you can do about that!) I love every single thing about this mattress! It came in a box and tightly wrapped in plastic which was great because I wasn't quite ready to open it the day it arrived. I was able to easily store it in the basement until I was able to get rid of my previous bed. (was nice to not have a huge mattress sitting in my basement but instead a big rolled up one in plastic)On to the best part... this mattress is SO comfortable! I always add gel infused memory foam toppers to any bed but I really considered not doing it with this, it really doesn't need it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not the best for me personally', 'author': 'Ricks Munn', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I was really excited to get this new mattress since we were in need of another bed for our guest room. The mattress seems to be built really well and the quality is what I would expect from a good mattress. I was very pleasantly surprised to see that there was no strange factory smell on the mattress even when it first came out of the plastic wrap. The mattress feels really nice when you lay on it and it feels quite supportive. I really didn't have any initial complaints or issues with it at first. However, my wife and I have both slept on this mattress to give it a real review, and unfortunately we both woke up in the morning with sore backs and lack of quality sleep. I'm not sure if the mattress isn't as supportive as we initially thought or if the spring coils are creating weird pressure points or if there is some other issue, but we both had a terrible night on the mattress. Obviously the right amount of softness/firmness is very subjective and depends on personal preference. But for my wife and I, this mattress didn't really work out for us.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice Bed', 'author': 'Brandy Thompson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was impressed how quickly this expanded to full shape. I definitely enjoy my new bed!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable!', 'author': 'Penguin23', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mattress is very comfortable! title: Leesa Sapira Hybrid 11" Mattress, Queen Size, Premium Cooling Foam and Individually Wrapped Spring / CertiPUR-US Certified / 100-Night Trial
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional mattress', 'author': 'Innovator', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Yes, it\'s a tad firmer than I was used to, but the back and edge support this hybrid mattress offers are exceptional, eliminating the back pain I had with my previous memory foam-only mattress. The build quality and luxurious materials used are high grade. Overall, the Sapira is a class act.Day 1: The mattress arrives in a tall square-box, about 2x2x4. I attached a photo of what the mattress looks like compressed inside the box. Upon placing the mattress on my boxspring, I cut the plastic off and the bed immediately sprung to life, literally, as the coils decompressed. Yes, there is a noticeable off-gassing smell, but it\'s not offensive. I left my window open at night, and 90% of the smell was gone by the next morning.Day 2: At first, the mattress was a bit firm, but after about 24-36 hours the mattress had fully decompressed and was much more comfortable. It\'s probably a 6.5/7 out of 10 on the firmness scale, the way most online professional mattress websites suggest. The top Avena foam layer sleeps cool, so I don\'t overheat. The bounce the Avena foam + the pocketed coils provide makes moving around, and getting out of bed effortless. The off-gassing smell is just about gone now.Day 3: Decided to get rid of my old mattress and keep the Sapira. I sleep mostly on my back, but sometimes on my side and stomach throughout the night. The only sleep position I thought wasn\'t going to work out was the side position, because of the firmness, but the 3 inches of Avena + memory foam actually provide just enough sinkage, while keeping my spine aligned. The off-gassing smell is completely gone now. I bought a mattress protector, and then my bed sheet goes over that to complete the package.When I bought this mattress last Sunday, there were 20 left in stock with Amazon. As of this morning, only 9 Queen-size beds were left in stock, while some sizes other than Queen were already out of stock. So clearly word is getting out about this mattress. At $1,325, it\'s also a lot less expensive than every other hybrid mattress on the market, most of which will cost at least $2,000 more than this one, and will require you going to a showroom, and taking time off work to be home for delivery.In conclusion, I highly recommend this mattress. Please feel free to ask me any direct questions on here. Also, if you have time, I recommend reading the review on Sleepopolis, as it\'s the most comprehensive professional review that matches my own experience.Update: although I bought a Claritin mattress protector, and although when I called Sapira customer service they recommended having one too, I removed it on Day 4. It added a "plastic" feel to the surface of the bed that became unbearable. Once I removed it, that initial softness I experienced on Day 1 came back again. I only intend to use just my bedsheet from here on out. I recommend you do the same.((On a side note, I suggest ignoring the only other two reviews on here, both two stars. Unlike myself, neither one is a confirmed buyer of this product. The first review is too short to be real for a legitimate mattress evaluation by an actual customer. The fact that this mattress has the firmness rating it does shows the Sapira is designed for superior back support, so the reviewer\'s complaint is illogical. The second review is also partially off topic, as they discuss the manufacturers\'s website, which has nothing to do with how the mattress feels. Yes, they are correct the mattress is a little firm, but every other online review already confirms this. So to slam the product with only two stars for performing how it was designed is unfair.))', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good quality and definitely med firm', 'author': 'KC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slept on this mattress now for a week and am very pleased with its level of firmness. I prefer firm (side and stomach sleeper) and this is definitely medium firm and I feel supported when side sleeping. I'm using an adjustable base (Lucid - highly recommend) and have it in up position frequently and it retains its shape . The only downside is that the edges are soft which makes it hard to sit on the edge, but I knew that when I bought it. So far I have no regrets with the Leesa Sapira.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress!', 'author': 'Donna S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this mattress. Needed a replacement for my 15-year old Therapedic. Took a chance on this highly rated product and have not been disappointed. It feels as good as my Therapedic. Soft and firm. Relieves my back and hip pain (I’m a side sleeper.) And it was HALF THE PRICE of a new Therapedic. I would recommend this mattress to all former Therapedic owners.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Feels comfortable but produces me back pain. Reimbursed by Amazon', 'author': 'Juan Diego Barco', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'When I lay in this mattress is soft and feels good. However, I always get up with back pain and I never suffered from back pain in my life.I have been trying to return the mattress for more than 2 months without sucess. As the mattress is unboxed, UPS will not allow pick it up.I have talked with several Amazon representatives but they have only forwared my petition and at the end they have not solved it.Update:After several calls and weeks trying to return the mattress, finally Amazon decided to reimburse me the full amount I payed. At the end they were cooperative,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Needed to try - not THE BEST but good', 'author': 'KayDawg', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Heard rave reviews and was inundated with social media ads after looking Leesa up online while mattress shopping, so the Hybrid won out for, well, being a hybrid and because Leesa is a B Corp.Queen mattress on a slatted platform frame without a box spring.It's really soft - softer than I expected it to be for a hybrid, and you can feel the springs on the edges and right through the side of the mattress. But good for stomach/side sleepers and can be good for back sleepers if you don't already have a lumbar spine issue, IMO.My friend had one that I spent just one night on and I don't remember hers being this soft. Will the softness dissipate over time?I'm afraid I overpaid for something that won't last up to the standard 8-10 years since it's already soft and I can feel the springs. We'll know more when we get to the 100 days of trial (it's only been 30)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’m a new person.', 'author': 'Chelsea Breza-Berndt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First off, I’m not a product reviewer. I generally ignore any and all opportunities to write product reviews. But I felt the Leesa Hybrid was deserving of my time to write a review.We had been searching for a mattress for a couple years, mainly paralyzed by the fear of not liking whatever we decided to buy. Our old pillow top was about 9 years old and at 28 years old I was starting to understand how boomers feel when they wake up in the morning.We tried the Leesa in person at a local store and were sold, but Amazon had by far the best deal we could find.My boyfriend likes firm mattresses, but I’m 5’ 2” and 130 lbs so we needed to find a balance between firm and too firm. The nice part about the Leesa is the memory foam top, so you get a softer feel while still enjoying a medium firm mattress. It’s even perfect for my lighter body weight and the boyfriend thinks the firmness is satisfactory too. We are both happy.The one thing that has taken some getting used to is it sleeping cooler. We’ve had to play with the thermostat in the house a bit since our previous mattress slept so hot.However the most striking thing is the GREAT SLEEP AND TOTAL AND COMPLETE LACK OF BACK PAIN!!!! I would recommend this mattress to anyone!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Was nervous ordering online!', 'author': 'R. Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so nervous ordering a mattress online. I had been able to try the mattress at a local store that carries the brand. Their delivery time was out 4 weeks. Amazon offered a discount and delivery was a few days out from the order date.I purchased a platform bed and it was recommended that I get a 9-11 inch high mattress. I like pillow top mattress especially. Not really available in the 9-11 inch range.I love this mattress! So comfortable and just soft enough for my liking. Very supportive yet comfortable. I am so happy that I picked this brand. Lessa is not as advertised as others, but well worth a look when thinking of spending a couple thousand dollars on a new mattress.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really excellent', 'author': 'Jenna.Leann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have had this mattress since July of 2018 and still love it. My husband prefers a slightly softer mattress, I prefer firm, and neither of us have any complaints. I am generally a side sleeper, no issues there.We have a king and I really wanted a mattress with good edge support and this one definitely does. It makes the mattress feel larger to us. Right now there’s three of us sharing this bed (us plus our 18 month old) and I love that the mattress is firm enough for us to feel safe having our son sleep with us. We all have our own space and never wake up sore.My husband has had two of his buddies buy this mattress and they were also happy with it (plus their wives). I also love that it’s a hybrid, full memory foam isn’t my thing and this just seems durable. Negative reviews on this mattress genuinely surprised me. Maybe we aren’t picky because neither of us have any back issues, but we sleep so much better than we did before!Mattresses are such a personal preference and I know it’s risky to order online, but this one is a pretty safe choice in my opinion (unless you prefer soft mattresses).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Painful Sleeping Experience But Amazon Honored Their Refund Policy', 'author': 'New Homeowner', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I really hoped this mattress would work for me, given all the positive reviews and ratings it\'s gotten from reputable (?) national media outlets, but it turned out awful for me. Maybe because my body is just too used to the firmness and bounce of inner spring mattresses, this memory foam hybrid caused pain in my back and hips so bad that I never slept through the night during the trial period. Some reviews say this mattress is too firm, but I found it too soft. Lying on my back, I could feel my butt sink down into the foam a good 3 inches; lying on my side, my hips would also sink down that far, pulling my spine out of alignment. Yes, the memory foam "bounced" back to normal once I got up, but that didn\'t help while I was lying down! Also, as someone used to moving around easily on an inner spring, moving around on this mattress also created pain in my back and sides since the memory foam basically "immobilizes" you.To Amazon\'s credit, they issued a full refund when I requested it, efficiently and quickly without making me go through a lot of paperwork or red tape.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Arrived mishappen.', 'author': 'Kathleen M. Sheehan', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'As shown in the attached photo, the mattress was narrower on the bottom than on the top at one end. This was the case on both sides of the mattress at that end. Thus, the mattress does not come to the edge of the foundation at this end. This defect may have been due to the mattress being compressed for shipping causing a permanent distortion in its shape. This was my first time purchasing a mattress that is shipped this way, so I do not know whether this is a common problem. I plan to replace with a mattress that is not compressed for shipping. Other than this defect, the mattress seems to be as advertised.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this!', 'author': 'Justin Dong', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this!This is a thick pad and elevates the comfort of any mattress. title: Twin Mattress, 10 Inch Twin Size Hybrid Mattress, Breathable Comfortable Cool Single Mattress, Supportive & Pressure Relief, Motion Isolating Individually Wrapped Coils, Medium Firm
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress!!', 'author': 'rachel richard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't usually leave reviews. I bought this mattress for my Grandaughter at Christmas time. I have it some time to break in. Super comfortable! A must buy! Great for the price", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolute PERFECTION 💕😍🥰', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Like all the other reviews I was hesitant to buy a mattress I couldn’t test first but after 2 months of trying to find a suitable used mattress for cheaper and reading review after review I decided on this one and took the plunge!!We opened the box and let it inflate up to proper size for about 48 hours. Idk why people are saying it’s not exactly 10inches bc mine is. Watching it inflate from a thicker pancake was definitely cool. I noticed a couple of people cut there mattress taking it out of plastic so we just made a U shape cut in one corner and then opposite corner and sides began to inflate but it released the tight no inch seal around the mattress first. Then we cut just one side and the top and bottom being sure to leave the plastic wrap on the opposite edge and top and bottom trying to keep it somewhat covered while it came to its original size due to it being stark white and in the kitchen and didn’t want to get it dirty.Like I said we waited about 48 hours to move it to the bed. As an after thought, still trying to keep it perfect, we set out to get some type of perfection for it incase we were to ever spill on it or sweat super bad (ya never know 🤷\u200d♀️). Looked at Walmart and I just felt as if they were super thin looking, cheap, and nothing special (most were the kind that would crinkle when you moved if you didn’t want to pay upwards of $50+. So then I went on target app and when I saw it I knew that was the one. Some of the reviews commented that edges of mattress weren’t supportive and if your on one you kind of roll off or fall off. The pad I found was quilted and almost feather bed ish if you know what I mean. But this one specifically had a 3inch outer quilting layer that would provide support around edges if what other reviewer said was true.So we put the mattress pad on (oh and it was only $37!!!) made the bed and the rest is history. 1-2 people said it’s quality you get in a nice hotel and I definitely agree with that if not this is nicer. When my partner moves or gets up I don’t even feel him honestly. When you lay in it you sink slightly (just enough for there to be a very mild cushioning around you but not enough to make the mattress not good for your back or good nights sleep. For past 2 nights I haven’t gotten up in middle of night for anything (bathroom, cigarette, food…nothing!)…that’s unheard of for me. My back hasn’t hurt whatsoever (idk if it’s springs, the 7 layers, special padding, idk but I’m in love). I even laid down after breakfast today and fell asleep for a good hour and a half bc it’s so comfortable. My fiancé somewhat rushes home to lay in it after long day and teases me with selfies laying on bed while I’m still at work.I’m by far beyond pleased with this purchase. I can’t say enough good things about it. If you want an affordable or even expensive mattress (bc you feel the more you spend the better the quality) that is made amazing and will give you best sleep you’ve ever had….this one is for you… hands down 👍🏼', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable!', 'author': 'Huda s.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Great price And very comfy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress', 'author': 'ana lopez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this mattress back in 2021. As a years went by it still was so comfortable that my younger sister and mom had me order them each the same matches just in different size. what I like about this mattress it’s that it’s firm enough where you don’t sink in too much but also soft enough where it doesn’t hurt your back :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So very comfortable!!!', 'author': 'Case for Moto g stylus 5G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is by far the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on I would recommend this bed!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Hibo O.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars nice product it works', 'author': 'Bruce Peterson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was used on our king bed...know issues...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not firm enough', 'author': 'TexasGinaBoutique', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'So I researched Amazon off and on for a few months looking for a full size mattress in a box under $400 that had the best reviews, so I took a chance on this one in December. It looks great. No fiberglass coming out like in other bed reviews . It feels perfect around the edges at each end with a soft but firm feeling. But the middle of the bed isn’t firm enough and sinks in quite a bit when you sit on it and lay on it. I really wish the rest of the bed felt like the edges of each end of the bed. And when you’re standing in front of the bed and you look straight at it you can see that from the left and to the right side (which is worse) of the middle of the bed never fully straightened out and filled completely out after opening and airing the bed up for a couple of days. It looks like a bed that’s been slept on for several years. I thought this mattress was supposed to be firmer. I’ve also been waking up with headaches and both of my arms and hands having fallen asleep. I don’t think I’m getting proper blood circulation in this bed. But other than these uncomfortable issues it’s not horrible. It’s ok to lay on and watch TV, you just sink quite a bit in it like memory foam mattresses even though there are coil springs in it. My previous mattress, I had it for so long that the springs recently started coming out so at least I’m not feeling that anymore. But I really wish I hadn’t bought this mattress. I will never buy a mattress in a box ever again. I will go into a store and try each one out in person and buy a mattress like I did with my previous one. There’s obviously no way of sending this mattress back. But this is just my review of my recent experiences. It might be a fine mattress for a child up to a teenager but for a 56 year old adult with arthritis it’s not very comfortable sinking into the mattress', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Mattress at Affordable Price!', 'author': 'William F Farmer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was suspicious of value for price point but after almost two weeks I am very happy with the purchase. title: Jenna 10” Innerspring and Memory Foam Full Mattress With Individually Encased Coils
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very firm, but not hard - comfortable and supportive even for big people', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is for the 14 inch Queen. Like most reviews about this mattress here, including mine, they are from someone who hasn\'t had this mattress very long, so I will be updating this from time to time. It\'s easy to say it is nice and comfortable when it\'s new, but how does it hold up over time is important to know so updates will be coming to this review from time to time.Pros:Shipping was right on time and it was packaged carefully and received in great condition. We received it on Thursday and put it on the bed and unwrapped it as soon as we got it. There was no odor or chemical smell of any kind right out of the box. We let it expand for more than 48 hours before sleeping on it Saturday, or last night. The mattress is very firm with a plush topper on it. It\'s very firm but not hard. I had the best nights sleep last night that I\'ve had in a very long time last night thanks to this mattress. It is very supportive and comfortable. I am a side sleeper that turns frequently and I found myself turning last night much less than I usually do. We are coming off a twelve year old 10 inch Serta mattress and I am pleased as punch that we went with the 14 inch mattress this time. I\'m really impressed with how tall it is. As a big and tall person, the height makes is real easy to get in and out of.Cons:None yetOther information:I am a big person, 6\'3" and 330#. My wife is pretty small, about 5\'3" and 135#. After the first night her opinion is that she was comfortable on it and slept better than she has in a while. It may actually prove to be a bit firm for a smaller person or for someone who doesn\'t care for a firm mattress, , but for me, I am very surprised and happy with how well it supports me. Again, it is very firm but not hard - very supportive. The topper adds just the right amount of plush softness on top where we lie. When either of us move or roll on our side, the other person doesn\'t feel it on their side.Recommendation:If you are a big or tall or heavy person and need a firm mattress, or just someone whole prefers a firm mattress, I recommend this one in the 14 inch height. The 14 inch height is well worth the additional cost over the 10 inch in my opinion. I also recommend for the 14 inch mattress that you let it expand 48 hours before sleeping on it. The website recommends 24 hours, but I can tell you that after the initial 24 hour period, ours expanded another several inches over the second 24 hour period. Give it 48 hours to expand before sleeping on it, you will be glad you did.11-26-2019 UPDATEHave slept on the mattress 10 nights now. No change in opinion, 5 stars...12-18-2019 UPDATEWe\'ve been sleeping on this bed for a month now and still loving it. The past week has been with our little grandson sleeping with us.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just WOW! Never imagined a 14" bed-in-a-box for under $250 could be this comfortable.', 'author': 'MomtoBoys', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE FEB 2024: Mattress is still going strong. It has been moved home and then back up to another apartment. We were able to fold it in half and hold it with ratchet tie straps in order to transport it in a SUV. It does take at least 2 people and ratchet ties to get it folded top to bottom ends. Surprisingly, folding didn’t negatively affect the mattress. It easily went back to its normal shape.So I bought this mattress for my son\'s bed at his college apartment. I wasn\'t sure what to expect, but I have been pleasantly surprised. He says that it is very comfortable and he sleeps well on it. The mattress pairs nicely with the ZINUS Judy Upholstered Platform Bed Frame / Mattress Foundation / Wood Slat Support / No Box Spring Needed / Easy Assembly, Full (and no box spring needed). I do recommend going with 14" mattress because I think the thicker the mattress, the more comfortable it is. My only complaint/issue with this mattress is that if you sit on the edge, you are going to slide off because there isn\'t much support along the edges (as you would see with a $1000 coil mattress). But for only costing $250 and arriving condensed in a box that allowed it to be easily put in an SUV and transported up to school, I can\'t complain. We were originally looking at mattresses at C*stc*, but this was about half the price and fit inside the SUV. It did expand to its almost full-size within minutes of removing it from the plastic, and had minimal (if any) odor. I did immediately place the mattress in a Four Seasons Full Size Mattress Protector Bedbug Waterproof Zippered Cover Hypoallergenic Premium Quality Encasement (which I also recommend.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Good night's sleep", 'author': 'Roger Goodwell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I went into a store and the guy actually recommended I buy a bed from Amazon. I never thought about doing this because I didn't know how it would be shipped.Surprisingly, they had compacted the bed really well into this vacuum seal. I let the bed to rest for about 36 hours for it to fully come into shape.It's been about 1.5 years I had this bed with no issues so far. The bed has a nice consistency of being soft, but the springs hold up support well so you dont feel like your sinking into the bed.Im not sure how the springs may last long term but it's been well so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars For the price, it seems like a good mattress', 'author': 'babette', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The mattress is very comfortable if your not by the edge. There isn’t many support springs around the perimeter, so when you sit or lay on the edges it sinks. However if you stay away from the edges it is very comfortable and has support.After unwrapping the mattress, which took me (I’m a 57 year old woman) only 15 minutes from start to finish, it reached 12 out of the 14 inches. It’s a really nice looking mattress. Never ordered a mattress out of a box before. I live in an apartment and when it was delivered it was dropped off in the foyer. Didn’t even press the buzzer to let me know it was there. I found it by accident. It was a very heavy box I couldn’t move to my apartment myself. Had to borrow a dolly to move it before it was stolen.Other than that, it would be good for a kids room/ dorm or guest room.It’s a good mattress for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely buy!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Update May 16, 2020It’s been officially over a year we’ve had this mattress for our little one. We LOVE it! It’s comfortable for her and me. We haven’t had any sagging. It’s still in its original shape. It’s excellent support. It is a bit warm but I think that’s more due to the mattress protector we bought so the toddler doesn’t wet the bed. *high recommend mattress protector.*We will definitely be buying one for us!Update: Feb29,2020We’ve had the bed almost a full year now. It’s still super comfy and in great shape, no sagging. Would definitely recommend! We will be ordering more to replace the other beds in our home and vacation home. The price point is fantastic for the quality!We’ve had this bed now for 2 weeks. We bought for our 2 yr old but both my hubs and myself have slept in it. It’s comfortable for all of us. We opened it up and it expanded almost all the way immediately. We did give it the 24 hrs to rest/ expand before we used it. It did have a slight smell but we opened the windows and turned on a fan. With in a day the smell dissipated. The mattress is nice and deep.We were a bit nervous about buying online but the price was worth the risk and we LOVE it!8/15/19We have now had the mattress 5 months. We still love it just as much. It’s a great quality and excellent price point. We will definitely be buying more in the future as we have to buy multiple new beds.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars You can’t beat it for the price', 'author': 'Brittany Dunn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this mattress for $430. That is extremely cheap for a king sized mattress. My husband and I have been sleeping on a bed that was entirely memory foam, which for us having bad backs was absolutely terrible. We originally got these as twin sized for both our daughter and our son and they were so comfortable we finally got ours. It’s very comfortable and my husband and I have almost no back pain upon waking up anymore. I will say I can feel movement more so with this bed when my husband turns over but it’s not a lot. It was super simple to open. Just pull the plastic off and let it rise. We opened it and it inflated almost fully immediately. I let it continue to inflate for almost two days and if you measure from the poofiness of the bottom and the top it’s about 13 inches but I ordered the 14 inch. That’s not a big deal for us. Everything feels just fine. You can see in the pictures that all the corners didn’t fully untuck but again it’s not a big deal for me. You really can’t beat this bed for around $500. I obviously could go spend a thousand dollars and probably get a better one but I’m cheap. If you’re reading this, you’re cheap also. That’s why we’re buying a bed in a box from Amazon. So really this is a great deal even with minor appearance issues.Also, there is a smell it has when you first open it. You’ll smell it for hours if not a day. After that the smell either dissipated or I got so used to the smell it’s no longer a problem.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful mattress for the price', 'author': 'Marissa Perkins', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It may not be the most comfortable or anything, but for the price this is a wonderful mattress. I have Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome and have had more mattresses than I can count that just wouldn't cut it. I figured as cheap as this mattress is that I would be waking up in all kinds of pain, but I don't. I actually sleep quite well and wake up feeling fine. I'm truly impressed with the quality of this mattress.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hot and too soft', 'author': 'YourMomSaysImCool', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is a nice thick mattress for the price. It’s easy to sit down/stand up because it’s so thick that it sits higher than my previous 17 yr old mattress. It’s more comfy because there are no springs poking me. However, the pillow top is too soft. I kind of sink in a little. It makes my legs feel a little hot and that makes my restless legs syndrome flare. Also, being a stomach / side sleeper, my low back tends to hurt/be stiff when I wake. This was something I was hoping to alleviate with a new mattress but it just isn’t firm enough. Obviously I’m keeping it though because returns are impossible. I don’t have a machine to vacuum pack a 35lb mattress in plastic to mail back - as the condition it arrived. Also, yes it is kind of heavy being around 35lbs. I know that isn’t a lot in general but it is for a full size mattress. Anyway, I’m looking to invest in a firm mattress topper. Well, not in my opinion.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I ordered!', 'author': 'Ring', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mattress is exactly as I ordered. title: King Mattress 10 Inch, Memory Foam Hybrid Mattress, King Size Mattress in A Box, Individually Wrapped Coils, CertiPUR-US Certified, Medium Firm Mattress for Back Pain & Pressure Relieve
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very sturdy and firm seems well made', 'author': 'KayHay', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this mattress. I got it for my son's room. We waited a full 48 hours before using. It is very heavy. It puffed out nicely to the full 10 inches. It is firm, so if you want a softer mattress, I would suggest a mattress topper. It looks well made and the sides do not sag. Great mattress for the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Facility use - above standard!', 'author': 'Pelsor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When you are in a re-housing facility, you tend to get the plastic covered hospital “pads” that they loosely call mattresses. They may have started out as 6”, but after years you’re lucky at 3. Rules and regulations require flame retardant mattress.Very sore hips for side sleeper. Can feel every single metal slat, old pad springs weren’t poking through but you knew where they were. Plastic covered makes sense in certain settings but damn uncomfortable and noisy.Which lead to this purchase, and it’s a game changer!!My guy was going to go for the 8”, which would have been better than what he had but I said NOPE! Went for the 10” (top bunk, couldn’t go much higher lol).Yes, it is medium firm, in his case that’s a plus so he wasn’t sleeping on metal and feeling it.It provides the medium firm support but it’s still very soft.And he a freakin heater! Just hot all the time! While HAVING to have a fire retardant mattress and not liking fans (the feel of them blowing on him), while being directly under the heating vent due to bed assignments - this mattress is actually allowed by the facility for its fire/char/flame construction, doesn’t have chemical smell and it he doesn’t wake up drenched in sweat.For the price? HITS EVERY MARK NEEDED.For reference, he’s 6’1”, ~165 lbs.*did not wait more than probably an hour at best for this to “puff up” (bonehead) - didn’t negatively affect his comfort at ALL!I’d recommend doing as instructed - but saying if you don’t, and you’re a person that understands cost compared to product use compared to purchased need — this is a really great product - def recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars True Medium Firm', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We love almost everything about this mattress.I'm a medium and my husband is a firm for mattresses. This one is perfect the two of us to compromise. It has been so comfortable. It only took a few hours after unboxing for it to bounce back to life. The mattress is not very heavy to move after unboxing.The only con is how soft the sides are. It is definitely not made to sit on the side of the bed, there is no support for that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Firm and well made', 'author': 'Keeshy53', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The mattress plumped up fast and was firm as I wanted. Could not ask for a better night sleep. Would purchase again if needed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stop looking for which bed, THIS bed.', 'author': 'Cooper Abernathey', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am 6 ft 200lbs. She is 5.5ft 160 lbs. Both of us feel the firmness is perfect. Value was great!I didn't know that we NEEDED this mattress.She wanted a new bed, I could care less, I'm a man, I can sleep on concrete. I was so wrong. I have never had a comfortable bed. This is it. I literally fall asleep faster, wake up more refreshed. I must be into a deeper sleep now? Also, I used to wake up sore, entire body. Figured it was the manual labor job. No, its your bed. I feel so much better when i wake up. She agrees with all of these statements.I picked this exact mattress because it was cheap and reviews. I was very skeptical about a bed in a box. I figured if it is terrilbe, for the price, i can toss it. To my surprise, I will never go back to a typical mattress.Remember the TV commercial of the gal jumping on the bed and the wine glass sits still? This bed does this exact same thing. You can barely notice when she gets in/out of the bed.Some reviews mentioned a smell. We never noticed a smell.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing for the price!', 'author': 'Jaclyn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was basically immediately at full size right after taking out of the shrink wrap and is so comfortable after a week of sleeping on it! We did put a mattress protector on it that had some fluffy padding but I am used to having a gel memory foam pad and it is not missed with this! Would 100% recommend to anyone and especially for this price!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's surprisingly firm", 'author': 'Stephen C', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I wanted a more firm mattress, my husband is a stomach sleeper. From reviews I was worried it might not be that firm, but I'm pleasantly surprised. We have a bed frame that takes the place of a box spring & it did not feel great until I put a piece of plywood on the frame, I think the slats were too far apart and it made it feel like the head of the bed was sinking. That's the frames fault though, not the mattress, as adding support fixed it. I have no problem sleeping right at the edge & don't feel as though I'd fall off, as others have stated. We've slept on this over a month so far and like it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good one', 'author': 'Ganesh Angappan', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Comfortable and good bed. I bought two of their higher incline Queen mattresses, one for each of my middle school kids. My sister bought the same one for her middle school son. My adult single brother bought one for himself. Except for the crease in the middle and that fact that the edges have ZERO support and you will slide off if you sit on it, it’s a great mattress for the price.
