The height of the mattress is at the normal height where it supports me to get off the bed easily in the morning and get on the bed at night.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This is the first mattress I’ve ever bought on Amazon.', 'author': 'Ashleigh H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I’ve had this mattress about a month now and I have some pro and cons.Pros: no smell.Well made, definitely more firm than plush but hopefully that changes after a while. But it could also mean it’ll last a lot longer than most mattresses for the price.The picture makes the 10 inch mattress look super tall but it’s a lot smaller than 10 inches maybe about 8 or less.The mattress cover is a nice touch.Easy set up.If your using a cheap platform metal frame I suggest buying a mattress pad which I will be doing soon.Cons:Like I said it’s a lot firmer than expected.Didn’t decompress fully to the advertised 10 inches.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice mattress, just right for me', 'author': 'Kewei', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Before I decide to buy something on Amazon, I usually decide to buy it based on bad reviews and generally the bad reviews will stop me from buying. However, this mattress reviews are very interesting, some commented that the material of the mattress is too soft, while some commented that the material of the mattress is too hard. This really aroused my strong curiosity, so I decided to buy it and give it a try. The king size mattress was about as big as I expected it to be and it didn't emit any strong chemical smell or anything for that matter when I just opened it from the vacuum bag, which is so important for me who was going to need a mattress right away in a new apartment. After almost two weeks of sleeping, I feel that this mattress is exactly what I expected. It is just right for me, neither soft nor hard.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible mattress', 'author': 'Corey Williams', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The mattress doesn't stay puffed up. It sinks after laying in it for 10 min. I must have received the one that's terrible after reading all these reviews. It is definitely no Medium firm. It feels like I'm sleeping on the rails the mattress lays on.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sink In, But Watch Your Back', 'author': 'Max Winter', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The Novilla Queen 12-Inch Foam Mattress is like a marshmallow cloud for your bed, but it's not for everyone. It took me a minute to adjust to the squishy softness – feels like a hug for your whole body. However, if you're all about that back support life, this might not be your go-to option. It's cozy, but be mindful if your spine needs a bit more love. Three stars from me – comfy, but not the best for everyone. ⭐⭐⭐", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to unbox, soft and comforting', 'author': 'Rojan KC', 'rating': 5, 'content': '"I recently purchased the Novilla Queen Mattress, and it has truly transformed my sleep quality. This 12-inch foam mattress in a box is a game-changer. I love how it conforms to the contours of my body, offering excellent pressure relief. It\'s neither too soft nor too firm; I\'d describe it as a medium plush, which is just right for me.One thing I appreciate about this mattress is the tight top, which adds an extra layer of sturdiness and durability. I\'ve had it for a few weeks now, and it still feels as comfortable as it did on day one.The convenience of having this mattress delivered in a box is great. The setup was a breeze, and it expanded to its full size in no time.Overall, this Queen Mattress has provided me with many peaceful nights of sleep. It\'s a fantastic investment in my well-being, so I am happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This 10-inch mattress had absolutely no odor or any chemical smells once I opened the packaging. At first, I had some concerns about whether this medium-firm mattress would be too soft for someone like me, weighing 200 pounds. However, to my surprise, lying on it felt incredibly comfortable. This mattress provides ample support in all directions, whether I'm lying on my side or back. Both my partner and I are very pleased with this level of firmness. Furthermore, this mattress features a bamboo charcoal foam soft cover that boasts outstanding breathability, helping to prevent dust mites from thriving. What's even more delightful is that this mattress can be used on both sides, significantly extending its lifespan.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Developed Ripples - Ops, there are part of the design', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I never saw it in the description that this mattress is designed with a wave pattern. The mattress is comfortable but odd. You don't notice the waves/ripples with your body weight but your hand resting on the mattress sure does. I have a very thick mink blanket I may use on the mattress, then add a mattress cover, then the bottom sheet and hope this will diminish this wave. Hopefully even elimate it. Ug.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the price', 'author': 'Nicole Brooks', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Really good value for the price. Comfortable mattress and supportive. Only thing I would change is the mattress has a wavy texture that I'm still getting used to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Shiloh 12 Inch Memory Foam Mattress, Queen Size, Bed in a Box, Cradling Medium Support
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Happy with my purchase', 'author': 'Tabitha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My boyfriend and I began having back troubles on our current bed, and were in desperate need of a new mattress, despite his protest. He didn\'t want to spend the money, and any time I would catch him stretching his back in pain he would play it off like it was nothing. FINALLY I convinced him to look at mattresses with me, and not only that, but I must have laid out a very persuasive proposal, for I talked him into upsizing to a King! So, we ventured out one weekend to a local Ashley Furniture store to begin getting a ballpark figure on how much this investment would run us, being that we had to now purchase a new bed frame as well. The sales lady, when I questioned her about the therapeutic and memory foam type mattresses, informed me that a King size purchase of that type would run us well over 2-grand for the mattress set alone. Well, needless to say I put that option out of my head, and we narrowed our search to only spring mattress sets. I found myself leaning toward a mattress set of either the Sealy or Serta brand, so the sales representative estimated a total that included the mattress, box springs, and a bed frame we were fond of, and the total was near two-grand. We told her we would think about it and we left the store.Thus began my search online to see if I could find one of the mattresses we had tested, and liked, at a cheaper price. I went to my trustworthy friend of Amazon, and so happened to run across the Sleep Innovations Memory Foam Mattress. I didn\'t understand how a King size memory foam mattress could be so cheap - It baffled me! As one could assume, I was very skeptic. "There\'s no way this could be good quality" I thought. So out of curiosity I looked at the number of reviews. At the time it had only about 60 reviews, and over 50 of them were 5/5 - and the reviews were of happy satisfied people who were extremely glad they took the chance on this mattress. Now I had a truly difficult decision to make. I originally didn\'t want to purchase a mattress online that we hadn\'t lain on in person - understandably I didn\'t want to waste our money on a mattress we hated - but this mattress was such a good price, and I had always wanted a memory foam mattress (I had a pillow of this brand and loved it).Finally, after reading probably almost every review on Amazon about this mattress, I decided to throw caution to the wind and purchase this mattress (the boyfriend had left picking out the mattress to me, as choosing between hundreds of mattresses turned out not to be `his thing\' to do on the weekends - and he claimed it to be something a woman would enjoy. HAH!) Besides, anything was an improvement to what were sleeping on at the time.The mattress arrived earlier than the initial estimated arrival date, and I had even chosen free super saver shipping (it arrived exactly 1 full week after I ordered it - I ordered it on a Friday, and it arrived the following Friday). I already expected a small box, in comparison to the size of the mattress, but when I opened the box and dragged the mattress out, despite my knowledge from previous customer reviews, I was still shocked. I knew it was compressed, but still it only looked like half of a king size mattress folded accordion style - It looked like a twin! "Surely," I thought, "I didn\'t make some mistake and I was supposed to have purchased two of these...maybe that is why it was so cheap." But alas, my fears were proven unnecessary. After reading the instructions on how to properly remove it from the plastic in which it was sealed, I sliced it open and it grew rapidly before my eyes! Not only was it compressed accordion style, it had been folded in half like a sub sandwich as well! This is a mammoth of a mattress, so I recommend anyone who purchases it to open it up in the location you intend to leave it (the UPS tracking said it weight around 105lbs).It has almost been a full month since we purchased this mattress, and we are simply in love. I could almost swear that not even a few days have gone by without either my boyfriend or I remarking on how amazing it is. Some people complained about a lingering smell. It did in fact have a chemical-like smell upon opening, but after about 2-3 days it was fully gone. Even so, during those 3-days the smell was certainly not unbearable as some thought, but actually had very mild potency, and we slept on it the first night without any trouble.Also related to the first night, I was a bit worried we would have to sleep on the downstairs sofas the day it arrived, because we had a dinner date we couldn\'t miss, so I was unable to assemble the bed frame (which had arrived the same day) and unseal the mattress until 9:00pm. By the time I had finished assembling the bed and laying the box springs (two XL-Twins) in their place, it was 10:00pm. After we cut the seal, however, it was quickly apparent that it would take no time for it to expand. It was done in 30minutes or less! There may have been additional minor expansion that went on unnoticed to us, but for the most part it was finished (and the instructions actually say it will be ready to sleep on the first night, and that body warmth actually speeds up the process).I will never go back to a box-spring mattress again. Your body sinks right into this one as soon as you lay down. It has never been more comfortable to sit in bed and read a book before going to sleep. Also, on our old bed I used to wake up frequently through-out the night when the cats jumped on the bed, my back pained me, or when nature called. Now, however, I never even notice when the cats or my boyfriend move around in the bed, never wake up with back pains, and only wake up for bathroom calls if it is absolutely necessary. I find myself sleeping straight through the night until my alarm goes off for work, a blessing I haven\'t had in years.Some think foam mattresses are too firm, but they only appear to be at first. Once you sit/lay on them you begin to sink in. So it is firm, but it yields and molds to your body, something I find much more beneficial and comfortable than a soft mattress with no support. Also I can not attest to the mattress causing an increase or decrease in temperature caused by body heat or anything of that matter. I have noticed no difference.I am a thousand times grateful I took a chance on this mattress, and I would highly urge anyone who is debating on the matter to do so themselves!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2011', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sound, comfortable regenerative sleep, finally! No more springs here. 2 yrs. later... Great!', 'author': 'Uwohali', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Originally ordered on 3/23 and it never came, lost? I called 3/28 and spoke with supervisor Heather, she quickly resolved the problem on 3/28 and the following day my mattress arrived. Heather tracked the order and sent emails as it shipped, now that\'s outstanding customer service! Thsank you so much Heather. UPDATE : It\'s been a couple of months now and the mattress is very comfortable still. We have a steel raised frame with a smooth finished plywood 3/8" top. There are additional support blocks at various points on the raised frame to make sure it is completely supported. Seems that a lot of reviews relate problems to improper frame and support of it. With the mattress supported as such we haven\'t had a problem with it at all. It does sleep warm, so we had to adjust the amount of covers we used to use with the Serta boxspring it replaced. I will update the review again at a later date. This mattress sleeps so much better than boxspring construction, just adjust your top sheets and covers accordingly since you\'ll get warmer than a boxspring.The mattress arrived in a large 2\' X 2\' box about 4\'tall, heavy but manageable, around 100lbs., so be ready :). Boy does it inflate fast too. It had a slight curve as some have pictured, but given time to properly expand it straightened out flat. Odor was very, very faint to where you had to lay on it to really notice it and even then it was faint, guess it depends on the individuals sensitivity. After a day or so it was not noticeable to us at all. It fit our elevated queen platform perfectly, so sized correctly. It\'s kind of weird after using conventional spring mattresses all my life, at first you\'re like "man... It\'s like sleeping on a board lol", but given several days and it\'s like "I will never, ever have a box spring again lol"... it is actually like that... I suggest first timers like me... moving from springs to foam to give it several days for your body to adjust to something brand new to it. Compared to the Serta Fairmont Pillow Top it replaced it is simply superior, the bottom line is I sleep sound and comfortable now, I did not with two previous Sertas. I wish I had went this route earlier, solid, comfortable, all night sleeping now. The price isn\'t the issue, it comes down to what gives you this type of sound & comfortable regenerative sleep. Recommended.Update : 3 weeks later. Takes some getting used to because it forms to you quite nicely. It does sleep warmly, meaning it reflects your body heat into the covers. This is no problem to me, a simple covers adjustment... just wanted to note this. I have quite sound, solid rests now that the Serta Pillow Top wasn\'t producing. This alone to me is worth the money easily... I mean you buy a mattress for comfort and good sleep, this mattress performs that. Will update at later date.Update : 10/28/16 Well it\'s been quite some time and the mattress is still performing as it should. Did a rotation at six months too. We\'re both sleeping quite comfortably and one thing I\'ve noticed is I now get quite solid sleep, something I didn\'t get with box\'s prints. The mattress has softened very slightly but in a comfortable way to me. No imprinted patterns or irregular shapes either. Still very happy with this purchase, you could easily pay 2-3 times or more and not get the practical function you have here.6/09/17 Update : It\'s been a year and three months, no complaints and sleeping wonderful still. The one thing I have noticed is the mattress sleeps warm... Reflects body heat... so I\'ve learned to turn the quilt down and use the sheet on my upper half. My girlfriend loves it just as is and sleeps like a baby. Again, never ever again boxsrings.Update: 2/21/18 It\'s been two years now. The mattress has held up quite nicely with no sags, low spots, and still sleeps great. We rotate it every three to four months and haven\'t had a problem. It is heavy to rotate, but to me that\'s a sign that it is well made. Two years of great sleep VS years of springs... Never ever again. There are companies selling the equivalent to this mattress at over four to eight times as much, why pay that? I look at it like this... If it lasts five years I will be totally happy for the price paid. I will likely order another soon for a second room after this great two years performance we\'ve received. Quite happy, we\'ll done maker!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 12" Memory foam Mattress - Good Value', 'author': 'J. Harmon', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Matress came in a fairly large box with an outer sleeve and inner plastic cover. Instructions were easy to follow but you can also find Youtube videos on how to do the process. Basically amounts to cutting off the outer sleeve then placing the mattress on your box spring and then opening the plastic seal, it will quickly take on a lot of air as it expands. Per the directions once this is done you can use the bed normally but it may take some time to fully expand. We let ours expand for about 5 hours, I noticed a slight smell but turned on an aircleaner and that went away very quickly. Overall I dont know why so many review it as firm, the under foam is firm however the top layer is quite soft and easy to depresses with your hand. When you lay flat and your weight is distributed it does feel a little more firm but you do slowly sink into the same way your head does on a memory foam pillow. I still wouldn't classify it as firm, at best medium firm on top layer. Overall its very comfortable and is an excellent value. I found I was not hot and Im sensitive to heat. The only time I did notice it was a little uncomfortable was if I rolled on my belly which is not my normal sleeping position. I was just testing all the angles. If heat is a problem which in Houston heat is always a problem you could also add a Mattress topper, they make a number of styles and I ordered an encryption cotton one that hasn't come in yet due to the reviews that said this mattress could get hot. We havent gotten to the dead of summer yet so I will have to add an update for when we do, I will likely use the topper I ordered just to compare and to have a little extra protection for the Mattress. I like having a little airflow around my body. Im not sure why the manufacture couldn't put little Do-nut holes in top foam to improve this but it hasn't been a problem yet for me. They do include air vents in the cover over the foam, and the info that came with it says the top foam should vent well stay cool. I'm not sure how as it seems solid which is why I ordered the mattress cover that has good ventilation. So far it hasn't been needed and the mattress seems adequate, it passed the wife test too which is the most important test! I will update this review once we have slept on the mattress for a longer period but initial review is good.>> Update, we are now mostly through January and we both are enjoying this mattress. We do use an Egyptian cotton mattress topper which definitely improves the air flow around your body rather then just slowly sinking into the soft foam top. Honestly that makes it seem very similar to a traditional mattress, when sitting on a corner or side you do notice its not as firm as a traditional mattress such as when tying your shoes in the morning. Despite that minor quibble, the bed is very comfortable and is standing up to 100 degree weather and high humidity Houston Texas days. My kids even love it and constantly want to come in our room to watch TV. Essentially its passed the whole family test and we look forward to having this Mattress for years to come. I also feel it should help with Allergies as its not going to absorb dust like a traditional mattress. Given that we are using a topper that may need to be replaced every so often but it wasn't expensive and allows for us to have an additional comfort boost. I could have honestly used the mattress without it, but due to some of the heat complaints I figured best to get that to allow a touch more airflow. I like it cold and my wife likes it warm and with this setup we both have been pleased. All in All a solid 4, not quite as good as my old mattress however that was also 4X more expensive so this budget shopper is happy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Truth, this mattress rocks!', 'author': 'Axel Foley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Okay, so here was my situation. When my pillow top mattress arrived years ago the delivery guys said they could not get it upstairs into my bedroom because they would have to bend it in order to get it up the stairs. Well, the sales guy at the store said the mattress could bend in order to fit it up the stairs so we told the delivery guys to just "get it up there!" They did and everything was fine, for awhile. Recently we noticed a large valley in the middle of the king sized, pillow top mattress. At first it was no big deal but the last month or so, it was HORRIBLE! So, I was on the hunt for a new mattress. I knew I needed a memory foam mattress because it needed to fit up stairs. And mind you, I don\'t live in an elf house but the doorway to the upstairs is at a strange angle so no spring mattresses will work.What does everyone do when they start looking at memory foam mattresses? They look at that name brand memory foam mattress that costs thousands of dollars. I didn\'t really want to spend that much money, I mean, who does. But I would have if that was the only mattress that I felt was going to work for my wife and I. Now this part is important, I did a TON of research on the internet. No need to research folks, I did it for you! It came down to this mattress or the one available at Sam\'s Club. After doing more research and Amazon\'s great reputation, I decided to try this mattress. And I am SO GLAD that I did!I ordered the mattress and it took a week and half to get to me. No problem. The shipping was free, yes free! So how could I complain? That mattress came in a box about 4.5 feet tall and about 2 feet deep. It was heavy, about 100 lbs. I was able to get it into the house and up my stairs by myself. Any man, in any decent kind of physical shape, will be able to push, pull, carry or drag the box into their house and up stairs. Some women can do it too I am sure! Not trying to be sexist, just realistic.Anyway, I set up my new bed frame, the folding frame by Structure available and purchased from Amazon as well. This frame is great. SO EASY to put together! Just fold open and screw the two sides together done. Way easier and better for your memory foam mattress than a standard box spring. Once the frame was set up I opened the box and pulled out the mattress. The mattress will be FOLDED IN HALF and scrunched up so it looks like Z\'s from the side. It will also be in a plastic bag in which all the air has been sucked out. PUT THE MATTRESS ON THE FRAME BEFORE CUTTING OPEN THIS BAG. The down side of the mattress is blue. This is really the only part of the mattress that you will see in the bag since it is folded over. As long as the mattress is on the frame, you can turn it in the right direction after opening the bag. Carefully cut the bag open and you will start to hear the air being sucked in. The mattress will start to get bigger but no need to go super fast as you will have plenty of time to cut open the bag and pull it out from under the mattress.Once the bag is off the mattress starts to get bigger and bigger and bigger. Once it opens up you will feel bumps an dips in the mattress. Don\'t worry, after an hour or two these will no longer be there. There is a smell. The room will smell as if you recently painted the walls. This smell slowly goes away. It really is no big deal. In fact, after I made up the bed, I could barely smell it.The mattress does come with a protecter already over it but I would recommend putting your own on it as well. King size sheets went on perfectly. Hour after hour the mattress would feel better. I was really surprised how nice it felt.Okay, so I opened the mattress around 1pm. At about 10pm my wife and I went up to bed. The mattress felt like a dream! It is a bit firm but once you lay down, you will slowly melt into it. You will not sink down 6 inches or anything like that, but you will melt in an inch or so. And it will feel fantastic! The mattress did feel a bit warmer than my old one, but IT WAS NOT HOT! You really won\'t notice a big difference. I slept great last night! Way better than my last mattress! One I paid around 2 grand for!!!! What a rip!Here are some other things that I read in other reviews.It is hard to get out of the bed. Not so. You can sit on the side, move around, get in and out. No problem."Non-sleeping activities" are tough in this bed. Not at all. If their are problems, it ain\'t the bed!It stinks. Like I said before, like fresh paint in the room. But as of today, I smell nothing. No worries!It is too firm. I don\'t think so. I usually like soft beds. But this one has changed my mind.You must work for Amazon or Sleep Innovations. Haha. Nope. City employee who is hoping I have a pension in 20 years (fingers crossed).I had MAJOR reservations about purchasing a mattress without ever trying it. But what was I going to do? I was kinda stuck. But I pulled the trigger on this mattress and I DON\'T REGRET IT! Not one bit! If you are on the fence about purchasing this mattress, just DO IT! I have been looking at this mattress since Christmas! Yes, that long! I should have bought it then. I\'m glad I did and like one poster said, if it only lasts 5 years, so what! I can buy another one for a fraction of the cost of the "name brand" memory foam mattress. But I don\'t see that as being a problem because everything about this mattress is impressive.If you have any questions, I will check back and answer them for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2011', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It may not be for everyone, but I love it!', 'author': 'JB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I rarely, if ever, have the urge to write a review, but when I was considering this bed I found the reviews very helpful. I thought I should contribute my thoughts to people that were on the fence about buying this memory foam mattress.Prior to ordering this mattress, I did a lot of research online. I also thought it\'d be a great idea to go to a local Tempur Pedic store. While I was there, I tried several of the different mattresses. I wanted to really find out if I would like the comfort of the mattress. They felt firm, but very comfortable. I would recommend anyone that has not tried sleeping on a memory foam mattress to go to a local store and lay on them to see if they are your cup of tea or not. I wanted to make an informed decision about my purchase; I made sure to ask the Tempur Pedic employee any questions I had about the mattresses.Some questions asked:1) What is the biggest reason why people return their bed?-She told me that people generally returned the bed because they said it was too hard, firm, and/or not comfortable. She went on to tell me that a lot of people don\'t give the bed enough time. She stated that people should try to give the bed 8-12 weeks. Some people actually love the bed after the 8-12 week break in period.2) Do you own a memory foam mattress? If so, which one and why?-She did own one. She owned one of the higher end "cloud" models. She told me she selected her mattress based on the feel and comfort.3) Did you find that your sleep improved? Did the quantity and quality of sleep change significantly?-She told me that her sleep did improve. She told me she still sleeps about the same amount of time but that the quality of sleep is much better.4) Are there "heat" issues with the memory foam mattresses?-She states that the technology used allows very good heat dissipation. She then tells me that a lot of people that "sleep hot" will likely feel the same on a memory foam.5) How much do these mattresses run?-She tells me that the mattresses run several thousand dollars. She states there is financing and that it is an "investment in your health".6) Anything else you want to share with me regarding a new purchase?-She tells me that it would be a good idea to get a new pillow with the mattress. She states that some people find the bed uncomfortable, but once they purchase a new pillow to compliment the mattress, that it can improve the overall comfort.I knew that I wanted a memory foam mattress, but I also knew I didn\'t want to have to spend $3,000 or more. That brought me to Amazon. I read hundreds of reviews on this particular mattress and on others as well. I decided to go with this mattress mainly due to the amount of feedback and positive reviews. I figured the price was worth the risk, took the plunge (I ordered a queen size mattress).The mattress arrived 2 days after I placed my order on Amazon. The package was heavy (close to 100 lbs), but I was able to move the box and unpack the mattress by myself (I\'m not a gym rat/health nut, but I usually exercise 2-3 times per week). I live in a one story home. The mattress was relatively easy to maneuver into the bedroom. I was smart about how I lifted the box and made sure to use proper body mechanics.I carefully followed the directions to unpack the bed being particularly careful not to cut the mattress. After cutting the sleeve/plastic wrapping, the mattress expanded fairly rapidly. I have my mattress on a platform designed specifically for memory foam beds.My sense of smell is fairly sensitive. I notice the chemical smell right away, but after a few hours it seems to be dissipating and it is much less noticeable. After a few days it is completely gone.I was happy to see that I wouldn\'t have to wait 48 hours before being able to sleep on the bed. The brochure that came with the bed states that it is actually okay to sleep on the mattress the first night. It said that body heat could actually help the mattress expand into its proper form.It is difficult to rate/grade the firmness because there isn\'t a standard scale that everyone is familiar with. Not only that, but deciding what is "firm" is all subjective and will vary from person to person. For me the mattress is "firm", but not in a bad way. The foam conforms to your body and there is a sensation of pressure relief. I am getting great support and the bed feels very comfortable. Regarding heat, I have no issues whatsoever. Of course there is also the no motion transfer feature.I can honestly say this is the best sleep I\'ve gotten in a long time. I had minor back and body aches before, after sleeping on this mattress a few days I no longer have those aches. I also ended up buying a memory foam pillow. I feel that it has added comfort and quality to my sleep.Bottom line is the mattress does everything the major name brand does, but is more affordable. I don\'t regret this purchase at all. Of course it may not be for everyone... but with so many 4 and 5 star reviews, there\'s a high probability that you might find that this memory foam mattress works for you.**Update (over 2 weeks later): I still love my bed. It is very comfortable! I would make this purchase again. I have been getting improved quality of sleep. I toss and turn way less, get up less during the night, and wake up without aches or back pain.**Update (over 2 months later): The bed still feels comfortable. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not my first foray into foam.....', 'author': 'Wildmaninid', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I know many of these reviews touch on many topics, not all of which I believe are relative to the actual product. So lets get these out of the way. Yes the mattress comes in a box. It\'s folded up, vacuum packed and wrapped in a band. The box a bit larger than a mini fridge. It weighs around 90 pounds. The foam does have a smell. Depending on how sensitive you are to it will depend on how you rate the product. It is just the smell of new foam. It will dissipate, how fast depends on room temp, ventilation and other environmental factors.So now that I have the simple, mostly unimportant things covered, I will give you some background. My ex-wife insisted on spending 2500$ on a Tempur-pedic mattress when we were together 3 years ago or so. I was NOT happy about the cost, especially when there were many lower priced products on the market similar to this mattress. So I slept on a Tempur brand for a year or so. It was built differently than this mattress. The top layer(s) were much softer and you really sunk in before you hit the "support" layer of foam. I found myself in a snuggled dip, making rolling over at night difficult and usually found that I was woken up by the struggle. The mattress was hot too. Let me tell you I was a sweat factory every night. It was nice in the winter time, however. But all in all I was comfortable and had little to no back or neck pain. This was the least I could expect, considering the fact that I spend a good sum of money on a premium mattress. One of the few things I will mention (probably just my own body issues) is that if I didn\'t pee before bed, you can bet your bottom dollar that I would wake up in the morning with a sore back and having to run to the bathroom. I just got used to going beforehand and never had any issues. Also something people don\'t touch on AT ALL is the subject of intimacy. We all pretty much participate in this activity on this particular household item exclusively, and no one really talks about the differences between springs vs. foam. On the Tempur mattress the fact that you sunk in quite a bit with no give made bedroom activities a constant game changer. If anyone had issues with joints, or needing to be at a certain level or position during this activity would have to pretty much find another surface to have these activities on.And with that background being covered I can move on. My new wife and I moved out to Maine from the Pacific Northwest, selling all our belongings and started fresh. We hit town and bought some furniture, and a mattress at the same time from the same dealer. It was a discount mattress and believe me after 2 months we knew we got what we paid for. Sagging center and broken springs. We spoke of our options and discussed foam. I had experience with it, however refused to pay 2,000$ for a mattress. We shopped around locally, even hitting the sleep number store in our local mall. Their memory foam was a bit firmer than what I had before, but the tilt/massage and air adjustability was very enticing, then I got the 5600$ price and walked out. We are both thrifty and big Amazon shoppers so we turned here. We shopped Sams Club and Costco also and decided on this mattress. Ordered it on Friday Oct 19th and it was at our door before noon the next day. Amazon will always have the best delivery and service. We unpacked the bed at noon and slept on it that night. The smell was already almost gone by our 9 o\'clock bedtime. We settled right in on the firmest bed either of us has ever slept on. It was a terribly uncomfortable frist night. Our pillows were not supportive enough either. We woke up Sunday, assessed the situation and went right out to Sams Club and dropped 80$ on a soft 1.5" foam topper, installed it and have the mattress of our dreams. A nice shallow cushy layer that supports with the firmness we desire. We sleep cool, we are isolated from eachothers movements and let me tell you, the firmness and the fact that you don\'t "sink" into the mattress have opened our eyes to a whole new world in the romance department. Having a bed that does not move all over on bouncy springs really amplifies the energy you put into the pleasure.I will leave it at that. I will also be very critical of this purchase and will update this review as often as something comes to light worth mentioning. But for now, we got an amazing mattress. It may not be perfect out of the box, but with products available anywhere you can tailor this to your own sleep style with little investment. This is a great mattress with an AMAZING price. I love it more than the Tempur brand that was almost 5 times more expensive.Enjoy!!Update (3-4-13) We have been sleeping on this mattress for a tick over 4 months now. Every night my wife and I look forward to our sleep! We have "rotated" the mattress twice now (end to end, not flipping it over, as you can only sleep on the top surface) for no other reason than to just prevent us from possibly sinking the mattress (absolutely no sign of that). One evening I was washing the cover for our 2" mattress topper and we lost power in the middle of it. We decided to sleep on just the mattress and without the topper. Same as the first night we woke up stiff and achey. This mattress alone is still just too firm without the 2" soft layer that the extra topper provides. I would still recommend this mattress to anyone, since you can customize the sleep with a small investment in a topper.Update (3-8-14) It\'s been well over a year now, and this bed has become our favorite place in the house. About 5 months ago we decided to remove the foam topper and sleep directly on the bed, because I was, for some reason, tossing and turning which shifted the topper, causing me to have part of my body on the topper and then my shoulders would fall and contact the mattress. I can only think that after almost a year of sleeping on the mattress, it "softened" up enough to where we felt the bed was the same firmness without the topper. Picked up some 600 thread count luxury sheets and we could never imagine not sleeping on this bed. Still stand by my rating and recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleeps Like A Dream: Especially if you suffer from Back Problems or Restless Leg Syndrome', 'author': 'R. Douglas', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have to say, I was wary of a mail order foam mattress, but the Sleep Innovations 12-in Shiloh mattress has exceeded all my expectations!!After injuring my back in 2005 and subsequently developing restless leg syndrome, sleeping the last 15 years had been a nightmare for both my wife and I. We had always slept on spring mattresses and found they quickly sagged and became lumpy and had to be replaced every couple of years...and mattresses aren\'t cheap. On the spring mattress, I\'d have a few months of great sleep which quickly deteriorated as the bed sagged, putting pressure on my spinal nerves causing all sorts of on-going pain and discomfort. The only way I could sleep was to prop pillows in front of me and behind me to keep me perfectly on my side. Plus, my night time muscle spasms and twitching from the restless leg syndrome amounted to interrupted sleep for my spouse. It was just an overall miserable experience for both of us.Of course, a well-known brand name memory foam mattress company claimed unrivaled sleep and comfort, especially with those of us with back problems and restless sleepers. However, we just could not afford the price tag.Introducing Sleep Innovations: February 2016, my wife and I just could not tolerate another night on our lumpy queen spring mattress. Now she was also in constant pain from back problems (probably due to the spring mattress). During hours of research, trying to find an affordable mattress, we kept running across favorable reviews of a memory foam mattress called Sleep Innovations. After more weeks of hesitancy over buying a mail order mattress, sight unseen, we decided to take, hold our breath, the plunge and order the Shiloh from Amazon. We debated the merits of the other models from Sleep Innovations and decided to place our bets on the model that had the most reviews - the Shiloh.The mattress arrived two days later by UPS in a box that seemed way too small to possibly hold a king sized mattress. My wife wondered if we had been sent the twin mattress by mistake. The box clearly indicated that it had been packed in September and held a king sized mattress. The box compact but fairly heavy so we laid down some towels and dragged the box from the back door into the bedroom where we removed the box. The mattress is vacuumed packed in plastic, wrapped in a nylon sleeve like a sausage, wrapped in cardboard, and placed in the box. We carefully followed the instructions to cut open the plastic bag and slowly let the mattress unfold. At the factory, the mattress is first folded in half and then in thirds. Although some reviewers and the brochure indicated an initial odor, ours was odorless. As we cut the plastic bag away, I half expected the mattress to spring open like a life raft, but instead it was a slow and deliberate process (it probably took less than a minute to unfold the mattress). Then, as recommended, we left the crumpled mattress sitting on the floor to continue its 72 hour process to re-size itself.Although the brochure indicates you can sleep on the mattress during this 72 hour period, other reviewers had cautioned us to wait the full 72 hour period before using the mattress. It has been an unseasonable warm winter here in North Carolina, and the mattress arrived during a week with temperatures in the 70\'s. By evening (less that 12 hours after receiving the mattress), it was almost completely flat (just the 4 corners were still sticking up off the floor), so we decided to sleep on it. (By the next morning, the mattress was perfectly flat, but we continued not to put anything on it during the day for the full 72 hours just to make sure we did not impeded its process to return to its initial size).The mattress is 2 layers of foam in a zippered cover (which you are cautioned not to open or it will void the warranty). However, you can easily see that the base 7.5 inches is a high density foam that holds the shape of the bed. The top 2.5 inches are a memory foam that conforms to your body shape within a few minutes of getting into the bed. Though some reviewers said the mattress was too firm, I have always preferred firm to extra-firm mattresses and found the Shiloh to be perfect. Even my wife, who prefers a less firm mattress, says the Sleep Innovations Shiloh is not too firm. We bought the 12 inch mattress figuring we could add an additional memory foam topper from Sleep Innovations in the event we found the bed too firm. However, both my wife and I agree that the bed is not too firm and does not need an additional topper.A memory foam mattress is a different sleeping experience if you are used to a spring mattress. I\'d say it took us both about a week to get used to it, but we found mattress to be comfortable immediately the first night. It\'s hard to describe, but it is just different sleeping on foam. When you first sit on the bed or get in it, the bed feels really firm. But as your body warms up the top layer of memory foam, you slowly settle into the foam for a really comfortable night\'s sleep. The next morning, when you get out of bed, the foam slowly cools to room temperature and returns to it\'s original shape, with no permanent indentations.One of best things about the foam mattress is that you remain completely isolated from your partner rolling over, or in my case, restless twitching legs. On a spring mattress, your partner\'s every toss, turn and twitch is transmitted across the mattress. So if either one of you is a restless sleeper, the other one knows it. Not so on a memory foam mattress. All motions are absorbed by the foam. (There used to be a commercial on TV showing a glass of water sitting on a mattress (one foam and one spring) and a bowling ball was dropped on to the mattress. The glass of water on the spring mattress went flying, but the glass on the foam mattress was undisturbed. I never believed the commercial, but after sleeping for a week on the Sleep Innovations memory foam mattress, it is absolutely true!) My wife reports that she no longer feels my legs twitch at night, and I certainly can not feel her roll over at any point. Also, the thing about memory foam mattresses, you really don\'t roll around as much at night because there aren\'t the pressure points that exist with a spring mattress.As far as the heat issue; we have found none. Both my wife and I like to sleep cool and often run the ceiling fan at night during the summer, even with central a/c. Both of us have been perfectly comfortable temperature-wise during the past week with temperatures in the 70\'s.Overall, I would wholeheartedly recommend this mattress. And, it for some reason, you did find it too firm, I would think that a an additional memory foam topper would take care of it. However, my wife and I have both found the mattress to be super comfortable so far. I\'ll be updating this post periodically to give continuing feedback of our experience.***1 month update: After about two weeks, my wife decided that the mattress felt too hard - that she didn\'t sink into the mattress at all. We are both lightweight people and she was correct in her assessment, it felt as though we were laying on top of the mattress slab. Although, as my body warmed the top foam layer, it did somewhat conform to me, it was lacking a difficult to describe "cozy" feeling. Now perhaps if our weights were closer to the average American weight, we would sink into the foam more. But my wife came up with the perfect solution to give the mattress the missing level of coziness...she purchased as fiber-filled mattress topper from a local national retailer. We put the mattress topped between the mattress and the mattress cover. My wife now says she sleeps better than she has ever slept in her life!***2 month update: Still loving the mattress with the "after-market" mattress topper. We have had some warm days and cold nights this spring so far. I would say the mattress does not seem any hotter than a traditional spring mattress, however, we do have central air. I have noticed, however, that the Sleep Innovations foam is warmer on the cool evenings than the spring mattress. I notice it the most if I get up at night to use the restroom, when I get back in bed, the foam is still warm and pliable where I had been sleeping - whereas the old spring mattress would have returned to sub-zero freezing temperatures in the span of the 90 seconds I was in the bathroom.We both are loving the mattress and can\'t imagine ever going back to a spring mattress after this experience!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars and then we have those purchases that we are happy about. However occasionally there are those rare times ...', 'author': 'Jonathan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me begin by saying that this was a terrifying purchase. Buying a bed online without being able to try it first? Are you crazy?We all have those purchases we regret, and then we have those purchases that we are happy about. However occasionally there are those rare times when the decision to buy something is just a home run of a purchase.For me and my wife this was a grand slam of a purchase! We LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this bed!!!!My wife and I started shopping around for a new bed because it was just time. We liked the innerspring mattress we had (I can now say it\'s because we didn\'t know any better) but dreaded a new mattress purchase. Will I like it? Will she? I need something firmer, but she prefers a softer bed. Throw sleep numbers in there and I felt even more confused. We took a different approach to shopping this time and simply Googled the highest rated mattresses of any kind. That led us to this gem on Amazon. I can be a skeptic when it comes to purchasing anything. I have to research it to the best of my ability which aside from looking up the manufacture specific information about a product means that I also tackle actual customer reviews. I spent three days reading 100s of the 2000+ reviews on this bed to try to get a good idea of what people thought and what their experiences were with this bed. I consistently found that the detailed reviews that were of the higher rating often addressed sleeping habits/issues that I found I dealt with myself. In those reviews this bed usually solved those problems. The problems people generally listed in the lower rated reviews I found were issues I personally didn\'t have a problem with, or simply seemed inconsistent with more of the higher rated reviews. I also read a lot of the Q/As for this product as well as one of my concerns was what happens if I don\'t like it. I read enough to also be comfortable with the return process if I had needed it (which I absolutely don\'t!!). I can advise everyone to just read, read, and then read some more to help make your decision. Now these are all just things that helped me make the decision to buy the bed, so let me begin actually reviewing it.The bed came squeezed in a big box, but much smaller than you\'d think a bed would be able to fit in. Removing it from the packaging was easy and straight forward, though it\'s certainly not a light mattress (over 100lbs). I did have to have someone help me lift it onto the platform, though it wasn\'t bad at all. I could have done it myself if I really wanted to try, but I had the help. A tip, place it wrapped up onto the platform/support that you will be using before you let the bed expand. This made the process easy for me. The bed comes with instructions to follow to properly unpack it as well as pictures. Essentially it\'s folded up into a W shape and when you cut off the packaging it unfolds. For me I placed the wrapped up bed onto my frame with the middle of the W in the center of my frame, so standing at the foot of the bed and looking at my headboard, I was literally looking at a W shape. Regarding the frame, while I was reading reviews I had hoped someone would mention specifically what they were using with this mattress as I was coming from a conventional mattress that had a box spring that was a size smaller so I couldn\'t reuse the box spring. I had to find something to use with this King. Not to sound like an ad, but I ended up going with the Sleep Master Platform Metal Bed Frame/Mattress Foundation and it works perfectly with this mattress (that\'s a separate review). Cutting it free it just popped free and unfolded perfectly onto the platform. I will point out that it doesn\'t spring open like a bear trap. My wife was afraid to do this alone assuming this thing would knock her over but it was the exact opposite experience, nice and slow. Once unfolded, it was easy to take the plastic out from under the now open bed. Yes it\'s a heavy bed, but that weight is evenly distributed. It\'s not a problem to lift a corner to slide something under it or out from under it. When our new bedding came in my wife was able to put the bed skirt under the bed all by herself. It took about an hour for the bed to come to "sleepable" shape. The corners were still a bit rounded, but it was flat. I did not experience any issues with the seams where the mattress was folded. I do live in Arizona, so it\'s a warmer environment. I know the ambient temp affects this process, though it is winter for us now (though that\'s laughable to most people) it\'s not like it\'s blisteringly hot right now. I have the ambient temp of my house around 75ish degrees. The instructions say to give it a full 72 hours to retain its proper shape but I would say for me that took just over 24 hours. It\'s now cut completely square just like the photo. As far as sleeping on it, we did so the first night. You are allowed to sleep on this bed the day you receive it. The instructions with mine encouraged it to help with the shaping process. We had no issues with any odor from the bed. I have memory foam pillows that were far worse. This bed had a very minor odor if I put my nose directly to it and breathed deeply, otherwise I had no need to open a window or anything like that.First night\'s sleep was great, though now I can say it\'s much better after a few days use (as I write this I\'ve had it for about 3 weeks). I did notice that first night that the bed does sleep warmer than our innerspring did, however it was not a furnace. I did not find myself sweating like crazy, and I\'m a person that generally sleeps hot anyways. I like feeling the weight of a sheet on me but don\'t\' like to be hot. I actually attribute it more to the stuffiness of the room at the time, which does seem to affect the heat of the bed. I simply adjusted how I use a fan in the room the first few nights and was perfect. In the third week of use, I don\'t know if I\'m simply used to the bed now or what changed, but I don\'t feel that it sleeps warm at all anymore. My wife feels the same. Comfort wise it\'s amazing. I have never experienced such restful sleep. The bed seems so soft if you sit on it, but lay down and it\'s perfectly firm/soft as you need it and I\'m 220 lbs. My wife, who\'s preferred softer conventional mattresses in the past, adores this bed. As firm as it is, it still perfectly conforms to her as she needs it, and she is a petit 5\'4" 120 lbs. She also had constant back pain prior to this bed. She sees a chiropractor and goes regularly to be maintained and originally attributed her issues it to her footwear or the nights she didn\'t sleep on her back. She hasn\'t had any back injuries or accidents to attribute to her back problems. She has woken up completely back pain free since sleeping on this bed, and she no longer concerns herself with sleeping on her back anymore as she prefers her side. Thank you Sleep Innovations for making her a happier person! The sad thing for me is that I caught a cold just a few days after we got this bed so I feel like I haven\'t been able to experience its full potential yet. Even with a cold though, I sleep better on it than I ever did on my old mattress. I was constantly tossing and turning before, and that just isn\'t the case anymore. Regarding rolling over/moving, we have had no issues adjusting our sleeping position on this bed. I\'ve never felt like I was stuck in a ditch, nor have I felt like I\'m waiting for the bed to respond if I do move. Yes you can tell it responds to you, but that takes 10 seconds at most. I don\'t roll back into the divot I left in the bed. There is no divot. Even sitting on the bed propped up on the headboard, this bed is so much more comfortable. I\'m a gamer, so I do sit on the bed a lot, and I can now sit comfortably in one spot without feeling my legs or bottom fall asleep.I can\'t wait to continue to experience this bed. We slept in a hotel recently and had the worst night\'s sleep ever. We couldn\'t wait to get back home to our new mattress. If I could rate this more than 5 stars I would. I will attempt to keep adding to this review as time goes on with my experience with this bed.Minor update: Not that this has anything to do with sleep quality, but for those with little kids who like jumping on your bed (thanks grandpa!), we have found that our children no longer like to jump on this bed at all. It just doesn\'t bouce like a traditional mattress. Another random plus for this mattress!! :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Never Will I Go Back to Springs', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The background: My wife and I bought our first king size bed in April 2005. Three years later the thing was already sagging down the middle. We lived with it for a year and then finally made a warranty claim. The company stripped the bed down to the springs and rebuilt a new mattress. It lasted 8 months before terrible again.So I read Consumer Reports and lo and behold, besides the fact that it states that mattresses are the number one inquired about review next to cars, they don\'t actually rate any mattresses. I guess it is b/c the companies give each store their own model so it is impossible to compare. Consumer Reports did, however, give satisfaction survey numbers on the different manufacturers. It was amazing. All but one were 50% or lower (the question, I believe, was would you buy another mattress of this brand). Most were much lower than 50% (Serta was 35%). I mean WOW. It is disheartening to think that the vast majority of people are unhappy with their beds. And yes, this includes those Sleep Number, outrageously priced people (I can buy an inflatable queen mattress at Wal-Mart for $15. Why does putting a case around it make it worth $3,000?)Well, the ONE COMPANY that had higher than 50% was Tempur Pedic (around 60%, not great, but better than the rest). Problem is, even though I could afford it, there is no way I am paying $3,300 for a 12" king size mattress. My first thought is, "China makes everything for 1/100th of the cost", so I started Googling memory foam mattresses. To my pleasant surprise the good ol\' USA came through with Sleep Innovations.I read all, and I mean all the reviews. I initially thought the Amazon Vine reviews (which are a lot) were bogus, purposely placed customer reviews. I have since learned (from a negative comment) that just means the company gave a bunch of free beds to get Amazon Vine reviews. But even discounting the Vines\' reviews, you could see that nearly all people were happy with it. I was still concerned though because I read horror stories from customer reviews on another off-brand memory mattress at Amazon. Stuff like the corners not ever flattening out and the company saying it could only be returned in the original box (which is absolutely impossible - the thing is vacuum sealed in there).So I called the company. I am expecting terrible service and it was the complete opposite. I got someone right away. A very nice, non-outsourced woman said that the company had been in business for 12 years; yes I could return the mattress within the 20 year warranty and no I would not have to use the same box (which when I asked that question, she stated flatly, "that would be impossible").The product: I took the dive and bought it. The real test is how it will feel in 5 years, but I can\'t fast forward five years to give you a final verdict. And to that end, I figured I could get six of these for the price of a Tempur Pedic. But I can say that two weeks into it and I love this bed. A couple bullet points:1. No problem with the hotness issue you read about, but it is not summer. I figure worst case scenario, I will add an egg crate on top to have some separation from my body and the foam mattress if I have a heat issue. I should note that we had an 80 degree day recently and I had no heat issues that night.UPDATE: Have had 99 degree weather days and no problems (of course we use the A/C (keep it on 78), but I thought I should add that).2. Foam smell went away. Again, if it hadn\'t, I would have bought an egg crate so my nose wasn\'t right on it.3. It is a firm mattress. You would never believe it if you sat on the side but when your whole body is stretched out, it is firm. It is a good firm though. I always thought I was a soft mattress guy, but after sleeping 4 years on a pillow top and a bad back to show it, I am making the switch. I figured if I needed it softer, I could buy an egg crate (see a pattern here?).4. DO NOT TAKE OFF THE WHITE COTTON COVER. This is apparently the equivalent of the do not remove for penalty of jail tag. If you read the brochure that comes with the mattress it tells you that the warranty is void if you do that. So put some other cover over that if you must.5. My wife has a memory foam pillow and it contours big time to your head and if you move your head, it is like you are squishing down Mount Everest again. This mattress is not like that. Very mild contouring which I think is a real plus.6. As other reviews say, it is heavy as Hades. I got it upstairs with me pushing it up with my back and my wife getting it over each stair hump. I would NOT recommend this if you have a bad back, etc. Get a couple guys to do it.Anyway it is late, I am tired, and I have a fantastic bed to go sleep in.UPDATE: Unfortunately, we have had numerous 100+ degree weather days here in Georgia. Fortunately, however, I have not had any problems with feeling hot because of the bed.UPDATE: Year later, no sagging, still very happy.UPDATE: Two years later, no sagging, still very happy.UPDATE: Three years later, no sagging, still very happy.UPDATE: Well after four years, we noticed the memory foam top 2.5 inches was much softer than when we bought it. I guess it is to be expected, but we want a very firm mattress. Best option is flipping over and putting your own new memory foam topper on. That will make this a 14" tall mattress, which makes me think maybe it would have been better to start with the 10" model.So I pulled the warranty card and got a new mattress. But I hesitate in saying anyone could do the same. According to the website, you have to have a 1.5" permanent indention to meet warranty requirements (by way of contrast, the exorbitantly priced TempurPedic only requires a .75" permanent indention). I mentioned to the customer service rep that I have loved the bed and in fact authored this review. I cannot say whether that made a difference which is why I hesitate in saying anyone could do the same.Note, however, that the couple I gave my 4 y/o bed to LOVES the bed and has no problem with it. As I said, I think it would be perfectly fine for anyone who does not want a firm top.UPDATE 5/17/18: Still love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2011', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Mattress is hard & hot, buy with caution', 'author': 'Melissa Kirsch', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I\'m not a big Amazon reviewer, but I spent so much time reading mattress reviews before I bought the Sleep Innovations 12" Queen mattress that I felt I should contribute to the discussion as there seems to be a disproportionate number of wholly positive reviews on here. I am trying, hope against hope, to fall in love with this mattress, but it\'s hard. It\'s hard as in difficult and it\'s hard as in I have nicknamed the mattress "The Marble Slab" because this thing is more a morgue table than it is a bed.BackgroundI had the same, crapsterella, full-size, basic spring mattress from Serta for 16 years. That\'s way too long to keep a bed. I know this. I purchased a $200 mattress topper from Bed, Bath & Beyond in order to "extend the life of it" (really, it should have been put out of its misery a decade ago). The topper did make the bed heavenly soft, but I also found myself sleeping at the bottom of a crevasse and having to claw my way out--the topper had no support. I threw my back out after a lifetime of not a single backache (It can happen to you! Stretch! I\'m young and active and one day it just went and oh my goodness). Climbing out of the mattress topper was horrible for my back and I decided it was time to buy a new bed. Since I hadn\'t bought a bed since the Clinton administration, I was delighted to find bed technology had made some technological strides for the better. I had stayed at a friend\'s home for a month and never slept better; he informed me that his bed was "one of those memory foam ones" and I went on my quest. I went to a midtown NYC Sleepy\'s and risked catching a social disease lying on their filthy Tempurpedics and latex/foam combos and foam/spring melanges and determined that yes I loved the foam and no I could not pay $2000+ for a new mattress. I turned to Amazon and the overwhelming number of great reviews for Sleep Innovations finally got me (I also explored Bobopedic, Angel Beds, etc.). I had the thing delivered to my NYC apartment.As others have said a million times, the box is small, the thing weighs about 100 lbs., there is no way on earth you are going to get this upstairs if you are a weak-limbed girl with a back problem. My gym-buffed 6\'3" friend pushed it up the one flight with difficulty. Unpacking it was a breeze, there was really no smell, I was psyched to have invested in perhaps the World\'s Most Praised Mattress. Onward to sleeping.PROSIf you\'ve been sleeping on a busted old mattress with a busted old boxspring and a ridiculous memory foam topper that only makes things worse, things are looking up when you first lie on the Sleep Innovations mattress. It\'s flat. It\'s firm.-You are not going to roll around a lot. Which is a good thing, because you do sleep more soundly. So soundly you are going to maybe wake up in a little pool of your own drool because you haven\'t moved a muscle.-It\'s firm. If you need back support, which I do, you aren\'t going to worry that you\'re sleeping on too soft a pillow-top or you\'re doing bad things for your spine. This thing is supportive.-It\'s high. I like a high bed. I have it on a boxspring (that weird one people say to get on here that you put together yourself is really a decent boxspring, I\'ve clearly been listening to Amazon reviews) and so it\'s about 20" high from the ground with a bed frame. This is good for getting up with your bad back, as there are no springs to launch you out of bed.-You can sit on the edge and put your shoes on. I\'ve heard there are foam mattresses that have no edge support. With a mattress this hard, that\'s no problem.-There are occasional nights of good, maybe great, sleep. You will go to your brother\'s house and sleep on a normal mattress, one you have slept on for years and used to think was a little hard, and think "This is too soft! Beds are not supposed to be this soft and springy, this is not good for my back." You are probably right, but it\'s a matter of degrees.CONSOK, listen to me. I\'m a picky sleeper, but not that picky. As in I sleep well in most hotel beds that pride themselves on comfort (W, Westin, etc.). I like a firm bed. I also thought, before I got this mattress, that I slept cold.-Listen to the people who say this mattress is hard. They are not kidding. They may be a tiny chorus that you\'re ignoring, as I did, needing to believe that this mattress is amazing and those people were a freakish minority, since every other review says this mattress is just right. I\'ve given it time to get used to, and I am still kind of shocked each night at how hard this thing is. There is no burrowing down into your bed. There is no "oh my god my bed is so comfortable and cozy". There\'s a lot of "what the hell, I might as well be sleeping on the wood floor".-You won\'t toss and turn, it\'s true, but if you TRY to turn, good luck. You can\'t roll around on this mattress. If you need to roll over, you\'re going to have to push yourself up on your arm and physically flip yourself over. There\'s no give. There\'s no help from the mattress to roll over. If you like to turn to get to the cool side of the pillow, you\'re better off turning the pillow. Or getting over your need to get to the cool side, because there is no such thing as a cool side in this bed. Which brings me to...-I am not menopausal, but I believe I have now experienced the discomfiting experience of hot flashes, thanks to the blazing oven that is the Sleep Innovations mattress. Imagine a pizza stone in a wood-burning oven. You are the pizza. HOT! Hot bed! I turn the heat off and still roast away in this bed. I did research to find what on earth was going on since, as mentioned earlier, I tend to be cold when I sleep. I read that a wool mattress cover is going to turn down the heat on a hot foam mattress. Not true. It does give a scratchy, horsehair sort of feel to the bed, which is not pleasant, but it\'s not cooling it down. People say to get the memory foam topper, but I\'m a little wary of the Amazon reviewers on here now, because I feel they\'ve led me astray once before. Listen to me. This bed is warm. I\'m a normal person and I\'m sleeping in a drafty New York apartment in December with a summer quilt and it\'s too much blanket. Farewell, down duvet. I won\'t be needing you now that I\'ve got a flaming mattress. How can we sleep while our beds are burning indeed.I am really trying to fall in love with this mattress. I so want it to be everything amazing that everyone else says on here. Anyone who lies on my bed or sleeps in it is shocked at how hard it is. I\'ve heard a lot of "I could never sleep on that" and "That is not comfortable" and I feebly cry that it is great (the power of positive protesting!) and great for my back (less pain, but the bar was looow) and really quite a bargain (the price tag is amazing, I\'ll admit it, but there needs to be a happy medium).I had given the bed 3 stars, as I do sleep okay sometimes, but then changed it to two after I realized I don\'t have many good things to say about it. I think I like my bedframe (the Crate & Barrel Scholar Bed) and the fact that it\'s a queen more than I like anything about the mattress. I really want to be clear that this is a troublesome bed for this not-too-picky sleeper and encourage you to think twice before ignoring the critical reviews of the Sleep Innovations 12-inch Sure Temp Memory Foam Mattress - Queen Size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2011', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love our mattress', 'author': 'Theresa Plesco', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wanted to wait until we had our mattress over a week to make sure we liked it. No pain at shoulders or hip points, supportive for back. Best sleep in years', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice mattress', 'author': 'Lachlan Carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The mattress was really compact when delivered. It took less than a day to fully expand, and after a period of about 3-4 days, I fully adjusted to it. The material is good, and it’s surprisingly cool for a hot sleeper like me. We have slept on it some nights now, and it was very comfortable but much softer than I expected. The best sleep we have had in years. If you're looking for a good mattress on a bit on the firmer side for a good price, this is it. I'm pleased with this purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I was SUPER skeptical- but', 'author': 'Lauren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’m really glad I purchased this mattress.
